column6: Incredibly rude worker. I will never spend money at this place again and will encourage others not to either.  I've lived in this neighborhood since 1996. He's the epitome of a privileged gentrifier who doesn't respect the locals.

Three of us stopped in for some afternoon beverages and appetizers.  The place was comfortable enough and service was good, too good.  The wait staff hovered over us and seemed disappointed/upset with us that we weren't having full meals.  I felt we were being rushed out, trying to take plates away from us before we were finished.  Pricing seemed a bit high, even for Brooklyn.  Don't think I'd stop in again.
Iron pot chicken soup thing was awesome. Nice local spot. Went with a friend . 8 more characters needed lol

I've been coming here for years and they never disappoint. My go-to Pho spot when I'm in Brooklyn... service is great and the food even better. The prices have gone up but still a delicious meal with heart and soul put into every dish.

My experience here was pretty great! Nothing that I could complain about! The atmosphere was so cute and quaint even during these pandemic times. A friend and I ate dinner here and had a small two-person table all to ourselves, nestled along the side of the restaurant among the plants, spaced out from others. There was only a 3-4 minute wait before being seated. Then the service was so quick and everyone made sure to check on us regularly. I started with the crispy vegetable spring rolls and then ordered the crispy seitan as my entree with a Vietnamese iced coffee. Everything was so delicious. I would definitely return, and maybe save room for dessert next time!

I had an absolutely horrible experience in this establishment recently. I walked in and asked to see a menu. A man rudely told me that there was a menu outside. When I told him that the menu outside was too dimly lit for me to see someone handed him a menu and he threw the menu down on the table in front on front of me. You read that correctly. Instead of putting the menu in my hand he aggressively threw the menu onto the table in front of me.   Without picking up the menu and without saying anything I turned around and left. About a minute later, after I had processed the absolutely incredible rudeness I had just experienced I walked back into the restaurant and asked, "Why would you throw the menu on the table in front of me like that?" The guy answered, even more rudely than before, "That's what I do. I do that to everyone." At which point I turned and walked out. In shock. Pre-pandemic I had eaten at this restaurant a couple of times. You can be sure that I will NEVER set foot in place again. This was a really terrible, terrible experience. I'm disgusted. If this is how customers are treated they don't deserve the honor of being in the hospitality business.

Pricier than what I'm used to for a Vietnamese spot but I guess I'm paying for the neighborhood prices. There's so much on the menu! The menu in person has a lot more than their online menu on the website. Everything was really tasty and flavorful. Unlike anything I've tasted before. I ordered the grilled slices of Berkshire pork chop and the chicken wings as an app. My friend got the chicken pho and the grilled prawns on skewers on sticks as her app. Her pho bowl was huge! The size of her head. I thought this place would be Americanized because it's the only Vietnamese spot near Clinton hill and fort Greene but everything was mouthwatering and flavorful. The portions are really large too. Enough for it to be 2 meals for me. I took off one star because rice does not come with my dish and was not asked if I wanted any when I ordered. I see myself coming here more often and trying everything on the menu!

Unassuming yet really enjoyable corner restaurant in Clinton Hill. I'm not all that familiar with Vietnamese cuisine so when a friend asked that I meet him here, I yelped to see what other folks loved. Fellow yelpers: ya'll did not disappoint! I ordered and subsequently decimated the sliced pork shop. The pork was super juicy; full of flavor and cooked perfectly - there was even a subtle char. The veggies that accompany the meat (some pickled, some fresh) afford the opportunity to make lettuce wraps... so I did just that. What a delightful and filling meal! I was really impressed. Ambiance inside is unremarkable but chill and comfortable (I visited on a Saturday for a late lunch/early dinner). The staff was kind, attentive and quick. They take AMEX which is always a plus for me!

This is easily the best restaurant in the city. For starters, service is always incredible. Everyone here is so attentive and kind I always feel welcomed and  taken care of when I'm here. The food really is the star of the show. If I can recommend anything to potential patrons, get the chicken wings and filet mignon!!! Quite literally one of the best meals I have ever had. To top everything off, the ambience is always so cute and cozy. A very nice place to decompress, have some great food and have a drink.

Delicious. Crispy spring rolls were fresh and the rice paper they used was very crunchy. Tasted great. The pho was nice and light, perfect portion. And their lemonade taste just like the one in Vietnam not over powered with sugar. Thank you for a great meal!

I've never been physically to Mekong the restaurant, but I ordered delivery from them many many times. They have amazing food, I love every dishes I've ever ordered: street noodle, Pho, chicken salad, summer roll...I can probably name the entire menu lol. I'm super happy that they survived COVID and I will keep supporting their business because they are good! I only leave reviews on yelp for the restaurant that I really like, and Mekong definitely deserve my 5 stars!

The food is a little bit watered down for local tastes, but it's by no means bad... just temper your expectations. I had the papaya salad, the summer rolls, and the grilled beef. The papaya salad was generally fresh but I wish it was a little punchier in flavor. More fish sauce, more tamarind juice, more palm sugar, perhaps? And maybe It tasted a little flat. The summer rolls were rather unwieldy to eat - the skin was too thick, and the insides weren't crisp enough. I had a really refreshing summer roll with a flavorful dipping sauce at Madame Vo recently and the contrast was marked. The grilled beef was not bad, I have no complaints. Overall this is an approachable Thai-ish place and if you don't have a great spice tolerance or if you've never been exposed to funky umami flavors like dried shrimp or assertive spices like bird's eye chili, Mekong BK will be just fine.

I should have went with my instincts when I only seen one person in the restaurant...First off my vegetables weren't fresh very whelped.. Second off instead of putting the shrimp with the vegetables they placed my shrimp in the hot broth(I've never seen that before) bout time I got home my shrimp was way overcooked.. I eat pho at least 2x out the week so I know a good bowl of Pho and this ain't it...
Favorite neighborhood spot for pho! We've ordered dine-in (pre-Covid) and takeout many times and it never disappoints. The chicken and broth are both nicely-seasoned and well-balanced. Classic pho

Stumbled upon this place while I was hungry in Clinton Hill and they really are PHO-NOMENAL! The space is super cute and conveniently located right by the G train. Would definitely recommend for anyone looking for pho in the area. Will have to come back and try the other bites.
Brilliant food and service. Clean and hygienic... The outdoor space was spaced out well and the food was delicious.

I had a pretty good experience here . Me and my best friend came here for some Pho and the last time I had pho it was in Texas so I wanted to try and it was absolutely delicious . What I liked is one of the owners or staff I think he was the owner though and he kept making sure we were good ht he also recommended us to put the basil and the plum Sauce in it and I love that . The pho was so fresh and the noodles were cooked to perfection . Everything was delicious . Glad we stopped here.

the food was simply fine--wasn't disappointed exactly, but wasn't blown away. I personally got pork vermicelli and the others I was with got pho which was described as bland and everything needed extra sauces in it. No one left raving about it being great, but no one complained either. The portions were a bit smaller than most Vietnamese restaurants, but that didn't bug me so much as the prices were reasonable. Just didn't think it was that great.

I've been searching for amazing pho for four years since moving from LA. There's one restaurant in Silver Lake, Los Angeles that sets the bar. Last night was my first time ordering from Mekong, delivery I might add, and it won! I ordered the chicken pho and it's just like I dreamed. Shredded white meat chicken - no mystery meat. Personally, I think grilled chicken in chicken pho is blasphemous.     The chicken was in a clean yummy broth, that allowed the fresh herbs, sprouts and lime to complement Perfectly. Tempted to order it again tonight.

Been trying to find a pho spot in the neighborhood, and finally did! This definitely hits the spot and satisfies when you're looking for a good bowl of pho. The restaurant is clean and cozy inside, with more of an upscale vibe than most Vietnamese restaurants. The menu is a bit on the pricier side, but it's probably the best pho you'll find in the area.
Great flavors and cooking technique, kind and caring staff. Everything I've had has been amazing-grilled prawn, lemongrass curry, steak, salmon... delicious and thoughtfully prepared.

I was excited to go get pho with my roommate at Mekong BK but was very disappointed to find out that they did not have a vegetarian option for pho as a lot of places do. They did however have a small vegetarian section on their menu so I can't be too upset, as I was able to find something yummy to eat albeit not what I was hoping for.  I had spring rolls over vermicelli with pickled vegetables. It was yummy but the portion size was much smaller than the pho for the same price so I was finished eating long before my companion.  The restaurant itself had a nice atmosphere with many candles and lots of jade plants and other succulents scattered around. They also kept it nice and warm on a cold winters night so that was appreciated. I would definitely go back and see what else they have to offer.
I enjoyed my meal at Mekong BK very much. The red snapper was crispy and the staff were friendly. Low lights and an airy clean dinning room made it seem romantic.

Randomly came in here for dinner with a friend without even knowing what kind of food they served. Immediately I liked the atmosphere there is an intimate vibe with all the plants and lighting. The music they played was awesome too. We then got some sort of spring roll for an appetizer and it was so good we both got two different mixed drinks which were also really good and then I had a chicken curry dish with lemon grass that was amazing and like nothing I've ever had before. Definitely will be coming back again.

Food is so good here- a bit of a twist on the traditional. I guess ppl in fort Greene are used to this level of good food? Shocked at how it's not that busy Friday night and some of the reviews. Man people are picky these days. Come here and try their calamari, beef tartar. So good!

Chasing Mekong from west village all the way to Brooklyn, it's all about that food,make sure to get Chicken salad and fried calamari to start everything else will come in to a place, food is just to good, you definitely will be back!!! Say hello to Brian when you there!

Based on one dinner but it was delicious. Recommend spring rolls, beef skewers, pork chop. Beef is slightly spicy and the dipping sauces are spicy, which I enjoyed. Wish they gave you a little more beef. Service was good.

The food is ok. Extremely overpriced. And there was this one guy(he's probably also the manager/owner) treated us with horrible horrible attitude. Super rude. Super angry. No patience. Pulled my menu away while I was still ordering. I don't know what is wrong with this guy. He just looked at us with pure hatred. Never going back to this place. Worst experience ever.

The food was decent but I have to say... the service was absolutely HORRIBLE. I presume our server was also the owner or manager (his name was Brian according to the receipt, but who knows? He didn't introduce himself). He was very rude and condescending, and had little to no interest in being friendly or attentive to our table; he did the absolute bare minimum a server could do. Perhaps this was due to the fact that we're young college students and he expected us to not purchase drinks? But that's no excuse for his standoffish behavior. What makes this worse is that a 20% gratuity is included for parties of 6 or more, regardless of how bad the service may be. Great! Either way, I'll never be coming back to MeKong BK again because I could never forget this horrible experience. Thanks Brian!

Passes the bar as someone whose mother was born near the Mekong. The bun noodles with grilled pork was delicious, the sauce authentic. I also ordered the iced coffee with sweetened milk, cafe sua da, and it made me nostalgic for HCMC.

Not authentic. Extremely overpriced. And the WORST part is that they have the cheap hoisin sauce found in grocery stores instead of the real stuff. It's way too sweet. It's pretty gross to be honest. The meat was cooked ok but I will not be coming back, mostly because of how disgusting the hoisin sauce is. Good hoisin sauce is Vietnamese food 101.
Man oh man I really wanted to like this place.  It has such a great location and the interior has an amazing layout but it was just ok.
Love their beef pho, best I've found in the area! Their dining room is very cute and hip, chill atmosphere.

I love this place! Literally go here at least 3-4 times a month.  I order always the same thing, spring rolls, filet, calamari and the chicken wings. Literally I dream about the wings they are that good!

Bryan, dry, crass and a total New Yorker thru and thru I get him and he got you. He's attentive and chill, my service is on point and food is a win. I mean good Vietnamese food without the city price and hassle is a fucking plus. So eat here and thank me later. You're welcome!
Authentic taste, great service, fair prices, and cozy atmosphere! It's nice for lunch and dinner, both casual or formal! Highly recommend coming here!

I wanted to like this place because there is no good Vietnamese food in Fort Greene, but was pretty disappointed. Service was fine I guess, but weirdly curt considering that there were only two other customers there when we arrived. We ordered crispy vegetable spring rolls, which were good. But the chicken pho was extremely bland and barely contained any chicken. I'm talking maybe 1oz, if that. The base broth was essentially water. A quick google search of "how to make pho" could probably help a bit here. It's too bad, because its a cool space, but seems poorly managed and food is lacking flavor.
This is my favorite traditional Vietnamese place. Great drinks and service. The food is super consistent and tasty.

One of my favorite's in Fort Greene. The food is delicious and the margarita happy hours are one of the best kept secrets in Brooklyn. Try the filet mignon au beurre, crispy spring rolls on vermicelli and Mekong street noodles with chicken. If you're vegetarian, the iron pot lemongrass curry is excellent.

The food is amazing, great flavors, service can be better but overall it worth to visit. The appetizers are delicious and the main dishes are tasty.! It you want some cocktails there is also a bar. But I come here for the food

I'm from San Francisco AND I'm a Vietnamese food snob.  This restaurant is very much up there with some of the best Vietnamese I've ever had. My meal was excellent in a soul food way.  I agree with other reviewers, best Vietnamese in NY.  The staff was very pleasant as well.  I'll be back.
The best place to relax and have great food and great drinks. So glad legendary bar from little Italy and W Village has found new home!

The most incredible and fresh Vietnamese food I've had in the area. Helpful, friendly staff. The lemongrass beef, calamari and bok choy were to die for. Keep this amazing place in the neighborhood! Enjoy their delish food.

Chased out of South Village, like so many people, by skyrocketing rents (a much more expensive restaurant now in its place), Mekong kept its pretty tasty food and corner entrance constant. Pho was tame and simple (and the portion small), beef tartar spicy and quite memorable, and spring rolls delicious. NO decent draft beers, unfortunately.

We found this restaurant by chance, was a really good experience, the waiter was very nice and helpful, I ordered the classic bun and was delicious. The place is very comfortable and calm, I am looking forward to return and try the coconut chicken
So good here! I'm so happy MeKong opened up here, it took forever to find them knowing they were in city for quite sometime! But I'm happy that I got to eat at their new location
The best take on calamari I've ever tried. So refreshing and delicious. Highly recommend this place. A new neighborhood fav.

This unpretentious but stylish spot is turning into our favorite neighborhood meal. The food is consistently terrific (and reasonably priced) with a pho that can hold its own with the best of Chinatown or Sunset Park. Other standouts are the crispy spring rolls (which are offered as a happy hour item) and the mouth-watering entree of grilled and diced  filet mignon on a watercress base. Great margaritas, too. Chill ambience with authentic southeast Asian decor touches that don't descend into theme-restaurant kitsch.
Ordered takeout last night - the bun was delicious and so was the shrimp papaya salad. I wish the portion size of the salad was a little bigger though...
2nd meal at Mekong BK and again, it wAs terrific. I had calimari curry and it was divine. My family enjoyed their choices too. Very pleased: )

Vegetarian Pho was fantastic and I'm not even vegetarian. Pork chops were really great as well. Service was quick and anticipated our needs well without being over bearing. The ambience was nice, and although the music was a bit loud for my tastes there is a bar there so I guess I can't really complain. We went with our children and with our apologies to other diners (maybe, don't know if they could be heard over the music or not) it wasn't bad at all if I should say so myself.

Glad to see this place in the neighborhood. I hope the service improves after a grace period. Pho was decent and agree portion smaller compared to other places. Spring rolls also tasty. Service needs overhaul: Walked in and no staff present for five minutes despite customers inside. Served drink in dirty glass and when I asked for clean glass, waiter poured into new one but never said anything. Needs to get more staff and some etiquette training. Manager seems a bit rude.

I wasn't expecting to find good, authentic Viet food in Fort Greene, but man this was probably one of the worst dinners I've ever had. We got the fried chicken, beef pho, and the spring roll vermicelli. Fried chicken was crispy but bland. Pho was terrible, the broth wasn't even broth as much as it was warm water and the meat was shredded with random grill marks(??) The vermicelli sauce was straight up weird, like diluted siracha with some vinegar. The spring rolls were crispy but dry and again, had absolutely no flavor to them. Prices were expensive as well

We were regulars when MeKong was in Manhattan, but very disappointed with our first experience in Clinton Hill.  Place was empty albeit for a few tables, and the hostess sat us right on top of another party, so we opted for the bar.  Humid night, no apparent AC, and warm draft beer for starters .  Calamari app was very good but the portion was extremely small- it's presented in a bowl that's 2/3 lettuce with the calamari on top, so deceiving.  The Chicken Pho dish had barely any chicken, and the Roast Pork Vermicelli had barely any pork. Both overpriced for what they were.  Food came out quickly and out of order.  Waitress was sweet.
Delicious Vietnamese food. We had the angel hair and tofu iron pot which were amazing. Space is beautiful as well.

What a huge mistake...again. I have ordered from here a few times and it's been a constant. overpriced disappointment. I have consistently received huge disappointments, both by pick-up, delivery and uninterested staff.  I am happy to give specific details but at this point, it really doesn't matter. As a chef that works in the neighborhood this place has missed every mark.  And it really had potential and I could have stuck with it were it not this awful.  This place represents the worst of the worst of the "new" Clinton Hill.
chiken wangs fucked me up fam i might have to get surgery to recover but i support the cause i support the mission i believe in the vision
Put this one at the top of your list. Fort Greene, Vietnamese, fresh, every dish is delicious. Nice enough staff. Ok drinks, the best food on the Dekalb. The Berkshire Porkchops are perfection.
Nice location! Excellent food and service. In general  a good choice for Vietnamese food in this area!

This place is great, and just what the neighborhood needs. The pho is really fresh...generally all the ingredients are all fresh, and I've eaten here A LOT since it's a couple of blocks away. It's never packed -- a drawback for people looking for a lot of "buzz." But this does mean you can actually hear your dining partners talk. Great variety of food, and if you like pork chop, people swear by it.

Wanted to like this place since I live two blocks away but it's most definitely the most over priced and poorly made banh mi I have ever had. The bread is complete wrong - way too big and not toasted. Too much bread with small fillings. I opened my sandwich in disbelief multiples times in mid-chew to see if any of the regular ingredients were missing. But they were all there in Lilliputian portions sandwiched in a giant loaf of generic grocery bought bread. I may go back to try an actual dish. Stay tuned.
Great dinner! We got papaya salad and the clay pot tofu curry. Would recommend both and will definitely return to try other dishes. Loved the atmosphere as well.

Never reviewed on yelp before but SO happy about this addition to the neighborhood. With new restaurants opening daily in Ft. Greene, you'd think it wouldn't have taken so long for someone to try Vietnamese. The folks here are very friendly and the food was fresh and delicious. We enjoyed the summer rolls, chicken salad, and beef with rice paper. I hope that whatever kinks other reviewers have found get ironed out and this place will stick around for the longhaul!

I wanted to like this place, because there are no other Vietnamese restaurants nearby. The food tasted ok, but it made me feel sick. The prices are on the high side for what it is, and the service is not so friendly. Pass.

Excellent across the board! Every dish I've had has been fresh, well-seasoned, and never greasy. Eating in is a great experience, especially the presentation of the clay pot dishes. The pho is the best I've found in the area, and I also highly recommend the Iron Pot Lemongrass Curry and Street Noodles.
This restaurant was around the corner from me in soho and it's around the corner in Fort Greene! So happy

I'm writing this review because I'm torn. The food at MeKong was pretty tasty. I had the chicken Pho and quite enjoyed the flavor. The other menu items also sounded yummy. My low rating stems from their terrible decision to round the bill. This is the first time I've experienced "rounding" on a bill, so I had to look it up to see if it this was an atypical business practice or the new normal. I asked the waitress if she could explain the extra charge on my bill labeled as "rounding", and she said that she wasn't sure what it was and would go check. She didn't return after 10 minutes, so I assumed she wasn't actually checking, so I left. It was only a few cents, so I wasn't enraged just curious to learn the logic behind it. After reading some articles about the practice, it seems that some restaurants do it to speed up the change-making process. This small restaurant did indeed have slow service, but I suspect it wasn't because servers were overwhelmed by counting coins. I can't imagine that many sit down restaurants deal with many cash transactions, nevertheless MeKong BK charges a rounding fee. I know that Chipotle was busted for doing this a few years ago and started to round down in favor of the customer, which seems to be the most obvious answer, but for some reason customers are being charged an extra fee for nothing. While it's only a few cents, it's definitely the principle of the matter. It's a shame that I probably won't return to this new restaurant in the neighborhood. MeKong, let me know if you decide to change this policy, and I'll be sure to come back and try the beef bone broth.

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: A vegetarian friendly spot which I loved. I would definitely get their eggplant in garlic sauce and the vegetable dumplings, both were so good. I thought their spiced tofu skins was a unique thing to try but I would pass on the chili cucumber salad. Their vegetable fried rice was good but their watercress mushroom dish was a little under flavored. Space is huge you could probably get seated right away.

I initially paired down my expectations for the 6 month newbie Steam. Reading the reviews on Yelp I picked up on the XLB ones and had to try. Ordered the classic pork/crab as well at the truffle XLB. VERY impressed by the size, marble color and clarity of the wrapper, very juicy interior that wasn't too fatty. Would gladly come back just for the XLB.  Szechuan Style Wontons were spicy and sweet and the wontons were plump. Also tried the pan fried Shanghai dumplings that was juicy and excellent with sweet soy sauce. The Shanghai style noodles with beef were delightfully chewy. Not pictured was the pepper steak. Would have liked a bit less peppers but overall again quite tasty.  Rarely do you go to a restaurant where all dishes were a hit. Service was attentive and welcoming.

Came here recently with a friend and we had a fantastic experience! As soon as we walked in, we were seated even though it was during the Saturday dinner rush. The service was prompt and friendly. The interior was bright and cozy - the perfect place to find yourself on a chilly winter evening. I had never had dim sum before this, so this was a great introduction. We started off with scallion pancakes, which came out fast and were delicious. The sampler combo of dumplings was so good, we had to order another. We also had veggie fried rice on the side. We were able to sit there for a while having some wine, and it was the perfect casual dinner after a day in the West Village/Flat Iron District. I highly recommend this place!

I'm so happy to find good Shanghainese in Greenwich Village, as there aren't as many Asian restaurants in this area except for St. Marks Place. I walked in for dinner with a friend on a Wednesday night, and was seated immediately to about a half full restaurant. We ordered the xiao long bao, beef noodle soup, and cha chiang mein. The xiao long bao could compete with Din Tai Fung - thin dumpling skins, perfectly folded, delicious filling flavor and piping hot broth! The cha chiang mein had a rich savory sauce (with a hint of sweetness and spicy), and perfectly cooked chewy udon noodles. I was also impressed by the service, as we were very well looked after throughout the meal with frequent check-ins and beverage top-ups. Overall, very comforting authentic food, clean interior, and attentive service - would recommend to anyone in the area!

Heard about this restaurant through a friend and decided to have dinner there tonight.  We ordered pork soup dumplings, pan fried dumplings, wine chicken, sweet and sour whole fish and braised pork ribs.  It was the most enjoyable meal, and the service was excellent.  All the dishes were tasty.  The pork soup dumplings were superb.  It is the best soup dumplings I can find in NYC so far.  Will definitely return to try other dishes.

Lovely and modern Chinese restaurant. Tasty food and awesomely priced lunch specials. I love the chicken & broccoli and all the soups. five stars!  Staff is so friendly. Efficient and friendly service. Many healthy options.

Tried this restaurant for a weeknight dinner with friends. Nicely accessible between subway or path train. The seating is a bit tight and I felt like we didn't have much space at all between our table and the group next to us. We ordered a couple appetizers and some mains. It was nice to see a vegetable section too. The food was good, but could use a little more flavor. Also, I was quite surprised that you have to order rice in addition to a dish, unlike many places where it comes with automatically. Overall a good experience for an easy meal out with friends and well priced for the portions.

I went on a Saturday night with my roommate - glad we made a reservation because it was pretty full. We ordered the soup dumpling sampler combo with crab, pork and truffle dumplings (2 of each). Our favorites were the crab and truffle. The soup dumplings were light and juicy - really delicious and I appreciated that it was easy to tell which was which. We also got the scallion pancakes, which came in 6 pieces and were pretty light and not too greasy. Finally, we ordered the general tso's chicken. The menu indicates it's spicy but neither of us found it spicy at all (depends on your spice tolerance!). It came with broccoli, but we had to request rice on the side (it never came, but they apologized profusely for forgetting and we were stuffed enough that we didn't need it!). Overall, really cute and delicious!

Regular food, nothing special, sub par. Wouldn't come back. I was charged for a dish that I didn't touch. I literally bit a small piece in which the server acknowledged and still charged me. Do not buy the red bean pancake, please don't.

Very rarely do I have an A1 experience at a restaurant, and this was one of them. Every single item we ordered was a fresh, vibrant, and delectable experience! We started with the soup dumpling sampler combo, the truffle dumplings were the truth! They were delicate and just the right size. Next we shared the Cha Chiang Mein, it was savory with the perfect chew and hit all the right notes. The watercress with enoki mushrooms was a symphony of flavors and an unexpected winner. I'll need to get this dish at every meal here, going forward. We finished up with the Dai Pai Dong rice, which had shrimp and Chinese sausage, it was very satisfying. Needless to say, we were so stuffed we could not order any more but I'd like to try everything in this menu! The establishment was clean and nicely decorated and the waitstaff friendly and helpful. We WILL return!

Every dish at @steam_nyc was really good and the people there were super friendly! Chinese food in the US is usually too salty, oily, or heavily seasoned, but none of those was the case here! It almost felt like eating in Asia. My favorite was definitely the wuxi ribs - super tender and well seasoned. Xiaolongbao was pretty good too! Would definitely recommend coming in groups to try their food.

Very reasonably priced and the soup dumplings are amazing! Probably cheaper BYOB but you can not go wrong with anything on the menu. Staff is very attentive and service is fast and friendly. The rice was missing some flavor but overall I loved the meal.
Delicious food and ambiance, my Shanghai lo mein noodles were amazing!! The service was nice but a bit of a wait for our food. It was worth it though because everything came out tasting amazing.

Loved loved loved this place. Sister saw it on instagram and TikTok and was like we need to go. We enjoyed the beef wrapped pancake, soup dumplings, the gua bao and many more. Staff was great and good delicious. I will definitely be back to try more items from the menu !

A gem! Fiancé and I were craving dim sum last night and we gave this place a shot. Service from the moment we arrived was outstanding, and everyone working there was so helpful and gracious. The restaurant is also nicely decorated and clean with 2 gender-neutral bathrooms. Shared 5 dishes for 2 people and we were stuffed: pan fried pork dumplings, pork XLB, aromatic beef wrapped in scallion pancake, scallion pancake, and Szechuan style wontons. Loved all the dishes and would recommend. Fiancé's favorite was the XLB. Bring a crew so you can try more of the menu. We got a free sweet red bean pancake to go because we checked in on Yelp, but haven't tried it yet. Adding Steam to our rotation!
Bland, Americanized food. Basically on the level of a takeout place. Servers were very nice and friendly to their credit.

THIN soup dumplings my kids fought for!  Truffle bits for a perfect soup, nothing overwhelming.  Chilled pork & garlic sauce that was delicious with the balance of the cucumber.  A forgettable bamboo dish and the Szechuan wontons that were surprising delish - just needed a splash of vinegar.  Other than that, great service and cannot wait to come back!!!

Delicious! Delicious! Delicious! Food was amazing and the customer service was on point. My husband and I shared everything. Lo Mein were cooked perfect, beef shumai great especially with the hint of tangerine, bao was bomb. Overall great spot with fresh flavorful food and great staff. Definitely will come back again.
Various great items to pick from on menu. Although my husband still has his favorite soup dumpling place he will come here just for their black truffle and pork soup dumplings! They're are the best!
Everything was so good. Decorating is warm and cozy; staffs are super nice. Truffle soup dumplings and silken eggs with shrimp are must try! Highly recommended!!!
Outstanding in every way:  good food, excellent service, reasonable prices, attractive decor.  A great addition to the downtown restaurant scene.

Delicious! My favorite was the wine chicken and truffle soup dumplings. The truffle dumplings were fantastic and full of flavor. Service was great, I was attended to regularly and our waitress was quick and friendly. Would recommend!

I had high hopes for this place, but found that most of their entrees are breaded and fried (including spicy chicken). The batter used for this was thick and not very flavorful, taking away from the meal. Also, I loves me some spicy, and the "spicy chicken" was pretty bland. Went back a second time to see if it was just a one-off miss on the food, but the second instance was the same - for me and my guests.
I love this place! I've done both dine-in and take out and have no complaints. Food is amazing and inexpensive. Highly recommend the Dan Dan noodles

Not one to ever write reviews but this place is DELICIOUS! I got the crab and pork XLB, the shrimp dumplings (har gao), and hot and sour soup. The shrimp dumplings is the best I've ever had! The dumpling skin is so chewy yet thin and the shrimp is fresh. The XLB is so perfectly crafted with perfectly thin and chewy wrapper that holds the soup very well. My fav meal of my trip to NYC so far!

New restaurant and came here for lunch on Saturday, where they have lunch specials even on the weekend. We had mabu dof, Szechuan dumplings and sweet-and-sour soup.  everything was excellent. Having traveled to Hong Kong, China and having lived in Asia for a number of years I can absolutely say the wontons are authentic and delicious. Come early before this place gets crazy popular. The people are very nice and the interior dining area is beautiful. Perfect for village not over done and neighborhood like
We loved this place.  The lunch we had was excellent.  The owner chatted with us throughout our meal and the food was terrific.
We ordered crab meat soup dumplings, pork dumplings, fried spring rolls, fried pork buns, Scallion Pancakes, everything tastes so good! And watch out everything is so hot too!

Went for lunch today. Beautiful, clean and tasty restaurant. I ordered the wonton in chili oil, shrimp and chive dumplings, general Taos chicken and noodles. Everything was delicious. Will definitely be visiting again. Also the staff is upper friendly. Great neighborhood restaurant.

A friendly neighborhood restaurant has the best soup dumplings in town! Love their decor and food presentation! Their cozy party room can accommodate small to midsize gatherings. Their selection of wine will be my next try.
Great soup dumplings and the spare ribs were fabulous. Strongly recommend this restaurant

Great food, comfortable atmosphere, quick and attentive service. My companion and I ordered the soup dumpling sampler, Shanghai style lo mein, bok choy w/ white wine sauce, and pork buns. The food was excellent. Lo mein noodles were delicious- great texture and delicious pan-fried flavor, but we enjoyed all the dishes. Would certainly return.

This restaurant has only been open a few months and they already have a loyal following!  Food is incredible and the staff is friendly and super efficient. We tried the soup dumplings and the scallion pancakes. Both were incredibly delicious!
Wonderful Food, Professional Services, Excellent Quality, Manager Ben is so nice and professional.

Came here for lunch on a Labor Day Monday and was seated right away.  Order 3 dum sum dishes (XLB, Beef Siu Mai and Har Gow).  They were all very good especially the Har Gow.  The skins on the dim sum were then and good fillings.   We ordered shrimp rice cake and tomato braised oxtail.  The rice cakes were good but was small dish.  The braised oxtail was full of flavor and had grape tomatoes but can be cooked a bit longer.  Meat was definitely not falling off the oxtails.  The Shanghai Bok Choy was cooked perfectly as well. We will be back when in Manhattan again.  There was a line when we left!  Service was good.  The waitress was soft spoken but very tentative.
Best place to eat at, this place is a hidden gem no cap. All the food tastes amazing and the service is incredible stg...

The food here is very authentic and delicious. The menu has half authentic dishes half Americanized dishes. The soup dumplings are great. Very thin and stretchy wraps are filled with juicy and flavorful filling. The crab in the dumplings are quite fresh. The wine chicken is very nostalgic and delicious. The beef wrapped in scallion pancake is freshly made and very crispy, without being greasy at all. Amazing new spi
Amazing food and service! I will be coming back here for sure  dumplings and the noodles were so good.
Great staff - super friendly and helpful. Food is always good. Reminds me of home cooking. Will be back.
Nice ambiance, very friendly staff and most importantly great food. Loved all the dumpling dishes. Will be a regular here!

What a nice addition to the neighborhood especially with so many Chinese restaurants gone since the pandemic.  Certainly more upscale than typical restaurants.  We've done take-out but eating in is a very nice experience as well.
Good food nice place in the town! Love there dumplings, Will go back to try another dishes

My favorite Chinese restaurant (Charlie Moms) was two doors down from STEAM  and when I heard from a cousin that this new place was just as good I had to try it. WHAT A FIND !!!! This new restaurant is so wonderful that I have been there 3 times in 2 weeks and every one I went with feel the same. The menu is very diverse with dim sum, noodles, rice dishes, dumplings, and different touches to the old regulars. I recommend everything I've had so far......all kinds of soup dumplings, especially truffle and pork, vegetables dumplings which had the thinnest covering I've every seen, cold sesame noodles (really peanutty) , fried noodles with beef (so crispy) and silky eggs with shrimp and truffle -exquisite, But I've saved the best for last...scallion pancakes wrapped around beef and vegetables and the baby bok choy....TO DIE FOR. Besides being beautifully designed with interesting touches, I recommend this wonderful new find in the village.
Came to this place for lunch, everything was excellent. Ordered the scallion pancake, pork soup dumplings, Wuxi spareribs, and red bean pancakes. Food was very flavorful. Would definitely come back!

Extremely good, new addition to the neighborhood. Service was fantastic, and recommendations provided by our server were spot on. Got the Pork Soup Dumplings, Beef wrapped in Scallion Pancake (a must get), cucumber and woodear mushrooms, Dan Dan noodles, and Taiwanese beef noodle soup. All were very flavorful and good portion sizes. Bonus was they have a very tasty chili oil to add to dishes. Will definitely be back to try their other dim sum and menu items!

The service is really bad. Got the order wrong 2 times. They fixed the first order, but for the second order, we order pan fried pork buns, and the server gave us dumplings instead, then told us they don't have any pork buns anymore and forced us to have the dumplings. They act like we don't know anything about Chinese food. Why would I pay for something I don't want, should've told us earlier.

The dishes we ordered from Steam were as good as it gets!  I highly recommend the meaty fall off the bone spareribs in a perfectly balanced sauce as well as the beef lo mein. I can't wait to sample other dishes on the  menu.

Just happened to walk pass this restaurant and decided to try them out. We ordered the soup dumpling sampler, beef noodle soup and the spare ribs lunch set. Every dish is so good! Soup dumplings were sooo juicy. Spare ribs were so tender. Beef noodle soup was so therapeutic. The dishes were all reasonably priced as well. Recommend!

My neighbor recommended this new restaurant in the neighborhood, so I figured I'd give it a try with the lunch special. I was pleasantly surprised. The quality of the food was excellent. I ordered chicken with broccoli, spring rolls, and hot & sour soup. I loved everything! The interior of the restaurant has a clean modern aesthetic. The staff is very friendly. I'm looking forward to trying the curry chicken or the pepper steak next time. Definitely recommend.
So pleased with this new restaurant.  Really delicious and fresh.  Great design too.  Can't wait to return.

I've nearby and have been waiting for this place to open. Area did not disappoint!  It's clean, bright, and the service is great. The food is fabulous. We got the fried pork dumplings, scallion pancakes, general tso's chicken, and the shirt ribs. Everything was so f good!  Will def be back soon and I'm looking forward to making this my regular spot.

ambiance was 10/10, friendly service and pretty quick too. id recommend the Black sesame and cream cheese toast, it was nutty and rich and tasted a bit like peanut butter. the berry was good but a little too sweet imo

Was pretty disappointed by the food here... their roasted green tea latte was amazing and I would come back just for their drinks but the food leaves much to be desired. The karage was not crispy and the flavor was lacking... mentaiko pasta was so so but this is a dish that is extremely easy to make at home so i was expecting an extra oomph. The biggest disappointment was the toast. extremely dry and lacking any umami, I could not finish my portion and my friend agreed it did not justify its hefty $13 price tag. Come for the drinks , get food elsewhere

Such a cute place to spend cozy afternoon with close friends.  Noodles are delicately made and presented beautifully.   We ordered sea urchin noodle and mentaiko noodle.   They were not like "die for" and "need to come back for" but good and beautiful visually.    We ordered green tea latte (Macha latte) and it was beautifully decorated on the surface but was very lukewarm and not hot.   Drinks are serviced by white paper cup which is ok for takeout but it is too casual for this cute seating for lunch.

Very cute place. Luckily I was able to walk in and get 2 seats at the bar at about 1pm on a weekday. Servers were super nice. Got the berry and cream toast, mentai spaghetti, and karaage chicken to share. All were very good but the spaghetti changed my life! Def recommend but will admit was a bit overpric

The place is too small. There's only a few tables and counter space. The wait on a Saturday lunch for 2-3 was estimated at 2 hours!! We ended up getting takeout, to which the food price to quantity ratio could be improved. The food itself was light in flavor, which I quite liked. I was also expecting the curry rice to contain pork pieces, but it was mostly pork flavor and some ground pork bits.

Solid place for a sweet toasts and warm beverages! Tried the cinnamon toast, honey lemon, black sesame and cream cheese, and the berry and cream cheese. Also tried the black sesame latte. Probably shouldn't have ordered so much considering how rich each was but they were so good. This was my dessert after having had brunch elsewhere. I was pleasantly surprised to have walked by and saw space inside for a bite so just had to try. Looks like they also serve savory dishes so I'm hoping to try that next time!

Davelle is a very charming restaurant that is perfect for catching up with a friend over breakfast. I ordered the berry and cream cheese toast, which was beautiful and tasty. Note that the price is high for what it is. My friend ordered the curry, which I thought was good but nothing too special. Would recommend skipping. I liked the hoji-cha latte, which has a great flavor and is very refreshing. Overall, I think it's definitely worth visiting Davelle at least once. Important to note that the space is very small so it's better to go by yourself or with a small group. There's also usually a long wait on weekends so make sure to get there earlier to avoid the crowd.

I had high hopes for this cute aesthetics Japanese cafe but was unfortunately let down.  The consensus among my friends and I is that the food is very mediocre and I would not return back albeit the drinks are very good.  The noodles were all average and yes the toasts are cute to look at but it ends there unfortunately.  I could make better toast at home for 1/5th of the price.  Anyways, our waiter was very nice so I added one star but I wouldn't recommend Davelle to anyone.

SO cute - one of my favorite places on the LES! Toasts are well priced and taste great. The restaurant itself is pretty small though and walk in only, so would recommend coming on the early side to avoid a long line. Definitely worth a wait though!

Davelle is always pretty crowded, but walking in can be easy around lunchtime if you're going alone! I enjoyed the chicken Katsu curry rice. I didn't expect the curry itself to have such discernible meat chunks, and I think that texture threw me off a little bit. Next time if I went again, I'd probably get the curry without the chicken because the whole thing was a little meaty for my liking. I do recommend going to check this place out!

Cute Instagrammable place that I got to check off my bucket list. Expect an hour long wait on weekends, but the food is brought out pretty fast. Both toasts were good ($12), but honestly nothing special. I would say the matcha au lait with coffee jelly ($7.5) was my favorite thing I ordered - it was smooth and creamy, and the coffee jelly was a unique touch.

The wait tends to be super long (it's a tiny place with tiny tables) and the portions are also tiny, but the dishes are super cute and yummy! I'd recommend for anyone wanting very photogenic dishes for their Instagram feed, because the toasts are truly adorable. Come at an odd time to avoid a crazy wait.
Food was very delicious! I recommend the toast and pasta, both were really good. The store is pretty small but cozy. Service was 10/10 definitely a spot i would go to again!

Very tiny, cozy brunch spot. The staff were all very nice and the food was tasty. They don't take reservations but spots open up pretty quickly. I didn't get to try the toast but saw they are made to order and will definitely try one next time. I had the fried chicken with rice "bento". It was the perfect portion, chicken was crispy and loved the purple rice.

A cozy little cafe, perfect for a weekend brunch. The place is small so I'd recommend only 2 or 3 people groups. Their menu is so adorable and cute with very interesting variations of toast. The katsu don had a strong sake flavor that can be bitter to some people. Overall, such a cute place for a date or meet up with friends!

A cute little spot with solid Japanese-inspired menu items! Loved the Hojicha Latte and Black Sesame & Cream Cheese Toast. The toast was just slightly sweet and the cream cheese added a smooth touch on top. There isn't much seating at the cafe, maybe only around 3-4 tables and then bar seating. Not great for big groups, but is a cute quick catch-up spot!

I was there 3 mins before opening time. The guy looked at us but kept ignoring, which I understood because we were early. Even if it was 4 mins after 9am, he continued to keep brewing coffee and set up table. We were freezing outside. He didn't apologize the fact that he was late. Then he rudely asked my friend to move so he can put up the sign. You could've apologized that they were few mins late or just tell us to come in. just be polite. Bc of this customer service, we decided to not go in anymore. When we asked for his name, he did not tell us his name. Greatly disappointed. Never going again

I love everything on the menu EXCEPT for the IG friendly toasts. Yes they look great for pics but they're literally  just bread. Get the uni spaghetti, mentai spaghetti and the curry!!!!! Tastes just like Japan. A little bit on the pricey side but SO good.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Came here with my friend around 4 pm on a Tuesday. We were lucky enough to get a table right away. Loved their matcha latte and mentai spaghetti. However, the katsu don was too salty and the chicken wasn't crispy. Overall the food was good and the service was 10/10. Would stop by for their matcha latte.

Very cute and aesthetic spot to grab a bite. The toasts are extremely pretty and also very tasty, but a little on the pricey side. I guess there's a reason we still came out to get them even though we could have made it at home though. The drinks were just okay, nothing particularly memorable.

100% recommend Davelle! One of my favorite restaurants I HAVE to visit when I come to NY. Staff is so kind and the food is to DIE for. I highly recommend. Their toasts are delicious as well as their uni noodles. But most of all, Davelle has the BEST cocktails you can ask for. I would come to Davelle simply for the drinks!!

Excellent cool and cozy little coffeehouse and cafe specializing in Japanese cuisine like curry and rice plates, mentai/uni spaghetti, chicken karaage (which was excellent with an amazing sauce), various flavored toasts and coffees (black sesame, matcha, etc.). Only issue is that it is a little cramped, but what NY cafe/coffeehouse is not? Highly recommended.
This place is tiny but it has the prettiest toasts and best tea drinks!  I had the lemon toast and it was almost too pretty to eat!
Toast was very aesthetic. The service was good and the flavors were subtle but tasty. A bit expensive but the vibes were cute and nice. The wait was quick. They don't take reservations only walk ins.

Came back a 2nd time with a friend. We tried: 1) lemon toast, 2) Karaage bento box, 3) uni pasta, 4)hojicha latte. The karaage bento box & the uni pasta were my most favorite! The lemon toast looked pretty but taste was nothing special.  Try to eat the toast soon bc it became soggy as my friend was taking photos of it. The hojicha latte was good too!

Phenomenal place run by beautiful friendly people- small, casual, perfect for an intimate breakfast or lunch. The lemon toast was remarkable (all the toasts were), the curry excellent, and the coffee top notch.

I came across this place on instagram and really wanted to try the toasts. The place was super busy and due to them only having roughly 8 tables, there was a 45min-1hour wait. Therefore, I recommend making reservations! Luckily, they had the option of takeout. I ordered the lemon toast and the berry toast. I wasn't a fan of the lemon toast because the lemon gave it a bitter taste. But if you remove the lemons from the toast, it tastes much better. My favorite was the berry toast! The cream cheese and the jam complimented each other nicely. I love how the bread was thick and soft. I was afraid the crust would be hard but it wasn't! I am not sure if I'd come here again, but it was a lovely experience!

I was pleasantly surprised how delicious these toast are!!! They look so good and tasted just as good! Would come back 100% Super cute Japanese restaurant! Be aware they close one hour to their timing

This is such a popular place, but I was pretty disappointed. Really overpriced, mediocre food, and service isn't good. Honestly, nothing is special about this place. Instagram just really blew it up. The toast is $12 (maybe more now?), and I could've easily made it taste better at home.

Went for the aesthetic toasts, stayed for everything! I love the pasta, is with a Japanese twist to it sooo delish, definitely a must get, and creamy sauce with savory, strong mentaiko flavors. And the cutest toasts that were definitely a little overhyped, the honey lemon combo was a little interesting. And the drinks is so refreshing with strong flavors!

Very cute and small place! You can always expect a line here and a bit of a wait. I went because the food looked so good and yummy. I got the lemon toast and the katsu curry. The toast was a little underwhelming. It's hella aesthetic but didn't taste amazing. It was kind of dry and the lemon tastes a bit sour and bitter instead of sweet. I was expecting more of a lemon pound cake tastes. The curry was solid! Not something out of this world, but for sure yummy!

I was actually looking forward to this given how cute the place looks and how long the line was, so I was unfortunately disappointed that I didn't like any of the food we got :( The katsu don was an immediate fail just looking at how cooked the eggs were, and the chicken katsu was too moist as well. As for the toasts, it might just be me but I don't think cream cheese and sesame go very well together :/ Nothing too special to say about it. The best we've got was probably the matcha, so maybe I will try just the drinks if I do come back in the future.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY

column6: This charming cafe serves up the most beautiful and artistic Japanese toast! I rolled up just after it opened and the counter was almost full with patrons already! I was seated right away and I ordered the berry jam and cream cheese toast with a matcha yuzu honey lemonade. My drink came out first and it was lovely! It was refreshing and had a great matcha flavor but was also sweet and tart from the honey and citrus. I loved it! And because i was sitting at the counter, I was able to watch how they made my toast! It was literally watching art be made. The bread was thick and fluffy and the strawberry jam and cream cheese combination made for a delicious combo. My neighbor to the right had ordered the adorable cinnamon butter toast and my neighbor to the left had ordered the mentai mayo and those were really pretty works of art as well. I only wish i had more stomach space to try all their toasts and more of their drinks. Their dinner menu sounded so good too. I hope to return one day!! This place is so cute and the staff are all so lovely and nice!

I was really excited to try this spot after seeing the beautiful toasts on social media! We ordered the black sesame & honey lemon toast, as well as the chicken Katsu curry. The curry was a bit pricey and the portions were pretty small ;( it tasted pretty average too. The toasts were beautiful but not amazing in flavor either. Overall a cute spot for IG but probably wouldn't return consistently.

Davelle is a quaint restaurant and great for an intimate date. The chicken Katsu curry was amazing and delicious! The plates were so unique and really added to the presentation. I would definitely go again to try the other items on the menu.

I was drawn to Davelle's aesthetic toast from my Instagram feed, but the star of the meal was definitely the uni spaghetti. The sauce is so flavorful, we were savoring every last bite. We also ordered the chicken katsu curry and it was surprisingly better than we expected. The curry has a tiny kick to it that made it so delicious. Of course, we ordered the black sesame and cream cheese toast. Aesthetic and flavor combination are both a 5/5. I was inspired to make my own matcha cream cheese toast at home afterwards. As for drinks, we got the matcha au lait with coffee jelly and black sesame latte. I liked how both of them were lightly sweetened and though I've had better black sesame lattes before, I still enjoyed this one. The space inside is quite tiny, so I wouldn't come here with a large group and you might have to wait. Would have been 5 stars if there was a bit more uni and if the toasts weren't as overpriced, but overall loved this meal!

Davelle is impressive. Aside from the long waits and spotty service, the food is pretty awesome. The different toasts and pastas are delicious, but the drinks are also a win. The black sesame toast was great, with perfect balance of the black sesame, cream cheese, and bread. The uni spaghetti was a little stingy on the uni, but the noodles texture and sauces were delicious. The chicken katsu curry was forgettable, but not bad. Big fan of their drinks, especially the macha au-lait with coffee jelly.

This is an intimate, slow dining experience. It's a tight, European-inspired space with a bar where you can watch the barista in front of a dazzling array of coffee machines. We were able to snag a seat at the bar a little over an hour after they opened on Saturday. I got the iced maple latte and it was well balanced and creamy. The ham egg toast was a tad overcooked but I enjoyed the experience so much and admired the speed at which the small staff created each intricate toast creation, I didn't care. The berries and cream cheese toast and the honey lemon toast were both magical, anyways. A special place for a special morning.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: The drinks here were PHENOMENAL! This is perfect for a quiet quaint brunch in LES. The toasts were super filling and the menu was pretty creative. Staff was so nice as well!

For the drink, the creamy nutty black sesame latte was bomb!! Also the bittersweet Matcha coffee jelly is a great match. The bread was not toasted which I hope it was. Their chicken katsu curry was not like the typical Japanese curry(which tend to be sweeter) and I'm glad this one is on the spicier side! Their menu is super cute.

Decor and servers were so pleasant and cute! The food itself, specifically the toast, was pretty, but not the best of what we had. The toast is not very crispy, but the toppings were good! The karaage was solid- would go again for the vibe and drinks.

Cute intimate cafe with some very creative dishes. We had the azuki latte (Red bean), black sesame toast, ogura toast, mentai spaghetti, and hojicha latte. I wish the red bean toast and latte would have stronger red bean taste. The red bean latte was a bit too sweet for me. The two toasts (red bean and black sesame) at least were not too sweetened and the texture was lovely with a crispy and soft bite. The mentai spaghetti was full of favor and the noodles had a nice bite (like a quality ramen). They diligently checked for vaccination status.

Wow this was delicious!! So happy I stumbled across this place. The space inside is tiny so there was a 20 minute wait to get seated even on a cold winter morning, but the interior is really cute and the food is yummy and looks amazing too. Can't wait to come back!

So cute and such nice staff! Tiny little place with a few tables and a bar area to sit at. Drinks were great and the toast was also great. Definitely pricey but for a once in a way experience, it was a good time!

Love the place. Cute and quaint Japanese restaurant, and there is a keen attention to detail in everything they make! Lines get long, so definitely get there before the morning rush! Ordered the sesame and roe toast, along with the matcha coffee jelly drink and katsu don. Everything was amazing! Will have to try the curry next time as I've heard amazing things about that as well.

if you love japanese food this place is a must try. i know the toasts are iconic here but opted for the mentai pasta and the pork curry. will say my mentai pasta is the reason im giving 5 stars- it was phenomenal. the pork curry was also decent but if i were to come back id probably opt for the katsu curry for more meat. this place had a line when we went and though they estimated 30 min it was much faster!

Super cute cafe tucked away on a quiet road. I came because I saw a post about their toasts and I love bread. It's very small inside but I was lucky to snag a seat- however they do takeout as well. I ordered a matcha au lait with coffee jelly that was so refreshing and delish. I also ordered the black sesame and cream cheese toast. It's a thick slice of toast with alternating spreads of black sesame and cream cheese. It was delicious. They had tons of other toast combinations including red bean, and ham and egg. They also serve pasta dishes, like an uni pasta, and other small appetizers. The service is great and the vibes inside the cafe are impeccable. Highly recommend !

It's pretty, aesthetic, and well-crafted, but the toast in real life isn't anything to write home about. I had the berry & cream cheese toast, which tasted like literally a piece of plain toasted bread with cream cheese and jam that I'd make at home, just much prettier and arguably slightly more airy bread. I don't know what I expected, though for the price, I was expecting this toast to be one of those thick sweet milk breads (huge fan of those) or to potentially change my life. The interior is tiny and waits can get long if you want to enjoy your toast sitting down. Overall, I'm glad I tried it once and everything was fine, just not quite fitting the hype or the price.

For either a quick meal or light snack, Davelle is a great place to visit. Choosing what to get was quite the dilemma; the cafe's menu is filled with unique items that I plan to try when I visit again, like the uni spaghetti and black sesame and cream cheese toast. My girlfriend and I decided to go with the honey lemon toast and were really content with our choice. While there wasn't anything particularly special about the toast, the bread was soft, lemons were thinly sliced, and the honey glaze was a perfect amount of sweet. All in all, the chic waiters/waitresses and stylish cafe decor made this cafe a must-visit.

I ordered the Black Sesame Toast, Chicken Katsu, and  Black Sesame Latte as well. I really liked the black sesame toast, but this place is very experience for the portion size. If you're trying to optimize your bang for your buck, go somewhere else, but if you're going for the Instagram factor and reliably good food, I would recommend.

Came here because I've seen too many IG posts about the toasts. I did get my photo too but the food was not that great. The toast was disappointing, no flavor. However the mentai pasta was delicious, and the cafe is cute, thus 3 stars.
Delicious. Loved the lattes and toasts. Can't wait to go back for the entrees. Small cute spot and very delicious!

Little bit in the expensive side when you think about it but honestly it was super fun. The space s really inviting and the toast was a spectacle. Very instagrammable obviously that's what you're paying for. The berrys and cream toast was my favorite for sure! Coffee and matcha also look great too
Food poisoning from the uni pasta. Think the uni was briney and tasted "off" but it didn't occur this was the cause until our stomachs reacted poorly later.
Idk why it says it's closed - but I recently went and I loved their toast! Super cute & cozy spot in the city. I def wanna come back and try some other meals!

It's a tiny tiny place, very easy to miss. Staff were super friendly. Mentai spaghetti is one of their most popular items but it is an acquired taste, I personally do not like the fishiness of it but my friend loves it. Pork katsu don was ok, it does get dry once the sauce is gone (maybe ask for extra sauce) cream cheese berry toast tastes exactly like how you imagine it to be. Very sweet and athletic pleasing, but nothing mind blowing about it. I would go back for curry rice though, heard that was good.
The food was really yummy and the service was amazing as well. It is a really cute tiny cafe, will definitely be coming back for a matcha latte!
Chill weekend brunch spot. Everything about this little place is adorable. Service and food were top notch

A very cute and small shop that serves delicious dishes. Me and my boyfriend ordered a cheese curry toast and the mentaiko mayo toast. Both were very tasty. I liked the mentaiko mayo toast more. We also got an order of the hot green tea latte which was very good! The latte is a must try when you come here. I'd love to come back to try their other toasts and lunch menu next time!

Came here for my niece's birthday weekend, with my sisters and nieces. I ordered lunch and everyone else in my party ordered breakfast variations.23 minute wait at 1030am on Saturday. Waiter was writing down the orders. But he forgot or couldn't read his writing....not sure but he came back twice to " make sure of the order. Food was correct but I was very disappointed with the chicken and waffles. Chicken breast was really good except it hadn't been trimmed correctly and I had to cut hunks of fat from it (and deep fried hunks of fat are just gross). The waffles were small rounds about 21/2 inches across and the menu doesn't tell you that. They were over cooked and cold. Butter was cold and hard. Egg was cooked as ordered.  Hubby's omelet was good. Waiter did come by several times and refilled coffee, water, tea.  2 breakfast meals, tea & coffee were $42.00.  Tip was $8.40.  Not worth it. I'm pretty sure we were over charged but they can keep it.

We came here for a Sunday brunch and luckily we made it to the last table before it was all taken. The place is pretty small and it was very busy as soon as it was opened. We got the Honey Lemon Toast, chicken katsu don, and black sesame kinako latte to share. The portion size was pretty good for the both of us as a light meal. The black sesame kinako latte was very creamy and filling and the chicken katsu don was def my favorite. I wasn't a big fan of the honey lemon toast, maybe I will try another toast next time.
The toast and the pasta were yummy. It's a cute place for food pics. The matcha was delicious
Super friendly staff, very aesthetically pleasing food and drinks plus also very delicious. Fast service good, small place but good to come chat with your friends for a bit

My friend and I had planned a trip to New York back in April! Thanks to Tik Tok I found Davelle and knew I had to put it on our list of brunch spots. We went on a Saturday afternoon and only had to wait 15 minutes, not bad for a weekend! The restaurant is pretty small but really cute! We were sat at an awkward spot which looked like a refurnished fireplace top. It was just us two so we didn't need much space, but it would have been nice to have one of the tables. We ordered the milky ruby, honey lemon toast, cinnamon butter toast, and the napolitan spaghetti (which I heard was no longer on the menu!!). The milky ruby was super light, refreshing, and sweet! Could not taste the alcohol at all, which in my opinion makes a good drink. The honey lemon toast and cinnamon butter toast were good as well! I usually don't like lemon flavor, but I thoroughly enjoyed it! The cinnamon butter is super simple and classic. As for the napolitan spaghetti, it was excellent! I had forgotten all the ingredients but I know it was one of our favorites! I am sad to hear they no longer sell it! Although Davelle's items are not overly complex, their food design and atmosphere makes this place so unique and classic. Definitely a must try when visiting New York!

My friend and I have been talking about trying this place out for over a year, but we were quite disappointed with the food. We came on a Monday at 1:30 PM and waited for 20 minutes for a table. We ordered the black sesame toast, karaage, curry, yuzu matcha lemonade, and black sesame latte. The toast was quite a letdown. Personally, I felt like the cream cheese and black sesame jam did not compliment each other and the black sesame was overpowered by the honey used to sweeten it. The karaage was good but not AMAZING. The portion size of the curry was small and the rice was hard. The black sesame latte was okay. Very rich. Overall, we spent quite a lot on this meal considering we weren't even full afterward.

Came on a Saturday afternoon. The waitresses were very nice and got us seated/took our orders promptly. We ordered the mentai spaghetti, berry and cream cheese toast, and black sesame toast. The mentai spaghetti was DELICIOUS. Would highly recommend for anyone that wants a creamy, seafood-y dish. A little salty but nothing crazy (im just very salt conscious). The black sesame toast is a must get for anyone-- perfect texture, not too sweet, and has a very noticeable sesame taste. We also got the matcha honey yuzu lemonade and hojicha tea (iced) with oat milk. Both were delicious-- get the lemonade if you want something citrusy, sweet, and refreshing, and get the hojicha if you want something slightly thicker (almost like a latte consistency) and somewhat sesame-tasting. Overall, would visit again.

Davelle in the Lower East Side, is a cozy Japanese cafe serving Japanese comfort foods, teas and coffee, and the most adorable milk toasts I've had the pleasure of laying my eyes on. With very limited seating, the wait list for brunch can get upwards of 1.5 hours quickly, so if you do go, make sure to arrive early to put you name down.

Holy cow I can't recommend this place enough. Everything we ordered was delicious. The spaghetti was surprisingly a stand-out dish to us. It was perfectly al dente and along with the crispy, crunchy karaage, it balanced out the sweetness of our toasts perfectly. The toasts aren't only aesthetic but also so tasty. Neither one we ordered was too sweet, and I'd highly recommend trying both. The restaurant itself was very charming, and the servers are very friendly and fashionable. We waited for about 20 minutes, and it was totally worth the wait.

Went here today for some breakfast and got two toasts (the egg and ham + red bean) along with two matcha lattes (hot + iced) to go. The matcha tastes pretty high quality but I personally wished the latte was a bit sweeter. The toasts are substantial and pretty cute but feel a bit overpriced. I didn't get to try their lunch options and may visit again, but their menu feels rather limited and you may need to be in a certain mood to go. The space is very small but very cute and clean. My main qualm is just the food felt overpriced.
It's ok, the portions are extremely small, the chicken katsudon don was really good, the toast was overpriced for the amount they gave but the jam was very tasty
The freshness of the food is excellent. The vibe of the space - super quaint & cool. Try the curry - delicious. I will be back for all the quality.

Food is very bland. It looks good from the picture but it was warm. It wasn't even hot and the curry was sweet. The chicken also wasn't that crispy. The sesame latte tasted like an instant sesame soup packet from the Chinese supermarket. Service is horrible too. There was a bar in the side with two seats and there were 3 people in my party. They wouldn't let us all squeeze in that bar with an extra chair because "it gets too crowded" but we said we didn't mind but they still wouldn't let us. Not a smart business move, they could have lost a lot of money bcuz we spent like $80 here. We stayed and had to wait another 30 minutes for a table. I would not come back here bcuz there is much better food in nyc.

We managed to make it just before the line started forming pre-open.  It's quite a small venue, so there was a line waiting for seating.  We ordered berry and cream cheese toast, karage curry, and a side of fried chicken.  I'd say everything met expectations, but the side of friend chicken definitely exceeded expectations!  I think it's a must-order, super crispy, yet good texture for the chicken on the inside.

I loved it! A real hole in the wall type of place with limited seating, but it added a unique and slice-of-life-esque atmosphere, especially with the watercolor illustrations of the menu. We ordered the black sesame and cream cheese toast, ham egg toast, and mentai pasta. All really delicious and unique flavors! I'd come back, especially to scope out the rest of the menu.

Super cute, cozy vibes with delicious Japanese fusion food. My friends and I got the Berry and Cream Cheese Toast, Chicken Katsu Curry, Uni Spaghetti, and Iced coffee with Coffee Jelly. I thought the toast was yummy but realistically not worth the price; would only recommend getting if you care about getting an aesthetic Insta pic. The curry and spaghetti were divine but gone in 5 bites :( However, I guess these serving sizes/prices are typical of a nice niche cafe in NYC. Be prepared for long waiting times due to the cafe's limited seating and no reservation policy. In conclusion, will be coming back but only during the weekdays when the waiting time is not absurd.

They're back open now for indoor dining! It's a super small place so don't bring your whole family + extended family. There's like 2 tiny tables inside which seats about 5 people max. They have miscellaneous items for purchase in the store such as utensils, masks, ornaments, coin holders, and alcohol. This time I tried the karaage and uni spaghetti along with a hot maple latte. The karaage was juicy and good with the not too overpowering honey mustard. About 5 pieces. The Uni spaghetti was okayy def more tomato than I expected and was very light tasting to the palate.

All the dishes are so good! The toasts are phenomenal, I've tried a few (can't remember which, but you can't go wrong with any of them) in the two times I've been. I've also tried the bento box styled fried chicken dish that was really yummy!

Hole in the wall, Japanese cafe serving mostly toast, curries, and speciality drinks. Have not tried the toast but they do seem to take quite an effort to make aesthetic wise. As a solo diner, I was seated at the bar counter. Seat was a little uncomfortable, hard to sit up on. Ordered a black sesame kinako latte. Was hoping to have latte art as I've seen on other pictures but sadly didn't get one. It was super foamy on top. Taste wise it was pretty good. A less sweeter version of the Chinese black sesame pudding mix. Which I actually love so the drink was a nice surprise. I did see them add the kinako powder in my drink but couldn't taste it. The black sesame is pretty strong taste wise. Near the end of my drink, you can taste the leftover gritty powder. Got quite busy inside, there was only one person serving and hosting customers. He seemed a little overwhelmed. I saw customers coming in and wanting to dine in but it was a full house. Some girls next to me already finished eating and looked like they ready to pay but they didn't call out to the guy and just kept talking. I think they can work on clearing out the place more efficiently if they had another person helping him.
toast is so good. thick bread so one is enough but i got two because i did. service is not the best - only 6 tables and clearly understaffed, but food was really good

Stopped by this week and this place has a lovely atmosphere. The service was quick and welcoming. I ordered the black sesame paste with cream cheese toast and it was very tasty. I also had a nice hot tea, all for around $19. The cafe is small but a nice stop for a bite to eat.
Service is great, food looked really pretty but the taste was average

So glad I found this small café! I came on a Saturday morning around 11:30am and the place was already packed (they open at 10am). The inside is pretty small, so I ended up getting a table outside. However, it was not an incredibly hot June morning, so there was a nice breeze which made the environment really enjoyable. Of course, along with the yummy food and great customer service. My favorite would have to be the Iced Café Au Lait w. Coffee Jelly! Mainly because I loved the coffee jelly lol. Other then that, the chicken katsu don and ham egg toast were pretty simple and good. I have to mention that their menu is extremely adorable and that's what attracted me to the café! I will definitely be back to try some of their other food items~
Cute neighborhood spot with great coffee. Chicken bento was delish however pork curry rice had good flavor but was a bit too salty.

Such a cute little cafe/restaurant place! The sesame cream cheese toast was the highlight. I would come back just for that. I also got the mentaiko pasta and uni pasta, but it was unfortunately just ok. I would definitely recommend the toast tho. I wanna go back to try the other ones. The fried chicken was good too, can't go wrong with fried chicken. It was juicy and flavorful
Amazing service and good food. I think the drinks are not their forte... my yuzu cocktail tasted like old sparkling water
Hmm, I like the style of this cafe. Small but they have everything! They have very unique toasts.
The wait is super long, especially on a Saturday but the uni pasta is worth it. The lemon honey toast is great and comforting, but I will be coming back for the uni pasta.
Just so everyone knows this location is permanently closed when myself and our friends came

A small-ish Japanese eatery on LES. They currently have indoor and outdoor seating; inside they have around three tables + bar stools and a few tables outside. Clean and calm atmosphere which I really liked! Perfect place to have lunch with your friends. Lots of innovative and aesthetic choices on the menu. I'd love to try their pastas and cocktails. I ordered shabu-shabu salad $13 and hot sencha tea $3,5. The salad was delicious and tea was good. For dessert, I had honey lemon toast $10. I was positively surprised, because not only was it pretty, it also tasted good! Not dry. The staff is nice and positive, despite the fact that they seem to be very busy all the time. I had to wait 10 mins for my check, which is not the end of the world, but could've been quicker. Would come again!

This Traditional Japanese Cafe is now on your list of places to try in NYC! This cute spot is the size of a NYC studio apartment with a waitlist has long as two pages on the weekends. It gives off cozy and homey vibes making it the perfect spot to cozy up with your friends and loved ones. In the kitchen they are serving up immaculate Japanese dishes from Black Cream & Sesame Toast to Mentai Spagetti. Their Honey Toast & Cortado are divine too!
