The staff was very warm, welcoming and accommodating.

The food is delicious, especially the chicken, crispy and tender. The toast is okay, and is easy to replicate at home. The only problem is that the restaurant is small so during the time we went, a Sat. lunch, it was so crowded and full of people, making dining environment not that enjoyable.
Black Sesame Toast. Found a piece of plastic in the cream on my toast, don't know what it was.

I am so thankful for gems like this in New York. This cafe is operation well, with limited seating indoor and outdoor. I came here by myself and ordered a Match au lait and Blueberry toast. Both items were delicious and a bit on the pricey side but worth it for me to be able to sit there and enjoy the aesthetics. The services was great, the staff is super friendly, I even saw the owner offer the delivery guy water after they dropped off their packages. 10/10 I have to go back to try other items on their amazing menu!

This is one of the cutest places I recently discovered with a friend.  We caught up and had lunch in this cozy spot.  The service is very professional yet not intrusive.  I also loved the menu, which is electronic if I can recall.  I ordered the chicken cutlet curry with its scrumptious sauce.  My dining companion ordered the cream cheese toast, which was artful and delicious.  Definitely worth a visit.  So much fun.  A beautiful environment.
Most  people sit down to eat are tourists. Locals are usually come here and get the drinks. You get the idea...
Lovely little shop. Lives up to its hype. Toast has great visuals and taste. Would visit again.

Davelle lives up to the hype, though it didn't blow my mind. The mentai mayo toast was very pretty and made a satisfying snack. The Karaage picnic set was also very good, and definitely had enough food to share. Their outdoor dining setup is a little confusing, and it does seem like the staff randomly gives preference to some groups for tables rather than relying on an equitable line system. They're a bit slow, but it's not a deal breaker. Definitely worth stopping by, especially if it isn't crowded.
All the food here is so good. They just revamped their menu and created a dinner menu! Cocktails are on point and the food is fabulous. Def coming back to this gem again and again.

We got the chicken karage curry and the pork curry!! Everything was very tasty, the cream and berries toast was a perfect way to end our meal with our matcha latte! Such a cute place! Definitely a must if you're visiting the city.
Had a nice double espresso here, didn't get to try their mains but the place is super cute and I believe in the former Soy establishment.

Was extremely excited to try this place and have been since before pandemic! Due to my laziness, I finally woke up craving their toasts (although I've never had.. I was craving via pictures) Everything tastes as good as it looks! Got the Berry and Cream Cheese Toast, Honey Lemon Toast and Cafe Au Lait with Coffee Jelly - all super delicious. -2 stars  because $10 is really steep for 1 toast.. if it was on the range of $5.50~ I'd probably get this every weekend but $30 for 2 toasts and 1 coffee is crazy + the delivery fees! Will probably go to Davelle for their other fuller options like their spaghetti since the price for those are more justifiable.

Charmed by brunch here. Uni spaghetti was truly impressive in how the uni taste was infused throughout the noodles. The sesame kinako latte had a more gritty texture, but the warm smell of sesame instantly made it one of the most memorable lattes I've ever had.
So it gave you good Instagram picture (I guess). But that is it. The food is pretty tasteless. Drink is similarly tasteless. The place is so small and no air conditioner. Will not recommend.

My friend came all the way from Canada for their toast but she was very disappointed because they did a sloppy job on the toast today. The shabu salad was refreshing and yummy. The dressing tasted like the ones you had at a shabu restaurant. The tofu matcha avocado was ok...it was in liquid where the cashier said it should be in a thick texture. It seemed like they made one size and split into two cups with lots of ice cubes to fill up the cups. Overall, their food was good but they were overpriced. Toast ($9) Smoothie ($9) Salad ($12) with questionable portion and quality.
This is the first time I came here. It is suitable for a light breakfast. The kitchen open at 10 o'clock. If you want some meal except for toast , you should come after 10.

Made reservations online. It was completely empty when I went with my sister. I went because I follow someone on ig and she said it's soooo good. Maybe the lunch or breakfast is so good but the things we are were okay. We got the uni pasta, spicy cod pasta, and curry. I think the uni wasn't as good as I expected. There were tiny uni pieces that didn't seem like fresh uni. I really don't know but when I've had uni pasta at other places it didn't look like this. It wasn't bad but I don't think it's worth the price. I really enjoyed the spicy cod pasta and curry. It was good but everything was pretty expensive. Service was good. They were attentive. Cute small place.

Okay, definitely an authentic Japanese joint which I have fallen in love with..and will be back for dinner. I came for lunch and ordered their katsu curry. The chicken was crispy and hot, curry steaming, and rice was well.. it's rice. I wanted to try a lot more things on their menu but due to limited space allotted in my stomach I'll have to come back.

We went to this place Saturday around 3:30. There was still a short line. We decided to wait outside while there was no much room for us to stand since the there were 2 outdoor tables on the street. So we were standing right by the store door and trying our best not to block anyone's way. But one of the servers were insisting we were not following the rules of his. I was trying to explain the street is too narrow and we are already trying our best. He was very rude and prejudicial: " if you don't want to follow the rules, you can just leave. We don't welcome anyone like you." I have never been treated like the way he treated me and so as my friend, and we were deeply offended.

Even on a weeknight, this broom closet of a restaurant fills up fast after 7pm. Perhaps the limited space keeps the dinner menu small as well, and one hopes that each dish benefits from the chef's extra attention. My first choices here were solid, but not mind-blowing. The crisp exteriors of the cheese potato croquettes are accompanied by moist interiors. Perhaps too moist in fact, and the cheese flavor is hard to detect. Although a staple dish, the chicken katsu curry arrives with a thoughtful presentation. Again the fry is well done, and the chicken skin adheres well to the meat beneath. Thus it's easy to cut tiny bites with the edge of a spoon (a pet peeve of mine). The first impression of the curry sauce is sweetness, but this is followed by a complex and lingering aftertaste. Overall, it's not the best curry I've had in the city, but it's pretty good.

Wow, Davelle was definitely exceptional. Love the atmosphere! The menu is really terrific, lots of good choices, I had to go with Napolitan Spaghetti, and it was incredible. The staff are always so friendly. I really can't recommend Davelle highly enough.

Lovely place with cute toast. I loved the food and the staff are friendly people. We order four different toast options. It was Easy to decide what we wanted because they include a picture of their food on the menu. The wait for our food was very short as well.

Wow! Amazing atmosphere and food at this new-ish Japanese café in the Lower East Side. I came here shortly after reading Ligaya Mishan's review on NYT. I wanted to have breakfast but came during lunch instead so I had the sea urchin pasta which was one of the most simple yet indulgent dishes I've had in a long time. Sitting in the tiny café, the atmosphere is evocative of Japanese kissaten or tea houses. And the menu is exactly that. I definitely want to come back for their curry and their breakfast toasts. I tried coming back recently but for some reason they were closed.

Calling all black sesame fans!! Ordered the black sesame kinako latte to-go and it was divine. The frothy consistency and black sesame flavor paired well together. When I drink black sesame-containing drinks, I have a tendency to swirl them so that the black sesame is well distributed as they sometimes sink to the bottom. Not sure if it is needed with this drink but I do it out of habit and thought I would share.

Oh, that oden is sure magical with its flavors and its broth. I swear Davelle's oden can cure all sorts of ailments! Look here, you can make your own by buying a pack of frozen fish paste blocks and heating them over the stove but the secret is in the soup, without the right ingredients then you'd be left with semi-decent oden with passable but definitely not stellar quality soup to match the mediocre oden. What Davelle serves up is oden that can make your knees weak, smile ear to ear, and close your eyes while taking in that sweet aroma that dances up to your nostrils while sitting in their quaint low-key restaurant. It was an incredible experience on an unassuming, uneventful Friday evening, and I am so glad to have made the reservation to come here with my fellow foodie!
Pricey, the food is great but it's not jawdropping. I think the atmosphere is really cozy. The staff are extremely attentive and kind.
Small place with very friendly staff. Ordered the berry and cream cheese toast which was really good. Their Kyoto brewed coffee is also great.

A nice quaint restaurant/cafe that has a very relaxing vibe. The inside was clean and had a good amount of seats for the space it had. Ordered the chicken katsu curry and i say it was pretty good. I appreciated the aesthetics of the cardboard bowls with the silverware. The curry itself was mild but bold with flavor but wasnt overwhelming. The chicken katsu was moist yet crispy which is exactly what you want. If youre feeling a nice quiet sit down for lunch id recommend going here. Feel free to get the coffee or any other beverage! They have a nice extensive drink menu. Next time im going to try some of the drinks.

Such a great find! The bartender couldn't be friendlier, and was knowledgeable about our preferences (I always like a dry sake), and so she made the PERFECT mojito, which I've never had with sake, but I'll never go back! It smells amazing, and I can't wait to come back and try the food!

Check out Davelle for their pretty Japanese fusion toasts and a quick brunch. The cafe itself is very cozy with limited seating; even though I went when they first opened on a weekday, the place was quickly filled up with people. For party of two, we ordered the mentai mayo toast, berry and cream cheese toast, and a loco moco bowl. The flavor for every dish is very unique and enjoyable, however, the portion size of each dish is honestly on the lighter/smaller end especially considering how much each costs. It was my first time trying mentai toast and I really enjoyed parts of the toast with mentai, but rest of the toast was almost tasteless (would prefer more mayo)! The berry and cream cheese toast had generous amount of housemade jam and cream cheese on it so no complaint there, very sweet and creamy. The loco moco bowl was on the sweeter side for the burger & sauce, but that is not a problem for me personally since I love everything sweet~ the meatloaf burger was tender and juicy, the rice was flavorful, and the bowl tasted really hearty. Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a quick snack or a light meal.

It was a cute and small cafe. It was nice and quiet, I can see myself doing work there. I visited during the morning so I've only tried their toast. I can tell they use good quality matcha for their matcha drinks.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Delicious and beautiful little spot on the LES. Highly recommend for meeting up with a friend for coffee or an afternoon snack. very yum!

This is the cutest little cafe with a fun variety of eats! The space, while small, is very cozy and friendly. There are bar seating, a small column of counters, and small small tables. The decorations are minimalistic but lovely. And the food is a very simple but elegant rendering of Japanese fare. I had a milk toast with cream and berries smeared on top on top for breakfast and it was lovely--to look at and to eat. It's satisfying without being overly sweet, and the bread has a bit of chew and bounce to it.

Atmosphere is 5 star but food is 3. The toast was a bit underwhelming considering the hefty price. The lattes however were great. If you are considering a drink this place is great. Food, not so much. Also this place has no WiFi.

Small Japanese cafe but they have actual food too. I love eating here but I wish they could reduce the price little bit. The size of the potion is small too. It's going to end up paying like eating at a restaurant. I understand Japanese ingredients are expensive though.
This is then in my place in nyc that serves traditional Japanese oden! So interesting and cute! I enjoy all my oden, the pastas were just okay.

I really wanted to love this place as the food sounded very interesting, but each dish was just a bit underwhelming. The oden dishes were a bit boring except the radish which was pretty good. The mochi spaghetti sounded really cool but just tasted like slightly overcooked pasta. The sea urchin rice ball and pasta were not great as the sea urchin tasted a little bitter and didn't taste like the sweet, high-end hokkaido/santa barbara uni that I'm used to.
A nice brunch place to stop by~ love the toast~ Will come back to try the other options.
Nice little place - friendly and adorable. Had the menchaku (codfish roe) spaghetti and miso soup. My friend had Katsu rice bowl. Both were good, will go back.

Lovely little 16 seater at the south end of the LES. Went for late lunch, which I love that they serve until 4 btw.. Uni spag was great, though I would have liked more sauce /moisture. The signature curry was rich and delicious. The prices are reasonable and lunch sets come with a little dashi broth and potato salad. The breakfast looks great for next time. Groovy music, nice, unfinished surfaces. Good date spot. It's small, so no more than 2 people parties. A gem.

I would give a 3.5 if I could. Super friendly and helpful staff, super cute interior. I really love the concept of a more elevated Japanese street food experience but for the price tag felt like the food fell kinda flat. If you don't really know Japanese food and want the explanation that goes along with each dish, I'd recommend trying it once! It's a cute experience but the taste was just fine/good.

This place is sooo good!!! Probably the tastiest spaghetti I've ever had. Get the Mochi Mochi napolitan spaghetti. It has a little bit of sweet & spicy to it. It tastes like Filipino sweet spaghetti but better!!! We also had the truffle oil potato salad, also super delicious and the kinpira gobo appetizer (also a good flavor too it). We are definitely coming back to try the other dishes!

One of the best "hidden gems" in NYC. Tried their pour over coffee and oden which were incredibly nice. A major plus: they serve a traditionally styled Japenese breakfast with. I highly recommend the cream fruit sandwich - SO delicious!

Cute little cafe. No wait at lunch time, although it may be a slow day due to Mother's Day. The curry was good but not spectacular, the spaghetti was a better option. The tomato soup and potato salad that come with the set weren't special or even good. My favorite part of the meal was the milk pudding, which was like flan. The texture was so silky. Note: portions are small.

Excellent restaurant! This unique Japanese Tapas place nailed it. The place was affordable and most importantly delicious. The potato salad and fried chicken are must orders. The spicy cod spaghetti was amazing, and my favorite dish. The place seats very few people, so do not plan on going here if your group is over 3 people. All around amazing experience, I recommend all those that enjoy Japanese food, scratch that, good food, to go.

My honey and I went to Davelle for lunch today. The lunch set was perfect for me. It comes with a cup of soup, a small potato salad, and a choice of your entree. The soup was super delicious. I didn't expect it. We ordered 2 lunch set and a drink - curry and rice , Napolitan spaghetti and match honey yuzu drink. The restaurant has a bar area and 3 sets of table. I recommend this place if you are looking for a good relaxing breakfast / lunch place.

I've been waiting for them to reopen, and so glad they did! They had a few tables outside setup so we were able to order and enjoy. We got the chicken katsu and the curry. Both were so delicious. I got the sesame late and it was also great! So glad we're neighbors.
Warning to people who see that they have gluten free curry but they changed their recipe and they no longer have anything gluten free on their menu.
I was craving japanese curry and i was well satisfied with my meal here.  The space is so tiny I love it and a food selection of Sakki and great service

Heard so many good things about this charming all day cafe in LES, but still wasn't sure what to expect when I showed up for dinner on a Thursday evening. It's a teeny tiny little place but still incredibly inviting. My friend and I split the dashi pickles and then shared the Napolitan spaghetti and the uni tomato spaghetti - both of which I could've eaten twice the portions of. Davelle does these pastas so well that I need to go back to Japan and actually try the Italian there (first trip there was more focused on getting in everything Japanese). The uni flavor was rich and incredible, and I typically do not like uni. My friend had a glass of wine (love the gigantic glasses here) and I enjoyed a tasty sake cocktail with strawberry lemonade. We finished with the milk pudding which was also amazing - cue spoons clawing the bottom for every last drop. I must come back and try even more of the menu, but I'd be happy repeating the same things to a T.
It smells amazing at breakfast. Have a seafood spaghetti at lunch and finish it off hot tea

Is a hidden found. The food is really good. If you visit make sure of check out their daily special. We ordered the Uni tomato Pasta, which is sooo good!!! The Uni is so fresh and it perfectly blend well with the tomato and the pasta. The food is fresh and unique.
Mentai Mayo toast was tasty but pretty scantly dressed for $9. The black sesame and kinako latte was good! Nice people working there and cute space.

Davelle reminds me of my favorite types of meal from Japan. Simple, flavorful, interesting, and beautiful. I enjoyed Davelle so much I returned t try the breakfast the day after my lunch. I'll be back very soon for dinner.

It's a newly opened Japanese style cafe in LES and I have already been there a couple of times! It's just lovely with a unique menu that has a sense of a classic cafe (kissaten) in Japan!!! Signature dishes for dinner are apparently oden, which ingredients ranging from vegetables to sausage and veggie tofu nuggets (ganmo) are simmered in a Japanese broth. "Davelle" comes from a word to describe "chill" in Japanese and as the name of this place shows this is certainly a place that you want to come to relax with delicious foods. As Japanese classic cafe always do, they are particular about quality coffee, and they have a special drip coffee machine from Japan and that's something that you want to try. Also, my favorite dessert is a coffee jelly, which comes with a syrup made of milk and this is the only place that you have that tasty coffee jelly in the city. They are open from early morning to late night and whenever you stop by you can have a quality time there.

Such a cool new Japanese restaurant in the LES, with cozy homey vibes and delicious food. My party of 3 was seated at the bar, which seemed like it would be a pretty tight fit but there was actually plenty of room. We ordered the 10 oden set, fried chicken, spaghetti, and potato salad. I think my favorite was the tomato in the oden set. It was such an interesting flavor and texture that I've never tried anywhere else before. The spaghetti was amazing as well-the waiter advised us to break the egg up and mix it with the noodles to get the full flavor, and it boosted the flavors so much more! Even the potato salad, which I imagined would be very simple, was delicious and so interestingly presented. For so much food, the bill was very modest at the end. This is also a Japanese-style no-tip establishment, and the waiter said the best tip for them would be for us to come back. Overall, definitely will go back!

Davelle is da-bomb (surely no one has used that before). Loved it all: the chicken katsu curry (great crunch on the fry and the curry sauce was HEAVEN), the croquettes, and the oden--perfect meal for a snowy evening. Gracious service.

This is a delayed review from our experience back in May. We heard there is a new spot where serving Japanese Oden so we decided to go. It was very crowded and our waiting hour was about 40 mins but there is a hip coffee shop right next to so we killed time. Their service is attentive, foods are pricey but really good, of course, we enjoyed the variety of oden items. I had a curry which was pretty good.

I was super excited to try out this place. Every time I walked by it seems busy. The decor is really cute and simple, so I​ would think they focus more on the food. Unfortunately, the food was really underwhelming, especially for the price. I wanted to try to pork curry dish but they did not tell me it was sold out until I had ordered it and finished my 2 appetizers. Only then they told me it was sold out and asked me to pick something else, I almost just wanted to say no thanks and leave but I didn't​ want to be rude. I ordered the Napoleons spaghetti instead, it was not tasty​ at all. It was cold, and it seems like they tossed it with generic ketchup, literally, and for $22?! Cray. We also tried their uni dishes, the dish was dry and not creamy at all, what's the point of the uni? Overall it very lacked​ luster. Will not be back.

This place is great.  The food and drink have an authentic Japanese style.  Solid quality.  I came with a group of 4.  We had pretty much every appetizer (chicken kara age, cheese potato croquette, unigiri rice ball, and yuzu salad) and they were awesome.  Main courses (Katsu kare, hambagu steak, spaghetti, etc) also excellent.  Nozomi (manager) and Sophie provide an amazing, cheerful, efficient, and professional service.  I also enjoyed the nama sake.  It was light and refreshing. This place has a cozy, friendly, casual, neighborhood feel. I recommend it!
Interesting and excellent food, with friendly and attentive service. The hot pot special was fantastic, as were the soft shell shrimp.

The spicy salmon roe is my favorite here. Tip is included. There's not much seating and it's probably going to be a packed place once more people know about it. I would definitely recommend going now.
Great food!! love their uni spaghetti and cod caviar spaghetti  btw it's great portion of uni!!

This was such a cute little place. Only 2 tables and about 7 bar seats so very cozy. Not an extensive menu but what they do they do very well. Totally understandable because they must have a tiny but very efficient kitchen. All comfort foods. I came here for dinner. 4 of us. 5 starters, 5 mains, 2 desserts, 4 drinks, 1 coffee (we like to eat) and the bill came to less than $300.

Love the pork curry! It was very fulfilling and brought back my childhood memory associated with Japanese curry (which was one of my favorite thing) The interior looks effortlessly elegant and vintage, maybe because the building itself is old. The restroom is also clean and really cute.
Amazing food and great service! We had the pork curry and rice with beef, which was delicious. The place can get a little cramped when busy but the flavorful food definitely makes up for this

This place is hidden. No sign. When you find it the menu is confusing. No idea what are the ingredients without asking, when asked, the folks have a tough time explaining. Overall getting to order is a bad experience. I ordered a coffee, the coffee is $6. And there was nothing special in the latte. We chose to order a savory toast and the server plainly told us that all their toasts are premade so there are no customizations, like removing bacon from the pizza toast. No vegetarian options available in the savory menu. Go elsewhere.
Favorite little place in the lower east side. Service, food, ambiance is top notch. Love the red bean toast for breakfast & superb coffee!
This place is small/cozy and pays great attention to detail! My friend and I shared (and loved) the mentaiko spaghetti and red bean toast - be warned that portions are on the smaller side, though!

Here's a quick tip for any hip new brunch spots looking for a glowing review: learn the ADA. Its an old law! It exists for a reason! Without ADA guidelines, there are a whole lot of potential customers who will never be able to access your business! Not only is this place not wheelchair accessible, but I was forced to sit and wait while the wait staff refused to serve me because they were convinced that my service dog isn't allowed to accompany me. Once the owner arrived, after I'd offered ADA info cards to my waitress and been turned down ("I know the law" my ass, ma'am), he took my order without even introducing himself, and at no point did anyone make a move to apologize for treating me like an undesirable. Now don't get me wrong, I love feeling like I'm unwelcome in public just as much as the next cripple, but I think in the future I'll take my lunch break somewhere friendlier. I'm sure there's somewhere else in the neighborhood where I can get mediocre food for an extravagant price.
Portion is tiny and entree runs around 16-25 dollars. Really not worth the price or wait.   I understand it's modern Japanese food, but come on.

For a spot that relies heavily on ketchup, it's a fair amount of money for what it is. Seems like they've done away with dishes on their menu that have any ingredients that aren't really affordable to acquire. Everything was edible (omelet, overdone katsu) to good tasting (salad) but for such simplicity at the price, the execution should be perfect. The boys working the place are sweet tho.

The uni pasta here is so creamy rich and flavorful. I also ordered some oden which I found interesting. All the oden dishes had a flavorful Bonita broth. The vegan lotus root ganmo was delicious and had the texture of fish balls. The okra was not slime and not overcooked. The moochi wrapped with tofu skin is interesting. When you bite through the tofu skin you the feel the ooziness of the warm soft moochi seeping out into your mouth.

When Greg Baxstrom first opened Olmsted, he intended it to be a neighborhood restaurant, but (lucky for him but not for us), it succeeded so well that it was impossible to get in.  This latest venture may finally be the homey local yet high-end restaurant that we need.  Only in its second week, the food and service are up to the high standards we expect from this group.  Started with Fried Cornichons and Escargots en Croute, then Mussels a la Bouillabaisse (with side of Duck Fat Fried Potatoes) and Coq au Vin Cavatelli, and finished with Profiteroles, of course.  Perfect, from start to finish!

This is a 'stickless' version of French yakitori Maison Yaki, with some kept interior, but also an updated menu. Named after his furry friend, Spud (chefs just love to name their establishments after loved ones), expect bistro influences, such as small plates of escargots, duck liver pâté and French onion soup, moules, crêpes, steak frites and of course duck fats fried potatoes. Surprisingly, desserts consist of Italian profiteroles and no creme brulee. Condenses cocktails list and a short wine list to pair with meal. This is a neighborhood French bistro without the stuffy French waiter outfits, but a more lowkey, butcher paper on  white table clothes kind of place.

Absolutely delicious. Phenomenal service, excellent creative touches that you can expect from Greg Baxtrom make classic French dishes both perfectly-executed, yet exciting. Sat at the chef's counter, and one of them was kind enough to share his soft fried egg recipe after he overheard me saying how delicious my salad lyonnaise was (...the salad has bacon dressing btw). Only possible area for improvements might be the ambience/decor and a strangely Eminem-heavy playlist ;)
Came here for drinks and snacks at 5 pm on a Friday. The cornichons and frites were delicious and the vibe was great as well as the service. Can't wait to come back and try it for dinner!

Excellent restaurant. The most delicious food. Great staff.  Cool people watching. Terrific service. Hot nespresso martini is a winner. Their kale salad is the best in New York City.  Have the pancakes.  Go hungry. Eat like crazy. It's such a great fun place. Enjoy.
So freaking good. The ricotta pancakes, the cocktails, and the endive salad was great. Love the interior style and flower bouquets inside. Such a bomb little joint!

I love this place! The food is really good and never disappoints. I can be a bit of a wait, especially on the weekends, but I think it's worth it. It's nice to sit outside on the corner and people watch. The only thing I will say is the staff is nice but def I truly rush you to get out of there. I've had the same waitress a few times and she is constantly coming to the table to try and move you along. It feels rushed and unenjoyable. I feel like I need to keep ordering things just to be able to sit there and take my time. I understand because the restaurant is busy and they want to turn over tables, but it makes the dining experience feel rushed.
Always very packed for brunch unless you go before 11am. Recommended by a friend and came here for their pretty pancakes. It was a bit dry but overall not bad. Good for sharing

Came here for brunch early in the morning. I got the Moroccan scrabble. It was delicious. Awesome to see something different from the usual brunch menu. I liked the cozy setting. The staff were friendly and helpful. Prices were reasonable.

I went for the ricotta pancakes & they don't disappoint. The service is also really good staff is friendly & attentive. I've had eggs & their mushrooms which I loveeeee. It's been years and the place still remains popular for a reason. Always lovely.
Great place for burgers with a cute ambience. Service is overall good but when they're busy inside you could be told in an arrogant way to step outside and wait for the host.
Wonderful customer service and delicious scrambled egg on brioche.  Heaven for brunch!

column3: Old Palo Alto, Palo Alto, CA
column6: BEWARE! The service was absolutely atrocious and unacceptable. The business is unethical and unscrupulous. They illegally added on additional tip to my bill without any permission or authorization to do so. On top of that Zander (the manager) does not return numerous calls or emails. Five Leaves customer service is absolutely unacceptable, atrocious and untrustworthy. Beware and make sure to check your credit card statement so you don't get overcharged!

The Ricotta pancakes are so delicious and moist and fluffy! Haven't really tried anything else on the menu but I'm just getting started! If brunch is your favorite definitely a great spot to try out. Keep in mind the place is small so not ideal for larger parties.

What a great place!  Had lunch here with my adult kids today. Everything was great, from the espresso drinks and mimosas to the dishes. We loved the pancakes, smoked salmon, and grain bowl (it's full of tasty veggies).  The wait was well worth it.
This is a nice spot for brunch. The service was good as well as the food. Our orders had us stuffed and satisfied. The table could have been a bit more spacious but all was well.
Excellent breakfast. The coffee is excellent and the full breakfast was amazing especially the chorizo
Love it here . Simple, comfort food and ricotta pancakes are always on their menu . Been coming here for quite a while and still have not been disappointed . Thanks guys
Love this place!  The breakfast pie is absolutely fantastic.  Have a tendency to overorder dishes every time I come here but hard to go wrong with anything on the menu!
Food was great, nice atmosphere, unique style of hasbrowns which were delicious. Their turmeric latte was very tasty my wife enjoyed the mint tea a lot!

I'm in town visiting my brother and we stopped in for some brunch. I ordered the ricotta pancakes. They were delicious but heavy! It's definitely shareable! Very friendly staff. Would definitely recommend!
Hands down the best pancakes I've ever had in NYC. The mixture of ricotta is unique and delicious. Great service - was able to get seated without a reservation on a Sunday morning. Will be back!!

YUM and open early! Pancakes were AWESOME, and the full breaky as sooooo satisfying. True home cooking with an elevated touch. Rich and balanced coffee's too! Staff was attentive! But the scream of the coffee machine was a bit annoying
Great place ...great food!Loved the pancakes...the five leaves burger with truffle fries and  the absolutely amazing sautéed mushrooms!
Love!! Great brunch and lunch spot. Verity on the menu and a cute inside setting. Pancakes were unreal!

Such a great place for brunch! I've been several times and have never been disappointed. Great place to bring visitors, friends, family, anyone! Literally everything from their cocktails to cold brews and of course their ricotta pancakes are perfection! Note there is always a line and people hovering around the entrance disorganized for the most part but don't be discouraged, the staff always know who is next in line.

We received the food within ten minutes of ordering. That was a plus. However, the food was just okay. The main thing that contributed to two stars was the service. My mom and I went at 8:30 am on a Sunday so there weren't that many people there but no one refilled water, brought sauces, cleaned the table, and the server brought the wrong check.  Also, if you have toast and ask for jam, that's an extra dollar. I'm not sure if the lack of service was because our skin didn't look like other patrons but we will not be going back ever again.

Wanted to update this review from a 1 to a 3, years later. I still think that my experience that day was pretty crappy but I wouldn't rank the overall business as a 1 star because of 1 bad experience. Management was kind, it was just an unfortunate oversight.

Wow! My first time at Five Leaves and the food was so good! My friend and I shared the French dip sandwich and the big breakkie with mushrooms and bacon. The French dip was my favorite. The broth almost tasted like pho which was such a good combination. Everyone that worked there was so friendly, especially the folks behind the bar. Such a cozy atmosphere and delicious coffee. Can't wait to come back and try more!
Very yummy and hip spot. I had the avocado toast with a side of eggs and I drank a Bellini. It was all delicious, the vibe was chill, and the staff were super friendly and efficient.
We stumbled upon this place having no clue of the hype.  Outstanding inventive food fair prices and pleasant service.  The crowd is a bit of a Bk parody but who cares.  Go.

First day of full service dining at Five Leaves was a bit of a miss. The reliable house made ricotta and the truffle fries was the saving grace. They had no Bellini's available and the French dip sandwich was not nice at all. It was cold inside and just fell short. Our server was new but very nice and tried her best and actually the manager removed one sandwich order from the bill which was appreciated. 3.5 stars is what this visit rated  but I gave it 4 stars because they were courteous and this was first day of full dining and because I have been here a handful of times pre-pandemic and had nice experiences. I hope they soon get everything on track.

The pancakes were very light, rich,  and had a creamy texture.  This was my first time trying Ricotta pancakes- and I am glad I did. I ordered from the Brunch menu. I also ordered a cocktail- Punk Thing. Both were good choices. The pancakes come with strawberries, blueberries, and banana toppings. They also add a dollop of Maple Butter.
Five Leaves was an amazing brunch place. The Moroccan Scramble had such a unique flavor and was so filling. I can't wait to go back to try their sticky date pudding.
Our favorite place in Bedford - summer or winter ... in or out ... delicious food ! High recommend

Wonderful dinner yesterday with our family. Great atmosphere and service! Food was HUGE and fresh. I really appreciated that they were checking vaxx cards and ID's. Staff was masked the entire time. We can't wait to go back next time we're in town.

Amazing experience. We arrived here around 1pm, and sat outside. It was very busy but we were seated within five minutes which was good. The food was excellent, as were the drinks. Their take on an espresso martini was delicious. Huge portions, very tasty food, and our server was really nice and efficient. Can't wait to return!
I was alone so I sat at the bar...no wait time!  My drink was awesome and my food was great!  Service was smooth.  Love this place!

Honestly a little disappointed by my visit here today. I was really excited to try this spot for brunch so I made the trip to give it a try. It opens at 10am. I was the second person in line to order at the coffee window. You then go seat yourself, so it's first come first serve. I ordered a coffee and the ricotta pancakes. Even though I was the 2nd person to order for the day, it took a solid 30 minutes to get my food? Not sure why it took so long. The pancakes themselves were also a bit disappointing unfortunately. Pretty tasteless. The only saving grace was the syrup (which I wish they gave more of). Oh well. Maybe the other food items are better and they were just having a rough morning for service.

Pet friendly restaurant and open for breakfast. My friend and I walk my dog to GreenPoint and my friend is hungry so I bring her to five leaves because I know they have a seat outside and my dog can sit with us. We share breakfast with two eggs over easy, hash browns, sautéed kale and medium rare steak. Of course! We also have couple morning drinks mimosa and bloody marry. Service is super friendly and my dog enjoy sitting next to us with some treats.

One of my favorite brunch spot in Brooklyn. It is a nice and cozy restaurant that has endless people waiting to snag a seat because you cannot reserve a table in advance . Though I have not visited during COVID - my experience is solely based on pre-COVID brunch outings. I always order the ricotta pancakes with honeycomb butter. The pancakes are fluffy and delicious. Whenever I crave pancakes, this is my go to spot. I have also tried the Moroccan scramble - it's okay not as memorable.

The place is right on the corner of McClarren Park. Great neighborhood plus they have an outside area. We sat inside and the only reason why I am giving it 4 stars is because there was a funny smell but it could have been just the wood floors that sometimes has a weird smell that I particularly do not like. The place was clean though. The staff was really friendly and accommodating. We order the Big Breakkie (one with avocado and bacon and the other one with kale and bacon). Both dishes were really good. Definitely recommend for brunch.

Good food, good drinks. However I saw a server touch the garbage and then touch clean plates to serve to customers without washing hands or sanitizing. Absolutely disgusting and they need to address that hygiene violation. She was short, skinny, with long curly hair and star stickers all over her face. Either she's new or she doesn't care, but either way it's no excuse. This behavior could very easily get people sick. Their food is great however this was shocking and nasty behavior.
Breakfast was amazing here. Fresh food and great staff. Service was superb. No complaints.

excellent customer service! The gentleman that works the window and bar is always smiling and proving exceptional service. thank you 5 leaves for always being on top of the game. Also, thank you for taking such great care in carry out orders. Your staff is all around fabulous

Very affordable spot considering the trendiness of Greenpoint nowadays . Brunch is always packed and it's with good reason , hard to find a spot like this ! Just wanted to say I've been coming her consistently for brunch this past month , and one thing that never changes is the excellent service . I normally have Medhi as a sever or Elise (hopefully I spelled her name correctly) and they are so exceptional . The hostess is also so fabulous , never got her name but she wears so many hats in the restaurant and goes above and beyond just seating and walking away ! The kitchen is also great I love the pancakes so rich , sometimes I like to just make three sides into a plate like the steak , eggs, and truffle fries (also so bomb ) . Everything here comes out so fast and is always quality stuff . I was so moved by the service to even buy the sweatshirt and hat lol!!! I will spread the word of this hidden gem , and continuing to support the fabulous staff :)
Great breakfast. We ate outside in 40-something weather. I'd do it again in the snow! In the top two of best breakfasts I've ever had.

Honestly not sure what the hype about this place is because the food is good but nothing special. I've been several times (mostly because my friends want to) but I just always felt that it's overpriced and cramped. Very bougie crowd but that's also the neighborhood so it's expected.

We came to Five Leaves to start off a full day in Greenpoint and Williamsburg. Meeting up with a friend, we were seated quite promptly upon arriving, despite the busy atmosphere. We were first served our coffee (Americano roast to be exact), and we're slightly disappointed by the bitter taste. The coffee could be better. Coming in for brunch, we ordered two plates of The Big Breakkie, with two sides of Avocado and Bacon. My Big Breakkie was ordered with 2 eggs scrambled, and the they did a terrific job keeping the eggs fluffy and yellow (our friend got 2 eggs poached). The Big Breakkie also comes with these two hash browns which are unusually prepared with seasoning, but still delicious. One of us ordered the Moroccan Scramble, which has a lot of flavor. On the side for the whole table, we ordered Ricotta Pancakes, which turned out to be a real standout. The pancakes were real thick, extra sweetness came from the butter mixed with sugar. The pancakes also proved very filling, so it was necessary for all of us to share them. Service is great and the location has that distinct Greenpoint charm, I definitely recommend this place to anyone exploring this part of Brooklyn.

Just ate here and the service was probably the worst service we have ever received in our lives. The food took over an hour to come out and from the very beginning the waiter and hostesss Rachel were extremely unprofessional and rude. After finding hair in our food and them bringing out the wrong food the hostess proceeded to call our entire group cunts and got in our faces we almost thought she was going to hit us. Never coming back.

Their Ricotta Pancakes are awesomely delicious! Topped with fresh fruit and Shea Honey combed butter that will leave your mouth watering at the presentation. Their burgers and their bloody Marys are to die for as well as their other food selections. I found out about this place while reading an article on Heath Ledger who was suppose to be it's owner but died before realizing his dream of culinary inspiration. The place is run now by his other partners in his memory and is a must go to happening place in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.
A great spot if you're looking for a reasonably priced brunch with a friend and a relaxing atmosphere! Its only outdoor dining so be mindful of that.
Right off the park, great outdoor seating and the food and drink options were good. It's a popular place for sure so you may wait a bit and also wait in line.

Really popular spot for a quick coffee or brunch in Williamsburg! There is tons of outdoor seating (first come, first serve) with heat lamps. Due to covid, there is no table service, but there are QR codes of the menu everywhere. My friend and I just came for a quick coffee and chat, and ordered fries for a snack. Coffee was nothing amazing, but the fries were sooo good. All good and drink come in paper products. Definitely will be coming back to try more of their brunch items!

I got brunch here on a Saturday morning and had a fantastic experience. We were able to be seated immediately (they don't do reservations as of July 2021) which was a pleasant surprise and had excellent service. My group split a few croissants (delicious!) and ricotta pancakes with fruit which were very rich. A few people in my group got the big brekky which offered multiple options for sides (both healthy and not so healthy depending on your mood). Price wasn't bad either- I would definitely go back.
This is my favorite place to have brunch in Williamsburg. Everything is delicious and the ambiance is really cool. Ricotta pancakes just wow

Horrible....they try to squeeze as many people as close together as possible. I had a table outside and I was practically sharing a table with another couple. People that go here a snobby and the food is not worth it. Avoid the place!!!!

The option to get brunch at 8:00am divine! I had the chicken sandwich with fries and it was delicious. Chicken thigh is used for the sandwich and it's surrounded by carrots and slaw it's a complementary twist to it.

Have been here a couple times. Had the burger the first time which i would highly recommend and i don't even like beets. I visited most recently last month in the rain, there is a cover on the top and sides but got a little wet because of the drainage on the sidewalk and the wind coming through. I got the breakfast sandwich this time and it was delicious especially the jam. Also got some tea which was great, especially on a chilly day. I would recommend coming here for rainy day weekday brunch that has seating in greenpoint- because the choices are quite slim in that area for weekday outdoor dining in the AM.

Ambiance is great, food is great, wine selection is a lil slim but usually has something I enjoy. Service is... unpredictable? One woman was super professional and on top of it (she had a bunch of tattoos and the rest of this review is now about her bc she is great). But-- most others have been hilariously bad, and not even during busy times. Like they seemingly have never been to their own restaurant before, or maybe any restaurant; they have zero menu knowledge, never touch the table, won't clear it, will drop the check and not return for 25 min, look at you aghast when you ask simple questions...you may or may nor be completely on your own, basically. Which is fine, and the ambiance makes up for it, just don't expect to be served by the servers.
I had the mushroom linguine. My daughter had the butter linguine. Both very good. Also had the cauliflower which was off the charts. Nice concept

It took me and my friends three weekends to finally get a table at Five leaves..... that's how you know it's that good. Recommendation to get a table is to get there a little before they open as the lines and wait times later in the day can get super long. It's a quaint restaurant in Williamsburg that is really quite tiny in size but their food has big flavor. We had their famous ricotta pancakes and fish burger. The ricotta pancakes are light and fluffy and served with honey comb which adds a whole other dimension of flavor.... to put it simply it'll leave you wanting more. The fish burger was super flavorful and well cooked. Five leaves is definitely a place to visit if you're walking around Williamsburg and looking for something amazing to eat.

Ordered delivery tonight and it tasted like someone literally poured salt into our food. I have eaten here previously and have loved it. The food literally tasted like eating a spoonful of  ionized salt.

We sought out this restaurant because of the song No Wait at Five Leaves by We Are Scientists. I ordered a crispy chicken sandwich and fries, my partner ordered the five leaves burger. We also each ordered cocktails but they never arrived. I enjoyed my food, the sauce on the sandwich was very good, and the fries were crispy, the pickle wasn't my favorite. Erin on the other hand had a hell of a time with her burger and wound up losing her pineapple slice and getting beet juice on her skirt. By the way Keith, there was a short wait.

We were a family of six. The front desk lady gave us two separate tables and when later another table was available, she didn't let us to switch saying that one seat would be empty. The customer service clearly was not a priority The music was too loud. Everyone was screaming to hear each other's voice. The pancake and burger was good. But it was not with the hassle.

The description is misleading as it indicates that the restaurant has vegan option. I went there recently and every vegetarian option includes dairy. The staff wasn't very accommodating and when I asked why they don't have more vegan friendly option I was told that they're not that kind of restaurant. It's 2021 Five Leaves, people have different dietary restrictions and allergies and if you want to keep customers I suggest you catch up.

Five leaves is always a great choice. We ordered our food to go so we could eat it at Mccaren park on a cool but sunny November day. My steak salad took a little longer than I expected but it was delicious. Husband had that chicken burger which he devoured.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY

column6: This is specifically a COVID time review. We were excited to go for brunch because we love Five Leaves, however, their COVID menu did not include the dishes we loved and what we did end up ordering, the BLT and the breakfast burrito were a total disappointment and not worth the money. So sad. I'm hoping they survive these tough times and can return to what they were once we're past this. But sadly, it's not really worth going to as it is currently.

This place is officially down the drain, with rude customer service, watery hot chocolate, and horrible tasting food. It's ashamed. I use to enjoy going to get breakfast at this location after yesterday 11/2/20 from now on,no thank you.

We went for Sunday Brunch just a little before 11:00am. We were a group of 4 and were seated after waiting just a few minutes. We all enjoyed our food. The place is tight, crowded and very busy. Our order of oysters (appetizer) came well after we were served our entrees. The waitress  was s bit overwhelmed, but it didn't affect us in a negative way at all.  The food was worth the wait and confusion.

This place is really a victim its own success. The food and the staff were both great but the wait to be seated and the wait for your food was almost unbearably long. Also, there is no personal space here. I bumped elbows with the person from the table next to me several times throughout the meal. If they ever move to a larger location I would go back.

Came here for brunch around 12:20pm!! It was pack but I was able to be seated less than 3 min since it was only a party of 2 the wait wasn't that long. Service is outstanding and punctual. As soon as we where seated we where greeted then ask what we would like to drink. Then within 4 min our waiter ask if we was ready to order and he put in our order right away. The ricotta pancake are to die for!! Fresh and moist and very satisfying. They drinks where definitely worth it.

They don't take reservations for weekend brunch, which is the meal everyone wants to eat here ... but the wait is worth it. At least my pancakes were worth it. Service was good, interior was cute, and everyone's food was really good. We waited a while to be seated, so if you're looking to get in out of the cold, keep looking. Otherwise, totally worth it!
The food is great and it trendy but often time they have no seat and even if you can get seated it is uncomfortable to sit so closely with other patron. I wish they have bigger space.

Came in as a group and waited over an hour to seat 5. It's very busy and the ambiance is very nice. Definitely a brunch vibe. I had to try the pancakes but as it was pleasing to the eye, it definitely disappointed after waiting that long for normal pancakes served with partially browning bananas and average cut strawberries. I think the only thing that was extravagant and different was their honeycomb butter. It was affordable given the $16 ticket on just a stack of pancakes. Not sure if I'll come back but I definitely won't recommend.

It is unbelievable and unacceptable that this restaurant put a table on top of a sewer and underneath the fire escape ladder. Not to mention this is a potential safety hazard, how can you expect customers enjoying your food while smelling the disgusting odor coming out of the sewer? When we mentioned about switching seats, the waitress told us that we have to wait back in line to get new seats. The service I experienced here is terrible. A perfect 0/10

THE FIVE LEAVES BURGER HERE IS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! The flavors you get at once is just insanely good! One of the best burgers I've had ever ! It has Pineapple & Beet which you would be like "okay weird" but once you try it .. it just makes sense ! The fires here are amazing as well ! But dam that burger I strongly recommend that burger love this place can't wait to come back and try other things as well !

Horrible service. We sat for 20 minutes before being spoken to and finally gave up and had to ask for a server to be sent over. Elise, our server, finally came over and did not acknowledge the mistake or apologize. Overall, we did not receive any attention from our server and she did not even check to make sure our food was okay. We ordered one dish we never received correctly. After we finished she did not bring the check in a timely fashion, and we again had to ask for service. Our server never returned to the table after our food arrived and other servers had to pick up the slack. Overall our experience was ruined by such inattentive service. We will definitely not be back.
I live 2 block away and when I crave pancakes and coffee, this is the place. I've been here for both brunch& dinner, and they're both great.

Listen... this used to be my favourite brunch place. I'd brave the L for it. I'd wait forever in line for it. But for some reason it hasn't been the same, I guess due to covid. I ordered the pastrami cured Arctic char. It took a long time to prepare, so I was ready for a lovely meal. But it ended up being three tiny pancakes and an extremely small portion of fish. No egg like it mentioned in the menu. It was overly salty and underwhelming. Welp.

Great food. Ricotta pancakes are one the best I've ever had, a must get. However, staff are really not the friendliest. They rush to leave you before you can even finish placing your order and gives looks when asked for things. They're lucky the food trumps all of that.
This place is perfect for brunch! I got the ricotta pancakes which I highly recommend. The mimosas and Bellinis are great, too!

Have been wanting to come here for years and decided to pop in on a weekday and was pleasantly surprised to get a table right away as you could sometime be waiting a while. I got an iced coffee and the avocado toast with poached eggs. This may be my favorite avocado toast in the area. It has the perfect touch of crunch and saltiness. I would HIGHLY recommend it.

Brunch is a time to catch up with friends while eating great food on a day I remain indecisive if I want breakfast or lunch. Wake up early or sleep in a bit. Well needless to say I grabbed a bite with one of my favorite Chicago girls. We arrived a bit before noon and we were told that there was a 30-45 minute wait. Ok, no problem. I like shopping so we went in the store next door to browse around and spend some mullah. We came back and were seated right away. So, the biggest con I have for this place is the space. The tables are teeny tiny and there is hardly any space for everything you order. My friend snuck between the two tables to get to her seat. We were approached quickly by our server for our drink orders. I ordered the lemon ginger tea and the turmeric bees knees which was recommended by my server. Turmeric can be very bitter, but this was infused with honey, it was such a good drink. I'm a girl who loves her gin and I dont feel so bad since I'm getting all of the medicinal properties of turmeric. My friend ordered coffee and the drink with mezcal. She said it was really good. We then ordered the daily oysters. We weren't sure if they were going to be worth but they were. They were fresh the mignonette had fine pieces of scallion and there was another red sauce. Oysters were a thumbs up. However, now our table was packed. After the oysters came our entrees. I ordered the Moroccan scramble and my friend ordered the daily quiche. The Moroccan scramble had a lot of middle eastern flavors with sliced jalapeno giving a great punch of spice. I would recommend getting the perfect bite of eggs, sausage, jalapeno, cilantro, chick peas, avocado and toast all in one. The flavors work really well together. The quiche was made with a nice bite of salty ham and potatoes. It was good, no complaints. The side salad was a bit salty. We also had a side of truffle fries that I happen to love and these did not fall short of taste. Overall the, the food was really good. A couple next to us had the ricotta pancakes and she told us how great they were. So I definitely have to come back to grab a bite of them. We ordered another round of drinks and really wanted to sit back and talk crap, but our server asked if we needed anything else and we realize that was our hint to get out. I get it, there was a huge wait by now. So up we went to our next adventure. Everything was pretty good  I just wish there was a bigger space so I could feel comfortable eating without feeling I was going to invade my neighbors space. I guess you cant have everything. At least, everything else was good. I'll definitely be back.
Great food.  Coffee is so damn hot, I burnt my mouth 20 minutes after receiving.   Is this even possible?  YES
The food was amazing, very upbeat atmosphere and great place to get some brunch! Staff was super friendly!

The wait time to this place is sometimes a little ridiculous but what's inside is just amazing, the food and drinks are absolutely perfect, some of the dishes I reccomend are the breakie, Moroccan eggs, five leaves burger, and definitely the ricotta pancakes. They serve all kinds of drinks they have a full bar and coffee station, the atmosphere is somewhat rustic, kind of gives you that feeling of going to visit Grandma, cute art pieces on the wall, definitely worth the wait guys give it a shot I'm sure you won't regret it, if you do you probably suck anyway ‍

My cousin was here from Australia and staying nearby I suggested we meet here based solely on the ricotta pancakes. Customer service was okay and I wasn't worried about it since we wanted to chat and catch up. The pancakes were amazing. Exactly what I wanted them to taste like. I love ricotta pancakes and I look for places that have them all the time. I found parking pretty quickly at the meter. I don't think I would take the drive there again anytime soon but if I'm ever in the neighborhood for breakfast I will come here.

I thought it was overhyped but the food was simple yet so effing good. I was mad at myself for putting my name down for an hour wait (no food-not even my mamma's is worth worthy when there's choices)  but my friend was running late so I thought why not. In the end the coffee was MEH, my drink was so so  but the egg sandwich was so simple and well executed I could have died and been satisfied. I think about it from time to time and I'll be back to tried the chicken sandwich. I'd go again on a down time to catch the food without the wait. Regular brunch prices so no deal but whatever it's NYC!
A hidden gem in Greenpoint! Delicious fresh food, amazing cocktails, great ambiance. Love it for brunch, could be quite a long wait but worth it!

Great location, good drinks. I wanted to grab the guy by the throat when I saw what a rip-off the food was. Order the cheese board for a laugh. I almost sent it back but I'm not that person. Some diced apples, a few walnuts and some crumbles of cheese from key food. Ridiculous.

We loved! Went around 545 and was pretty empty and did not need a reservation for a party of 3. Service was a little slow but the high volume of customers was a factor. Food was delicious, had decent portions, and the drinks just kept coming! Will be back again, maybe for breakfast or brunch!

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY

column6: Wow - horrible staff and super rude. Came in for a drink while they were open and he said  in a nasty way that they were closed. Meanwhile there's a whole crowd inside - the attitude these people have is disgusting. LEARN ABOIT CUSTOMER SERVICE
Beautiful restaurant. Very good drinks. A little bit pricey for the potions of food, but very tasty and I give 4 stars because of the atmosphere!!! Very classic!!!

Good food but not a service. Server asked you whether you finish food after put her fingers on my plate and food. Server put tissue on your ice americano cup before asking you while you r working on ice and coffee.

The menu has a great variety of unique combinations that are delicious. If you go during peak hours, you will probably have to wait for a table because the neighborhood knows this place does not disappoint- it is worth the drive by!

I love this place. Came here a couple of times and haven't been disappointed yet with the food or the service. I do have to say that on this visit it was extremely cold in there. The staff seemed cold and during our dinning experience I was cold the whole time.

The good.   Is the food. Chicory salad was delicious and dressed properly.  Lamb rib appetizer was a bit fatty but cooked perfectly.  The salmon main course was interesting and good.  And the cheese platter dessert was very good.  Loved the raisin bread.  Service was good.  My only complaint is there is no room.  My chair was bumped into all night.   I am not that big.  This could be a 5 star pace   But it is a bit too cramped in there
The place is a small dive.  Cramped but still has a good vibe !  For the pancakes ...took them forever to make it . Freshly made ...was worth the wait . Delicious pancake ...the butter was amazing .

I'm writing this review based on my experience at this place today. Unfortunately, the service and food was disappointing. It's a shame because the other times that I've visited this place, I would order the ricotta pancakes and enjoy it! This time I can't say the same because all the food we ordered was given to us in box containers and with plastic utensils. I understand that with COVID-19, restaurants have to take safety precautions with the public, but I honestly think that the food and service is not worth their high prices. There are other restaurants in the same area that provide better food and service.

Came in during brunch  and ordered pancakes and avocado toast. Sadly had to wait 40 minutes for the food. There were tables who came after us and left before us. While food tastes good, the service is horrible.

Amazing brunch spot. Came on a Sunday and the wait wasn't terrible for two people.  They both tables and seating at the bar.  I had the avocado toast and an americano. (Dairy free options of almond/oat milk).  Great hip hop playlist and a dope vibe. Just a little tight on space, but worth it nonetheless.
We're told the wait was 30 min, but it turned into an hour when the gentleman running the list seated later-arriving patrons before us. Service was slow and inconsistent, and the portions were small.

I've been coming here for years and I love this place. Don't get me wrong, it's always busy no matter what day! The seats are close together but don't let that deter you from waiting. Their ricotta pancakes are the reason I keep coming back!

Five Leaves is the best!! I love the intimate atmosphere and chill people here. They've got a quality drink menu and the bartenders are great at recommending something you'll love. Always excellent service-- Drew and Alex are awesome bartenders!  I'd recommend Five Leaves for pretty much any occasion.

I have been a client for 13 years , one of my favorite place in the city . Today was a nightmare of disgusting behavior that started with a server that's was so unprofessional , after an experience with him i asked to speak to the manager who was not better. Sadly i left very upset , thinking how a place that I really liked is going down the drain with such horrible management. I hope the owners pay attention and save the place from some of this staff that seems to be totally oblivious to their loyal customers.

Best burger in Brooklyn! I used to live right up the street and ate here all the time and everthing was always delicious. But now I live way down the L train and I only make it here a few times a year and I always get the 5 leaves burger with truffle fries. It's consistantly amazing and I've been coming here for 7 years. It gets really crowded here, so to avoid a long wait I reccamend coming Monday or Tuesday at 6pm. I've always gotten a table immediately when I do that.

Five Leaves is a really charming spot. It's way too popular on the weekends, but I don't think that it's lost any of its charm. If you do wait around for a table, you'll have a perfectly good time. I would recommend going at night just as much. It makes for a quiet, intimate dinner and drinks spot. You feel like you're at home with the low key bar tenders and the cozy size of the place.

I thought this place was really cool and cute place for brunch. It's in a corner and it isn't big but it's narrow. Inside with seating along the side. They have outdoor seating which I would've loved to sit out there but none were available. We chose to sit at the bar. I loved what they were going for, which was that rustic hip look. They had quite the selection when it came to beer, wine and cocktails. They also had coffee for those coffee lovers. We got the Ricotta Pancakes: honeycomb butter, banana, blueberries, strawberries served with pure maple syrup.  Stacks of pancakes so high and so filling. It was delicious!  Also got the Big Breakkie: 2 eggs any style, has browns, whole wheat toast and 2 choices of size. I got over easy eggs and avocado and fried tomatoes as my side. Boy oh boy. I was a happy camper. Definitely will be coming back.

Came here for breakfast on Sunday  morning, excited to check out the food after reading good reviews. While the food was good, the service was terrible. We had to wait an hour until we got served our pancakes and eggs, the waiter never bothered to come back to see if we wanted more coffee or check in on us. Once the food came he still didn't bother to check if we needed anything or if the food was all right.  The pancakes were barely warm. I felt terrible for the people waiting outside for an hour to get seated only to then have to wait probably another hour to get their food. Would not go back

One of the worst restaurants I have ever been to. The salmon was undercooked and salty, the spinach dish has sour and not good. The wait staff could have cared less and were not helpful at all. I will NEVER go back to this place and recommend you don't either.

My boyfriend and I did brunch here after seeing their Vice cooking video on YouTube. He ordered the sausage spicy chick pea scramble on sour dough and I ordered the ricotta pancakes with fruit. Those pancakes were DELICIOUS. The buttery sugary topping (had some fancy name, I don't do it justice) was so so good. It was nice enough to eat the pancakes with the butter topping and the fruit alone. Great service, pleasant outdoor seating, affordable. Happy we found this place!

The ricotta pancakes are to die for. The best pancakes I have ever had. The ricotta made the pancake so fluffy and moist. The combination of the honeycomb butter, banana and strawberry was perfect. I normally cannot finish an order of pancake, but I can eat that whole stack of pancake by myself. My two friends and I came on a Saturday before 10am and the place was starting to get packed and there was a line forming. Get there before 10am is you don't want to be waiting for a while. Definitely want to make a trip back here for dinner one day.

I liked it .. Waited like 20 mins and once seated it was worth the wait . Will go here again. I liked the drinks and the pancakes/steak was delicious. . .  They also have oysters that I will be trying again soon.

What a fantastic lunch. We started with delicious Bloody Marys and oysters. Both were perfect. The kale salad was delicious, and I loved my order of mussels! So good. My kids said the truffle fries were also awesome! Highly recommend.

The food here is really great! The menu is unique yet not too far fetched to make ordering complicated.  The service is decent and the drinks from the cocktails to the lattes are good.  Five Leaves is definitely a place to go to for brunch on a whim with 1 other person.  The space has a great vintage feeling, but it's really cramped inside and this poses a problem when your party is larger that 2 people or if someone is really tall and needs leg room.  Overall the food is good, the drinks are good but the space is limited.
5 stars are for the BLAT and Truffle fries which i dream of often. Definitely a scene in there but I can ignore it for those dang fries. Go for late lunch on a weekday to avoid the crowds
Stopped in for a quick lunch.  Enjoyed the tonkatsu ramen....perfect for a chilly day.  Great service.

Spacing is horrible IMO! Everything else was pretty good! Food was freaking AMAZING and so were the drinks. It was a 30 minute wait for me n my bf. After the 30 minutes we went back and we waited an extra 10 minutes maybe to get seated.  Totally worth coming here!!
Having a long line doesn't mean customers should take attitudes from wait staff and host. I guess they don't care because they have so many customers anyway. Very disappointed.

I love the decor here, its so chic and clean. But here's the bad..the wait can be a bit long on the weekends and the seating is kind of cramped. Wish I took pictures of the The Heritage Grain Bowl which was great and really pretty, but I was so hungry after the wait, I didn't even bother. We also had some sort of chicken sandwich which was okay, nothing special. Everything else, like the avocado toast, was just bland. Maybe we just didn't order the right items; don't know if we'll be back.

Beautiful little spot across the street from McCarren Park. This place is especially beautiful in months where outdoor seating is doable. It feels very french, as the chairs face outward to the park, and nearby restaurants. I come to this place frequently, and the quality is always high. I do have trouble with the waiters from time to time, as some of them have been a bit cold, but it's a great spot. I go with my best friend often, and we split the kale salad (best salad ever, and I eat a lottt of salads), curry muscles, and truffle fries. It ends up being relatively inexpensive, delicious, and satisfying.

Dined here today. Pretty crowded during brunch, be prepared to wait a bit. It was a nice day out so we chose to eat outside. That helps with less wait time. It took a while for our food to come out. We ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and the five leaves burger. Food was just okay to me, i am in no rush to go back. Server was friendly.
Swear to god best truffle fries ever. Best combinations is to have them with a burger it just works. Place has really nice atmosphere and it's pretty cool.
Food is good, but not worth the crazy wait on the weekends. If you can, go on a weekday morning for a much more relaxed breakfast!
The burger there is awesome get the salad with it onions in that r fire and yea nice people

Five Leaves is one of the best brunch places that I have ever been to. My boyfriend and I came here on Valentine's Day so the long wait was expected but it was definitely worth the one hour wait. The only thing I didn't like was that the place was a bit tight. We already knew what we wanted to have, he had the famous ricotta pancakes and I had the big brekkie. I chose the mushrooms and bacon as the two sides. The mushrooms were phenomenal and the dish itself was overall good. The egg was perfectly cooked and the hash browns were delicious. His pancakes were the best we both have ever tried. We also had to try the truffle fries which were also amazing and super crispy. I have absolutely no complaints. It was just perfect!

When we arrived here for a Monday morning brunch, the half an hour wait told me it would be amazing. My friends come here often and had good things to say, so I was looking forward to it. We had the Ricotta Pancakes and the Big Brekkie. The pancakes are far and away the best pancakes I've ever had the pleasure of having in my life. Words can't express how perfect they are so you'll have to just try them yourself. The Big Brekkie is also great which features the common breakfast comfort items. Any breakfast with toast, beans, and eggs is alright with me.
I'll admit the wait sucks but I expected it coming in so you should do the same.  Food was completely worth it.  Pancakes, hash browns, bacon, eggs, chorizo were all delicious.

Cute restaurant positioned conveniently on the corner of the block right outside the train station. I asked for a table inside, they mentioned it would be an hour and a half wait. Since there are a ton of coffee spots around I walked around the neighborhood and came back an hour later and the table was ready for us. I wanted to try a little bit of everything so we ordered the ricotta pancakes, Moroccan scramble, heritage grain bowl and a side of hash browns. The pancakes were good but heavy, I wasn't able to finish it. The scramble was delicious and the grain bowl was just mediocre. The atmosphere was cozy and the music set the tone perfectly to chow down the food.

Cutting to the chase, I came here solely for the ricotta pancakes and oh did they deliver! I have never tried ricotta pancakes or even ricotta itself, so I thought the pancakes would taste a little cheesy XD But the ricotta just made it much fluffier, which you can see in the pictures. There was a huge chunk of honeycomb butter, never heard of it before, but it really enhanced the taste of the pancakes and syrup. It was very filling and I couldn't finish them by myself, so I recommend sharing. They're the best pancakes I've ever had, but I will soon try Clinton St Baking Co and see which are better. I definitely recommend this place though. The atmosphere is also really intimate and "homey" I can't think of a better word.

The self entitled white girl with the black hair that works on Friday is rude and a disgusting human being. The kitchen is a disaster and the food was cold. And no one gives a shit. I was told "if you don't like it leave". Fuck this place.
Brilliant food and good service. Always busy so may have to wait for a table but worth it.
Amazing little gem!! Menu is filled with great breakfast options, it was really hard to choose! Staff is friendly and in a very genuine way. I will definitely be back!
At 7:59 I was told I could not sit on the outside benches because they didn't open till 8...
What happened?!?! Over-cooked steak that took 45 minutes to arrive on an empty Tues night? I've been here a bajillion times and it's always been great. Hope this isn't downward spiral.
Great food! Awesome menu and location. Customer service wasn't top notch but whatever, it's Brooklyn ‍
Food was worth the 30 min. wait. Not a place for those with quiet voices tho

Horrible music- pure noise. You have to yell to try to have a conversation. The food was bland and, more than that, made both me and my date sick. The ravioli tasted like a pumpkin spice latte from Starbucks, so if that's what you like in your dinner, maybe this is the spot for you.
Dunno why its so hyped. Food was mediocre and the wait was brutal. It was packed... No peaceful and spacious brunch like typical brunch hot places in nyc.

Im only giving it one star because there lights are on and it does smell like food inside.  I wouldnt waste youre time though unless you enjoy sub-dom play and are into being a sub.  This place made me 2ait an hour for a to-go and instead of giving me my enteee they gave me two side dishes to pair with their speacial of the day which appeared to be hipster royalty because they just couldnt be bothered by anything but themselves!!!  NO STARS!!!

Recommend by local tattoo shop.  Great atmosphere and nice menu, oysters were delicious.  Veggie burger was just ok nothing to rave about.  Truffle fries were great and ate every single one.  Server was new and very attentive.  Was hoping for more menu selections other than salads and some sandwiches.  A pasta?  Fish dish??? Idk just simply ok.

I thought this place was just ok - my five leaves burger was kind of crumbly and dry.  My friend's moroccan scramble looked good, though.  We came late morning on a Thursday and were seated immediately at an outside table.  Food came out fairly quickly and service was fine.

Cute brunch spot with a good mixture of hearty and healthy food options. I would come back here just for their ricotta pancakes. The maple/brown sugar butter was just beyond. Can I dare say that these were the best flapjacks I've had?! I just might.
the overnight oats BLEW MY MIND. went for Sunday brunch and didn't have to wait at all. Servers were nice and the place is super cute
What a cute spot. We have enjoyed two lovely brunches here. Good food and nice service.

Best brunch spot! I came here with three other friends for brunch on a Sunday and while waiting for a table was brutal, it was worth it. We each got something different but the ricotta pancakes were my favorite. Word of advice: come early and expect to wait if you're coming for brunch.

The food is good and the servers are nice and polite. Was there for bunch on a Friday and the place was packed. No problem got our food in the time as expected. Portion size are large. Must try the fries with truffle oil, so good hold the ketchup. Lost a star because the seats can use some padding. It's important to be comfortable when having a good meal.

Super tasty brunch spot; easily one of the best in Williamsburg. Highly recommended dishes are ricotta pancakes (strawberries and banana), big breakie (two eggs, toast, and choice of two sides like bacon or roasted tomatoes, etc.), and mushroom kale toast. Could be a long wait as the place is small. Price is very reasonable for the area.
