If this is the #1 Burger in Brooklyn - go to Manhattan!  The host wasn't very friendly and The waiter MATT was so rude - unfriendly - and simply couldn't care less if you enjoyed your experience of eating there.  The meat in the Five Leaves burger was very good and well cooked - but the bun was so dry! The egg on top was cooked perfectly.  I didn't care for the beet - so I simply took it off.  The muscles were cooked perfectly and tasted amazing with a wonderful sauce. But overall the experience was ruined by bad staff!  I can't recommend this restaurant because of it.

I've had my eye on Five Leaves for a long time but was scared away by the wait time and time again. This time I had no where to be and decide to put my name down, head to beacons to kill the hour and come back. Welp, easily the best decision I made last Sunday because this place is fantastic. The guy running the wait is great, really nice and accommodating. We decided to embrace the sun and sat outside which gave us a taste of spring. I had the mushroom toast and lickedy spritz and both were top notch. My boyfriend had the BLAT with truffle fries and a evil twin can. I snuck bites of all and they were also delicious. Highly recommend if you don't mind the wait, go for a walk on the park or browse the stores near by.

I found Five Leaves on a brunch blog that gave it good reviews for brunch spots in Brooklyn. We had to wait a while to get seated and there is no where to wait other than outside, and it was a hot summer day in New York! However, the wait was totally worth it. I went with my boyfriend and our two friends and we all loved the food! We ordered drinks as well, which were delicious. The service was great and the mood and decor was very trendy, which I expect nothing less from Brooklyn. Overall, it was a great meal and I highly recommend brunch here (especially the pancakes)!
Try and sit outside if the weather is good, inside can be cramped. It's almost with it for the pancakes though!

Brunch here is excellent, except there is a long wait and no high chairs for children. Best truffle fries to date!!! The five leaves burger is amazing, and my wife got the ricotta pancakes also amazing.

Believe the hype, this is one of the best breakfast/Brunch spots in Northern Brooklyn. Conveniently located across from McCarren park, the place is buzzing all day long on Saturdays and Sundays. The inner space is rather small and quaint, but seating doubles in the summer months with a nice patio area. They have a nice selection of cocktails, plus an interesting brunch menu. Of course I usually go for the avocado toast. For evening meals, the burger is one of their specialty. Ladies, lookout for the easy on the eyes bartenders if scruffy hipster dudes are your type.

We discovered this cool cafe by accident. It has a real 1920s European feel to it and their pastries are really simple and delicious. The waitresses are super courteous and you can tell they are more than happy to accommodate your service. It's located in a very hipster, up and coming part of Brooklyn so could be crowded at times, but the feel of this cafe is really the bonus.

This place has a lot of potential but didn't hit the mark. Incredibly slow service with aloof waitstaff (except the host - he was super nice and helpful). Ordered a burgers cooked medium and it came out medium well so know that as you order. I liked the drinks (rose spider and tequila cocktail) and the food was tasty, but I'm not in a rush to go back because of the service.

I have now dined at Five Leaves several times & have to say that Five Leaves is truly five stars. The service is not the friendliest; however, the service is attentive & quick. I've never waited more than a minute before being greeted, & I have never waited more than 10 minutes for my food regardless of what I ordered or the time of day. This restaurant is always busy, so that's a positive if you don't have much time but still want to enjoy their offerings. I've tried several items now: egg with sage panini, ricotta pancakes with berries & honeycomb butter, homemade ricotta with honey & figs, chopped vegetable salad, oysters, & brûlée grapefruit with mint & ginger. I can honestly say that each item is as good as the next & I have thoroughly enjoyed each one. The only thing I wish is that they had regular coffee instead of having to order a cappuccino or latte but it is what it is. I have enjoyed each experience here & if you're looking for a great cocktail then you should try the grapefruit margarita; it's awesome.
Love you guys even after so many years, recently visited ordered mussels, they were perfect love you for all your attention to details with all your dishes

We all know the story! Long lines, packed, long wait...but i love this place. Food is delectable, carefully picked and prepared. Almond cappuccino/alpachino, is heaven, real European way made. Although, i d like a tiny bigger cup. I love the avocado toast here. And please, if you add at least one or two options of gluten and dairy free dishes, I would be for ever grateful. I can even ignore the attitude of the handsome waiters who are for sure, models, actors etc...Because if you dare not look like a hipster on a Sunday brunch, you get a longer wait. Still love you tho!

Do you want to watch cool people walk up and down the streets (and restaurant!) while enjoying a great drink and delicious meal? If you answered YES, this is a must see!! I have been going to this place since 2014 and have always had a great time, it doesn't matter if I'm by myself or with friends, its always great!! Please do not leave without trying the fresh ricotta with figs and honey AND the avocado toast. Putz!!! It is so freaking goooood!

Soooooo good omg. I got the chicken sandwich that was possibly the best I've had. My friend got the ricotta pancakes that were super fluffy and delicious. The inside is SO CUTE and the staff was super accommodating. It was hot in the sun so we waiting until we could sit inside. There's a cute coffee window to-go outside too.

I love this spot. They have the most wonderful staff and the best lattes in North Brooklyn (I go there several times a week for my iced oat lattes because they are so damned good). Extra special appreciation for these workers busting their butts, staying open late, and using all necessary precautions during this pandemic. So glad to have them in the neighborhood.
hated the service, everyone seemed to be having a hard day, our server Kevin basically threw the bill to me. Not cool dude.

It's not as good as it used to be. Their oatmeal is the instant oatmeal you can buy from Trader Joe's for $2, the granola had almost no yogurt at all; I came in with a party of five and they got us two tiny tables that can barely accommodate four... And the place was almost empty!!! It took for ever to order, food arrived after half hour, I got out after one and a half hour from a semi-empty restaurant for a simple breakfast it is not acceptable. A burnt americano, and a passive-aggressive waitress who, when I said "we're ready to order" replied "that's what I am here for", completed an awful experience. I brought guests visiting from another country and I felt embarrassed for taking them here, definitely the worst possible welcome to Greenpoint. I used to love this place and I would have never thought I would someday discourage you from going

Kind of your typical trendy brunch place. However, the pancakes were delicious. Not because they were fluffy, not because the fruit was on point, but because they give you honeycomb butter. Seriously, slather me up and roll me all over that shizz. The sandwiches and the other breakfast things were good, also, but pretty pricey as you can imagine.

Horrible service- not the first time that I experienced it there but after today I'm not gonna go back. The guy in the front was rude and made us wait outside in the cold for thirty minutes even though there were two tables free? No thank you too many places that aren't rude and good as well

This place is awesome! I had the mushroom toast with kale and it was filled with so much flavor. Definitely recommend getting the ricotta pancakes, they were light and fluffy. The only downside is the place is relatively small, so the wait time for brunch is usually an hour.
It was a such great experience for brunch. The pancake was super awesome that I never expected it ;) Also they serve so fresh coffee;) I must go again

I always wonder why there is a line outside this place and on a long weekend, we decided to try this place out since it is a little quieter.  We ordered the ricotta pancake and Moroccan scramble.  They are both phenomenal. Also, the espresso beverages are solid.  They are on par with the Toby's estate and the likes.  All in all, we had a wonderful experience, probably won't come again in a while since we are not the "line up for brunch" type.  If you are, you should definitely check this place out.

Find the leaves was a very tight restaurant me and my friend A there the tables were very close it is very loud atmosphere we were there on a Friday night it was also very dark however the food was delicious we had hamburgers they came out perfectly cooked the bartender was very nice to wait staff was good very trendy restaurant music playing inside and outside seating

Third review! I'm usually not so petty as to dock an extra star, but imagine my dismay when I waited in the infamous Sunday line here only to be given a BLAT sandwich that was MOSTLY BREAD. Skimping on bacon is NOT okay. My favorite meal was almost unrecognizable!

Is it tasty? I can say 'just mediocre' Service? The servers are so rude. I waited for 30min to have a table. 1hr for dishes. I said, 'we have waited for 1hr' The surly female server answered 'I know' Even worse, the food of those who came later than us came first. We ordered same menu. Plus, the tatoo guy is much more rude and his pronuciation sucks. If you want to eat avocado toast and pan cakes, go other place. There are bunch of alternatives in Wiliamsburg. Still, if you want to get there, you have to compete with many tourists for get plain ordinary brunch.

Awesome local restaurant in Greenpoint. The burger with pineapple and an egg is one of the best burgers in Brooklyn, and the staff are all super friendly and welcoming. Outdoor summer dining looking out toward the park is a fun and relaxing hang.
Rosewater pavlova with passion fruit is amazing.. never had a dessert like this before, you definitely need to save room for dessert after dinner at this restaurant

This place is super overrated. I've been there a few times and the latest time, my friend and i were ignored for 20 minutes after sitting down and only were half-greeted by our server after another couple sat down next to us. We ordered a quiche and pancakes, aka the two quickest things to cook, and waited one hour for our food. Our server was cold and didn't apologize for the wait or even acknowledge that we'd been waiting. 3 other tables, all of whom got there after us, were served before us. We probably should have left, especially because when we finally got our food, it was unremarkable.
Great food! Must try the Ricotta pancakes. Everything there looked amazing, and tasted really good.

I think the best part of this experience and food was the truffle fries. Hands down the best one I've tried thus far. Other than that, the pancake was good and fluffy, but nothing TOO special. Butter was amazing though. The morrocan egg was good too. I think what bothered my friend and me the most was the service and the lack of people they have here. If it a "hot" place, I feel like the place should hire more waiters/waitresses for the people they serve. It took us 10 minutes to get the waiter to order food, 10 minutes to get mimosa/refill our water (as were sitting outside and thirsty), 25-30 minutes to get our food (which isn't THAT long, but at least bring one plate at a time?), and a good 20 minutes to get our check. I asked twice and I think the first time they might've forgotten, but we're literally right in front of her (15 min) and had to ask again which she brought it back 5 min later. Was it worth it? I don't think so, but I guess if you come in a less busy day, you can try it out.

This place is cool, trendy, and effortless! My friend and I came here after doing our research on the great eats in the Brooklyn area and seeing the vast amount of rave reviews. Glad we did too. We arrived around 2:30pm on a Monday and it was steady with customers. I knew what I wanted as a result of doing a yelp search on Ricotta Pancakes (also how I came across this place) they were massive. Three stacks and loaded with berries and a banana sliced in half. I'd suggest sharing with someone no doubt. My friend had the Big Brekki which is eggs, hashbrowns  toast and a choice of two sides. He opted for avocado and tomatoes it was quite the plate. In all we had a nice meal, great staff and great energy. Oh I like that they serve this same menu all day and into the night....1AM but the kitchen closes at midnight. Go and enjoy! You won't regret it.

You will wait but it is worth it! Went there for brunch on Labor Day and waited a while. Started with a bloody which had a nice spice. The kale salad is amazing, loaded with hazelnuts and delicious parm.  There are little anchovies throughout so order without if you don't like fish flavor. Others had the five leaves burger which had rave reviews, excellent fries! The avocado toast looked very fresh and with the sage eggs was a winner! Lastly my brother had the moracan egg dish, which is more like a loaded toast. He said it was delicious but on the smaller side.

This place is my fav Greenpoint restaurant! They have a best staff and great food. There is limited seating, but the small interior is part of their charm. So if you don't want to wait for weekend Brunch then go at a later hour or on a weekday... but the wait is worth it.

Came here for coffee and drinks with friends, but when I was going to show a document on my laptop, but we were promptly told that they don't allow laptops because it's against company policy. We definitely wouldn't have ordered had we known this, and they wouldn't budge at all on it. Be warned about their zero tolerance policy on this.
Came here on a Saturday before the brunch rush. The food and service were great and a good change from the normal brunch items.
Love it, great atmosphere and the food was great. Definitely will be back when I come back to NYC.

Went here a few yrs ago for a friends bday brunch. NEVER again. I saw so many great reviews about their pancakes. Well, let me just say, they were awful, AWFUL no taste whatsoever.. My friend had the omelette, she said there was too much seasoning in it. There was a bright spot, 2 stars for their truffle fries! I don't know what it was that day,  maybe the cooks were having an off day or something, and we felt like we were being rushed out of there. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Nice place! Waited for like 15 min to be seated which is not bad. Got the pancake as it looks so bomb and thick, the chia pudding and burger. The pancake is great! The thickest I have ever seen and is fluffy and moist. The honeycomb butter adds a perfect touch! Chia pudding is refreshing and filling! Love them all.

I decided to try this place a couple of times before I made up my mind. The first time I was here I came for brunch and had the ricotta pancakes (delicious) but the service was TERRIBLE. I assumed it was a fluke. WRONG. I came back today and not only was I ignored the whole time, the people that did "feel" like serving me were attitudey, inattentive, and just don't belong in the service industry.

The decor was very unique...especially the turntable playing music. The food was absolutely scrumptious...we had the morrocan scramble and the the big breakie with avocado, bacon & steak. We will definitely come back...

Highly recommended by a Brooklyn local, we stopped there on a Thursday afternoon. The place was packed - had indoors as well as some outdoor seating. Opted for indoor but the noise level was so high, and it was difficult to even hear each other among the two of us. The seating also is very limited and tight inside because of lack of space.  So we just ordered takeout and went and had in the McCarren park located just diagonally across the red light intersection. Ordered the Black Rice pudding and spicy chicken sandwich which were delicious, and the portions were ample. Black Rice pudding had coconut yogurt, pineapple and basil, a little sweet as expected but was lovely and a good choice. Loved the food so much that I went there next day as it was opening up and had their avocado toast and coffee for breakfast. The toast was so crispy , presented well and was a winner overall. Staff is friendly. Also early in the morning it was a prefect place to just sit outside and watch the outside activity and start the day with such a satisfying toast. Overall a good café to try if one doesn't mind the wait.

Had high expectations of this place until I got let down, I went today to try it for the first time to not even getting the chance to try it because there was a wait time & by the time it was our turn to go in the guy who sits people down, skipped me and my friend & just took the next people who were also waiting on a table.. not cool if I'm standing right there behind right behind them to get skipped. Very disappointed & unfriendly service.

Stopped here for breakfast and was super happy we did.  Got the clotted cream and strawberry rhubarb preserves with baguette.  So good.  We ordered the avocado toast with scrambled eggs and the Sage Egg Sandwich.  Both were delicious- so flavorful with very fresh ingredients.  Perfectly put together.  Coffee was excellent.  Flowers on the table were replaced while we were there (by Sprout Home) and it was a really happy touch.  Beautiful restaurant with a cool coffee to go window.  Everything seemed to be well thought out.  Service was incredibly fast.

A friend took there this morning and I got the Ricotta pancakes....now I gotta walk thru NY aimlessly trying to find better pancakes or fligh overseas... Thank you for ruin all other pancakes in NY for me...and your butter should be the 8th deadly sin...

Second time I am here and I love it. Their ricotta pancakes are the best and I really loved the cream starter with the fresh figs :) I brought friends for the first time here and they said the wait was worth it. I can't wait to come back again for brunch when it's even warmer. Also, love the decor :-)

This restaurant isn't something that necessarily stands out as an amazing dining experience; but I give it 5 stars because it is a place I find myself wanting to come back to over and over. I recommend the kale salad, and burgers are great too.
Great food, cute atmosphere, good service.  Don't miss the ricotta pancakes.  Small place, so be prepared to wait a bit, but they have a coffee window to grab a drink to kill time.
Great service and food. Everything on the menu is super healthy. Definitely coming here again
Big portions, lovely staff. Food and drinks are really great. Don't complain about the small space and all the people, that's part of the experience!

This is a must-even if it takes an extra jaunt in your day to get here. The atmosphere is quaint in the sophisticated hipster hustle bustle. I didn't come for the atmosphere-I came for the food-which exceeded expectation. A definite recommend.
We must've waited around 30 mins for a table and were then seated at the table closest to the door. BUT WE love it!!! Thank you!!!

Finally got back here for brunch on a sunny Monday and it was still popping and lots of others were dining. I loved the ricotta hotcakes which were like those at Granger and Co. In London by Bill Granger. If you like those (which are divine) you won't be disappointed by these.

Okay so first off the food is AMAZING. However. Be prepared to wait a VERY long time for it. I have been here when it's quite and when it's busy and no matter what your food is going to take forever to come out. If you go on the weekends bring a snack because you will wait an hour for a table and over an hour to get your food. Service can be very spotty. BUT everything is delicious. I wish there was a way for them to better their system in the kitchen. Favorite order is hands down eggs and steak. Their steak is about 7$? It's incredible.

The customer service here was appalling. The food was delicious, but it was really a disappointment otherwise. Nobody asked us if we wanted more drinks, it took an hour for our food to arrive, waiters walked by us staring at our empty plates without ever offering to take our them fifteen minutes after we were done. As much as I really wanted to love this place, and the food was super good, I won't be back because of how horribly inattentive their staff is.

The food here was really good. Not a sandwich person but tried their swordfish sandwich with a side salad and was impressed. The sandwich is nice and light but very filling. The place is however very small, had to sit at the bar, service was not great. They were busy and probably under-staffed.

Had the ricotta pancakes which included bananas, strawberries, and blueberries. There was so much food that I couldn't finish it all. I agree with the other reviewers that the pancakes itself were very fluffy and soft, but it wasn't the best pancakes I had... I might opt for a more savory meal next time. The people there were great and they were very nice.

Get their Swordfish!! My second time coming here and got the swordfish twice. It comes with asparagus and gooseberries-the best combination! And their Truffle Fries are so good too. The place itself is small, but the vibe is good. Def going back!

On reference from a friend, and a great one! Drinks were great and refreshing. Outdoor and indoor seating--not too loud but a little crowded. Luckily we got a back table with no one to either side. Burgers were great and the side of celery root mashed potatoes was DELICIOUS.
Just go ok go ... get the pancakes ... the ricotta and the morrocan  scramble  ... pure yummyness I can't wait to go back just for that ricotta , can be a long wait but so worth it ...
Pancake is so fluffy and so good!!! I think their homemade butter makes it better. Moroccan scrambled egg was aite :(
Amazing food. We had the crispy duck rice bowl and a burger. Both amazing. The outdoor seating was lovely on a warm early fall evening. Busy place so don't expect fast service.

I've been here for brunch a handful of times and i'll keep coming back because the ricotta pancakes are TO DIE FOR!! The space itself is a little small and usually crowded so there is often a wait to get a table, however the wait for food is typically within reason. It can get loud, so if you're looking for something more intimate I wouldn't suggest this location. But if you're craving amazing brunch food and cocktails - Five Leaves is the way to go.
GREAT food! The quiche of the day was amazing and so were the pancakes. Perfect brunch place! A little small inside but it was the best brunch we ate our entire trip.

This place is solid. Nothing too fancy, nothing too out of the ordinary, but definitely some solid food. It has the typical Brooklyn vibe to it. Seemed like maybe 1% of the staff is native to NYC, but tbh they were not judgey transplant hipsters at all rather very welcoming and accommodating especially for how busy they get. My wife and I got there at like 9am and they were already starting to pop off. The place gets filled with many locals, commuters, etc...a true neighborhood gem. We had the big breakkie which was super decent and the ricotta pancakes which looked cute. We loved the vibe and I loved my breakkie so we will with out a doubt would try this spot again next time we're in town.

Probably the most overrated place to eat in Brooklyn. It's not that the food is awful, it's just over priced and over hyped. Sure, eat if it's quiet, but to be honest there's plenty of better food in the area. Service suffers from the typical problem places like this have; snobby staff with elitist attitude. Simple solution is a low tip (because it's not the customer's responsibility to make up for the crap wages 'just because') but it's not worth the trouble. Also the experience is ruined by being 'that place' people recommend to out of towners. Kind of like the old Clinton Street Bakery which was also all hype, average food. Save your time. Venture up Manhattan Ave or elsewhere down the side streets. Five Leaves is a whole lotta 'meh'.
Ordered the mussels and a salad, mussels were old, had to send back of course got sick from eating that one. Salad was okay.

Hmm, it's a cute spot, but very tight. Sorry, but the pancakes ARE overrated! The ricotta pancakes had no flavor. The bananas, strawberries, and syrup made it better. I have yet encounter a restaurant whose pancakes that can out do Cafe Luluc in Brooklyn.
Fantastic. This place is stellar. The bar is incredibly inviting and tables are cafe romantic. It's spitting distance from a beautiful view of the park and is open and airy. What's not to love.

My credit Card wasn't working and the guy at the window was so friendly about it. He gave me my coffee despite the weird card reading issue, which was really sweet. It's Not even my local coffee shop but I'll prob come here anytime I'm by my corporate office because of that rad barista- oh and the latte was AMAZING.

Amazing coffee and love the atmosphere! Came here on a Sunday for a little brunch and the food was amazing! The staff was on top of everything and it was just overall a great experience so I came back the following day!!

Located a few feet from the subway and we saw a MTA bus pass by.  I came across Five Leaves during my search for a good breakfast spot and I was feigning for pancakes.  They had nothing but good reviews on their food.  So we hopped on the subway and headed over.  I never went inside because the weather was so nice, we decided to eat outside.  Our order was taken pretty quickly, but the wait was our food was extremely long and patrons who came after us were serviced quicker.  Our waitress never came over to inform us to justify the wait and when we finally inquired, she gave such a bland and nonchalant response.  Fortunately our food came out right after our inquiry.  The ricotta pancakes were delicious and the toast baguette bread with pumpkin butter was good.  Nice quaint location with really good food, but the service sucked.  Unfortunately, I would go back for the ricotta pancakes.
Service was awful, multiple staff insulted us to our faces because we asked to turn down the air conditioning.

This place is over rated. The host was rude and our drinks sat at the bar for 10 mins before anyone realized it and brought them over. Maybe because we're not neighborhood regulars, but it just felt like the staff didn't care about our table. The food was decent, nothing to rave about. Next time I'm in the area I'll def be eating somewhere else.

Staff was really friendly and awesome and the food was amazing. Love what this place is about and glad I happen to live so close. Ive never experienced pineapple on a burger until now and life has changed for the better in this post pineapple burger era.

Just got back from Five Leaves. The food was delicious! I had the Big Breakkie and my boyfriend had the burger. I just wish our server Kevin didn't bring us the check before we asked him. Although he assured us that we could take our time with it we felt a bit rushed. A group of people came in during that time so I kind of understand but it could've been handled with a little bit more finesse. Our table was cleared in two minutes and we could barely grab our drinks. This is enough to make us think twice about returning. A shame because the cappuccino was so good!
The best part of the three plates that we ordered was the honeycomb butter. Nothing special about the burger, kind of bland. We waited over an hour for mediocre service and food.
What a treat! Fabulous atmosphere and great food..pancakes, eggs,Bacon, mushrooms! Highly recommended!
Best veggie burger I've had ever and the truffle fries are amazing service and music was also great

Parking is not great, but there is a park nearby with free side parking. Service was okay, a bit slower than what I expected. Very small inside but cute, typical, brooklyn, hipster-ish place. It also has a few tables outside but it was a hot day. But the food, OMG!!!!! My cousin had the avocado toast which was visually appealing and she said it was good. bUT OMG the ricotta pancakes... OMG ... Were AMAZING. I usually tend to go for the plates that have somewhat of a reputation/hype and this definitely lived up to it. It was visually very appealing and mu taste buds were going crazy. Looks small but pretty filling, at least for me cause I don't take in too much. But overall the food made ip for all the other small flaws.

I'm not sure if people have the same experience as us. It took over half an hour to receive our food. What was more frustrating was that people around us who ordered the same food after us were being served before us. When we checked up on the status of our food the waitress was unapologetic. Waitress did not come once to check on us. I don't think I will be dining here again. I cautiously say this but maybe we were being discriminated for being Asian because I don't see what reason there was for us such poor service.

Delicious food. Friendly staff. Long wait. We shared three plates and it was more than enough food. Put your name down and take a stroll in the neighborhood, park, or grab a donut nearby if the weather is lovely.

My mom and I had a great day in the area visiting where my Dad grew up and went to church. We wanted to go to the food and drink museum, but it was closed. We walked two blocks and had a great lunch. I had the BLAT and my mom had a winner dish veggie burger. WOW. Her meal was the best. It was not dry like some veggie burgers can be. And the flavor was fantastic. The service was great. The atmosphere is eclectic and cool. The music was a bit loud. This was a great addition to our wonderful trip.
people rave about the burger so i had to try. it was really good but it wasnt lifechanging. the place is near spritzenhaus so its a good spot to grab food after drinking, very cute and quaint

Omggggggg I still have sweet dreams with their ricotta dish! Deliciousssssssss! The bad part is that this place doesn't take reservations so you have to wait. And the place is small so don't go if youre super hungry. But once you're in - omggg wow! Every dish is awesome! I had the ricotta dish with the raisin bread - heaven! And I had one of their specialty salads. I'm not sure what was in it but I ate every last bite! Cant wait to come back! Service was good too !!

First we waited for an hour outside in 10F outside. The cafe was tiny and jammed. The service was very mediocre and since it got so busy, I would have to wait for so long to get the waiter to refill my coffee or waited for my cream, which should have come with my coffee. I ordered the ricotta pancakes and they came in such a huge portion that it was the only thing I had for the entire day. It was delicious first few bites but in the end it got greasy and too much. I don't think I'd want to go back but their pancakes deserve a try.

Came on a weekday for brunch and there was no wait.  We got the pancakes, Moroccan scramble, black kale salad, and five leaves burger.  We all agreed that the Moroccan scramble was the best. The eggs were cooked perfectly with just the right amount of spice.  The salad was also delightfully cheesy without being too heavy.  The burger and pancakes were good as well, although I wish the pancakes could have been lighter and less solid.

Always solid awesome experience ! There is a reason this place has been staple they r efficient professional, well run and of course every meal is delicious in the kind of way that leaves u happy. I point this out bc lately bk dining has become so pretentious and 5 leaves is just always amazing.  If there's wait there's decent time estimate and awesome service.  I can't say the same for new place across street or lillia they have hype but that will fade.
Nice food, good service. Didn't wait for long for the food at all. The waiters were friendly. Will definitely come again.

Stopped in for a drink (ok, two) and a quick bite at the suggestion of a guy playing kickball in the park. Bartender made me a fabulous, off the menu lime/cucumber cocktail that was stellar. Truffle fries were also spectacular. Service was great, too.

Five Leaves is an amazing spot! I ordered to-go once but finally had a chance to dine in. They have outdoor and indoor seating and is located in such a great location. I had the avocado toast, thick cut bacon and my boyfriend had a Five Leaves burger, black rice pudding and a pitcher of APEOL SPRITZ! The Apeol Spritz pitcher was great. They use a lot of ice in the pitcher but we were able to have about 2 glasses a piece.  Everything else was made to pefection. I'll definitely be going back!

This place is great. Their ricotta pancakes are to die for. The butter was so amazing that I could eat it on its own!! And the bacon was delicious, they serve you a decent amount for the price. The place is really small and it's crazy busy so get there early! There is outside seating which is great for the spring and summer.

The ricotta pancakes are a MUST HAVE. Amazing texture and was not too sweet. If it had been a slight bit crispier on the outside, it would make the world's best pancake actually. The maple butter scoop on top crowns the dish. Need to try the Morrocan bfast next time. Big Brekkie was standard, bacon was a bit too old/crunchy to my taste.
Ricotta pancake is must try!!  So fluffy and moist. The butter on top is just sooo on point.

I had heard really good things but didn't think it was anything special. The veggie burger was on the dry and bland side. The decor and atmosphere is very cool but the host was pretty rude and did a bad job of managing the brunch queue/waiting list

When we went here early today we were told to wait 15 mins. While we were waiting near the bar, a bearded, rude and unkept worker (perhaps manager) told us to wait outside (there were no other people waiting inside or outside). I asked if we can wait inside the restaurant near the entrance and he said "no there is a door there". Never in my life have I ever been told to wait outside of the restaurant especially when it is below freezing and windy outside. At least he could have asked us in a polite way. Would never go back here and support this business. I would recommend Maison Premiere, Reunion, Hudson and Delaware as awesome brunch places in Williamsburg.

Absolutely love this quirky spot! I ordered the grilled vegetable panini and we quickly fell into a deep consensual romance. I really enjoyed the fact that I can taste the thick cuts of vegetables and the gooey Brie in my sandwich, and it was a perfect match with my mixed green side salad. My dining partner ordered the mushroom toast, which tasted a-maz-ing. The creamed mushroom and kale is unlike anything I've ever had anywhere else. Our female server wasn't anything memorable, but we'll definitely be back again for the food.

Fantastic Brooklyn find. The menu is incredibly light and fresh, and absolutely delicious. The avocado toast came on a fantastic loaf of healthy oat bread and the thai mussles looked fantastic. I'd recommend sitting outside as it is a great spot to being dogs and young kids. The cocktails also appeared well made. I'd be more than ecstatic to return.
Waited quite a bit, but it was well worth it. Ricotta pancakes were delish, i'm not a huge ricotta cheese fan, so I was a little worried, but in the end I was full, fat, and happy. Will go again!
Great lil spot super hipster though food had so much flavor $12 for eggs but all cage free and organic latte was everything
I'll go back to eat but I'm reviewing just the coffee-to-go counter which is luckily open late for when you need a macchiato rally cup.

I went here around 8pm with hubby. It is a nice spot for couples. I am visiting from DC so I was looking for a very nice spot. Not too upscale but def classy. I ordered the Amish chicken dish which was very very delicious. Hubby had the burger he loved it. Very nice staff can't remember the waitress name but everyone was very respectful. Also had the mixed green salad which was great as well. Had a glass of rose and a glass of champagne. Def would like to have brunch there one day.
good food!! every time i've ever been to this place there has been a wait the host seems pretty nice but the servers always seem stressed out or upset for some reason?

This is place has become a bit of a parody of a hipster scene restaurant. It has an edge to the service where you are made to feel like you're being done a favor to be allowed to eat there. I live locally and was in there this week. Having ordered a salad which was swimming in dressing, I barely ate it. The server asked if there was an issue only after she had run my card. Upon pointing it out she appeared to agree but offered no remedy (eg. taking the salad off the check). Rest of food was ok but not worth price or usual wait.

This is one of my go-to places in Brooklyn. You won't regret it. The brunch is amazing especially the ricotta pancakes with banana and berries. The mushrooms are also a fave of mine, the truffle fries as well. Their coffee is very good. Only inconvenient is the wait time : this place is CROWDED especially Sundays. Expect one hour wait at least! But worth it :)

The skirt steak was cooked perfectly, the mashed potatoes were delicious. My fiancé enjoyed the squid. Server was very attentive. It was a bit more expensive than the $$ lead me to believe. Three drinks an appetizer and steak dinner came to $100 with tip. We will probably go back.
Had a great brunch here. Tried the Moroccan Scramble and the Miso Salmon Poke--both were great. Cozy interior, friendly staff, reasonable prices, and great location right next to the park.

One of absolute favorites. A very cozy little restaurant in the heart of Brooklyn serving up delicious comfort food. The ricotta pancakes are on the best dishes I've ever eaten. It really is that good. The batter is so perfect and fluffy, while the honeycomb butter is outstanding too. The service is friendly too.

My friend told me i have to try their ricotta pancakes and she was right.  Fluffy panckes, oh so good.  Try their mussels if anyone like coconut milk and curry, so sauce was good that i can drink the sauce if i still had room in my stomach.  Did not like the Morrocan Scramble was alright, i found the dish abit dry.  Better come early since it is quite packed.  We went on a Tuesday around 10:30 and there was no empty table.

Food is very great but service could definitely be better. As of recent, I've become very critical of the service in the restaurant industry. The amount of tip that patrons are expected to shell is just ridiculous. Some places even have the audacity to request up to 25% in tips. Just to be clear, I do and have accepted that as part of eating out but shelling hefty tips for shitty service I will no longer accept. This is all because restaurant owners just don't pay their employees enough anymore and have transferred that cost to their customers. So if i'm expected to give a generous tip then I better get damn good service.
Go-To spot in the neighborhood! Cocktails always on point, and their menu's are perfectly curated for any craving. Bartenders here are super chill... try the "El Rey".

I was so happy to try this place for brunch. This place is usually packed and it's hard to get a table but when we walked in we were seated right away. The food is delicious and the menu has plenty of things I would like to try. The bloody mary was good. Not the best I had but it was good. I got the Farro Bowl and my wife had the Moroccan Scrabble which was delicious. Everything was great. I would come back here again without a doubt. Service and hospitality was great as well.

Absolutely delicious and unique menu. It gets croweded and isn't huge, like many places in New York. But we only waited about 30 minutes on a beautiful saturday morning and were able to dine outside. One of my favorite brunches in town.

I came here because of the pancakes, stayed because of the pancakes, cool staff and the atmosphere. The food is top, the staff (once they get to know you) are top notch, together with nice music everyday. Just be sure to come outside of regular food hours so that you get seated quickly. I was eating here during my whole holiday, around 8 breakfasts in total and the food quality stayed the same. The only thing which I didn't like (but everyone else seems to like) is the coffee, a bit to acidic.

What hasn't been said about this spot by now? It has a nice outside spot and perfect people watching across from the park with solid food. Had the salad with chicken and it wasn't some measly low-quality chicken breast lamely grilled, but an actual quarter chicken, either oven-roasted or pan-roasted. Actually really good, for what is typically a bore of a salad. It isn't obscenely priced and for lunch-time during the week there isn't an offensive line like at brunch (why tho?). It turns out the value for seeing the wild kids in their wacky clothes walking around Greenpoint/Wburg in bra-less shirts or all black long pants and all black t-shirts in 85 degree weather pays off.

Great service and nice interior but food was just okay. Ordered the ricotta pancakes which were fine but quite costly ($16 for three pancakes, a banana, and a few strawberries and blueberries). Also ordered the scallion pancake halloumi sandwich which was teeny tiny (like the size of a half sandwich) flavors were pretty tasty but the kimchi used was starting to sour (I wouldn't have served it, only passable in kimchi soup at that point).
Love, love, love the Brekkie! It was everything I wanted for brunch and more. And not to mention the amazing truffle fries. Yummmmm

Came here for brunch in Sunday. Only giving four stars because the wait was insane (1 hour for 2 people) but it was well worth it. I got the pancakes and my friend got the avocado toast and we shared the big Brekkie. We were offered bellinis due to our long wait which always puts a smile on my face. we were then seated. Seating is really tight so be sure to leave unnecessary items elsewhere as it can be annoying to walk through. Everything tasted amazing. Food takes a little while but so worth the wait. Definitely a go to if you're in greenpoint.

The bartender was great!... guy with glasses and tattoos- really on top of service and very friendly! We will give him 5 stars... however My husband and I both got burgers and unfortunately his was legit raw and we had to send it back, then mine was so burnt on the outside and some what cooked on the inside- I just forced myself to eat it, winded up finishing before my husbands second round out, so he ate alone and I ate alone... place is to packed to be in such a small spot, I'm thankful for them that there busy but it's not comfortable when a waitress is brushing up on her back every time walking by!.. needs adjustments. I don't see what the hype is- it's to busy for quality service, they really just don't give a shit lol

Hash browns were awesome. Little crispy circular patties. Ordered the moroccan scramble and loved the spice. Big portion. Fries good. Waited 40 minutes for two people on a Sunday. Would not come here with a large group. Cramped inside and out.

Never a bad meal here. This place is always busy and it's for a reason. Of of my favorite places, periods The food is done right. You never leave hungry and you your wallet doesn't hurt either. The Amish chicken is my go to. Also a great burger, lentil soup and blackberry gelato! Friendly staff, good atmosphere. You won't have a complaint
Great food specially 5 leaves burger with truffle fries delicious. Cozy ambiance good selection of wine. Our  server was very friendly and attentive, for sure we will come back

Great place for brunch in Brooklyn. I had heard a lot about Five Leaves throughout the past few years, and the food lived up to the hype. I got the ricotta pancakes which came with this amazing honey butter, and tons of fruit. I'm also usually not a scrambled eggs fan, but the way they make it here looks amazing. Only thing is that I came on a really hot day and there's no air conditioning and they don't give you ice with your water so you have to ask. Plenty of outdoor seating as well if you enjoy eating outside.

I came here for lunch by myself not too long ago. Even though it was midweek, it was still pretty crowded. I had the Heritage Grain Bowl, which was tasty but not mind blowing, especially considering the price. There are enough bougie brunch/lunch spots in Brooklyn that I wouldn't run back here anytime soon.

Not what all the reviews say it is.  No host available when I walked in , although they were waiters walking left and right of me but apparently they didn't care enough to greet or seat me. Huge turn off! The seating arrangements are horrendous. If you don't have a 2 inch waistline you won't be able to get into your seat. So uncomfortable! The service is horrible. And the food is mediocre. Not at all what I expected. Such a huge disappointment. I will not be returning here again. Sorry!
The best brunch in Greenpoint, if not the best restaurant. Always incredibly packed, have a better shot getting a seat for dinner then on a weekend for brunch. Get the Burger.
Amazing pancakes!!! Love the butter on top it's like a dessert on its own.  And so fluffy.

The food here is excellent.  I love their coffee and the walk-up window outside for when I'm passing by and crave a cup of their hot joe.  I love this place.  Of course like any good spot in the hood, there is always a wait to get a table.  It is a bit crowded inside but it's worth it.  I have been here for brunch and dinner and I am never disappointed.

Food was excellent , but a bit pricey for breakfast/brunch . However , they use organic ingredients cage free eggs so I believe that's why the prices are high for breakfast they had a great special for oysters when I went in , but I do have to say try their truffle fries omgggg soo good !
Best breakfast/brunch spot in north Brooklyn. Staff is great. Good food options for kids too. Favorite dishes include the big breakie, signature burger and ricotta pancakes.
Been going here for years, food and service is consistent and bathrooms are clean. The patrons might be my only complaint.

My go to spot when I'm in Greenpoint. Possibly the best breakfast in town, definitely my favorite walk up coffee window. The atmosphere and staff are absolutely awesome. I take all my out of town friends here to show them a good time.

An awesome brunch spot. I passed by it several times and didn't really think anything of it until I used Yelp and searched for the best pancakes in greenpoint hence how I found this place. The pancakes were unbelievable. The service is great and the outdoor space is cool for warmer weather. Will definitely be back and will try a healthier option on the menu.

This used to be the place I come to regularly. E every time I have a visitor, I take them to five leaves. However, due to the rudeness and snootiness of the staff- I didn't tip for the first time in my life. The food was cold, bland, and the drinks were flat and terrible. It was the worst way to spend $50. Bad vibes result in more than you think.

I love this place. You can take your Mom here. It's pretty, the food is very good with generous portions and excellent coffee. It won't break the bank. I've impressed many with the pleasantness of this experience. You look out at the park ,what's not to like? Plenty for a vegetarian to eat. I only had one weird experience here with a bartender but he was inexperienced and came back to apologize. It happens. DJ? More like the staff puts on a vinyl and plays the entire side, flips it over plays the other. That's fine with me.

I was in the area one weekend, and walked by to see how packed it was. I took a seat at the bar and noticed how many plates of pancakes were going by, so I figured I'd order some to go along with my Reed's Ginger Brew (they have my favorite ginger beer!!) The ricotta pancakes were out of this world. Fluffy, thick and covered with fruit. Also, the bruleed grapefruit and the avocado toast are a must have. Hell, I'm sure anything on this list is a must have. My only complaint is the small space, but that's what you get living here in NYC.
Beautiful little place in Brooklyn that has amazing food.  It's definitely one of my favorite places I've eaten in New York! The biggie breakfast with mushrooms is kick ass!
Delicious. Fresh, healthy and generous servings. Foodie haven... Suggest the Moroccan breakfast if you like a kick. Only one bathroom and busy even on a Monday at 1030... expect a wait for both.
my favorite brooklyn brunch spot i have tried since being here on business... delicious food.. ordering at a window and eating outside is smart during these uncertain times
I ordered Moroccan scramble for myself and ricotta pancakes for my daughter.  Both tasted so good.  Coffee tasted okay.  Not strong enough for my taste.
Excellent brunch: loved the ricotta pancakes; brûlée grapefruit & chia pudding. You must try the Turmeric Latte
We haven't been here in a year. But damn. We think about this place a lot. Definitely top 5 maybe even top 3 on best brunch spots in the world.

Food here is delicious. I'm not a brunch kinda person so I never have had to wait all too long for a table. If you're  going for brunch, expect to wait a bit... Service is overall good, but sometimes is slow depending. I tend to stay at the bar, the bartenders are great. (Grayson is great by the way! Thanks for being such a great host every time we come by!)

Granted that we got there during the busy time (Saturday brunch), service was on the slow side (45 minutes for pancakes?), but the Ricotta pancakes and Moroccan scramble were just alright and not exactly what one would expect when other reviewers rave about them. So, in all fairness, this is an average (but very popular) brunch place.

It was a tight squeeze in terms of space, but my Americano and breakfast were great. I can't remember the name of the dish, but it had scrambled eggs, hash browns, toast and two sides (I got the avocado and sauteed mushrooms). My husband had the riccota waffles and liked them. The hash browns may be an acquired taste, but I didn't care for it. The eggs were perfectly cooked, and the presentation was way better than I expected. The service was nice. It was quite busy.

Got the Moroccan scramble and the five leaves burger. Both were delicious, the beer on the burger was unique and made the burger! It was busy on a Sunday morning w a line outside, but we easily grabbed two seats at the bar w no wait. Fun fact our driver told us: Heath Ledger opened this restaurant.
Every meal was great, and every cup of coffee was good. Just expect some wait time when you go yo brunch on weekend.

Will NEVER DINE HERE AGAIN!!! Food is great. I have been there a few times...HOWEVER the service on Tuesday 10.22.19 was deplorable. The blonde waitress was so rude that it was so uncomfortable to eat and I took my food to go. I hate complaining and confrontation. This will be the last time that I dine here. My partner and I have been here before and had a different experience. Sadly, the food is pretty good...for whatever reason I was repeatedly treated so rudely I got my food packed to go. I cant stress enough how rude this waitress was from how she handed plates to me to not even asking if I would like a refill on wine. Even the minimal standards of service were gone...checking even once on my table...I left feeling so uncomfortable and the entire experience was offputting. It seems as if she went out of her way to give this type of service! It wasnt just an oblivious fluke. Wont be back. Please get new waitstaff. Entirely unacceptable.

This is a super lovely place, but you might not get that from the first impression. The food here is always incredible, however the service can be a little too slow for comfort when it gets crowded in here. The crowd itself is also the usual hipster mass that hangs around this part of NY, but if you can endure that then you're guaranteed to have a wonderful time here. Every dish I've tried so far has been impeccable, the salads are always fresh to death but the black kale salad triumphs all. I always order it every time I come around here because it tastes way too terrific to miss out on.
Delicious!!! Artsy fartsy, great playlist, food is as good as it looks.  Never thought beets and pineapple would pair so well.

I won't comment about the food as the quality speaks for itself. I just wanted to comment on the enhanced eating  experienced of having a turntable play tunes this make my brunch ever so more stellar! Today, I was feasting on perfectly done eggs with the sounds of 1970s black action movie songs! So fun!

Everything I can't stand about Brooklyn in one cramped space. Staff has a weird standoffish attitude that makes you feel like you've somehow ended up in their home begging for coffee. It's insanely small and narrow, leaving you to actually ask permission to leave your table or walk anywhere in the place because it's always really crowded. Food is alright but there's also tons of other better/more welcoming/spacious places in the city to find a great burger or pancakes. Truly nothing special.
This was a quaint little spot with delicious food! Great menu, delicious oysters and whole grilled fish.
Super chic/hipster brunch spot. Really great good. The only downside was the wait during brunch rush hour on Sundays. It took about 45mins to get a table. Id definitely come back despite the wait.

I'm only giving three stars because of the food and the manager! This place is much raved about but the service is horrible. I've been waiting for over an hour for pancakes! I mean how long does it take? The server has never came back over to even check in on me. I have watched the couple next to me be served their food and I ordered 30 minutes before them. I will never return here. The customer service is horrific. I asked the bar tender if he could check on my food and he responded I'm busy. I spoke to the manager and he was extremely apologetic so I am pleased.
Nice food but rude staff (probably that day!). We ate the super brekkie (i think it's the name) and it was pretty good! I'll recommend it, try to get there early.

Hands down the best pancakes you will ever consume in your lifetime. I'm just upset so many people caught on. The wait is usually two+ hours on Saturdays. Delicious, though! I'd say it's worth the wait.
Best pancakes in the city. The honeycomb butter is to die for! Also try the other brunch items, the Moroccan Chick pea bowl is also very good!

Went here for breakfast and immediately loved the place. It's cozy, a bit noisy and bustling, and the staff is attentive and quick. My server was super friendly and made me feel welcome. My steelcut oats were perfect, and i liked that they didn't drown it in sugar. The scrambled eggs were as good as they looked - let's just say I had to eat them right away. Oh, and the coffee was rich and tasty - i will definitely come back here!
Moroccan scramble is so good, as is the coffee! It's a lovely spot on a week day when it's more quiet and nice for people watching.
The restaurant is in a great location, the staff are friendly, and the food is great. Downsides: slightly overpriced and a bit too hipster.

Great food and coffee. Appreciated the bottle of water on the table. The service could be a bit better. We sat outside and felt a bit forgotten about and it took a while for them to bring our bill. I'd definitely go back.

I just love this place! The food is just so terrific and affordable. The steak, the burger with a fried egg on top...and the truffle fries! The grapefruit margarita is always a wise choice - not too sweet. The location is picturesque, right on the corner of the park...yet still seems a bit out of the way from the Bedford stop, which is nice. Great interiors. The staff is pretty with cool style, but they never have an attitude. Always very friendly and accommodating. I've come here on my birthday before, it's that great. Just the BEST!
Always super crowded. Great corner location right in front of the park. Super chill/hipster vibe, classic soul  and hip hop blasting at all times. Solid food choices, good drinks, great coffees.
one of my top few favorite restaurants. so many incredibly delicious dishes. the pancakes go above and beyond! the burger is also incredible, tasty oysters, and "whiskey in a jar".

The food here was pretty good, we started with the mussels and had extra bread for the coconut soup concoction that the mussels were cooked in. Then I had the Tagliatelle it was nice, the thyme was strong in it. The atmosphere was nice, our server was decent, she seemed busy n couldn't give much attention but that's okay. I recommend.

This is quaint healthy hipster place to go for brunch. It has a very rustic salvaged feel. Even though the waitress spilled a whole thing of milk in my Marc Jacobs bag. Being in the industry myself I couldn't be mad, it was an honest mistake. At least they offered to have it cleaned. I remember the food being in point especially since I prefer and look for gluten-free options, and I do believe I had a lovely Bloody Maria here. I would go back with a satchel from one of the second hand stores nearby.

Great place! Seating is limited and it was pretty packed, but service was quick and between waiting for a table a waiting for our food, it was just under an hour (which for Sunday brunch, ain't that bad!). Great selection of food and drink (definitively get the mushrooms!). Staff were friendly and definitely a great place to gather with friends or family.
By far, the best pancakes I have ever had! 11am on a Saturday and only waited about 20 minutes. Great Bloody Mary too.
Everything is amazing on the menu and the coffee is some of the best in NY. Be prepared to wait though, average brunch wait is about an hour and a half.

No more than two people. My husband , mother  and I went to five leaves.  We've waited 1hour and 30 mins for ricotta pancakes.  There has plenty of set for only two peolpe and one unclean bath room. The ricotta  pancakes was not something special pancake than nomal pancake. Very disappointed.(maybe i had high expectations)Do not order thick bacon...it was too so dry and chewy and morroco scramble taste very strange.   Don't waste  time and money. Worst experience

Awesome food! The Five Leaves burger is an amazing blend of flavors. The Black Kale salad is also really good. Def try the Ricotta pancakes. Everything was tasty and delicious. The atmosphere is really cute too.

Came for lunch on a weekday because I've never wanted to wait for brunch.  The place was pretty full, but I could get seated almost immediately. Inside and some outside seating. The place is cute and has a perfect Brooklyn vibe.  Nice cocktails, I found several things on the menu that struck my fancy, nice service, and they didn't balk at filling my to-go glass with iced coffee. It wasn't cheap, but I thought the price met the quality. I'll be back in for sure.
Had the grilled Shishito peppers with cilantro lime and salt and some truffle fries.  Fun food!

Luckily we went on a weekday so we didn't have to wait that long . The food was good but not worth waiting a long wait . I had the pancakes which was yummy & fresh . My bf had morrocan scramble  which he thought was overpowered by the parsley. The place is really small which was annoying . Our waitress was ok .
Avoid this place if you can. Everyone works here look miserable. Mediocre food. Everyday there is a super long waiting line outside but there are actually plenty of seats available.

Great food, great service, great drinks. I had their burger which was cooked perfectly and their truffle fries... I could not stop eating them! Hubby had their five leaves burger which was amazing! We have zero complaints. Atmosphere was great too, it's a tight little spot but that's what makes it unique. Definitely recommend this place and we will be back!
Very nice breakfast and pancakes, Worth to come in early morning. We the pancake is yummy, better than we ever had.
I really like their food with some avocado,and very great service here,waiter are so nice,really enjoy the meal.

Quaint restaurant tucked away along a nice street. The food was superb! I had the big brekkie. It was delish and sampled the pancakes. They were light and fluffy and yum! The service was OK. Could have been a little faster, then again it could be on purpose for this place is a great place to conversate on a date.

Half an hour wait on a Saturday was to be expected, it was so busy but the waiters were ALWAYS polite and patient with everyone they spoke to. The menu was great, so much choice.  I had the avocado on toast and it was amazing. My friend got a grain bowl and replaced the poached egg with avocado- it was so good!! Highly recommend this busy little restaurant and give my respects to all the workers there!

This review is ONLY for the ricotta pancakes! Those pancakes.. Are absolutely amazing! Especially the butter on top. However, I've had a couple of items here (Moroccan scramble, burger) and it was quite average. Definitely not worth the 50 minute wait. The pancakes bump this place up from a 3.5 to a 4! If you don't have the pancakes, make someone else on your table get it.. So you can atleast taste it.. And then regret all your life decisions while they continue to eat the whole thing.

The ricotta pancakes were AMAZING!!! We also had the five leave burger which was good as well. After one order of pancakes shared between 2 people, we were full. So if you're gonna order any one thing, make sure it's the pancakes!

I've heard about this place a lot so decided to come one Saturday morning. The line was very short and be got table very fast, thanks to a polite hostess. But it is the only advantage of this place. Service is not good (they did not even change our forks of previous course, and put in on the table again(!!!!) plus a waitress had hardly overturned on me a plate with mushroom toast and anyway some pieces of spinach were in my new pants. This place does not have bough room, so you is hardly ever can move. Food is not bad but absolutely nothing special. There are a lot of place like that we you can have eggs and pancakes (very dry, btw). I'm not going to come again and believe that the cafe does not worth to be one of the best places for breakfast ( how many advertising articles put it).
Always an amazing brunch spot! Famous for their pancakes and for good reason. I was lucky to come on a less busy morning but definitely be ready to wait a bit to get a table here.

The brunch was okay. I had the 5 leaves burger and my partner had the pancakes. Both dishes are staples and highly recommended. It is overrated. What aggravated me most, was the VERY long wait and the rude host. He wasn't very welcoming with a "too cool for school" attitude. I also didn't like the way the staff was treated my management.

Delicious food, fantastic cocktails (and strong), and excellent service. Five Leaves has it all. It's got outdoor seating which is perfect for people watching. The place is small and they don't take reservations (with the clear demand, they seem to have a steady flow of people coming), so that is my only real complaint. I highly recommend the Chicken Paprika, Seared Octopus, and Truffle fries. Definitely worth the wait!

I don't brunch often but so glad I came here. Obsessed with these pancakes. Fluffy and deliciousness in one. Busy spot in Brooklyn but managed to get seating immediately upon arrival. Great service and setting. Cannot wait to return.

We came here for dinner. The food was good, nothing outstanding. The service was poor. The server wasn't very keen on helping us with what's tasty on their menu. He also seemed rushed. Poor service and standard food... Not worth it.

Completely average brunch. Due to past reviews and the ridiculous hour and fifteen minute wait, I was pretty sure we were going to be in for one slammin' brunch. Nope. If you know one thing about me, it's the fact that I finish everything that's on my plate. As long as it was good/great/amazing/phenomenal. My plate was 47% clean. Completely average. Nothing to write home about & certainly not worth going back a second time. Outdoor seating was THE highlight on such a nice day.

Best brunch place I have visited for a long time!! We entered the restaurant and stepped into a pleasant place with a retro decor and hip atmosphere. The menu was modern, fresh and organic. We ordered the Morrocan eggs and Big Breakkie, mimosas and coffee, and for dessert we had the ricotta pancakes with fruit. The food was so delicious and so fresh. Would def come again and recommend the place to everybody that love a good brunch with a twist!!
The food is good but the SERVICE SUCKS Literally waited 2 hours for our food and it was just 3 of us, there's better brunch and service in Brooklyn don't waste your time here

Great spot for an early Sunday breakfast. By early I mean arriving at 7:58am for 8am opening time early. Servers are very attentive even as it got busy. The scrambled (or swirled??) eggs are damn good!

Disappointing. Staff is rude, they don't wash the dishes and the food is average. The waiters seemed bored and uninterested in making us have a good experience. We asked if we could replace an item in the dish - the side - and the response was a flat "no". So you can't even tell me that you're sorry and that I could order the side as an extra? I would've actually accepted. Then they brought my cup of coffee with a huge lipstick mark on it. I pointed it out and the guy just looked at me like I was crazy and said "What?". Then finally looked at the cup, apologized and went to get another one. At this point, we were not having a great brunch. The food was ok but nothing extraordinary. Your average Williamsburg brunch place. Honestly, not worth it.

Wish I could give five leaves a better review. The food was amazing. Both the savory and sweet brunch options were absolutely delicious. Perfectly balanced flavors. However, the staff were terrible. I am not usually one to care about a restaurant's service, but this was atrocious. Almost everyone was incredibly rude. I called ahead to ask if they were busy and I was told "I don't know." So I asked if he had any idea how long the wait would be in about an hour. He responded, "How could I possibly know that, its in an hour," with a condescending laugh. The rudeness continued with the hostess, onto the waiter, and the bussers.  Extremely disappointing considering the quality of the food and the fun atmosphere.

Love the food here....truffle fries are the best I've ever had (among other things) Only complaint is the tables are too close together; sorry stranger I'm sure your fabulous but I'm not here for dinner with YOU too :/

First time visiting Brooklyn and saw the reviews. It was a squeeze in and very busy, but the food was great and the decor really interesting. Peak hipster. The very definition of hipster, and we loved it. Highly recommend the pancakes and the clotted cream was splendid.
Hostess, extremely rude. Unhelpful - said we could order breakfast at the bar and when I asked to be seated he said the FIVE MINUTES it took us to decide was too long. Terrible

Came here for brunch on the weekend. It was nice weather and therefore busy, but the service wasn't the best. Sat by the bar and got the pancakes - they were delicious - very light and fluffy. Unfortunately I was unable to finish them!!!! I'd like to go back to try dinner service.
Great food in a chill outdoor seating area. Duck cavatelli was amazing and our Australian server was a dude. Will definitely be back
All I can say is wow! Great ambiance, strong drinks, delicious food and friendly and professional staff.  Right down the block from McCarren park.
My all time favorite brunch spot in Brooklyn!! The best homemade granola.  Delicious coffee.  Great crowd.

I wasn't blown away. I got the burger and its taste was... overwhelming.  The beets and the pineapple made the burger sweet... It wasn't bad but not good enough to order again. Definitely depends on your palette though. My friends enjoyed their burgers.
Everyone has taken pics of the pancakes, but the are so worth it. Not too hard to get to from the subway. It can be crowded, but that's a good sign.

Great vibes, great food, great service, Stumptown!!! The Moroccan Scramble is so good I could die. Perfectly fluffy eggs and delicious sourdough. A menu so good I knew I could order anything and be satisfied.

Five Leaves is not a spacious place to eat; however, it had a nice view of the park across the street. They have outdoor seating, which was convenient for us because we brought our dog. They had outdoor tables, but only a couple of umbrellas to block out the sun. I don't know what it is, but I always eat out on the hottest days, so I wish I was sitting under an umbrella. The tables were so close to each other, my fiancé and I started chatting with other customers - I just wanted to eat my burger. Speaking of the burger, it was alright. It's not the best, but reading the reviews here, I guess it was best for the neighborhood. The service is extremely slow, and I suppose that's what this neighborhood expects as well.

This place is usually great. But today it was absolutely horrible. Burnt burger (asked for medium rare). Like I'm talking charred where no amount of condiment can mask it. Waitress took forever to take our order than got the order wrong. As I was leaving I saw them throw out four burnt burgers in the back. If they did that with those why not mine?

Please say you let go of the waitress who broke three different wine glasses while picking them up from multiple tables in less than 10 minutes last night. Still finding glass in my coat from one. Same woman took our plates before letting us answer if we were done. We enjoyed our food. We even let slide that the duck wings were bone cold when we got them. But the service was a circus. Not coming back.
Awesome breakfast. In Brooklyn for the weekend and found Five Leaves by chance. It's a "must eat" stop in Greenpoint.
Slow service. Cool atmosphere and good food. Staff a bit rude upon entering. Apart from that, I would recommend to most.

The food gets a five but let's be real, the service is like a two. The food really is amazing, just don't expect smiles or much leg room (it's always jam packed, but whatever - welcome to brooklyn). Everything I tasted was delicious, and everything in here is beautiful - the staff, the decor, the food. I can't get that butter lettuce and fennel salad out of my head. Crispy capers?!

My new addiction. After a long week of juicing and trying to eat right, all I want by the end of it is a burger and truffle fries from five leaves. The juicy well seasoned meat with sharp cheddar and thick cut bacon (why not?) and to make it perfect a heaping portion if truffle fries. It makes you drool everyone. Utter perfection.

Hair1 hair2 hair3 on two dishes. DISGUSTING. Rude, making faces, don't remember they took the cash from customers kind of waitress and waiter. Been here many times, services DEFINITELY getting worse and worse every experience.

This place is a Brooklyn gem...perfect neighbourhood spot, delicious food and awesome atmosphere. We snagged seats at the bar and loved it BUT we recommend you get seats on either end so that you don't keep getting bumped in the middle (tight space). Thank you for a great experience!

We didn't feel welcome at all. The hostess was very rude and had an attitude, So we ended up going to Sauvage across the street which had great food and very professional service, Thanks to Five leaves terrible hostess we discovered an amazing place.

The brûlée grapefruit was delicious. The BLAT was fairly good as well. They get busy, and won't answer the phone for To go orders. It's also a pretty tight spot so I would expect a way on typical rush dining tim
Friendsgiving brunch with friends. The Moroccan Scramble is worth the wait. Yes, you'll have to be patient and wait in line since it's no secret this is the best brunch place in Brooklyn.
Five stars hands down!!! just about sums up what I like in a spot! Cool music, good food, oysters, nice col glass of beer!!! Oh yea!!! Cheers guys!

My wife and I eat here all the time for a late dinner. We always get the Kale Salad and Oysters.. The staff is awesome and every meal is tasty. Yes it's a hipster joint, but nothing wrong with that as I don't like the uppity crowd anyways..

Love this restaurant. Really great atmosphere and have taken a few friends here. The food is amazing, with staff that have an understanding of wine / dinner pairs. They also have some classic kiwi pie dish (sadly it does not come with NZ crust).

Great place for a small lunch between two walks in the neighborhood. The sandwiches are good, and cheap for the area ! As a tourist, it felt like the place was mainly local, and that's a feeling you like when you're visiting a city (and especially NYC).
Love the ricotta pancakes during brunch! So fluffy and delicious plus fresh fruit and this awesome homemade butter. It's a must have every weekend!

Me and my girlfriend visited Five Leaves. The place was a little wait to reach on table but it was worth of it. We loved the feeling of this amazing place. Bit rustic but unique. Ricotta Pancakes were amazing. It comes with lot of maple syrup. The staff was cool and nice.

I would give 3.5 stars if I could. This place has a great menu but only reason I'm giving it as many stars as I did is because the food took FOREVER to come to us and I had to ask the server if they forgot about us. The food was good but it was super salty.

Pretty average, the hype is overblown for a lot of it, I think. The pancakes are good, but I think Park Luncheonette's are comparable and you don't have to wait for hours. The BLT is p much the same, kinddddda average. I've also had the pineapple beet burger with the truffle fries, which was okay, but too large to get a good bite in. The thing I remembered from my first time eating there was that the cup and saucer were a bit dirty, and the milk for my coffee had mysterious things floating in it. Service was okay, I didnt get any of the snobby waiters that everyone else seems to complain about.

How is it possible that I have not yet reviewed Five Leaves?!? I say that because everyone who knows me knows that I am always saying Five Leaves is one of my top 3 favorite restaurants. I have never had anything here that I didn't enjoy but my favorite thing on the menu is, believe it or not, a salad. Specifically the Crunchy Vegetable and Quinoa Salad. I *crave* this salad. Something about the balance of watermelon, okra, goat's milk cheese, quinoa, greens, and light dressing is incredibly satisfying and well-balanced. Go there. Try it. Trust me.

Love this place!   Coffee is excellent.   Outdoor seating adjacent to the park is real nice!     Walk-up window is fast and efficient.   I haven't been here enough!  I have had a number of things on their breakfast menu and everything is just delicious!   If you a fan of delicious flavor then check out 5 Leaves ... you may have to wait for a seat ... but you wont regret it!

I was very pleased with my dinner at five leaves. Although the restaurant was packed and there was only one server for the whole patio on the night we dined, he was very attentive and pointed us towards delicious things on the menu. The atmosphere is very nice and the outdoor seating overlooks McCarren Park. The food is very fresh and vegetable focused which is how I like to eat. If you are looking for a nice and casual yet tasty restaurant in Brooklyn with both indoor and alfresco dining than this place is for you.
Eat brunch at the bar, get the moroccan thing, drink a bunch of bloody marys, catch up with a friend. The staff is A++ with zenlike positivity.

The $14 burger that I ordered medium rare was super dry, very over cooked, and so salty I could barely eat it. I would have sent it back but was embarrassed to do so in front of my date.The fries were good, and the staff friendly, otherwise one star would have been generous.

Very good food. Tried the falafel and it was very good. The burger is their best dish. Attentive service and good vibe. Great place to hangout with friends and very busy throughout the day. They have a proper turntable and a decent selection of jazz vinyl with a healthy dose of good taste from the bar tenders. Good all around.

The morocco scramble egg is awesome.  Avocado & chickpea hummus and a good amount of ground beef.  Right amount of cumin really put all flavor together. A really filling meal.  The ricotta pancake is not as good as before.  It used to be very puffy but somehow it's quite flat.  I guess I will not order that next time.

We followed the stars and they led us in the right direction! The food was delicious, unique and tastefully prepared. Everything we had was so good! You can't go wrong with anything you order. The wait staff was kind and helpful. Highly recommended!

We had a great meal and great service here. The oysters on the half shell were so amazing we ordered another round after the first 6 were gone. My entree was lamb steak with grilled okra - delicious! Staff was knowledgable and gracious. We had a lovely Cotes du Rhone. I loved the decor. Would be a great location for a date if you want to lean in close.The place was hopping and that made hearing each other a little difficult.
Been going here since it's opened and it has been consistently amazing food and service. Food always comes fast and perfect. Brunch is top notch.

I've been eating at Five Leaves since 2012. Great spot for brunch (definitely order the pancakes!) However, the past few times I have been for dinner I am not as impressed. They changed the shepherd's pie dish and it always comes out way too hot and difficult to enjoy eating.

You know those places you always wish you would find, where everything is just right. That make you feel welcome asap and want you never want to leave. This is such a place. The food is just a bonus, but a great such. We had mark can scramble and the huge fluffy ricotta pancakes. The scramble was interesting in flavour, had just enough spice, and was beautiful to watch. The pancakes where huge but we still finished every bite. Service is casual but professional, and is together with the general atmosphere what makes you wish this was your neighbourhood , so you could come back every day. But we are not the only who have realised, so come early, or prepare for a long wait. The only negative was the coffee, that has quite of a bitter tone. It's not bad, just has a special taste that might not be to everyone's liking.
