The dinner was disappointing. There were a few items on the menu that were unavailable, including many of the vegetarian options. Service was pretty good. I don't think I'll go back, even with the glowing reviews and convenient location for me.
The food is average with long waiting time . The pleace looks cool inside it has a good vibe .
Fresh food, hipstery diners. Better when they turn the volume down a bit to balance the noise from the masses. Ordered burger medium rare but came out medium well. Apart from that all good.

A great place to go for breakfast! There is sometimes a wait to get a seat but if you're not in a rush it is totally worth it. I have been to this place twice and both times the food was amazing. I recommend the Moroccan scramble. I'll definitely be back!

Oh my gosh! This was my favorite spot in Greenpoint when I visited this past January. It was the quintessential Brooklyn cafe but, enough about the ambiance the food... Oh the food was amazing as well. In a week we ate there 3 times, it was sooooo good!

What can I say about this cute little spot except that the food was DELICIOUS and the presentation was fabulous. We were 4 people and 2 people ordered the Moroccan Scramble and 2 people ordered the Ricotta Pancakes. We also started with the Truffle Fries that were fantastic! Probably the best breakfast I've had. The 2 dishes can definitely be shared. The Ricotta Pancakes were so amazing I almost finished the whole thing. There were 3 layers of fluffy, thick pancakes, blueberries, strawberries and bananas on top with a dollop of honeycomb butter. There were also bananas in between the first and second layer of the pancakes! Served with real maple syrup. The Moroccan Scramble was exceptional and my sister who doesn't eat eggs much, said it was the best dish she's ever had. Delicious hot chocolate, and latte. A MUST GO TO SPOT IF YOURE IN BROOKLYN!!! Get there early because there's always a wait!
The service was slow. Food was mediocre. The only thing worth raving about is the truffle fries and the scramble eggs. Everything else was just alright. Would not go back.

Loved the pancakes so much! The waitress who helped us was nice but didn't really smile or so. But when we asked for a place with more shadow it was easily fixed so that was a big +. As said, we both loved the ricotta pancakes, and most of it's employees were really friendly.
Really yummy food.  The pancakes were fluffy and tasty and the Moroccan eggs were  unique and savory.  I'll happily go back for seconds
Great food and nice owner but bad and arrogant services. Also extremely busy so I basically never go there in 8 years I have been living here.
I love the food. Their pancake is one of the best I have ever had. If the service was better, I would give it a 5 star.

So I came back to try the ricotta pancakes everyone keeps talking about. Not a fan, it's so dense and heavy, not much taste to it. If I should return it would only be for the Moroccan Scramble  it has lots of flavor.

Fell into this place today for brunch. Coffee was quite mediocre. Good amount of people eating here and a good atmosphere. Had the Moroccan eggs and grapefruit brûlée. Both were promising however the Moroccan dish was a bit too much with the mix of spices. It could be adjusted a bit and be a hit.
My personal favorite brunch place in Williamsburg. The food is amazing and the coffee has a very unique taste. I will definitely try it for dinner also. Do not hesitate to try it! It is worth it.
From our first interaction, to the food, to paying the bill - this whole place is poopoopanana blit blat. Would not recommend.

Pricey but worth it.  Two of us shared the toasted farro bowl, chopped black kale, and housemade ricotta, and after finishing couldn't help but try an order of the ricotta pancakes as well.  It would definitely be a splurge for us to come back but I think we will have to.  My favorites were the black kale salad and the housemade ricotta but everything was excellent.

Came here twice and i thought the overall experience was pretty decent and enjoyable. Food is great you get a decent serving portion of it. Things I recommend would be the mussels of course! Nothing like a big pot of mussels and bread to finish things up and suck in the savory broth. I also like the Moroccan scramble, it's not like your typical Sunday morning scramble eggs or any other regular egg dish... They put a twist to it with some bold flavors. Customer service is good as well as they are attentive to your needs.

came back here a fourth time and ordered things we had already tried. including the dessert with date pudding and the toffee syrup. It was not good. It tasted like they had just brought it out of the fridge. Other dishes were also forgettable the second time. I am changing the overall score because of lack of consistency.

Five leaves is a cute place. I really like the food and they have yummy creative cocktails.  You can always find something to eat and drink on the menu. Even in the dessert department and I'm not even into sweets that much.  But they have this rosewater Pavlova that I am obsessed with. This is a place you can re-visit over and over again before you get bored.

Heath Ledger, may you live on forever in those delicious Thai spiced mussels. This place is man bun heaven. The food was pretty good, albeit a bit spicey - big ups to that celery root mash, mussels and broccolini. Unfortunately our squid was overdone, and it was one of those situation where it took a couple of bites to realize that it was way chewy and in fact not supposed to be that way. By the time we realized, the small portion already looked devoured. Not sure about that ink sauce either. That whole dish was just kinda meh. Other than that though, cocktails and service were way up there.

Food and service was really good! HOWEVER, 5 of us ended up with 106 dollar check, which they would not split for us. So with three debit cards and two cash payments we split the bill in writing on the check and gave it to our server. Two days later the guys who used their cards checked their balances and were MAJORLY OVERCHARGED. One guy asked to pay 20 and was charged 40. Another asked to pay 50 and was charged 60. I'm now having a very difficult time getting in touch with a manager to get this fixed. My advice, save your time and money and go somewhere else!!!!

I'm sure this review won't change a thing about the service here bc there will inevitably be a long wait for brunch on Saturday and Sunday but I think that the people who work here are the absolute rudest servers I've ever encountered. I've lived in Williamsburg for 10 years now and recently moved closer to Five Leaves (a block away) so I was really hoping my previous bad experiences weren't indicative of their overall service but it's really just awful every time. And I don't think any food is good enough to treat people that way.

If you're in the mood for a disappointment, look no further because this is your place. The Tuna Bahn Mi should be renamed the mayonnaise and mint sandwich. The spicy chicken sandwich was a $2 Tyson chicken breast marinated in knockoff sriracha sauce. The one saving grace is the service, which is friendly,appropriately attentive and accommodating.

I don't usually write reviews on yelp. I just don't really care. But I had to for this one. The location and the service are pretty good. The problem I had was with the Octopus I ordered. I have quite low standards with food in general, but this octopus was just so so so bad. First time in my life, I had to send a full plate back to the kitchen. Maybe the other items in the menu are good, but I don't think I'll ever take the risk to try them :) I paid $15 bucks for a 3 pieces of plastic tasting, cold octopus. What a life :))
Great brunch spot! Love me some Ricotta Pancakes and the Moroccan Scramble. Be prepared to wait about 30 mins if you're not there early. It's the go-to in the hood.
Staple of the town. Great food and pretty good cocktail list. We had the BLAT and the seared tuna banh mi and both were awesome!
Me and my friend stop by for a coffee and we ordered fries as well. I'm really appreciated that they are using stumptown coffee which is unbeatable.
Nine dollars for a bowl of oatmeal with butter melted on it. The place is small and the strangers are smashed together, and you are grazed by someone tush trying to get into the seat next to you.

Went here on a rainy day for breakfast and sat outside under the awning. The ricotta pancakes are amazing. The bread and clotted cream was mediocre. The service was pretty poor- it took forever to get our coffee and it wasn't hot when it arrived. I'll probably give them another chance though.
Brussel sprouts were good, but the kale salad was really fishy. I was sick all night after eating here.

Yes they are a little slow at times but the food is amazing and the atmosphere is top notch. I love when it is warm enough and you can dine al fresco. I highly suggest Five Leaves for any NYC visit and especially Greenpoint visits.

Worth the wait and the hype is right... The food was awesome. Ricotta, mussels, kale salad... Damn. So good. Service was awful. Our server was rude and condescending. The host was very nice though. Would eat here again but will be prepared to have rude service. Just because your food is good doesn't mean you have to be mean! Damn!
Excellent little place with lots of talent and delicious place. Service was great too also :) and a good bar. Loved it ! Try the Benedict's  there ... Yuuuuumy
Gréât place for brunch. It is unfortunate that the first person you meet when you go there is a non smiling guy barely looking at you when you ask something..
We had to wait for an hour to get a table but their brunch was so good that it was worth waiting! One of the best brunch places in Williamsburg/Greenpoint.

Ok so we went back this weekend with some friends from out of town who are big oyster fans as well. We started off with 2 dozen oysters and cocktails which were sublime... Note: we brought our own traditional cocktail sauce this time :) but in my opinion they didn't even need it. They were so yummy and tasty. For dinner, we all had a little bit of everything...the burger with truffle fries, the beetroot ravioli, the duck confit with pumpkin risotto, and the crispy skinned arctic char. We all enjoyed our food very much. The ambience was perfect and the service definitely stepped up big time from our last visit hence the extra star I am now giving them in my review. Keep up the good food and service Five Leaves...we will def be back! :)

Ok so some would say I have thawed over time but I have to say I gave five leaves another go and well.... It was sooooooo much better, staff chipper and nice and good top notch food (lovely abs ado toast) ,Would now consider myself a regular. Before I get too carried away I should mention the reason for 4 not 5 stars is that it's impossibly cramped. Or maybe I should say compact bijou.
There's always long line to get in. But I don't mind the line. Best burger I've ever tasted

The kale salad was delicious, as was the BLT and truffle fries. Sit outside if the weather permits. This place gets crowded so be prepared to wait a little. On a beautiful weekend you could have brunch and then take a nice stroll in the park.

If you're looking for a brunch spot, this place will do AS LONG AS YOUR WILLING TO WAIT FOR AN HOUR. We put our names down and the hostess told us it would be better to walk around and come back in an hour which we did.  Have to say they're on point though with timing.  Food was great. I got their famous five leaves burger and my girl got the Moroccan scramble definitely recommend these two. Would go again only if I don't have to wait for that long

Came for brunch sunday at 9, which turned out to be perfect timing - only had a short wait, before we got seated. Half an hour later people were standing in line outside. Got the mouthwatering ricotta pancakes, the moroccan scramble and Arthur Palmer lemonade. Great sunday kick off.

I'll give this place a benefit of the doubt for food and good energy, since it is a sweet little place and the chef is supposedly awesome in the kitchen. Unfortunately I wasn't willing to sit for a meal after it took the hostess 10 minutes to get a table for us, especially since there were multiple available tables. When she finally did decide to "seat" us, she looked at us and simply pointed at a table. Um, no thanks! You could have pointed at a table 10 minutes ago, lady. I wasn't interested to meet the rest of the service people after that. Hopefully I can come back again when their staff are more organized.

APPALLING, RUDE SERVICE! We arrived on a Sunday morning to a busy cafe (no surprise there) but no-one even acknowledged our presence as we stood right near the front door.  We had to seek out someone to help us.  Then only after multiple attempts to get his attention, a man came along who put our name on a waiting list for the hour wait after our request. (no surprise there either). HOWEVER, when I asked if they could take our number and give us a call when a table became available, the man (skinny, gold tooth, don't know his name), was incredibly rude and said No! I asked where we should wait etc, He said, I don't care what you do or where! I told him we were keen paying customers and that despite how busy and popular the cafe is, to remember that there is a way to speak to people.  He said he didn't really care.  The food may be lovely but after being treated like that, there was no way we were staying.  Pity, for multiple reasons but especially because I'd brought a senior food and beverage trend researcher from Europe . . .

Definitely one of the best brunch spots in BK. Love everything on the menu but my favorites are the Ricotta Pancakes, Avocado Toast, and Truffle Fries. Get there early for brunch or go there on a week day if you want a smaller crowd. I also love that I can get a nice cappuccino from the to-go window and take a stroll in the park while I wait.  The food is worth the wait for sure!

This is the worst restaurant ever in New York. We were group of four and they keep taking at least ten group of two people come after us even if they can make table for four. They are not even patient with customer and told us to stop complaining. I don't know if this a racism or what. This restaurant is bullshit. Don't go there, there is still lots of place to go in the city.

The food keeps me coming back - and this place could be so perfect if the staff weren't so unhelpful. I understand that they're always busy but as someone who's worked in hospitality for the last five years it's not okay to be rude/unhelpful to customers. Staff attitude is never nice but I'm keeping optimistic that things will change because this place is great.

It was good, but there is so much hype.  People eat outside on the street in the middle of winter with piles of snow on the ground (and bundled up in parkas)!  The ricotta pancakes were beautifully presented and the special touch was the scoop of honey comb butter on top.  The pancakes were more like an actual cake than pancake.  I don't know why people call them fluffy.  Their duck pot pie was way too salty.
The food is mediocre, I was seating for 10 min and then I call the waitress to give menu no one cares . The kale salad wow nothing for what I will be back.
Great food (loved the ricotta pancakes) and nice atmosphere especially in the summer sitting outside.

The food was excellent with many layers of flavor. The service while attentive, we waited 1 hour between appetizer and main course. Couples next to us came in after us, got their food, and said this had happened to them. Kitchen needs to get their act together. They did comp us an entree & drink which was the right thing to do, but if this is happening on a regular basis not good.

I would have given them 5 stars but the food came after 45 mins. My friend had the burger and I had the eggplant falafel. Both the dishes were really good and I would recommend others to try their drinks

This place is a bit out of the way and there is a bit of a wait, but its well worth it. The poached egg and mushroom toast is really delicious, but it could definitely use an extra egg. I love it when yolk runs on my food and there is too much toast for one egg. The Aussie burger is really great too--a little heavy, so go hungry! I need to go back and try more of the menu. One disappointment was that they use stumptown coffee--which is great coffee--but they could at least use aussie coffee which is better and goes with the restaurant.

the Five Leaves burger had a great flavor combination- fried pineapple and egg on top- but i still dont think its the best burger in BK....few tables outside but the place gets filled up quickly.  The salad had a nice light summery dressing on it...the truffle french fries were cooked well and were tasty...I am a sucker for truffle oil, i have to admit...adjacent to the now-shit-filled McCarren Pool....

Brunch was banging! A local friend of ours took us here for our start to our journey home. We were told that some weekends our friends would wait 2.5 hours for food here... That is a long time to wait and a heck of a hype story and  we were not disappointed! There were a lot of great choices for breakfast. Our party had the avacado toast, the granola, big brekkie and almond croissant! All delicious and the food came out quick! We didn't have to wait at all to get a table but  I would wait 2.5 hours for their food! What a great start for our journey home!

There are a lot of good brunch places in Brooklyn, but Five Leaves is one of the few where the food is consistently great, the portions are big, the prices are reasonable, and service is friendly/attentive.  I was amazed that a non-Mexican restaurant could make such good micheladas; it was spicy and not watered down.  If you get there before 1PM, expect a 30-60 minute wait; the crowd dies after 1PM.
Food was good! Waiting in line, sweating to 90 degree heat, was not! Better to sit indoors and enjoy your eats! The kale salad looked beautiful but tasted bland, though the pancakes were great!
bad service today keep taliing not looking for costumer waitting for oder food it good but if your server bad no costumer coming back again

The food might be good. Who knows?? My wife and I sure don't because the waiter that "welcomed" us when we arrived was so insanely rude and unwilling to seat us anywhere that wasn't for 2 people only. That's cool, I get it, except that there were open tables everywhere. So instead he seated us in the most absurd corner seat that couldn't possibly fit 2 people. Customer service - so important. Black haired guy, a little heavy set..hopefully the manager reads this.

When you forget someone's food after forgetting the appetizer, it is important to comp something. Don't say, "my bad but your burger will take 25 minutes if you still want it." How about, "we will get that right out to you, and it's on us." What a shitty dinner that turned out to be. Too bad they're so busy that they'll never read this review and never feel my lost future business. Assholes...

DELICIOUS! I've been here twice, out of the five times I've been to New York. My cousin introduced me to this place, and we both got the five leaves burger. Juicy, seasoning is great, and well worth my money. My boyfriend got the Big Brekkie and he says it's the best breakfast he's ever had. The truffle fries are just as good as the burger, and the wait can get long on the weekend. I recommend going right when they open!

came with a friend for brunch. we were barely greeted when we got inside so just kind of waited until someone said something to us. im not sure if we should have just seated ourselves or what the situation is at this place but first guy tells us the guy at the bar will seat us and leaves. guy at bar heard and basically told us to wait for the guy who just told us to go to him. aside from that weird interaction, the place is small, theres barely space to move around. my friend sat on the outside and the waiter guy kept shoving into her chair. we had the pancakes and quiche. the fruits and butter on the pancake was kind of amazing but the pancake was undercooked. the quiche and the salad it came with was unremarkable which surprised me because the person to my left and right both ordered that. i see from other reviews there were complaints about the female waiters but both our female waiters were friendly.
5-Leaves burger is crack! Worth all of the mess!

Excellent place to eat for certain!! Quality of food was superb, service was by far impeccable. Im new to the area from cali and i can say Greenpoint/ Williamsburg are where to be. Kudos to the Chef on duty!!! Your cooking skills are the shizzle!!!

Great food, although the menu is not too big. I had the eggplant falafel sandwich and my friend really enjoyed the grass fed beef burger. All was well seasoned and delicious!  Also, the staff was kind and accommodating. Highly recommend it.

So I was on my last day of my trip to Brooklyn, and was feeling down because I wished I still lived there. I was looking for one final NY experience, and I wondered north into Greenpoint, an area I'm not that familiar with. I didn't want a normal boring breakfast. And I spied this place on a cool corner. It was one of the only places open at the time and was packed, but I found a seat at the counter. I thought it might be a run of the mill diner, but the menu was unique. I decided on the Moroccan scramble with sausage and avocado. There was a really cool mix of people from trendy indie types to workers to older French ladies. I also had a delicious glass of fresh orange juice. A lot of people were ordering the sage egg sandwich which also looked great!  It was a Thursday morning, but people were ordering Bloody Mary's and mimosas. I guess they don't have a regular job! What a dream life that would be to not have to go to work, but just go to this place and work on my novel I'd love to write one day! But for now it was a great way to end my trip to NYC!
Amazing place for breakfast. Everything was great. The service is awesome and the food was wonderful. Come check this place out when you are in Brooklyn for sure!!!
Don't get the rump roast. It just tastes weird. Really gamey and not everyone's thing.

Excellent food at this tiny place near McCarren Park. Be prepared to wait a long time for a table, but it is worth the wait. Food is very fresh, prepared with care, and they have a creative chef. Highly recommended!
COLD on all accounts. Our waitress could not have been ruder. It was freezing inside and we were made fun of to our FACES when asked to turn off the AC/fans. Will not be back!

No air conditioning!!! Cheap. The whole reason for eating out on a random Sunday in August is to not hear up ones own kitchen. I so wanted to go to this Resturant but apparently August (or summer for that matter) is not a good time. I suppose it is great. I'll have to wait until the late fall. I wonder if they will have heat in the winter.
Sat us down pretty quick, but then no service after that. Never sat with a menu on my lap that long ever. I wish I could have tasted all the awesome food everyone mentioned.

It's Monday morning, 10 am now. Guess what!? Five Leaves is out of tables, Gosh... Thank God I'm alone to fit in the bar! This restaurant opened in 2008, but its decor looks like back to the old time! Not just latte for this visit, I also ordered Big Breakkie as brunch! If you wait for 5 mins, its latte would taste better. Not a doubt, my brunch is so American. That's truly enjoyable to have the personal time like this!

ALWAYS A LONG WAIT ! Finally managed to eat here on a Monday afternoon and they had one empty table. They have a pretty limited menu for lunch/brunch and it's all food you can get everywhere else. Typical Brooklyn vibe/atmosphere and staff and a generally small establishment inside. The service was pretty bad/slow and our waitress was pretty soft spoken (and I have great hearing). The food wasn't bad but like I said very basic. Definitely wouldn't try eating here again considering the wait.

Their truffle fries were incredible. I loved their ricotta too. I didn't have to wait for a table both times I went. Quick service, but their utensils were a little dirty. I found some food particles in my water cup, too.

This place is amazing. Pancakes are my favorite by far. Very busy so come early or on a weekday or else you'll be waiting for over an hour. The hostess is beautiful which is a great addition anywhere. If you sit close to the espresso station, it will be very loud and not good if you're hungover!

We were feeling adventurous one Sunday about a month ago and decided to walk over from Woodside to Williamsburg. After almost 2hrs wait we opted to sit at the bar, can't remember what I had to drink but I liked it, lol. I didn't love the pancakes, they were a little too dense for my liking but the honey butter that came with it was out Devine! My friend ordered a smoked fish dish which was amazing. It's a really tiny place and seating is very cramped, you can't turn without bumping into someone, also some of the outdoor seating weren't usable unless you wanted to get scorched by the sun. I would love to come back and try some other dishes but only if the wait time were significantly shorter.

I went to have nice family breakfast here on Sunday morning. It is a small and cozy place inside but as soon as Brunch approaches they set up tables outside which is also great. The food is very delicious and the wait staff were very nice and attentive. I had the Big breakkie with bacon and grilled chorizo. The rest of the family had Ricotta Pancakes and Moroccan Scramble. We tried a little of each of the plates. I would definitely come back here.

Man, this place has fallen off as of late. The brunch is still pretty damn good, but the last few dinners I've had here were kind've disappointing. Not like bad or anything, but not as good as I was expecting, and when you couple that with the price, and hype, and the memories of it being better, well, it's a bit of a buzzkill. Shit is still good, but maybe not worth the baggage anymore.
The soft shell crab and mussel are great, I like the atmosphere in the restaurant. It's tight but very relaxing.

Outstanding flavors and fresh ingredients.  I've been many times for brunch and for dinner, and I have been quite impressed with the food each time.  Have never had anything to complain about, other than the wait (because they're so popular!).  Try to come early (before 10AM for brunch or before 6PM for dinner) to avoid a long wait.
The ricotta pancakes are very tasty and the place is young and friendly. Recommend!

Everyone raves about this place and, yep, the food is good. Worth the hype? Not really. Worth a long wait? Totally not. The food was very yummy, although I've gotten similar tasting brunch in the neighborhood. But there were two big downsides. We were sat at a table that was half under the bar, super uncomfortable and there were plenty of other tables available. Also, despite having coffee advertised everywhere, they only have espresso. False advertising and also pretty pretentious. Don't get me wrong, I love espresso, but an americano is no cup of Joe.

Probably one of the best brunch spots in Brooklyn, the food is great quality , and the staff is very hospitable, if you're willing to wait an hour (on the weekends ) then it's certainly a must try, get the ricotta pancakes you won't go wrong !!
The only thing worse than the 80s tattoos are the stale coffee beans and lousy espresso drinks. No maybe the attitude is worse

Meh.. I dont know if it's just me but when one orders a salad I expect a ready made plate to come before me not a plate where I need to make my salad... The food taste good here but it's not something you'd want more than once a month (if that)
Omg the pancakes are heavenly, service is slow, but thats only because its the place to be. But the wait is worth it.
A very good breakfast/brunch spot. The caramelized grapefruit was something special and is worth trying. My egg dish was solid too. Nice atmosphere.

Try the savory Kale salad with anchovy sauce and of course the "super-fat" pancake! I thought I got a special deal when I saw 3 or 4 FAT pancakes piled up but it is just how it usually is... Can't even finish although it's soooo tasty! So go, eat in and take out from one meal!

While visiting friends in Brooklyn a few years back, I met up with them at five leaves. The food was great, service was wonderful! We had an "unwelcome friend" in one of our dishes but the waiter fixed it and didn't charge us for the meal. Being Brooklyn, "unwanted friends" in the food isn't that uncommon but usually the staff isn't as nice about it. I really like this place a lot and go there everytime I'm in Brooklyn
I am at often times working on the road ...Five Leaves has cancelled out my search for good food time and time again. Enjoy fellow yelpers!

Had not been here in maybe 2 years and the quality of that 5leaves burger just went way down!! Also temp on burger was wrong so had to send back : / for $66 w/ tip two burgers and 2 beers it's rough really to justify. Staff was nice enough but yeah food experience was just ok..

Love love love 5 leaves! Mum and I went for breakfast on labour day. It was busy busy but we just put or name down and went for a walk. The hostess was great professional and had everything under control we got our table after about 40 min and where served a delicious breakfast and the coffee was great too! The ricotta pancakes where fluffy and delicious. Cool place for a Brooklyn breakfast!
Great food !! They make the best pancake!!!! However if you are coming for brunch .. Except at least 45 mins wait . And they don't take reservation.

Those ricotta pancakes were super nice :)))))) Pancakes are moderately fluffy, it goes well with fruits and syrup, and I don't know what that butter was made of but it was super amazing, going so well with every components of the menu! Was worth my money.

The five stars is for breakfast, not for dinner, which is three and a half to four stars. The ricotta pancakes with fresh fruit are the best breakfast I've ever had. I find the nautical theme is just subtle enough, especially when paired with Augustus Pablo or desert-sounding jazz. There is usually some ultra stylish girl reading Mailer or Bellow with a gimlet at the bar. And strolling around Greenpoint is pleasant as well.

Four stars and not five because the pasta here is too al dente. But that's my subjective taste. Other than that, wherever I've lived in the world, since Five Leaves opened, I manage to end up here on every trip back. Drinks are strong and the food is consistently yum. Burger snobs, get the hamburger. There's an egg in it!
Worth the wait. The house made ricotta is my favorite with fresh fig, thyme, honey & a side of toasted fruit nut bread. The space is tight but the food is so good it doesn't even matter.
Really great food, just expect a long wait. The restaurant does not offer itself to lots of personal space, so be ready to cozy up with other diners.
Small but cozy brunch space. Burgers are delicious as well as the omelets. The ambiance is very rustic.
Wont go there again. Nice crowd that likes to show off. Trendy place. But the food is not good. You are paying for the scene. But if you like good food don't go there.
Long wait but you must try the Moroccan Scramble!!! The pancakes looks amazing!!! Unless you gon early there is a big line, but its totally worth it... You can always have a drink and come back.
Good food. Worth of money. Wish the place get bigger space so we can have our less than 30 minutes of waiting.

Five leaves has been on my must try list now for awhile, so I'm disappointed that I have to write this review. But getting to the point my boyfriend and I both order cappuchinos, they were incredibly bitter and undrinkable. I got the sage scrambled panini, it wasn't a pressed sandwich at all but served Luke warm with chucks of cold cheese scattered about, my boyfriend ordered the ricotta pancakes after hearing how amazing they are and after waiting close to 40 minutes to get them were highly disappointing. They were huge, burnt and utterly tasteless. Overall food was and service was were poor enough to keep us from coming again. The ambiance and outdoor seating however was very charming.

Sweet heaven almighty. Yet another review singing its praises. I don't trust anyone who doesn't give this place a five. Chances are they fell victim to a tragic loss of tastebuds or have poor taste in life in general. Worth the wait.

Their pancakes were amazinggggg, ugh, I could barely finish them. It's a very cozy spot for brunch. Crowd is pretty diverse and the music is on point! I waited about an hour to be seated but it was well worth it. My tummy was stuffed, food was tasteful and service was cool. Definitely a place to try!

Came here for breakfast. Ordered scrambled eggs without milk added, hash browns and a couple of sides. Meal came, no eggs with it because they refuse to make scrambled eggs without milk. Literally they would make me an egg any other way than scrambled without milk, but refused to make them scrambled without milk. Why? "That is how we do it." Makes no sense. Not impressed.

Just left this place. Host didn't greet us and had a lot of attitude. Waitress was being short but she just seemed busy so I don't mind too much. My friend's rice was undercooked or just old! With the service and the price totally not worth it. Music was cray as well. Def detested our time there.

Delicious food throughout the day, beautiful aesthetic, great music spinning on vinyl...  It's the right place to get some food and soak in some vibes any time of the day.  My favorite hangout in Greenpoint!

Serious 5 stars! Love this place. It's the kind of place you get food envy of other diners even when your own meal was amazing. Everything coming out the kitchen looked incredible so I can't wait to go back and try the morrocan scramble. I just had to have the coconut rice pudding with mango and gogi berries for being different and it did not disappoint. The pancakes are huge! My fave brunch spot right now.
I been here a few times & I would say the kitchen is messy, place is not well kept, dirty plates, service not so great, long waits, Food is whatever.
Good food- great location.. Def a scene. Muscles are great, burger, everything is good. The Devil Horseback Bacon wrapped dates are WOW
The food was delicious, especially the scallops and the toffee desert was to die for!
Overrated, Staff are pretentious idiots, Hipster D Bags

Literally one of my favorite restaurants in the five boroughs (and I eat out a lot). Sauvage doesn't even come close, although they'd like to think they do. Five Leaves serves consistently amazing, sustainable, high-quality comfort food at a reasonable price point, perfect portion sizes, and without any hipster snobbery or pretentiousness. If it weren't for Five Leaves, I would have a very hard time finding the perfect Sunday brunch spot.

Loved this place but I had to have my skirt steak cooked twice and it was still way too chewy, I wasn't the only who complained about it but I tried other people's food I came with and it was pretty fantastic, so I'll defintely return, I just won't order the skirt steak. The bartenders were super attentive and made great drinks

This place was amazing! The food was delicious! I had the 5 leaves burger and it was fantastic. This burger was huge, I'm talking about so big I couldn't eat it with my hands. I had to cut it up with a fork and knife. The drinks were super pricey so that was nice. The only bad thing about the place is that it's tiny. There's not exactly a lot of elbow room. The tables are so close to each other you're almost sharing a table with the couple next to you. Still, I would definitely recommend this restaurant to others. Enjoy!
I love this place. The food is great as is the service. The owners are the nicest guys as well! Flash fried oysters are my pic of the bunch.

I wanted to like this place but sadly I didn't. The food was pretty good - cream of celery soup was tasty but not worth the price. Beet salad and Kale salad were both delicious. However, what was really surprising was the rude service by both the waitress and hostess.  This restaurant needs to learn what it means to make a customer's experience a good one and that they are in business FOR the customer, not the other way around.  I would NEVER recommend this restaurant based upon the rude service and would NEVER go back. Also, it's just too noisy.

Best place in town to wait a log time to sit with hipsters in the cold. It's always busy, and hip, drinks and food are tasty but so are tons of other places. However if you want to so the edge of Williamsburg greenpoint thing  come here

This place came highly recommended from a fellow yelper friend . We didn't make any reservations and got there in time for an 8pm dinner. The place looks great for breakfast/brunch too. Need to check it out during the daytime. Anyhow, I forgot to take pictures of my food here but there's plenty on their yelp page to see. We ordered the kale salad, truffle fries and shepherd's pie. Everything was so freaking delicious and fresh. The kale salad had a nice kick to it. You can taste the truffle in the fries - I'm still thinking of it and wishing I had some more for lunch! And the shepherd's pie was delicious. Blend of celery roots, with potatoes and carrot and meat...it was so savory and we both had two beers before hand so needless to say, we were stuffed after we were done. Love this spot. Willing to go back again for sure!

Broke the ice with a cold NY Sour to start!  The butternut squash soup off the chart with pumpkin seeds for great texture! The kale salad dominates among salads with its chopped hazelnuts and those were just the beginning. The braised ribs are drippingly delicious, bar steak MR perfectly cooked, really enjoyed the sauce.  Great service by the way!  Inspiring ambiance with music at the perfect balance for social interaction and intimate conversation.  Always a wait, very polite maitre D, exceptional communication!  Worth every minute.
Bartender doesn't know his beers but chef knows his food. They really jam guests in small spaces (even for for NY).

Holy Moses totally worth the "brunch is for jerks" wait. Hash browns made like a delicacy. Flavors coming at you in deceptively simple egg dishes. Brunch has become so ubiquitous in NYC, but this place raises the bar for other restaurants who think they do brunch well and really don't. The only drawback is they pack ya in like sardines, so get a Bloody Mary and delight in the dine.

My hubby & I love this place! The long wait can be a bummer but on the right night, we can get in quickly and enjoy a yummy dinner! The specials are always a treat... can't go without getting the baked oysters & shishito peppers.

Came here for brunch and it was very good! I had the ricotta pancakes which were delicious and my bf had the five leaves burger which was very good as well! The wait is long on the weekends big it's worth it
Went here for brunch and we liked it a lot. Really good and fresh food and the service was fast. I had the avocado toast and my husband the ricotta pancakes. I understand why the place is so popular.
Had their brunch and it was fresh and tasty. Liked the place as well. Seems to be a really popular place, so you might have to wait for a table.

I came here by recommendation. The food was AMAZING. I had a yummy panini. Plus the ambiance is very posh but not your typical New York spot. It is very Brooklyn; low key, beautiful, and peaceful. It was packed but not loud at all. My only gripe is the tables are waaaaaay too close. Secondly the waitresses are not the slightest bit friendly. Otherwise great food, timely service, and gorgeous decor.

Hands down one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. I came to NY from MA for work and one of the guys at my hotel recommended this place. The mussels and oysters were phenomenal and the burgers are amazing. Drinks and dessert were both delicious as well. I loved the rustic decor and the staff were so friendly and accommodating.

Huge statement; favourite brunch in the US! It's true. Everything is good, and I mean everything. The food, staff, drinks, location, people watching.... Huge line/ wait so go early and not on the brink of malnutrition as you'll most likely wait around an hour. Worth every second... Obsessed.

Excellent service! No New York attitude! Food and coffee perfect! The burgers and pancakes looked amazing although I had the chicken baguette which was also fantastic. I can see why people line up for this place. Really impressed!

The food at Five Leaves is simply outstanding, and their cocktails are imaginative and masterfully made. The ambiance is romantic and rustic, and the fact that it is so small actually adds to the cozy feeling you get dining there. This place basically hits it out of the park. I just wish it weren't so difficult to get into. The wait is always excessive. One time I was able to get in with less than 10 minutes of wait-time, but then realized we were there over half an hour before they began serving their dinner menu, which explained why we were seated so easily. We ended up leaving to go elsewhere since we had limited food options. I hear that they are going to expand, so after I visit the new and enlarged version, perhaps I'll come back and update this review to add a fifth star. I just really can't stomach the long wait these days.
The pancakes here are good but way overpriced. The service is okay. The wait is too long. I would just stick to a different place. Nothing is really special here.

Great service and delicious food. Loved the fresh flowers and the vibe of the restaurant. Will be going back to check out brunch since I went on a Friday night for dinner. Noise level is a bit load and seating is tight but that is the norm in Brooklyn if you go out.

I come here for brunch all the time with my sister. My favorite is the scrambled eggs and sage on a brioche bun, and the moroccan scramble. The truffle fries are also to die for! And the coffee is delicious and strong!

I have been all over Brooklyn for brunch and 5leaves continues to be my favorite.  I bring visitors here all the time and they always love it.  There will always be a wait so I usually put my name down and grab a drink at Enid's or Matchless while I wait.  They serve Stumptown coffee which is my favorite.  I have tried various menu items and never been disappointed.  Love their truffle fries.  My friend always orders their burger and swears it's the best.  I also enjoy their ambiance despite how crowded it gets.  5 stars for delicious food and coffee.

They have really creative things on the menu which all taste good, but in terms of overall food and service I don't think it's the best brunch you can get in the area. With that being said, the coffee was on point.

Try to go on a weekday to avoid the lines. This place may be a wait to get in on the weekdays but every dish I've tried has been amazing. To add to the the gustatory brilliance, the dishes are beautiful. If I was an instagrammer....I probably would have taken photos of each one. Definitely check this place out!

I came here to try the ricotta pancakes that so many people were raving about. We arrived on Wednesday noon and the place was still packed. We stayed outside as it was nice and sunny. My friend ordered brûléed grapefruit - a whole grapefruit served in a cup with some burned sugar on top and a mint leaf. She said she liked the flavor but it was really messy to eat. I was really excited about my pancakes. And it looked great, but ultimately I was disappointed. They were very dense and heavy with a huge blob of butter on top; eventually it made me feel like I was carrying stones in my stomach even 3 hours later. Also the portion is way too big, I barely finished 2 out of 3, i think it should be shared. So in the end I enjoyed it but because it made me feel so heavy, I don't think I would ever order it again. I do want to return to try Moroccan scramble and the burger. The service wasn't much either, waitress is way too busy to pay attention to all of her tables. We had to wave her down for our check and after we paid, she dropped our change while passing by without saying a word.
Amazing pancakes. Love the morrocan eggs. Been to this place twice so far. Will be coming back. There's a bit of a wait, but it's worth it.

I moved to the neighborhood just a few months before they open and watched 5 Leaves become an instant hit with growing popularity. I have been there dozen of times and loved all my experiences there. Although they have a good variety of dishes, I only ever get few things because they are just the best. 1. Coffee is strong and good. 2. Guinness, good pour, great beer. 3. Big Breakie breakfast with mushrooms and kale. Bacon and steak if I'm feeling extra hungry. 4. Five Leaves cheese burger with truffle fries. This one is a must for burger lovers. (Grass fed beef, beets, pineapple, fried egg, lettuce, onions n tomato). It's huge and full of deliciousness and flavors with every bite. The only problem is figuring out a way to eat it because it's such a hand / mouth full. Make sure you ask for "5 Leaves burger" or you will get their regular burger, which is still pretty good but not that Australian style burger.  I also love the mom n pop feel with the owners Jud and Kathern always being around and being awesome. Granville is always there and he is the man.

Its no wonder this place always has a line . I was shocked by how fresh and amazing my meals was. So was my dinner date. Outstanding.  The chef is truly amazing! A must try and repeat..over and over! Just WOW

I have walked here a billion times and never realized this is where five leaves is located.  Great corner outdoor spot.  Everything we ate was really tasty.  The bacon covered dates were good, but I would suggest making the plate look a little prettier.  The ceviche on the other hand was really delicious and absolutely beautiful.  It was fresh - i could have eaten 10 of them.  The steak main is absolutely huge so you definitely don't have to worry about going hungry, and the potatoes that come with are buttery.  The arctic char was cooked perfectly and was really delicious.  Minus the one star for the not so friendly hostess.  She warmed up a bit at the end, but catty is never cool in my books.

While the food was delicious the service left a lot to be desired. After watching the people next to us get (who were seated after us) get served first, recieve and finish their food, we waited awhile longer. We watched others who ordered the same food recieve theirs before us as well. The people next to us started to ask why we hadn't gotten our food and when we finally asked the host he condescendingly told us it was because they had ordered scrambled eggs and we had a burger and that takes about 20 minutes. This was the reason we initially waited to say anything but after 30+ minutes of waiting that seemed excessive. If it was just us who were concerned that would be one thing but others around us also that the explanation and wait left alot to be desired. Maybe we just had bad luck.

Pancakes are amazing but the staff sucks. Came here and waited for 30 minutes. Was offered a seat at the bar for breakfast. Was with my wife and said ok. As soon as we sit at the bar the table next to us becomes available. So we kindly asked if we could sit there, the waiter said no I've got to sit other people. I'm like ok but we've been waiting for over 30 minutes and we just sat at this bar. He didn't care, last time I would ever go back
Wonderful cafe in a great location. Delicious breakfast and brunch, especially the pancakes of course. Love this place!
Good Brunch .... There Pancakes are worth the wait and travel.
I LOVE THIS PLACE! Most delicious kale salad. Fantastic lamb steak, shepherds pie. AMAZING cocktails. The service is always friendly. Great place all around.

Moraccan scramble was suuuuper yummy. Spicey, but not too much so. Their coffee is definitely some of the best around. All the servers are all very nice, and their side dishes are to be definitely added on any main dish.

If I could give this place zero stars I would. Such a shame because my friends raved about the food, but personally the bitter, angry hostess who was working there (Sunday shift) was enough to leave an awful taste. No business should have a person representing them with that rude of an attitude. I kindly asked her to put our names down and she condescendingly insisted that we'd never get seated because it's a 3 hour wait. I understand Sunday brunch in New York is busy but that's no excuse to be mean to another human being. I will never recommend this place or return.

Waited over an hour for food and when it finally arrived it was cold. The scrambled eggs had shells in them and the waitress took my coffee without asking before we had even finished our food. Won't come back.
Fantastic food and a relaxed atmosphere. Quick and unfussy service combined with some delicious pancakes for breakfast made for a 5 star experience. Recommended for anyone and everyone!
One of my favorite brunches in Brooklyn.  Food is great and you get solid bang for the buck.  Will be back soon to try out dinner

I'll admit the reviews below scared me prior to requesting a table. I went with two dear friends of mine, all of us were Deaf. It was a warm summer evening (weeknight). Server was friendly throughout our dinner. We sat outside. The food was delicious. We shared fries, I forgot what it is called but it was very good. I liked the bathroom decor. Very much. It has an old cabin feel, which I liked very much. The restaurant blends well in the neighborhood

Great location right in the heart of greenpoint! Good food and drinks at reasonable prices. They are busy most of times and you need to be patient. Downside the service needs to warm up, be friendlier and less pushy, otherwise a great spot.

Yummmmmm. Woke up at 8:00AM on rainy Saturday morning to come get some breakfast at Five Leaves. It started to get packed so make sure to come early if you don't want to wait. Everything about this place is awesome from the food to the lovely staff and atmosphere. I got the big breakkie which was amazing and the hash browns are tasty/different. The girlfriend ordered the ricotta pancakes which were awesome, almost regretted my decision just by looking at the presentation. Both of our dishes were amazing and I would highly recommend anyone to try any of the dishes we had. In addition, we ordered the truffle fries which we thought were tasty and had a strong truffle taste. Unlike most places that lack that truffle taste these fries did not disappoint. Anytime I want a great breakfast in NYC I will be sure to come back!

Great solo dinner at the bar: had the soup of the day( roasted veggies and corn), then whole dorade (well cooked) with haricots verts and top of the top the warm pineapple dessert with roasted coconut and banana ice cream .... And a glass of rum from Venezuela :) friendly staff, bartender Matt with Air vinyl  on the back!

The food is delicious but my low star rating has to do with the very unwelcoming and down right rude service.  On top of that the server we got didn't even know the menu very well and then got defensive when I asked about a particular plate.

Alright. Everyone I know loves this place. And I can see a lot of reasons why! It's cute, has great atmosphere, an interesting story, and great ambiance. This is a go-to for me for drinks and appetizers. That said, the food itself... it's good, but I don't think it's worth the hype. For a fantastic cocktail and delicious truffle fries, I'd go to it in a heartbeat, but for the entree, I always find myself satisfied, but not particularly impressed. There's nothing wrong with it, and makes for a lovely brunch atmosphere, but if I am looking to be wowed, or to impress any real foodies, I'd probably take them to other neighborhood restaurants, like Allswell, or Juliette.

I've heard so much about Five leaves that I was really excited to try it. However its also insanely popular so I had really high expectations. Unfortunately my experience did not live up to expectations. Our table was extremely close to the next table, which is not uncommon in popular places, but the table next to us had a dog so I constantly was playing footsie-pawsie with a furry friend during brunch. The food was good, but not out of this world like I expected. The servers were fine, but the impression that I got was that they were so popular that they didn't have to be nice to their current customers because they have a waiting list over an hour long. Fortunately we had a short wait for our table (due to a no-show) so I didn't wait a long time only to have an OK experience. I won't bash Five Leaves, I just think its overrated and I wont come out of my way to eat here again.

I've been here twice for breakfast but would go all the time if I lived locally. It's just perfect - hard to find anything bad to say about Five Leaves. Lovely decor, attentive, kind service, rich coffee, creative menu, beautiful execution, delicious dishes! I've had the mushroom toast which was very good. Next time I got the ricotta pancakes which were out of this world. Rich, amazing pancakes with tons of fresh fruit. The pancake portion is huge... could maybe be a little smaller. Would be nice to offer the dish with your choice of 1, 2, or 3 pancakes.
Best brunch in the area. Their bacon is by far the best damn bacon I've ever had -hands down. You can never go wrong with the BLAT. Bacon Lettuce & Tomato sandwich YUMMMMM

Four dishes that NEVER disappoint: MOROCCAN SCRAMBLE, BURGER, MUSSELS & KALE SALAD! I love Five Leaves and am so grateful they are in the neighborhood! And the service is always on point. Love you Five Leaves!
Foods amazing. Bitchiest waitress I've ever encountered though. Ruined our whole experi

I'm giving this place 1 star because the service was shitty. The red headed "hostess" had a really bad attitude. Also, I ordered before 2 couples next to me (we ordered the same thing) and they got served WAY before I did. Our waiter was a guy and not once did he ask how I was doing considering that my food was still not served. I honestly shouldn't have tipped at all but I did because it felt like the "right" thing to do.

5 Leaves has a reputation and it lives up to it. I'm biased because it's in my neighborhood, but I appreciate it for many reasons: consistent, high quality food; attentive (but not over-attentive) and friendly service; intimate (too cozy for some) and always lively; great Americanos; yeah it's got a cool factor; and good location across from McCarren Park. I'm grateful for you 5 leaves!

My all-time favorite brunch spot in Brooklyn. Also the only restaurant outside of anything super high end that I've given 5-stars. Everything here is exceptional (except the wait). The ricotta pancakes are something from my dreams, the Vietnamese burger, the truffle fries, even the bacon is outstanding. As someone impatient, the long wait is my only gripe but I understand. When something is good, the people will follow.

Went here for a birthday dinner after passing it god knows how many times on the street. Just a fantastic dinner all around. Delicious bacon wrapped dates, a superb lamb starter plate with some scrumptious sauce that I can't name at the moment, and a pork tenderloin with fava beans and rice that was o so tasty. It's not cheap but for your money its high quality food and a great cocktail list as well.
The line's too long for me to try their brunch, but I love their dinner.  The perfect three course meal for two is oysters, ribs, then steak!

The Kale Salad AHH! It's perfectly salty and hearty. The toasted hazelnuts add great crunch and pairs well with the anchovy in the dressing. We also had mussels, chick pea bruschetta. All were delicious. Do get there early, becuase seats are limited.

I am going to ignore the crazy long waiting line and impatient waiters in the rating because the pancakes here were SO good, and those are what I had come here for. I had ricotta pancakes with fresh fruit, honeycomb butter and maple syrup on top -- oh my word. This is definitely on my list of favorite brunch spots.

Good food, good service and good time. The food was good, the folks, though a bit trendy were lovely and the wait was minimal for the day and time. Only real complaint, bathroom... This place is always super crowded and there is one bathroom, ladies and gents in one. One toilet... So often the wait for the loo is longer than the wait for a table. Really needs to be sorted. Mega hindrance. Esp. as its one of those place where you spend 2+ hours hanging out, 'shooting-shit' and 'what not'. Plied with water and coffee I was forced down the street to another, better equipped, but decidedly 'less cool' spot for a wee. I dunno what the answer is, a jonny on the spot maybe? ?

This restaurant is located on a busy corner of Williamsburg facing McCarren Park. Popular for people watching and pooch-sitting, this eatery serves up tasty food and drinks. The wait times can be up to an hour during prime weekend service, but there are enough places in the area to check out before coming back for a table.

Holy truffle fries! Soo the bestie was in town, and wanted to get something "light" to eat after a long weekend of cocktail annihilation. So we decided to find something in Brooklyn and stumbled upon this place on yelp. I ordered the mushroom toast and the bestie got the granola with fruit and we split a plate of truffle fries...because it only makes sense, duh. The mushroom toast was good... however the cut of the toast was too thick (clearly I was too hungover to register that I DID order a toast dish, what the hell did I expect??) Soo yeah that was my own mistake. However, the dish overall was tasty but I wish there were more slices of mushroom in the sauce... but still good nonetheless. I tried the granola and that was amazing! They had a light and airy tasting whipped yogurt with a crunchy and not-too-chewy granola mix. It was perfect and very refreshing with the fruit on top. The truffle fries were perfectly fried.. with the right amount of truffle oil tossed to taste. Service was great, great atmosphere and very much enjoyed the food.  I look forward to coming back to try the five leaves burger and the brunch menu on the weekends.

I'm in the neighborhood and was anxious for a new restaurant. I went during the second week of being open and I have to say I was pretty disappointed. My boyfriend and I stood waiting a good 7 minutes before any of the staff would approach us for a table. Once seated and having ordered we waited almost an hour for our meal and only saw our waitress when she brought out our food. I thought the prices were a little on the expensive side. I don't think I'll be heading back anytime soon.

Ate here this morning among a large concentration of tattooed people (staff and patrons). The food was most excellent. Had the ricotta pancakes with what seemed like a fruit salad on top of it. I also had sides of home fries and chorizo and they too were delicious. Highly recommend.

A really solid buger, great kale salad and awesome mussels (huge portion.) The burger and mussels are favorites and the truffle fries are really tasty too! Over here in hipster heaven this place has good food, the scene is a lot of loud music, scruffy bears, tight pants and tattoos.  Overall a good Brooklyn food spot!

While waiting for a lane at Gutter, we wandered over here to grab a bite. We called ahead to see if the wait was terrible, and they said no, it's winding down. It was a Saturday night, sure, and we were a party of seven, admittedly annoying, but the attitude we encountered was even far beyond the snobby hipster douchebaggery we expected. We put in our name and tried to push past the crowd in the entrance to wait at the bar, but the "host" informed us that there wasn't room for all of us (there was) and we would have to leave. Um, gladly.

Went for brunch only to find it packed and several other people waiting. We put our names down and were told to come back in a hour (for us, this was fine - we had other things to do). Once we came back, we were seated straightaway at the bar. The chia seed pudding was a little on the small side, but yummy, and the rest of our order was spot on. Love the interior and the general layout of the place, just wish it was a little bigger to accommodate more people.

The food and brunch service were fantastic.  Enjoyed and shared amongst two other light eaters the ricotta pancakes as well as the Big Breakkie.  Definitely a great place to showcase Greenpoint's vibe.

Rude service. We had a waitress that was arguing with the bartender and other wait staff in front of us. It was extremely awkward. After waiting too long for our appetizer we paid for our coffees and left. I came to eat at a restaurant, wasn't expecting theater.

If you like hipsters, then welcome to heaven because I've never seen a more complete collection of skinny jeans, scarves, crystal necklaces, converse all-stars, ironic t-shirts, shaggy hair, and pointless tattoos in my life. That being said, the Moroccan Scramble Morocked my mind! The wait staff is so hipster they lose interest in you as if you're a top 40 hit on the radio. The food is worth it though so give it a try.

The food is good. Not really worth the long wait you have to endure on weekends, but they serve thoughtfully prepared and seasoned food. It is definitely over-hyped (definitely not a 5 star Yelp place like the reviews suggest), and the ambiance is really lacking, but you can get a solid brunch here.

This place is hands down one of the best brunch spots in nyc in my opinion. The restaurant is super cute and with outdoor seating and indoor which makes it ideal for dining in both summer and winter. The brunch menu here is fantastic and very creative. I highly recommend the burger  which is not something Id ever normally do, but here it is really something special. My only negative ( no fault of the restaurant )was that while i was there both me and my gf sat directly in the line of sight of some chick (believed to be Argentinian )eating ketchup on a knife out of the bottle. We wanted to throw up. wtf?

I had a delicious brunch here last month, although the waiter was Extremely rude. Last night I tried their dinner and was very disappointed. The Hanger Steak was tough and uninspired. The Shepherd's Pie was thrown together. Our appetizers were better (fried oyster special and the white bean/anchovy mush). What saved the experience was our incredibly friendly waitress, which I was not expecting to find. This may be a good place for a snack and a glass of wine but not much else.
This place blows!  Stay away at all costs!  Don't believe the hype.  The quality that presided here has moved on to greener pastures.
Delicious and creative. Friendly staff. Outdoor seating is great in nice weather. Recommend ricotta pancakes and brûléed mint grapefruit.

A great place for brunch or dinner. Must haves: Truffle fries, honey and ricotta, flash fried oysters, chopped kale salad, mussels, shepherd's pie, Five Leaves burger. And the cocktails are equally amazing - They make one of the best sazeracs!  Too bad there's such a long wait nowadays, we used to be able to just walk in.

Dinner with my cousin in Brooklyn.  She knows all the hip spots, and I'm just a tourist, so she suggested Five Leaves.  Cool menu and a nice vibe.  I wouldn't say I was ecstatic about the food -- it was good, but rough around the edges especially with presentation.  We tried the shepherd's pie (lots of mash, not too much meat, great roasted root vegetables), the cheese plate (great variety, but sort of randomly dumped out on the plate), brussel sprouts (delicious), salmon (great flavor in a nice broth), and three scoops of ice cream for dessert.  All in all, a fun night out that I attribute more to the ambiance and company than the food itself.

This is one of the best brunch spots I have discovered in NYC. Outdoor seating is great in the warmer months. The food is delicious, I have never had a bad meal. And what's better than a walk up Stumptown coffee window when you just need a little pick-me-up.
The best place to eat in Brooklyn, hands down! Good coffee, good service, the food is incredible, they nail it every time without fail. Thank you Five Leaves!!
Always a wait, but it's worth it! Delicious drinks and food that will make you feel like your at home. Great for brunch, after work cocktails or dinner.
Hands down, best burger in Brooklyn.  For that reason alone, Five Leaves gets five stars.  And, the rest of the menu is delicious too.  If it were only a little bigger...

This is probably my favorite restaurant in my neighborhood, maybe in all of Brooklyn. I'm especially fond of their brunch. I usually order a side of poached eggs with sauteed kale and avocado. The kale salad is incredible and the americanos are great. If you're a big coffee drinker, be forewarned that they only offer americanos, so there are no bottomless refills--which is surprisingly fine by me. Whether you're eating outside or in, it's a lovely restaurant for a meal, a date or happy hour cocktails.

Absolutely love this place. Intimate, small, wait for weekend brunch can be quite long but definitely worth it. I've eaten here twice and I love their coconut mussels that come in a surprisingly hearty and spicy soup that's perfect for bread to soak up.

Walking through the neighborhood we ended up here. The Ricotta. The Mussels. The Staff. Everyone was friendly. The food is made with love. We started outside and when the rain came suddenly our server and fellow patrons helped us bring our food and drinks inside, and made room at a table. That was unexpected and wonderful.

Fantastico! Sat at the half-moon shaped bar and enjoyed brunch from beginning to end. Great overall old-time ambience (and water closet) with interesting light fixtures (Einstein's lost set during his "artsy" phase?). Bartender-man spun some fine soul and reggae (Yellowman!) LPs with the subwoofer just gently jammin' my stool and feet. Delicious soft scrambled herbed eggs w. bacon, sliced avocado, big warm toast, and round-elicious hash browns. Great service! otherwise, me thinks oj not exactly "fresh squeezed" Intelligentsia beans!!

This is my absolute favorite brunch spot in the area. I've tried the Moroccan Eggs, the pancakes and the yogurt and granola with fruit. I've LOVED everything I've had, but my favorite is the the yogurt and granola. So f-ing good. The service is fantastic too... The whole situation is a win. BUT you might want to get there early or be prepared to wait it out.

Really really liked the grapefruit. It was super juicy! The steel cut oats were a little boring tho. didn't taste like much. Hubby got the Moroccan scramble and said it was ok. Good service and nice atmosphere.

love Five Leaves. Glad to live close by because I can choose to dine here on a whim whenever there's not too terrible a wait. It's one of my favorites in the Greenpoint. It's a beautiful, rustic space, and if it's nice outside, snag outdoor seating.

This place is simply the best.  Hands down.  Good service, good atmosphere, awesome food.  I recommend going in small parties (2-4) because the spot is fairly tiny and getting:  The Five Leaves Burger (pineapple, beets, and egg!), or the Dry Ribs (I don't even like pork, but these are amazing), or the Ricotta appetizer.  Or anything else - it's all heaven.  Don't forget truffle-oil fries.  This place is so worth it.

The difference between a 4 and a 5 rating here is the truffle fries. Nothing I've ever tasted before in my life. True, the prices at Five Leaves are a bit higher than your standard Williamsburg restaurant, but the food is tasty and the atmosphere is great. This is a great place to take a date, parents, or visitors from out of town. Just be prepared if you're going to foot the bill!
Meh. Not a huge fan. Took forever for our food to arrive, and when it did, it was kinda cold. The big breakfast doesn't compare at all to an English big breakfast!

Such a nice little bistro - we loved Katy our server. It was sunny and very warm the day we dropped in and sat outside - they were great to all down the awning to make us more comfortable. Salads were great - seating outside is a little tight but friendly.

Love this place! My boyfriend and I came in for an early dinner about a month ago and the dinner was incredible. Our sesame-crusted salmon was perfectly cooked and the apple fritters we had for dessert were srsly heavenly. You NEED to order those if they're still available. We didn't wait too long for the food at all and we'll def be back soon

I been in this place before for dinner, is a nice place, just went for brunch, and the hostess took like 10 min just to tell me that we need to wait an hours with some kind of Attitude and so passive aggressive, don't like this type of energy when I'm starting my day, I live in the area and I know is busy on Saturday but no Need To Be Rude!!!!

We came for brunch on what had been the first nice day in awhile. The crowd was intense but there was space at the bar so we opted to eat there. It was tasty. The drinks are also pretty noteworthy. I would get here on the earlier side especially once they lose the outdoor seating in the winter.
The weekend brunch wait is long but worth it.  Everything I've ever ordered off the menu has been delicious but I am particularly fond of the kale salad.

I live on Long Island and visit Five Leaves every couple of months when I'm in Brooklyn. I love this place. I've had their regular burger, and the roast organic chicken, and they're both very good, but my favorite sandwich is the Blat (avocado and bacon). It's absolutely delicious. The servers are very friendly and attentive, not snooty at all. The space itself is warm and cozy. I only wish I lived closer, so I could visit more often.
What's REALLY good is the oatmeal (served with maple syrup... YUM), and the tea. So delicious.
Cute place tucked on the corner full of amazing menu options!!!! Well worth the trip to Brooklyn. No reservation so be prepared to wait but definitely worth the wait!!!!

Why are you so grouchy pretty girl who looks vaguely Eastern European? You are so pretty. It could be worse.  Your server friend is just as pretty and she is so nice. It's ok, the food is generally good, the decor is great, and there is always nice energy. I think this place used to be better, like, great, but it's still pretty solid now.

I tried Five Leaves because a friend suggested we go there. I never knew it would be so good! I usually eat across the street and thought that 5L was a coffee shop/cafe as it is very inconspicuous from outside. They don't take reservations so we went (on a weeknight) and had  a 30-40 min wait as the place is small (but so worth it!). Eventually, the host/manager(?) asked us if we wanted to wait inside as it was chilly out. He was very friendly and kind and made sure we got a table soon after. Their drink list is very extensive while the food list is kept simple. We both ordered the five leaves burger (one med. well and one med. rare) and it was as good as it sounds on the menu! We added truffle fries to that and ordered six points and ayinger beer. The result was a very very tasty and satisfying dinner! Service was great, food was great, and decor was cozy. I'll definitely be back for more and suggest that others try it too!

I guess it's easy to hate on this place as it is the epicenter / ground zero of the hipster universe, but I will venture to not be a hater. This was a go-to date night spot for my wife and I. Well done cocktails (ask for the Old Pal, not the new), share the soup du jour and the unmatched hamburger, and you're in and out for a reasonable price. Expect a bit of a wait and to sit next to a few teenagers with big glasses, $10,000 outfits, and pedantic conversations, but it's still well worth it.
Went on a date here with a friend. The wait was long but the food (which was a typical burger and fries) was prepared very well.

I wish I lived in BK so I could come here more often. I've only been twice, but I love this spot. Truffle fries are like crack, you CANNOT stop eating them, I promise. Pancakes were great as well as the eggs I got with the chorizo and bacon. Definitely stop by if you're in the area.

As you walk in it has a rustic environment with the wooden walls and the light bulbds. The place is quiet small from the inside and the outside they have a couple of tables. The wait wasn't long. The service was exceptional the waiter attended us quickly and let us know that the food would take longer then excepted. Took about 15 minutes. The burger tasted good juicy with the lettuce and the tomatoes fresh. The truffle fries tastes somewhat like stored shoes, wasn't use to taste and had a lot of salt. I would go back the burgers were good.

A cute little place. I went at 4pm on a Friday and got drunk on 6 points ale, sat in a window with my girlfriend looking at  w-burg and the fixed wheel bikes, had an excellent prosciutto, fennel and pomegranate salad, a whopping burger and fries and loved the toilet door which is like it came off a ship (strange but true)

The Five Leaves Burger may be the best burger in the city, and the Kale and Anchovy Dressing salad is without a doubt my favorite salad around.  Brunch is good, but a weekday breakfast is an even more reasonable and nice experience.

Now I know what American (New) is...  This place is a little heavy on the hipster sauce, but they don't disappoint with the food.  Stopped here for a 2:30 lunch with a colleague praising this place for its brunch.  Two full figured males found the place tight, but could not get enough of the mussels & oysters.  Not looking to nap up at the office, we split a bacon cheese burger  deluxe with truffle fries.  We gobbled every bit up.  It was terrific.

I'd been waiting to go to Five Leaves for years, however living in Melbourne put me half a world away from that goal. Luckily I found time to experience this gem whilst on a recent trip to the US. It was a busy Sunday morning when I found myself in Greenpoint, with more people arriving by the second. The takeaway coffee line to the right of the entrance was pumping and I was wondering if I'd even make it inside. Luckily the maître d' was kind enough to offer me a seat at the bar seeing as I was on my own. I quickly got chatting to the lovely staff (one was a fellow Melbournian!) and my coffee was soon in front of me, poured to perfection. Breakfast followed promptly and was a delicious concoction of eggs, coriander, chickpeas and chilli. I enjoyed my meal whilst stealing glances out the door across to the wonderful park opposite. All in all I couldn't fault Five Leaves from start to finish. If you're in the area, it's a must.

Great little eatery in Williamsburg (and by little, I mean little). Had to wait for 1 hour or so to get seated, but it was entirely worth it: they have a full bar with good bartenders (my Manhattans were fab) and the food is delish. Went for mussels as an app and got the amount you'd usually get as an entree (and that saffron-something broth is to die for), and the fish I got as an entree was every bit as good. The bar steak is pretty solid - not a filet mignon, but that's not what you're paying for - and the dressing on the side salad and the fries are perfect. Very pleasantly surprised by their wine offering too: not enormous but very reasonably priced and good quality. In the summer they kick out the sidewalk tables so you get to wait only 45 mins for a seat...

One of the best brunch we've had in a while.  Their dishes were perfectly cooked...especially their egg dishes.  Major drool factor just looking at everyone else's dishes arriving.  We'd go there again in a heartbeat if the wait wasn't so ridiculously long...grrr...
Really delicious fresh food in yummy combinations. Small plates and mains and special desserts as well.  Cozy, if a bit small, and ify service, but the food is wonderful.

There always seems to be a line outside the Coffee-To-Go window at Five Leaves but one slow Sunday we stopped in before noon and were able to sit down right away. The crowd quickly followed and it became quite noisy. The food seemed a little pricey at first but made up for it in quality and quantity. I had the sage scrambled organic eggs with aged cheddar on bread- really delicious. My friend got the fruit salad which was generous and full of blueberries, strawberries and other summer picks- not the usual boring melon. I have heard that some of the servers can be a little rude but ours was lovely. Like most places in the area they only take cash.

Took our friends here for Sunday brunch a week ago. After 50 mins past after we placed our orders, we asked our waitress about it, and she told us that the food would be coming in 5 mins. Since our friends had to catch a flight, and with little time left to enjoy our food, we told the waitress that we would need to cancel our orders. The waitress's response was "This is a very popular and busy place, next time if you're in a rush for brunch, there are other places around here, like bakeries. This is not a place to rush your food". WTF.

Only in between menu at 4pm on Saturdays. I ended picking a mussel dish with green curry. My companion had a burger with fried pineapple and beets. "Fried pineapple?" - how innovative. The burger indeed tasted so good with pineapple and beets. The mussel dish came out with neon green color of broth and it was delicious! I made a mistake of splattering some broth to a guy sitting next table. (Yes, the seats were a bit too tight). The guy was upset and had neon green t-shirt since that meal. Even then, the mussels were amazing!

Rather than deal with crowded, noisy restaurants on Valentine's Day, my husband and I decided to do takeout from a nice place and decided on Five Leaves after perusing the menu.  What a fortuitous choice!  The food was all amazing, which is particularly impressive since it didn't get eaten for almost 30 minutes after it was made.  The Wild Boar small plate was definitely the winner of the night - tender, well-seasoned meat on a bed of herby polenta.  The truffle fries were also a treat!  They were incredibly nice to us, despite the fact that they were slammed with dine-in customers.  Can't wait to go back for brunch some time!
This place has absolutely the BEST pancakes I have ever tasted! You must try!!! Be warned you may have a wait because this place is VERY popular.

Overrated. You can get way better brunch and cuisine elsewhere in BK. Nothing had a wow factor, starting with: the margarita (basic), southern belle (just lemon juice), signature burger (ingredients didn't go with each other), farro bowl (the beet sauce was nice but the dish as a whole was BASIC). With burnt coffee to finish.

This is the one place that I will actually wait on line to eat at. Part of that is because the host on weekends manages the line with such seriousness and grace that he makes you feel calm and attended to. The food is wonderful, seats are comfortable.
