They play music from a record player and though the wait staff is definitely of the hipster breed they seem to also have a good dose of altertness and kindness. The grapefruit margherita with a cayenne and salt rim will definitely get you drunk and happy. Love this place!

Last time I ordered  short ribs with Swiss chard. It was a huge portion, I couldn't manage it, but above all - it was perhaps the most delicious thing I've ever eaten !!! The meat was perfect - fresh, prepared with care, and the whole dish was just a dream. I couldn't help thinking: 'The chef and the kitchen stuff must love me',  because I can't explain this otherwise. I thought only my mom can prepare so carefully and amazingly tender piece of meat. Well, now there is also a place in Greenpoint doing it. Thanks guys for the creativity and amazing treatment! I'll be always back, as much as possible.

Always crowded, for a reason. Even though the burger is much lauded, I think it's too much stuff.  I really loved the brunch here, though. Truffle fries are amazing.  Great atmosphere. Can't wait till it gets warmer so we can sit outside.
Packed on a Wed at 3pm. I was tempted by the duck and rabbit liver mouse, but went with the Vietnamese Lamb sandwich. Pretty good. Few taps. Very nice interior.

Amazing, AAAA-mazing truffle fries. Wow. Did I say Truffle Fries? Because I was considering the regular fries for a half second, truffle fries allllll the way. Really. Great food with great display of the food. They know what they are doing, and I appreciate that.

I came here two years ago, and I'm still thinking about those ricotta pancakes I had.  We came here for brunch on a Sunday and it was jampacked, but we still managed to get seating outside in about 30 minutes.  Only thing I didn't like about the outdoor seating is that it's a small area, and we were seated by the takeout window where a lot of people were standing by and we were located by the trash can.
Great food. Looooong waits. Small tables.

This place...this magnificent place. I was walking along one night, cold and hungry when I was drawn to this corner of the earth. I didn't hesitate to walk in as it started to drizzle and  didn't want to be caught in the rain. I'm greeted and taken to the end of the restaurant against a wall and next to the record player playing a Iggy Pop record. I order a burger. No substitutions. I take it as it is. There in that dark corner, I ate my burger in the candle light with Iggy Pop singing in my ear and it's been the closest thing to perfection. It's the best burger I've ever had in my life. I say this because I didn't need to add anything to it. The science of it all is what was. The temperature, bite, and taste. I miss this dark corner deeply and dream I will walk in one of these nights I'm ever in New York. I hope there will be a candle lit and another Iggy Pop record waiting for me. To the waiter that served me... I apologize for walking in so near to closing. I'm forever grateful.

Hard to get a table here, finally did on cold weekday morning.  The coffee drinks are made with care, service was awesome!  Had the big breakie, had the chorizo and grilled tomatoes, both awesome!  My companion had the sautéed mushrooms, they were a little too salty.  Great breakfast!

Food was good and menu inventive.  Service was solid and friendly.  Lines were long - but I guess people want to check it out.  I almost docked them a star because: a) the wait was a little long - but admittendly not their fault just popularity...and (b) they brought me the wrong food - but I think that was because it was loud and crazy (popular place:), and the fixed their mistake pretty fast.  Atmosphere was fine I don't give a crap about the whole hipster or no hipster thing, the place is decorated well, and so is the tattooed staff.

I've heard a lot about this place but never managed to eat there because they don't take reservations and I always end up in Brooklyn during major meal time with a ton of people on a Saturday night.  So never had any luck.  Then I end up being out in Brooklyn on a Wed night late and realize PERFECT let's eat here!  The meal was pretty good although sadly not up to the expectations that had been set for me by friends who have eaten here.  The bacon wrapped dates were really sweet and the mustard just seemed kind of standard.  The Shepherd's Pie was rich as expected but pretty good.  It was a filling meal but I wasn't that impressed.

The food is mediocre at best, service is way to hipstery and slow. I have been here on a relatively slow day and had to flag down three separate people to get cream for my coffee. I have also had my table given to friends of the staff that have shown up after me, making my wait that much longer. The salads are over priced and small and the music is way too loud for a restaurant. But honestly, It's the service that will never have me coming back.

I came here for lunch and i understand that they are busy. The food is good... Or it could have been the fact that they made me wait 20-25 min for my food. After chugging down the whole bottle of water, i asked the waiter for the delay in "warming up my quiche", when just then his colleague brought the quiche and my main dish together. Why in the world would i want to eat the appetizer as a "side dish" of my main course?? I was already too upset and hungry to even utter a word out to him. Not to say the least that he did not even apologize for the delay. It was also clear that my table was the only one that had to wait that long for the food. Oh... And by the way the menu says "freshly squeezed orange juice", but what they gave us was NOT freshly squeezed OJ.
Absolutely amazing food. Moroccan scramble and truffle fries are to die for. Great service and love the coziness of the place.

Found this cafe scooting through williamsburg on our way to fort greene. I highly recommend the chicken and anchovy sandwich. Great flavor combination without the fishiness. And the bacon, avocado sandwich was nice as well. The fries were a bit much and too thick for my taste. It was nice to sit out for a quick bite if you're ever in the neighborhood.

Prepare for Egg length waits for weekend brunch. That said, much like Egg, it was well worth the wait. I ended up with the Moroccan Scramble with a side of fries. Amazing blend of spices and great fries. I think it's a great option for brunch and it looked like they had some solid cocktails (didn't have any this time). If you know someone near by, make them head early and put their names in ahead of your arrival.
Excellent coffee and a favourite brunch spot. Make sure you order the bruleed grapefruit!

This place easily becomes your favorite restaurant.  I like coming here with my hubby because it's a small, intimate space.  Wait times for a table can be pretty long, even on weekdays.  My experience here has always been a joy!

Unreal. Made it for an early brunch this weekend and can't wait to go back. Had the poached egg-kale-mushroom toast--one perfectly poached egg atop a thick-cut slice of nine-grain, with lovely stewed kale, unique mushrooms, and a touch of lemon cream that was not too decadent/overpowering but instead really brought the dish together. They give very generous portions of iced coffee, everyone's pancakes around us looked obscene in the best way, and the truffle fries my friend and I split were also superb. I only regret not living closer, though that's probably better for my bank account.

5 Leaves sets the bar very very high.... I love this place! The food is perfect, the vibe is cool, the bacon melts in your mouth. The best place I've ever had Brunch... EVER! I would give it 100 stars if I could. Highly recommended. Enjoy.

My daughter brought me here for brunch. Very cool atmosphere. Had a sip of her excellent bloody mary, and ordered the fruit- yogurt- granola, which was divine. At the bottom of the bowl was crunchy granola heavy with pumpkin seeds, topped by a layer of thick greek yogurt, and then a layer of the freshest fruits - pineapple, strawberry, blueberry, blackberry, raspberry, apple, banana. Beautiful AND delicious.  Their hash browns are crispy cakes of mashed potatoes that have been fried. Decadent and yummy. Would love to return for dinner.

Well I ate on the outside tables with a friend. The waitress was very nice and service was pretty fast seeing it was packed inside but after tasting the food I can see why. I had pumpkin duck risotto and flash fried oysters as an appetizer, delicious. My main was the five leaves burger and I thought I had burgers before but this was good. I chased those with a Rum fix and a Mojito with uber fresh mint leaves. Oh man the fries, the fries!

Had a really great brunch here.  Was told the wait would be 45 minutes, but it only took 15 to get seated.  We were able to order drinks while we waited, and the warm hard cider was perfect for the cold fall weather.  The food was excellent as well.  There were lots of things on the menu I wanted to try, so I'll definitely be going back.  The space itself is very small, but provides a nice ambiance for a relaxing brunch.
I love this restaurant. The food isn't always the best but who cares?  The staff are adorable.  The customers are super cool.  Loyalty is well rewarded.
Went there last night with a friend super nice waitress with redish hair good burgers nice atmosphere I love this place. I ate the burger but their steak is amazing had that a couple weeks ago.

This is probably one of my favorite places to eat for brunch in Williamsburg for sure. Pancakes are the best, also the mussels. I got the octopus last time i came in and was not as good. Kinda dissapointing. But other than that, everything is amazing here, cocktails are amazing, ambiance etc.
about an hour wait for a small table, noisy environment, pre- fried potatoes with truffle...wrong combination....
This place always has great food. Definitely try the brussel sprouts, the mussels, the devils on horseback, and the truffle fries.
I could eat here morning noon and night and sometimes do. I never get sick of their amazing food or their amazing employees. Love this place so much. Thanks Five Leaves for ruling the planet.

Returned to Five Leaves after a few poor experiences a little over a year ago.  Seems things have come together over there and we now look forward to going. The food was always good, it was mainly the service that spoiled our past experiences.  If you had a similar experience give it another chance.  Kale salad, burger, truffle fries and cocktails are all lovely.  Only gripe: beware the transition time between menus.  This seems to be a shift change that was noticeable.  Drinks came 20 minutes after I ate my salad.

Five Leaves is great. I wanted a burger the other night and my cousin who lives in Greenpoint said this was the place to go. We had burgers and beers and it was a great dinner atmosphere. I don't like a stuffy place and I'm real fickle about my burger. But I enjoyed this. I don't get out this way much because I'm on the other side of Brooklyn. Check it out when you're in town.
Great portion size for the price. Delicious food - great atmosphere. Got starters, entree, and dessert plus wine for $70. Will definitely be back!

Food is excellent, service is usually a bit lacking. Like most New American cuisine, the menu features heavy, salty fare with little in the way of vegetarian options. For starters, try the fried oysters or the bacon-wrapped dates. For your entree, I recommend the hanger steak with truffle fries.

The crowd - their outfits and hairstyles - is annoying, but man, that sage egg sandwich makes me want to be a better woman.  That's all I'll eat there, though.  I make better ricotta pancakes at home, but I can't get my eggs that soft and amazing.  4 stars because that sandwich is that good.

I give it 4 stars but really I wasn't a big fan (3 stars) because it was packed and we sat at a table with people 1 foot on either side. The service was great and the food came out super quick. I thought that the Moroccon breakfast wasn't that good but it was presented great and was huge. Maybe I'm just not a fan of that dish in general. Great atmosphere. Would love to try the place again if it was less busy.

Best scrambled eggs, toast, and sautéed kale I have ever had. And perfectly ripe avocado. Service was on point and cocktails were generously poured. Wow! It's because of businesses and ppl like this in Brooklyn that I could see myself living here

Intimate atmosphere, lovely attention to detail: lighting, fans, Billie Holiday & Louis Armstrong on vinyl. Tasty food-the truffle fries are some of New York City's finest. Attentive service. Perfect place for a date.

Stellar burger. Only menu item I've had so far so can't really say anything else about the place except that it's hip meng so hip! Love the hipness fer real for real... Nah it's pretty low key all in all for being right next to Kickball central McCarren park... Oh Tennessee how I love thee!! Though the price could come down some... Organize it.
I've never had ricotta pancakes like these before!! Mouthwatering, plus they give honey butter! YUM!! The granola is also great as well as their sage egg sandwich :)
Everything was delicious. Definitely recommend the scallops, the pork chop, and the lamb shepherds pie was unbelievable.

Not bad, but entirely unsure what the fuss is all about. I would NOT wait in line to eat here ever. The food was average at best. The steelcut oats were overcooked, the mushrooms were oversalted, and the serving glass for orange juice was a bit pathetic--they call that a shot glass down South.
go for the scene. stay for the awesome burger, good drinks and well-styled decor and people-watching...

The lemon Ricotta pancakes are amazing....comes with fresh banana slices, strawberry and blueberries. A must order! I went for Saturday brunch, this place gets pretty packed, wait time may be 10 minutes to 1 hour, so be patient.

One of the best brunch places in NYC. Some would give it 4 because of the constant 1-1.5 hour wait but the wait is well worth it. Go take a walk on the east river, have a drink at a bar, or lay out at the park. The menu is pretty unique and not your typical brunch menu items. Everyone is my party was impressed. I'd say the standout dish was the morocan eggs which came layered on a piece of sliced baguette and topped with a handful of cilantro which gave it such a refreshing taste, but one of my favorite little details was the toasted spiced chickpeas. My boyfriend had the eggplant quinoa falafel which was great and it looked like they even made their own flatbread (this should be a go to for vegetarians.) My least favorite dish was actually the one I chose... the kale salad. It looked good when I had seen it at others tables but dressing which was described as an "anchovy lemon dressing" tasted more like a chipotle ranch dressing and took away from the fresh/clean feeling of a kale salad. It was good I like the toasted hazelnuts but the dressing was meh. Outside seating is always a plus. I will be back.

Went here the other day for brunch, very cramped space and may as well have just sat on someone's else's lap... It took them a while to take our order and everything seemed a bit chaotic... However regardless there was no denying there food was excellent! But service was a no go for me
5 stars just for the shishito peppers and burger.  The mussels are good too, but filling.

Definitely worth the trip for their amaaaaazing food. I can clearly understand the ridiculous amount of love their truffle fries get on yelp. Drink list covers every taste - bartenders shake with passion. The wait does suck but if you come earlier than the late weekend dining crowd, approximate a 25 min wait, which isnt so bad. The ricotta honey comb app and flash fried oysters highly recommendable. Best of all was the arctic char. So unbelievably blown away at how good this dish really is. A future must do for brunch.

Wonderful quintessential Greenpoint restaurant. Great for brunch (be willing to wait) mid-afternoon cocktails and bites (highly suggest the grapefruit marg, oysters and cheese plate) or an intimate dinner (favorites are the mussels and kale salad).  It's tiny, very hip, always busy, not to be missed.

We came here on a recommendation to try the truffle fries and i was not disappointed.  We were staying a short walk away, and headed up for dinner on a Wednesday night around 7pm.  We got seated outside right away, which was really nice as got to see all the people walking by and its always fun to people watch.  We ordered the truffle fries and i ordered the black quinoa and goats cheese salad which was really nice.  The truffle fries were pretty delicious and i would absolutely recommend them to anyone coming.  We only stayed for one beer and ate our dinner.  The wait staff were friendly and looked after us.
I like five leaves for brunch.  I like five leaves for dinner.  The waitstaff is nice, adorable, and helpful.  The only flaw is that they don't have a veggie burger on the menu.  Hint hint.

Great food, great people watching. Eclectic staff but service solid. Gets very busy at peak times. Love that five leaves opens early on weekends. Moved away from w-burg but still make the 30 minute drive for that Big Breakie. Delish!

I've visited this place for brunch, for the coffee window and for the bar. I've tasted their homemade ricotta, I've sipped their americanos, I've swilled their rye. I love everything about the oldey timey feel of the decor, and particularly when I was there late on a Saturday night, I appreciated the music selection. This is a solid place for any time of day--if you're just grabbing coffee and going to McCarren Park, if you want a peaceful neighborhood bar, or a delightful meal.

Food is good. Customer service is good. Been here twice. Tried the Moroccan Scramble: great combination. I also tried the Big Breakkie: mushrooms and brocolli rabe cooked and seasoned well. Great place to eat.

Great restaurant! I've never had a dish I didn't like. From the watermelon quinoa salad to beet ravioli to burgers and fries, it's all delicious. You can't go wrong. It is also a great brunch spot if you get there early, otherwise expect a very long wait.

i've been here many times since they opened. i usually get the moroccan scramble or the kale caesar, but i could easily make any of these things at home. they also don't have regular coffee, just espresso, so any coffee you get is actually an americano. the food is fine, but this whole establishment is over-hyped, not to mention over-priced. you can find the same quality of food throughout the neighborhood for the same price, without a long wait for table, or even both.
Breakfast. Oysters. Seriously serious bloody marys. I love it all, including the hipsters behind the bar that know exactly when to turn up the music as a good song comes on.

I didn't find any food nearly this good while I was in Australia.  These guys are wizards of unique flavor combinations.  I don't even like mustard, but when it was offered with bacon-wrapped medjool dates I had to try and it elevates the already delicious appetizer.  The wild boar with coarse polenta and pickled quince was also another hit.  Lastly, the dessert special of calamansi lime flan was enhanced by sesame/almond tuile.  Don't miss their classic cocktails either, the Sazerac was solid with a healthy pour.  This place has more going on than just the burgers and fries...can't wait to try brunch.

Love the terrace, the looks of the clientele, the neighborhood and the food is generally ok...the service is indifferent but not really bad...BUT had a recent bad experience with mussels not cooked and belly ache after !

My favorite breakfast place of all time. Anywhere. Ever. Get the ricotta pancakes. Even if you have to wait in line a million years, who cares. Worth it. The best pancakes I've ever had. Also the best latte I've ever had. UGH, GET A LOCATION IN MAINE!!! xo
Favorite place around greenpoint / bedford, I've been there couple times, absolutely good food! Don't forget to make reservation couple days before...

The food was good and our waitress was very polite. The reason why I only gave 3 stars is for the rude hostess who kept telling everyone that came in to go back outside. Now I understand that it is small and crowded inside but there is a proper way that you talk to customers and she definitely was not doing that. She clearly seemed irritated with many of the customers the whole time we were there. I know it can be frustrating working in a busy environment but perhaps she needs training in customer service. She made the experience very unpleasant. Also be ready to wait about an hour before being seated...especially on the weekends for brunch.
I like this place a lot. I just don't see what the big deal is about this place. I still can't figure out why there is a line around the block to get a table on the weekends.

Ate here only once for breakfast and it was pretty good. I haven't gone back since because I don't really have the patience for a long wait when I'm hungry. But if you don't mind the wait, definitely worth checking out. A bit on the expensive side for breakfast. Their coffee is absolutely wonderful. I frequently get coffee to go and it is probably my favorite cup of coffee in all of the burg.

So good.  I have been here for brunch a few times and was very happy with the food, but brunch is kind of hard to fuck up (although it was better than most places I suppose).  But this past week we went here for dinner and it was sooooo crazy good.  We had the mussels to start, and for entrees I had a bass special and my bay had this shepard's pie thing with lamb in it.  Everything was delicious.  A couple bad things-the tables are like a millimeter apart so you basically sit with other people, the service is kind of slow, and it's always too crowded.  But I am not even taking off a star for these things, that's how good it is.  I want to eat there everyday!

Went for breakfast, but was not overly convinced. It was a little crowded, and noisy. Being I'm lactose intolerant their menu was a bit difficult maneuvering for Saturday breakfast. After telling me they were out of both types of croissants, I went with just a soy latte and stole bites off my fiances big breakfast platter, which was impressive.  Proper baked beans, texas toast with real butter (they should have brought jam), thick bacon (a little fatty), scrambled eggs (were a bit watery), and hash brown patties that a spicy kick to them. I noticed they were open until 1am, so maybe I'll go back in the evening for a drink and enjoy it a bit more.

hash brown and cappuccino, what more does a hungry soul need? the space has great details and the small tables made for an intimate, delicious experience. One minor note to my black cat classic espresso, up the dosage. proportions leaned more towards a latte.

Awesome oysters, yes. Cute, warm, friendly waitress, check. Some cocktail special that was yummy with great big ice cubes. Gettin' pretty happy at this point. Truffle fries, over the top. Yellowtail hamachi with melon and cucumber, wowsa. Chocolate molten lava cake. I am coming back. You betcha.

Heated benches. So fabulous in the winter time (when I visited). Having only been there once, I'd consult other people's reviews for a more detailed account, but just to give my quick input - the food was pretty amazing. Devils on Horseback is a must.

You have yet to disappoint me. I always leave here with a smile and never regret the long wait. Your truffle fries as my friends and I like to call them trouble fries def get you into trouble when you're done trying to walk away from the table! Hmmmm let's see what don't I like that i've had.......... NOTHING! Love the beet salad, oysters, burger, ricotta pancakes, devils on horseback, bloody marys and the list goes on and on and on.

I recently had a delightful dinner here at Five Leaves.  Despite the fact that it was packed, we were seated within 3 minutes of arrival and the waitress was so awesome.  We ordered a delicious bottle of white wine, and I got the mussels in coconut milk which were to die for.  The waitress was so sweet and brought me extra bread to dip into my sauce! I would say it was a lovely place and I would definitley return.
Good burger and truffle fries. Really good gelato from Il Laboratorio.
Always a good vibe and excellent food. Warsaw Mule followed by braised rabbit followed by fig pudding cake covered in warm salted Carmel sauce and topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Stellar.
Decent food. Ok if you want to wait a godawful time for a table outside. Inside is cramped and noisy. Strictly steerage. Bump into the people though -- they're all so pretty.
Mussels, fries, kale salad, cocktails are delicious.  Enjoy their breakfast on one of their sidewalk tables with an Americano - you won't regret it!
If you're an Aussie this will feel familiar. Great coffee. Great brunch. Homely accents.

By far the best breakfast/brunch i have had in nyc. I went on Wednesday morning so there was not wait! My husband had the Ricotta pancakes, w/ honeycomb butter, banana, blueberries, strawberries. OMG I cant tell you how good they were. It was Heaven sent! I had the toast and eggs with bacon and steak. The steak was so savory and delicious! The eggs where light and fluffy. This place is a NYC must!

Total disappointment! I will not be returning to this cafe. The staff didn't seem very friendly/welcoming and its completely cramped, but those weren't the dealbreakers. The food however, was. We ordered Ricotta Pancakes and the Big Brekkie after reading all the other rave reviews and looking over a somewhat lackluster menu. The pancakes were dry, flavorless and reminded me of a basic dry bisquick pancake. The baked beans and bacon in the big brekkie were undercooked, lacking any flavor accompanied by the hash browns that were a beautiful disappointment. To salvage the meal we focussed on the fruit served with the pancakes and the eggs with the big brekkie. Honestly I could have made a MUCH better breakfast at home and have had better breakfasts at IHOP/Cracker Barrel I'm amazed this place is crowded for brunch and has such high ratings!
i arrived on a freezing cold day and was asked to wait outside for a table inside. i was told i was "incredibly rude" for standing inside next to two people eating .. huh?

Showing up early at this no-reservations establishment proved just the ticket to an atmospheric and relaxing Valentine's Day dinner. When we walked into Five Leaves, we felt like we'd stepped into a local joint in an earlier era, and when a couple of guys sauntered in wearing fedoras with dates on their arms, that only reinforced the decade-out-of-joint feeling.  The decor is lovely, from the Edison bulbs and the zinc-covered bar to Louis Armstrong playing on the record player most of the time we were there. Service was prompt and the truffle fries were as delicious as others have described them here (they're like crack; we were instant addicts), as was my tenderly cooked hangar steak and the creamy mashed potatoes, which accompanied it. Satchmo handed the torch to Billie Holiday just as we headed out the door and into a chilly Brooklyn night.
Best burger of all time - pineapple, beet, mayo.. Sometimes I crave it in my dreams. Also has great atmosphere and is a superb place to sit outdoors in the evening while observing the passersby.

I am a regular at this place, can not rate t high enough. The only downfall is the minimum 45min wait at any day of the week. Love everything on the menu - especially the grapefruit margarita and the flash fried oysters!

The wait can be a bit much for a Saturday lunch, but you figure out why after ordering. Lordy, the ricotta starter is like eating a dense, sweet cloud. Just incredible. The kale salad is perfectly seasoned and has a spicy kick that takes it to the next level, and the Big Breakkie is a substantial amount of food, each component of which tasted like it was crafted with the utmost care. What a wonderful way to start a Saturday.

Holy cow this place is a gem. Go here and you will be happy. They use all fresh ingredients and every employee was so nice. The food was phenomenal.  We all got breakfast and i cannot tell you enough how great it was. the coffee was so good too. I got the mash avocado egg dish with chickpeas, I think it was the Moroccan scramble and i ate every bit of it. Seriously i recommend this place to anyone.
Always worth the wait. Shepard's pie tastes like my momma cooked it.

Just went to this place for the first time last night and loved it. Its pretty small and was packed on a tuesday night (no reservations so come in prepared for a wait.) But it was worth it! Had a good cocktail and wine list, and all the food was fresh and tasty. As a vegetarian (no fish either) I found plenty to eat. Loved the chopped vegetable quinoa salad, and the house made ricotta app was amazing too. Nice servers. Definitely a hipster spot, but for the decent prices and good sized, yummy portions, I definitely recommend it!

Sat at the bar.  Service service service.. Where did it go missing at this way too hip restaurant?  So because it's a Hipsters joint, the servers have to put on a facade to be too cool to have good service?  Did you forget that you are in a service industry? The bartender had no expression after i ordered from him. I wasn't even sure if he had heard me.. Barely acknowledged me. The food is truely good; I'll give you that.  Just think about how much better your business would be if the service improved.. just my two cents..  A good business is good everywhere; not just in one area.

My wife and I found this for Sunday brunch and loved it! In a trendy part of Brooklyn but arrive early. We waited outside with many others for about 45 minutes but worth the wait. They also offer outside tables (too cold for us) and counter service which would have lessened the wait time. Friendly staff and awesome food. Try the avacado toast!

In Greenpoint, there aren't a lot of quality dining choices.  I have had dinner and brunch here.  The atmostphere is a bit more Williamsburg than Greenpoint, but the food makes it quite fine.  I've never waited longer than 5-10 minutes, even in peak brunch time.  I loved the steak, and I'm not a steak fan overall.  All the greens they've served have been delicious.  Today I had a regular burger, and my date had the breakfast beans with a poached egg.  Quality.  Waitstaff was awesome too.

I have been here a number of times just for a drink or two then on to another place. Their cocktails are fantastic. One of the best old fashions I've ever had. The decor is very Moto-esque (since I hear they were designed by the same guy). So, we finally decided to eat here. I ordered the squabcock. Presentation was fantastic, but it was tough vainy and generally not good. Maybe this is the nature of the squab seeing as it is a domesticated pigeon, but I did not enjoy it and will not order it again.  I ate as much of it as I could and grabbed a slice afterwards to fill up. The only other problem is that it is cash only. I will be returning, but just for an appetizer (the table next to us got the mussels, and I thought about changing my order they looked so good) and a cocktail then on to the main course elsewhere.

Never really gave this place much thought beyond, "oh, the Heath Ledger place," but ended up there this weekend and it was sooo good. The homemade ricotta with honeycomb, sea salt, fresh thyme and figs was ahhhhmayyyyzong. Really, one of the best things I've ever eaten! The combination of flavors..wow. Want more. For an entree I had a special duck tortellini. The actual duck/pasta part was good, but the broth it was in was the best part. Something about the mix of flavors and spices. I wish I could better articulate what made it awesome. Just yum. Boyfriend had the crazy Five Leaves Burger with 34958 things on it, which he said was really good but maybe not worth the mess and difficulty getting it down his gullet. I'll be back! Oh, and we sat outside, where the table is small and the chairs are 1950s elementary school style, so not super comfy, but ya know. Service was great.

Delicious lamb.  The beet salad is consistently awesome  and refreshing.  The ambiance is lovely, and the service is pretty good.  One time they brought the starter plates along with the entree plates and we had table organization issues as a result, but whatever.  Also, the bathroom door is intimidating but the aesthetics override it.  I highly recommend it.
Get the bar steak,.. yummy! Great drinks and the truffle fries are great. Our server was awesome and the host was so accommodating and friendly.

My favorite place to go and splurge.  Brunch or dinner...it's all delicious.  The decor is kinda steampunk and industrial.  It still has cute cafe charm from the outside.  Aesthetic and ambiance play a big role when I am choosing a restaurant and this place always wins.  Try the mussels, they are delicious and served in a cute white pale.  Now dip your french fires in the sauce!  oh yeah......

I first went for brunch, which had a crazy long line, and was not so thrilled like everyone said I'd be. It wasn't bad, just not so great. Then I went for dinner, and got it. We ordered 4 sides and the soup of the day. So good. I was surprised to see the sides were so massive, two would have been plenty for the two of us, but I'm glad we got to try almost all of them. They're were DELICIOUS, and the next best thing was the price. Only $6! You'd spend more than that at a deli or market for less food and of course, not any good. All sides were great. Warning, the truffle fries are massive. So good though. The staff was not especially friendly, but efficient and they were certainly busy. I recommend it for dinner, and will be back.

Solid 4 stars, maybe 4.5 stars. The only downside is the tables are very close and the main isle is very narrow so you will get bumped.  I've been here for brunch and dinner a few times and with the exception of mediocre pancakes once, it usually doesn't disappoint.  The staff is usually very attentive without being intrusive.  Coffee window helps when your waiting outside.  I wouldn't say its expensive but don't expect a bargain because its in Greenpoint.
I'm disappointed every time I come here. Great atmosphere and location but the food is just so so. Caveat: have not tried brunch. In sum: meh.

Food is 5 out of 5, but service is even better. Without us saying anything they noticed my daughter not eating her eggs and simply brought us a new order, without the "little green things" ( in her words).
I came back here, all the way from flushing, just for this amazing burger! I had it with Gruyere and truffle fries. So good!!

I live few blocks from this place and I come here both for breakfast and dinner at least 3 times a week. The food is outstanding and you discover flavors you didn't even thought exist. This restaurant is ALWAYS packed and I'm happy for them cause it's definitely deserved:))
Staff was initially very rude and suggested we leave. So we did...After contacting the business to inform them of the situation, the lead manager did apologize which was really nice.
Solid negroni. Ask for the special vermooth. And these guys fight crimes. It's a daring menu- but I'm game for trying.

Lovely place for brunch. Best for a pair. Great panacotta pancakes! Tiny space but very lively, even at noon. Hipster crowd, of course, you're in Williamsburg. Good service. A couple bucks over what I'd want to pay but overall, a very good experience.

Fantastic brunch! Filled with ricotta, topped with berries and some kind of delicious butter, I crave the ricotta pancakes all week, . The cheddar cheese egg sandwich and the stewed tomatoes are also very good and the Bloody Mary's range from good to excellent depending on the day.  What more can you ask for? Oh and the host was very nice and accommodating to our group of five, despite the fact that it was truly a mob scene outside and he was running around like crazy.

Love their pancakes!!!!! Yum! Have also had their mussels, they were ok, not impressed with that, but great coffee!  Watercress salad was good too!  This is a great spot for outdoor dining, and picking up coffee to go.  Hate drinking out of mason jars, that's just too trendy for me.

Had brunch here the other day and was very impressed. Being a big bacon fan I loved the thick cut! It was actually done right! It wasn't too dry or too greasy. It was just perfectly delicious. Meaty but with excellent flavor. The rest of my breakfast was good too. My sister got the sage egg sandwich which was really good as well. Service was timely and the bloody marries where great!

Had a really great time here with my friend who was visiting new york. We had to wait a bit on a Thursday night. The place is so casual and chill and the waiters are super nice and friendly. They also play good music here. We had the skirt steak with celery root mash, braised fennel and truffle fries along with two cocktails. All of them were excellent except they burned my steak in the corner. Some places have good food but crappy cocktails and some places have great cocktails but crappy music; this place is definitely NOT one of them. Great food in a casual atmosphere. Sold.
Same rating.  Just need to say that the new bar steak is WEAK in comparison to the last bar steak on the menu.  I could make a better dish at home.
Crowded but staff is friendly. Had a light amazing brunch of brûléed grapefruit (a must) and fried tomatoes

Was here for brunch in Summer '12. Amazing food and atmosphere. Service could b a little more attentive but thats no fault of the staff, they just need to hire more people. No drink special otherwise it would be 5 stars. There is no brunch like a boozy brunch

One of the best places I've been to in a long time. The wait can be long at times, especially since there are no reservations but well worth it. The Sheppard's Pie was absolutely amazing as well as the Kale salad. The dining room has an excellent atmosphere and its the perfect place to bring a date for wine and some great food

We came here on Friday, November 28th expecting this place to be amazing with so many reviews. It was just meh. The reason why I have it as two stars was because I was expecting it to be sooo good and it wasn't even mediocre. My bf and I had the kale salad, the Moroccan scrambled eggs and the pancakes. The pancakes were alright, the Moroccan scrambled eggs was missing something, but I just couldn't put my finger on it and the kale salad was horrible. If I hadn't had kale salad that was incredible someplace else and tasted kale salad at this place for the first time, then I would never have kale again. Maybe I ordered the wrong dishes. If you have about 50 bucks to spend including a 20% tip then go for it - this is not including any drinks!! The ambience was really nice and the waitress and hostess were excellent :) I just left feeling unfulfilled although I forced myself to eat all the food.

OK, the place is awesome. They need to lay off the salt with their burgers! I love the food there, but how do you constantly over salt the burgers? I would like to taste the ground beef guys, instead I get an overdose or sodium! Otherwise, the place is fun, service is fine. This place has so much potential. Wanted to give them a star or two more, but until they fix the salt issue...no dice.
I love this place!  Food, cocktail, decor and the vibe!  Been there many times I think I lost count.  Service isn't the best but you don't expect it in a hipsters' hood, do you?  lol

Great breakfest spot!  They have delicious thick cut bacon!  Had the big breakfest and it was delicious.  They also play great music!  The coffee is magnificent the only thing is it is a tight space.  I dont mind it but other around seemed to get mad if people bumped them.  I found it quite funny.  If you are in Billyburg definitally hit up this spot but get there early cause it is always crakin!
Went here for brunch on a Sunday. We had to wait for an hr. This place is so expensive for the quality of food and drinks. Totally not worth it.
Very cute place.  Great place to have brunch and sit outside.  Delicious food and the drinks were great, I had the "Southern Belle" - sweet tea vodka...nothin wrong with that!

Since they switched their coffee beans to a different brand, I haven't been coming back. The Big Breakkie is still yummy but the acidic coffee turns me off completely. The heavenly lattes were the main draw for me. So sad!!!
Dinner was excellent.  The staff is very friendly and laid back.  Great wine selections.  The squid salad special was amazing.  Great music selections.  This is my favorite new addition the 'hood.

Friends with the head chef and sous chef so I have to love the place!!! My fav is the mussels and the truffle fries. Omg and the drinks sigh and the clams. I tried the burger it's good. Oh and the celery root mash I AMAZING. Yummy yummy yummy.
Went to 5 Leaves with my girl friend tonite. Oysters we awesome. Terigo and white beet salad was tasty and the Dorado was really good. Overall good meal. Sat outside.

I was there for brunch last saturday and I can't wait for the next weekend to come back! I had the five leaves burger and my friend those delicious pancakes :) we waited for an hour to be seated but it was worth it. Service and food very very good. I highly recommend it!
EXTREMELY rude over the phone. I can understand it being busy but isn't the first step to getting people in to be kind and helpful? I won't be going there if that is what the service will be like.

This was one of the worst experiences I've had at a restaurant! We went for brunch on Sunday, party of 4. The space is extremely right. Granted, we expected a wait at any restaurant being Sunday afternoon. The host told us the wait was an hour, so we went to the place across the street since it was bigger and less crowded to get out of waiting in the cold. My friend kept going back to check in on the progress. She even told him 10 more minutes, "I'm putting a table together for you all." Which wasn't true/didn't happen. She went from 1 hour to 2 hours. She also failed to mention that brunch was over at 3pm. I only found out because I asked the bartender if we can take a look at the menu to decide what to order before sitting down since we had already waited just over 1 1/2 hrs. Their lunch menu is very limited so we decided to leave. We only went to try this place because of all the hype we heard from word of mouth. We just wish we would've been told when their brunch was over so we could've gone elsewhere. Definitely not worth the hype and we'll not be coming back.

Came here for brunch on Sunday and had a party of six.  We arrived at 10:30AM expecting an hour wait especially with such a large party and we were pleasantly surprised when we were told that our table was ready after only 30 minutes. While we waited outside I was surprised to see people eating outdoors in 45 degree weather with a stiff breeze.  Once inside we were seated and our waitress immediately took drink orders and gave us adequate time to look over our menus before taking our orders.  Our group had the Ricotta Pancakes, Mushroom Toast, Moroccan Scramble and Sage Scrambled Egg Panini. Everything was very good.  Portions were decent size except for the Sage Scrambled Egg Panini which was smallish.  The Ricotta Pancakes were as good as everyone said they would be.  The honeycomb butter was amazing.  The Mushroom Toast had a generous amount of sautéed maitake mushrooms and kale with a delicious brown wine sauce toppped with a beautifully poached egg. Delicious. Oh, and their coffee is also very good.  We enjoyed our meal and never felt rushed despite the people waiting outside. Would definitely recommend this place.
Usually you have to wait, the price is reasonable but not cheap and the food quiet amazing. Fav: rosewater pavlova for dessert
Hash browns were ok. The avocado they gave me had gone bad, and the fat on the bacon was not rendered and inedible. Check please.

You know what the food was good , and I liked the staff, they were all very sweet . . But what I really love is the details and esthetic of the place! oh I am so jealous of your beer tower sooo jealous .

Hipster hell although the people watching here is amusing. Five Leaves' interior is cute but cramped so we always sit outside which is essentially sitting on the corner of a busy Williamsburgh/Greenpoint intersection but the food pretty much makes up for it. This whole New York couture burger thing that's been going on for a few years is getting out of hand and frankly I don't think Five Leaves' is so special. What is damn special are their delicious Thai inspired mussels (oh that broth!), the BLAT (bacon, lettuce, avocado and tomato sandwhich) as well as some hearty yet delicate salads and their delightful cocktail menu. And for all it's hipster appeal the wait staff is super friendly and cool (prolly the Aussie influence). It's a neighborhood joint for us and we hit it  for a reliable, leisurely and luxe lunch at least once a month.

I've been here a couple times for brunch. After an hour wait, then another hour for our food, it was a major disappointment. Even though I was starving and could have ate anything at that point, the food still tasted mediocre. I want to like this place because it is cute and the drinks are good. But the food is just below standards and overpriced. Not worth your time. Boo.

Mmm, the ricotta pancakes were delish! I can't wait to eat here again when it gets warmer, because I know sitting out on the sidewalk would be divine. I went here on a Friday morning and it was packed.....this says something about the place. Worth a wait, and you'll leave happy.

I love the food. Brunch is fantastic... great iced coffee, the eggs with sauteed kale or mushrooms or bacon... yum! Even better though, the ricotta pancakes. Best pancakes I have ever had, hands down. I would give this place five stars, but I hate the wait and I hate practically sitting on my neighbor's lap. The food is worth it, though!

This must be one of the most overrated restaurants in the hood. It's just where hipsters go to dress up and look important. The food was ok but had very little substance, it's  not even in my top 10 places to go in the hood. It's pretentious yuppie food, you'd be better served going to Egg for brunch for truly delicious food. The wait for brunch here is absolutely RIDICULOUS, and then you sit down and get served pretty bland fare. This place is ALL HYPE, don't waste your money just to be seen here.

Quality joint. Place was crowded and there really isn't anywhere to wait but the hostess managed to seat us much faster than she originally said. Food was delicious --we shared the delicious kale salad and then I had a wonderful stuffed squid special and the fries. I wish it were a little roomier but that is my only complaint, and in nice weather the outdoor tables take some of the spillover. Last time I was there ate at the sweet romantic banquette in the back. I'd come more often if I lived closer by.

I had a great lamb dinner here, the coffee is fantastic. They serve stumptown coffee. Also had a decent beer called six points, not amazing tho. Very cute restaurant. I had meant to check this place out due to a website I found with 20 best places to eat in Brooklyn but accidentally ended up here anyway.

This is actually as good as it gets. The wait is killer... the fact that everyone keeps waiting several years down the road is a statement in itself. I've been coming to Five Leaves for about 4 years. The food is 100% every time. I must have had about 80 brunches and a few dozen dinners here and I've never had a miss, NEVER in nearly one hundred meals. And the staff is amazingly professional, hip and beautiful but still extremely friendly. The ricotta pancakes can't be passed up (order for the table to share on top of your meals) and the yogurt is shockingly large with the best assortment of fruit I've had anywhere. Their eggs are amazing so big brekkie if you're hungry or the sage panini for light days... and always get a side of avocado, so fresh and perfectly ripe - I'm from Cali so I know. They make it all look so easy, I always leave wanting to come right back :)

I just love this place. I visited from LA last year, stayed nearby .... This year I had to come back and traveled from manhattan just for brunch.... And it did not disappoint.! I had the egg sandwich with amazing tasty tomato jam, we shared pancakes loaded with fresh fruit....to die for!..., side of thick perfectly cooked bacon... My wife had the the big breakie with fried tomatoes and fries. All perfect. ...and did I mention the fab coffee!

Love. Truffle fries, please. Sometimes, only this burger will do, nothing else, nowhere else. Stumptown coffee, outdoor seating. Tight space but it's okay for the most part. Good selection of booze. Can't ask for much more. Does get crowded, of course.

This is the place where the phrase hipster service was invented. 30 minutes for a raw hamburger you ordered medium? I don't see what all of the fuss is about. And if you like a nice 40 degree breeze from the coffee to go window then you'll love this place.

Absolutely love this place.  Love the truffle fries.  Love that they play only vinyl.  Love the coffee.  Love the seasonal cocktails.  Love the decor, love the block, love the flowers on the table and the candles in the bathroom.  Servers are always super sweet and attentive even if there is a really long wait.  There are only a few vegetarian entrees but honestly get a salad and the truffle fries and you will be stuffed full of deliciousness.  The breakfast is to die for!!

Stopped for brunch after running errands in the neighborhood. Surprisingly crowded and overheard 40-45min wait for seating inside...on a weekday! Over the weekend, I can understand, but seems a little ridic that folks were willing to wait on a Monday. No wait for seating outdoors and surprisingly warm sitting outside in the sun. Ordered the ricotta pancakes which were delicious. Great portion sizes as I people-watched other's orders waiting for my second cup of coffee. No free refills sadly...and service was a bit slow, but overall good food and I would return.

Went there on Oscar night. Good atmosphere. Very good cocktails! Ordered two appetizer specials and a side of truffle fries. Kale-Chorizo soup special was unbelievably bland; the prawns (special) were smothered in pepper (it must have been an accident, seriously) and at least 5-6 other ingredients/competing flavors; the truffle fries...the one dish that I had hoped would save the evening, turned out to be stale. I think it'll be a while before I go there again.

Wow this place rocks. The service is great and quick(thursday lunchtime, I am sure weekends are mobbed) Food was great, had hanger steak sandwich which was cooked perfect. I will be going back in evening to try dinner options(any suggestions?)

It's hard not to give five stars for the two things on the menu that send me into rapture every time I get the chance to eat here: truffle fries and home made ricotta.  For some reason the Five Leaves burger is more than a little sub-par, all the slippery pickles and egg just sliding around everywhere on the plate and overpowering the sandwich.  Other than that, its a fantastic menu, a small menu but a fine menu.  The food here is good, and the atmosphere is good, and even though I had a full drink spilled on my lap once while squeezed into the corner table by the kitchen, I don't mind because the TRUFFLE FRIES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Thank you for having great coffee available via a take out window for my morning needs.  Thank you for creating the best breakfast sandwich and thank you for a great drink menu and delicious oysters in the evening.  I think you have created a great restaurant on a great corner in Williamsburg.  I love sitting outside in the summer and having lunch while watching everyone walk by.  I love your dinner specials and I think I love you!

I think its a little overpriced and the food is alright. I tried the beet and blood orange salad but was immediately disappointed. The arugula topped with goats milk yogurt tasted bitter, unpleasant and just wrong. The celery root mash was amazing though and I'd go back just for that. It is very cute and charming inside.

I have never visited Five Leaves and had an experience that was less than lovely. The food is delicious, the terrific-to-look-at staff is smiley and kind, and they were so nice to my little dog. My favorite place in the neighborhood.

Great food.  Steak is unbelievably yummy.  Unfortunately the sound level in the evening is so loud you literally cannot speak across the table and getting your order understood to the server who is leaning over towards your ear is a challenge.  5 stars unreservedly if you don't need to talk and are willing to wear earplugs.

I just visited NYC for the first time, I live in Austin TX. I went to quite a few restaurants and this one was the bestttttt. There was a 45min-1hr wait, which is quite a while, however the amazing hostess said she would text me when the table was ready. What? thats awesome! haha. so we went to a bar to get a beer and the wait went by quickly and I received the text and we went back to the restaurant and were seated. The atmosphere here is just so great. Its busy but still intimate. I had a burger and fries which was amazing. We also shared some oysters which were fantastic. Next time I go to NY this place will be #1 on my list to go back to.

Darling delicious place.  Williamsburg has Manhattan trumped for innovative fresh food in atmospheric places. Yet another awesome restaurant here.  I tried their Alaska cocktail and really enjoyed its herbal ginniness, perfect for summer.  We demolished the fried oysters and devils on horseback. The irony of dates, a staple Middle Eastern food, wrapped in bacon, not lost on me every time I enjoy them. Opposites attract and compliment. Savory sweet.  Ying yang.  We also had the fried cauliflower which was good, although I'd fantasized about it differently.  I ordered the hanger steak, cooked perfectly to my request.  MP ordered the lamb shepherds pie (in July ?!) and loved it.  We said yes to dessert (!) and had pineapple upside down cake which MP loved.  I'm a bit more hedonistic and basic about my desserts and would have preferred it a little more rustic, less precious.  That said, I savored every bite and will return frequently now that we are in the neighborhood.  It's a fantastic restaurant with great atmosphere.

We read about Five Leaves while on the west coast, and sought it out on our visit to Brooklyn.  We arrived on a warm Thursday evening around six pm. The outside tables were all filled but there was plenty of room inside.  They played some cool background music (the Youngbloods, jazz, etc).   As our meal progressed, the place began to fill up, and by the time we left it was a packed party vibe.   So, if you like a quieter ambiance, come early!  The service was attentive throughout, though more personal before it got so crowded. While not inexpensive, our food was excellent.  We ordered a grilled fish called dorade, which was succulent and tasty.  Another dish consisting of sautéed ricotta cheese, was also delicious.  The truffle fries were fine, though not necessarily "to die for" as some other reviewers have contended.  The server recommended a Riesling wine, which was just right for us. We had to ask for bread, but once we did it was soft, yet crispy and tasty.  The chocolate pecan tart was a wonderful finish to our meal.  A minor complaint was that we ordered an ice tea and twice asked for refills.  We were unaware we'd be charged for three teas.  I would add a fifth star if you don't mind a crowded party scene as the evening progresses, or if you arrive around 5 pm for dinner while it's still calm and peaceful.
The hostess  and sever was so rude to our party. The food is great. Dec.12,2014.... Terrible service!!!!

I think it's funny that people are so crazy with reviews.  They've done an amazing job so far and this place is pretty relaxed and the food is good.  The hype is annoying--how about we talk about the living and the amount of effort that has gone into making it work.  The truffle fries are bangin' ($8?  really?) and the brunch egg sandwich is REALLY simple and good---especially if you like sage.  Ricotta pancakes good too. Congrats all around...and kudos for sallying forth with the project.  Someone is smiling from heaven, mate.

I've been here once for dinner and once for brunch (got a burger, moroccan egg scramble, oysters, truffle fries). Overall the food is above average (truffle fries are delicious), the service is good, the music is good. It's a small place and seems to be packed at all hours, so get in early for a table at brunch. I'll probably return at some point to try the pancakes.

Huge Fan... My wife and I love this place.  It's always a bit too packed for us to try their brunch but we have been here several times for dinner.  The burger is amazing and the bartenders are great.  We came here once just to drink beers and ordered their truffled frites - just a perfect relaxed night.

From the outside, the place looks like a typical bar.  Nothing special.  But let me tell you, the food is incredible!  Simply delicious.  Everything was great from appetizer to dessert.  The truffle fries are out of this world!  Excellent food and great service too.  Too bad there's a long wait... it's worth it though.

This cozy place is a great place to grab breakfast. Moderately priced for fresh made, high quality food. We ordered the Moroccan scramble and the ricotta pancakes. Both were delicious. It can get crowded as the place is small, but the food and atmosphere is cute and fitting for the neighborhood. Would definitely come back again.
4- stars for the atmosphere. it's a tiny joint that has NYC feel. dirty martinis were deliciously smooth, mussels in a creamy coconut milk broth as my meal and fried oyster appetizers.
i just wish that had even one vegan option on the menu.  sure, its my choice to be vegan and i dont have to go to this restaurant, but it'd be nice.  its not that hard.
get the ricotta, fig, honey dish, even if none of those are "your thing"

This place was on point! A friend took us here for dinner on Sunday night. We waited a long time to get seated but the place was packed. We finally got seated inside and it was pretty snug but had a warm intimate setting - great for a date. The ambiance was chill - lovely music selection - lots of hipsters. Our waitress was awesome and the chef overlooking the orders was pretty hot. Lol. As for the food, the truffle fries is a MUST! You can't go wrong with truffle oil. Also, everyone should try the Flash Fried Oysters with smoked chili and cucumber relish - it was to DIE for! I seriously still can't stop thinking about it. They had a variety of drinks to choose from - I liked the spicy bloody mary - it left a tingly feeling on my lips. I wish I had room for dessert though. Overall, my experience was quite yummy. I'll definitely recommend this place to my friends and come back to try the other dishes in the menu.

Beyond overrated. Went for brunch last Sunday, but got there at 3:33pm and the brunch menu ends at 3:30 so could only order from the "in between" menu. The food is average and the service is AWFUL. We waited 20 minutes for our drinks. So did the table next to us. When the customer at the table next to us asked where her coffee was the waitress cut her off and in a patronizing tone said "they're making it honey, they're making it." She'd ordered a coffee when she sat down and had already been served her entree before getting her coffee. The mussels are interesting, but not outstanding like they claim. The hostess was so rude and pretended there was a 25 min wait for a table when there were clearly at least 6 tables open or opening up outside then after we stood for five minutes she sat us at the table that she initially insisted we couldn't sit at. This place sucks.
Normal food, really bad service. Not friendly staff. I don't know why it's so popular and has good ratings but I will not go again.
Really amazing menu at good prices. So many delicious vegetable dishes. Really kind and helpful service. cool atmosphere.

What I love about Five Leaves is that the dining experience somehow manages to feel season-appropriate, no matter what time of year. It's the perfect place to seek shelter on a frigid winter evening, huddled close to your companions in the crowded dining room, sipping a fiery hot toddy out of a mason jar and enjoying hearty fare. Come summertime, it's also a great place to grab a juicy burger and sip lemonades on the sidewalk. Though I'm in love with their regular burger (comes with an amazing harissa mayo!) and order it every time, my friends have practically deified the monstrous Five Leaves burger.  The beetroot ravioli is also a favorite.

Probably the best burger in the city in my opinion.  The truffle fries are also outstanding. I just wish the place was a little bigger sometimes the wait on the weekends is pretty long and you have to wait standing outside which is not fun in the winter time.  I do it since the food is awesome.  Ill definitely be going there again.

Consistently great food, efficient wait staff, excellent cocktails at a great price and fantastic atmosphere even during busiest of times. I have yet to have less then stellar experience. Do not go here during busy hours if you aren't prepared to wait for quite some time and definitely try the burger which, in my experience, is the best that Brooklyn has to offer.
Gastropub par excellence!  Awesome food and great music.  Well worth the waits.  People watching and flavors on steroids.

Love this place! great interior, and great exterior!! This is Heath Ledgers restaurant. I've only been here for brunch, but on all occasions, the food was good, the service was good and the bloody marys are strong! Definitely a favorite if you're in that part of town.

a gem within the Greenpoint neighborhood! great burgers, very nice ambiance within a very cozy interior (you get to know your fellow diners pretty well), great service, and decent prices. their truffle fries are a must and if there is a special that piques your interest - definitely go for it! this is a cute location to catch up with a friend or to go on for a mid-week date...then there's a bar around the corner to keep the party going !

Love the place, the good and the ambient. The staff is amazingly friendly and so helpful. All the dishes we ordered were amazing and served so nice! The wait for 7:30pm on Friday was long but totally worth it! I just wished it wasn't so loud sometimes.
Best, most interesting cocktails in Brooklyn. And also the cutest chef in Brooklyn!
Overpriced, oversalted, and just plain old disappointing hipster hangout.  Save yourself the wait, and just go up the street to Brooklyn Label for a much more enjoyable experience.

the shepherd's pie and the signature burger are worth the trip from anywhere in nyc.  the staff is friendly and the atmosphere is lively, yet remarkably chill.  been going here on a weekly basis since it opened and five leaves has yet to disappoint me.  delicious coffee too!

My boyfriend took me to Five Leaves while I was in town this past week, and it was a perfect date night. We arrived there around 8pm on a Friday night, and he let me know that there would likely be a wait, but there was a bar. Indeed, there was a 30 minute wait, but we kept ourselves happy with drinks at the bar. If you don't have patience for tight space, I would say don't go on a weekend, but for me, the ambiance (despite the packed house) was worth it. The specialty drinks were incredible! I suggest the Foxtail. The bar was a bit awkward and cramped, but I would have done that over waiting outside in the cold, for sure. I filled myself up with the INCREDIBLE cheese plate and salad, I was so thankful my boyfriend and I decided to share an entrée, the pork chops. The entire meal was cooked to perfection, but I still can't stop thinking about the cheese. The entire plate was amazing! The entire experience was perfect for a date night on a Friday, and I highly recommend it!

This was a friendly warm and cozy cafe with fantastic service.  We all ordered the big breakfast and the bacon was the nicest I have had in a while with perfectly poached eggs.  Coffee was quick to arrive and had a mellow flavour and I love it when you get to enjoy your coffee first then food arrives after.  We are from New Zealand and this was our first morning in New York so thanks for making it such a cool start.

ordering off the somewhat limited menu as a vegetarian was a bit tricky but the four different items myself and my wife shared for dinner were all FANTASTIC!  the mixed greens salad was delish and hefty. the cheese platter with nut bread and roasted fruits, awesome. truffle fries, AWESOME.  beet root ravioli, HOLY CRAP, SO GOOD.  service was fantastic as well :)
Delicious. Get the burger with fried egg and pineapple, and the truffle fries. When you come back try other stuff.
The ricotta pancakes are more than enough reason to withstand the wait. Always an interesting experience and service is usually on point

I was really excited to try Five Leaves from all the great reviews I was reading.So my colleges and I decided to give it a shot, we went during lunch. I was disappointed at the menu options. Being a vegetarian it's hard to find a restaurant that accommodates. I asked the waitress for some suggestions. she was helpful enough to suggest a salad. So I went with her choice. It took 30min for my salad to arrive and it was extremely salty and not worth the price. I won't be going here anymore.

So, months after my initial review, I did in fact try brunch.  It rocked.  While my dinner experience holds back a star, the brunch added one.  The Moroccan Scramble is legendary, and the Mushroom Toast was awesome.  I am still not rushing back to dinner, but breakfast is a must.  I got there at like 9am on a Sunday (I know, lame) so didn't have to wait really, but normally it is packed so be prepared to wait.

I'm reserving the fifth star because of the long wait usually associated with this place in addition to the cramped quarters you're sometimes forced to dine in.  That said, there's a reason for the wait and the cramped quarters because the food here's delicious.  (They certainly don't skimp on the truffle oil and when can you go wrong with truffle oil.)  Great selections for brunch and dinner.  As long as you can plan for and don't mind the wait, then it's a great place to go.  Tip: You can always put your name on the list and then stop by Lokal across the street for a drink at the bar while you wait.

Delicious!  I live around the corner and go at least once a week.  Everything is amazing, from the pancakes to the burger to the salads.  Just typing about the pancakes makes me want to go tomorrow for brunch.  Very cute inside and great crowd of relatively chic, good looking people.  My one complaint is with their take-out coffee.  It tastes good but takes FOREVER.  Expect to wait outside at the window for 5 minutes for a simple iced coffee.  Overall though it's an amazing place and I highly recommend going there.
Love this place! Mussels, truffle fries, ricotta pancakes. Everything is super yummy!

We love this place since the day it opened in our neighborhood! If you think this place is great, imagine what it was like when it was brand new. The place was perfect perfect perfect it every sense from food, to service, to napkins, to cups, etc. Attention to details has gone down considerably since but it is still very good. Best time to go for dinner is Wen - Sat before 7pm (before the dinner rush) and for brunch on the weekends before 10am or after 1pm.
this place is over-hyped and they don't have AC so have fun dining in a puddle of your own butt sweat
really not exceptionnal - just an OK place

We were really looking forward to coming here but unfortunately the service was terrible and ruined the experience. Our waiter was inattentive and showed no sense of urgency in order to take care of his tables on a busy Saturday afternoon. We watched two couples get seated (at the tables right next to ours), order, eat, pay, and leave before we even got our food. We ordered a second round of drinks while we waited but they never came. After an hour, we asked our waiter if our food was on the way and he seemed annoyed that we asked. A few minutes later the hostess brought our plates out. My Moroccan scramble was cold but the ricotta pancakes were delicious. It took a while for the waiter to bring over the check without saying anything. I completely understand that it may have been a busy afternoon and that this may have been an isolated incident, but our waiter was so inefficient, unapologetic, and lackadaisical, we just left frustrated, unsatisfied, and disappointed.

Great restaurant and bar. Went here on a date, was crowded so we sat at the bar and the bartender was amazing. Apps arrived a little late so we got a free drink. I will come back here again for sure! Great atmosphere and music too!

Have now been for dinner a few times. Food is still quite good, but the scene is maddening and I can't justify the expense when I leave a place that annoyed. And what's with the tables outside in the middle of January? Dear hipsters, I know, it's awesome, you scored a table at Five Leaves during high brunch hour. But you are freaking eating outside in freaking January. I can't take it.
ive gone here every weekend since it opened. its just perfect. perfect food, perfect ambiance and the servers are very accommodating

Super good food, a swanky burger that doesn't try too hard and tastes good. Cool place and staff without the painfully hip attitude you might expect from this type of place. Great cocktails too, get a Muddled Margret it's gin and something I dunno but they're goood and strong.

Yum ee. I had the artisan cheese plate, the soup of the day, and shared the kale salad with my daughter.  All huge portions and all was fabulous.  My daughter had the house made ricotta - wow!  A little pricey but all well worth it.
Great food at reasonable price. Busy even on a Wednesday night but great atmosphere. Good local beer and a great cocktail menu. Fab atmosphere. Highly recommended
One of my favorites in the city.  Seriously, why leave Greenpoint when you've got a place like this?

Very tasty.  Their breakfast menu is surprisingly vegetarian while their lunch menu is much more meat heavy.  I ended up ordering the sage scrambled egg panini, and added steak to it.  It was good, as was the drink I got (The Sneaky Peat, which was a hot toddie of sorts), but of all of the delicious brunches I tried in the Williamsburg area, it didn't exactly stand out.

Awesome breakfast/lunch spot. Everything we ordered was amazing and everything the people next to us got looked amazing. We need more spots like this in south Brooklyn. Prices are fair. Service was very friendly and only slow due to the high volume of customers. Highly Recommend.

I finally ate brunch here and was really underwhelmed. First of all there are like 5 options..I guess for a place thats known for its brunch I was expecting more and more interesting stuff as well. Inside is extremely loud because dudes are making the loudest ever high brow coffee which you have to shout over ~ i guess people enjoy this charming "atmosphere", also extremely small and awkward navigating to the wc...Now to the food. I ordered the moroccan scramble which looked beautiful but was really difficult to eat because it was in a huge unwieldy pile. There was hardly any merguez in it (i think i literally found 2 little crumbs) and the taste was meh. The avacado was in-edibly lemony, the bread was huge and hard to cut through and the raw pepper garnish on top was too fiery for most people i would think. This is a great example of a huge pet peeve of mine: adorable looking food that is impractical as hell to eat and doesn't even taste good. There did not seem to be much quality control happening. My boyfriend got the "big brekkie" also pretty, his was a much better because it was simple (toast, bacon, eggs). I saw a lot of people eating the ricotta pancakes ..I guess I would stick tho those. I guess all you need in brooklyn is a good reputation.

I used to come here all the time - I really enjoy the brunch and dinner and the amazing cocktails, but you can never get in the place.  So I started ordering food to go since I live very close.  When I ordered take-out last week, a couple bites into the ricotta (one of my fave dishes!) I discovered a giant long hair that was not mine.  Had to throw it out.  I don't think I'll be able to eat food from here ever again.  I was going to give it 1 star, but decided to give 2 since I had some good experiences in the past.
Highly recommend! The truffle fries were amazing, and the five leaves burger was easy the best burger I've ever had.

I went to Five Leaves with a friend the place was packed. My friend and I waited 30-minutes for a table. During the time we waited I watched folks get their food, eat their food and sit around and chat. The pancakes looked amazing but when I got the menu and saw they were ricotta pancakes, they lost their shine. I didn't wanted pancakes with ricotta I was more intrigued when I thought they were straight up pancakes. Anyways, I spotted somebody with an amazing meal so I had the waitress bring me the same. It was good -- eggs, mushrooms and hash browns (two delish fried hockeypucks of amazing potatoes). I also got a coffee. The coffee was quite good I just wished they offered free refills (or at least A free refill). Nope, after I'd drained my coffee, a very nice, funky man who was working hard behind the bar took my mug w/o even asking if I wanted more. Sigh . . . I ALWAYS want to be asked if I want more coffee if I'm dining out. ALWAYS! Nobody really wants just one cup of coffee. Anyways . . . the food was good, the place was nice, the people were uber-funky. If that is what you like Five Leaves is for you.

Yum this place has impeccable food, even at midnight when we went. Absolutely delicious, fresh ingredients, delicately balanced dishes. We had the squash blossoms, baby squash, ricotta on bread, and five leaves burgers. All amazing. Will come back frequently.
truffle fries, ricotta pancakes, great dark coffee, the list goes on and on and on, but no matter what you are going to order, it tastes great!

Ate with friends on a recent Wednesday night. Good service. They brought us the wrong bottle of wine - it was a Rose when we'd ordered a Sauv Blanc. I blame our table tester for letting her open it despite the color, but nontheless they were good about replacing the bottle with no hassle. They keep water pitchers on the table - a huge plus in my book! Menu was a little too fancy/foreign for our party's tastes (blow fish tail?) and we all got $15 burgers, except the veggie who got a salad and truffle fries. The burgers, fries and salad were all excellent. I regret that we did not order the Devils on Horseback (dates wrapped in bacon served with dijon mustard). I bet they are amazing.
I love this place. Consistently good food. Only problem? They don't take reservations and there is ALWAYS a line!

My, oh f**king my,  the food here is delicious. The first time I came here,I was happy enough to roll out of bed and go to a nearby place with friends on a weekend, but what really made me happy was the granola and fruit...I don't know the exact name on the menu... fresh, delicious granola, greek-style yoghurt, PECANS, and LOTS of fruit (strawberries, blueberries, bananas, oh my!). I absolutely loved it- you also get a lot, so contrary to what granola might sound like, it is filling.  One of my other favorite breakfast/brunch items is the Big Breaky (sp?)-- eggs any style, very yummy hash browns (almost like potato cakes), and a choice of two sides (I usually go for avocado and roasted tomato). It comes with toast and you have the option of adding some grass fed steak slices, which are delectable. As for lunch or dinner, the Five Leaves burger is awesome! Piled high with pineapple and beet, with grassfed beef. Delectable. The kale salad is also delicious. FIve Leaves does get crowded and can pretty loud on weekends, but it's a good place to have breakfast/lunch (or indeed, brunch) or dinner. The outdoor seating area is nice and not as loud. Lovely neighborhood spot.

docking you a star, sadly, b/c service is not what it should be.  or at least service from the waitress assigned to our table could've been better, but thumbs up for the waiter who took pity on us and tried to make up for her obvious, um, inattentiveness (trying to be nice here so not going for words that would fully illustrate our frustration with this particular gal).  i like easy-going and relaxed but not when it translates to barely checking in with/on us and ignoring us when we tried to get her attention.  the food and her fellow server saved the day in the end, but really, please do try to make the dining experience less of a chore.

Visiting from out of town my sister takes me here and said that it was amazing.  Amazing to some degree but defiantly very good.  The wait was ok however if we could have been told we can take a drink out side on the sidewalk that would have been better.  We later noticed that was what some were doing.  The drinks were out standing.  I had the cuban sidecar and a Bees Knees.  Quite yummy.  The food was very good as well.  My sister and I shared the Devils on Horseback, very good.  Next we just had the green salad with croutons.  Great dressing.  Also we had the Kale which I particularly do not care for.  Finally we had the Shepherds Pie which was amazing.  Loved it.  The service was good but very quiet and just ok.  Would go back and not mind waiting for a table.  Max amount of time for wait I would give it 30 minutes.
great place ,always packed but the wait is worth it. excellent burger.and when it s sunny eat outside.
my delicious sage & egg pannini w/soy latte was the perfect post-yoga breakfast.

Fantastic! Amazing food, lively and cozy atmosphere, friendly staff. I never had to wait a long time after ordering. Being relatively new to greenpoint I have to say that this is one of my favorite spots. Highly recommended. Please order the mushroom toast. It will knock your socks off.

Didn't get a chance to try the food here, because we never got waited on.  Eventually we just gave up and left after being ignored, and the staff didn't even notice.  Maybe we'll try again sometime...
my fav. brunch spot before a beautiful bike ride.
was a little afraid of all the hipsters, but the staff was pretty friendly and people watching is always fun. the decor is cute, good coffee and yummy truffle fries.

i love this place for many reasons but I don't see the sense in waiting so long for food when there are a lot of great brunch places around...The big brekkie is yum and everything else I've had has been great but unless i have a lot of time to kill, it's not worth the wait anymore...You should definitley go if you haven't but only on a sunny day so you can soak up the sun while waiting...
