These guys make some real good brunch,  on a completely different level than most. It also has that feeling that is the mark of a good restaurant. It's a bit hard to put your finger on but its an complete, cohesive aesthetic experience that has something to do with you forgetting it's a business for a while.

Just got back from a great breakfast at five leaves. This restaurant is close to my apartment so I have been there a few times. This morning I needed a good breakfast with coffee..its getting cold out and there is nothing better than a good and yummy breakfast in a cozy environment with friendly people around. My waitress was very friendly and excellent. The sun was shining, making it feel warm in the restaurant and there were quite a few other people in the room so it was a cozy and warm/relaxed place and perfect to go to on a chilly winter morning. I had the granola and yogurt and fruit with coffee-yum!I have also been here for drinks and dinner at night as well, and everything excellent-the food and staff. The only reason I have to give four stars is because it does get a bit crowded especially at night and is sometimes too busy if you just want a relaxing dinner because it is so crowded.  Other than that I love this warm, cozy and friendly neighborhood establishment:)

I am oh-so-pleased to have a place like Five Leaves in the neighborhood. So far, I have enjoyed the cozy environs of this new little utopia on five occasions, none of which have disappointed me. I've sampled the roasted beet salad, truffle fries, pumpkin and butternut squash soups (served with crusty rustic rolls from the Sullivan Street Bakery), and the bacon wrapped dates. UH, YUM! My beloved recently indulged in the sage scrambled egg sandwich and declared that Five Leaves would be his new haunt. To boot, Five Leaves serves some of the most flavorful and pleasing coffee around. I could easily fritter away an afternoon sipping one of their cappuccinos and noshing on a roll or laze away a winter evening drinking a glass of their temperanillo and nibbling on some fries.  I will say that I have yet to indulge in a full scale dinner adventure at Five Leaves and I am slightly disappointed by the fact that though their beet root ravioli does look interesting, it is the ONLY vegetarian entree on the menu. Will it kill you to offer something other than pasta? And would it kill you to offer two options? Other than this one critique, Five Leaves has my vote as a top notch addition to the hood.

I am honestly giving Five Leaves 4 out of 5 stars because I feel like Yelp will start deleting my reviews if I am giving everyone 5 stars.  This is HANDS DOWN one of my favorite and most frequented restaurants.  It is close to my house and I know most the people who work there (because I am there all the time) and I kinda have this weird obsession with Melbourne and the people who live there, so you know...I'm kinda creepy.  You HAVE to try the five leaves burger, it is messy but incredible.  The grilled pineapple is spot on.  But my 2 favorites are the devils on horseback (dates wrapped in thick bacon) and the skirt steak.  Their steak is always cooked perfectly and the sauce is divine.  And celery root mash?  Get outta town!  Plop down at the bar and stay a while.  Oh, and prepare to wait most of the time.  I am not the only person who loves this place.  I also only rated price on dinner, if you are having a drink or two. Most of the time you can walk away with only spending $20-$30 depending on if you are going for brunch or dinner.
the greatest burger of all time.  period.  cool, comfortable spot.  enjoy.

My friend had been bothering me for over a year to try this place, so I finally did and completely regret not coming sooner.  Saying the food is amazing would be an understatment, I was literally speechless after this experience.  We began with a bottle of very reasonably priced cote du rhone red, which yes was the cheapest on the menu because thats the way it goes, but was just fine and a great way to get our appetites going.  We shared the half dozen oysters which came with 2 great sauces-a garlic chile and some sort of mignonette.  The oysters were fresh and wonderful, and the mignonette sauce which was my favorite was just perfect.  We also shared a simple appetizer of warm bacon wrapped dates with dijon mustard as an accompaniement.  The dates were huge and sweet and paired perfectly with the salty crispy bacon and the dijon cut the richness to really round out this simple yet incredible dish.  What really blew my mind though was the seared scallop appetizer which I had as an entree.  The scallops were sweet and seared to perfection, and were placed upon a bed of black lentils, wonderfully seasoned with a hint of dijon mustard and a serious slice of thick maple smoked bacon. The bacon just fell apart and just sent this dish over the top.  This was by far the best scallop dish that I have ever had in my life and literally left me speechless.  I cant wait to come back for more!

Excellent food. Our new favorite place in the area. The oysters were superb, the lamb and mussels were perfect and everything else that was ordered in our group left a smile on everyone's face. The drink menu is good as well. It's a small place with in and outdoor seating but be prepared to wait. It can get busy, but we got lucky. We had to wait for the rest of our party. After talking to a restaurant employee they said they couldn't hold a table or seat us until our entire party was there (per usual) so we went to grab a drink at a nearby bar. When we got back, as a full group, a table was ready for us. Not sure if they did 'hold' the table or our timing was just perfect, but we were seated promptly. All in all we had a great experience, loved the decor and the food and will be back for more.

Has a great neighborhood vibe. The burger is amazing and comes with an incredible pickle with Janelle C. and I are pretty sure are the spicy McClure's pickles. Great place to sit outside and people watch.

We sat at the Bar, great service and friendly staff. The sage, tomato and egg on bread was creamy, fluffy, and savory. Eggs were airy and cooked just to perfection! Subtle but clean and just the right balance of flavors. My boyfriend got the morracan eggs which was a stronger flavor, great balance if herbs with the egg, highly recommend. Bloody Mary's had a good pour and can't go wrong! All and all was a very satisfying breakfast!

I've dined here 3x in the past two years and enjoyed it each time. The service has been great (less pretentious than it seems like it would be) and the food is seasoned well. I especially enjoyed a tobacco-infused cocktail I had there a few months ago.
The pancakes alone are worth the 5-star rating. Best pancakes I've ever had, by far. Can't stop thinking about them. I'd highly recommend them to ANYONE.

Great ambiance, especially during the summer when you can sit outside.  Food is usually very good- contemporary American- delicious, creative salads and fresh, flavorful meats and fishes.  The kale salad is epic and the mussels are pretty good too!  Tip:  when you order, remind them to go easy on the salt or else you will be thirsty for the rest of your life.

truffle fries...best fries i've ever had. devils on horseback were great, but i wouldn't order the octopuse again...seemed to get lost in the sauce..sounded good in theory, but lacked any pop. place is very nice as well.
Great place for brunch and dinner. Perfect for a date, dinner with your parents or drinks with your friends. Ladies this is where all the hot bartenders are!!!

Trendy spot with good but not outstanding American dishes. I'd definitely come here again though. The atmosphere is lively and fun. It's a nice place to stop by with a small group for some conversation and standard American cuisine with an occasional vegan twist for some menu choices. For example, although not vegan, I enjoyed a large juicy burger made from free-range beef raised on a vegetarian diet, and you could certainly taste the difference. Obvious cons: service was a tad mediocre (waitress never seemed to be near and the food took too long), the place can get uncomfortably crowded, and some dishes are just, well, okay. But the pros do outweigh the cons, so I'll be back.

my wife and I have been here on numerous occasions. I am new to yelp so I'm making up for lost time. Raviolis with fois gras, excellent. Fresh oysters were great, and our knowlegable server steered us towards really complimentary wine selectons. Over all experience was great.

We waited 45 minutes for a cheese platter and tuna tar tar.  The place wasn't even packed, I'd say about tables filled.  Lamb not cooked- was still raw.  Chicken had not flavor.  It tasted like they went to the back, killed a chicken and threw it in the oven.  Suppose to come w/ eggplant puree- it did!  About 1/2 a TEASPOON of it!  Then they forgot my broccoli rabe- it came out- bitter, bitter bitter.  I couldn't eat it.  Not sure why so many people go there, maybe it's for the overpriced drinks bec it's not for the food!
Came here for brunch  Great food! Great price! Delicious almond croissant!  Only draw back is the long wait and small place.

Had a dinner for two here and the food was amazingly delicious! So glad that we decided to try something new. I took off one star because the waiter was a little bit of a dickwad (not attentive)  but lucky for him the food was outstanding..

I've been to Five Leaves several times and have always had a great experience here.  Even Sunday brunch (when I had to wait for a table for about 20-30 mins and had a drink at their bar across the street)! Consistently delicious food.  Love the black kale salad, bacon wrapped dates, BLAT with egg, and lamb they had a while back.

Lets just start by saying there must have been something funny in the water because the waitress was unusually friendly!!!! As an aspiring restauranteur in new york city i am always surprised to find an establishment where genuine hospitality is practiced. I went there on a date expecting mediocre service from some hipster in skinny jeans. BOY WAS I WRONG! Our server ( gorgeous blonde with a harmonica necklace) recommended the ricotta for first course and the pork chops. It was as though my palate had experienced something like never before. It made me forget that though extremely attractive, my date was quite boring.  Because of my experience at Five Leaves i am happy to say that i will most definitely be returning with more interesting and attractive men! P.S. Try the Moscow Mule! It's fabulous!

Love love love Five Leaves. Great early in the morning for coffee/breakfast and in the evening for dinner. Everyone who works there is super friendly and the place is beautiful. Some of my favorite things to get are: the Sticky Date Pudding , Beet Ravioli and the Fried Oysters. So happy to have found it!
Two words: Hanger Steak.  I liked it so much I told the head chef in person.  That man understands meat!
Loved everything from the delicious organic food to the decor to the very friendly owner. It felt like a neighborhood place with just an extra touch of class.
The food is wonderful, the place is cute, they play records on the bar, and they have delicious cocktails.

Hands down the best brunch and burger place in Williamsburg. I can honestly come here every single weekend for the Moroccan Scramble or Ricotta Pancakes and, of course, the Truffle Fries. YUM! The owners are sweet, hospitable, and accommodating  and the of the waiters are welcoming and funny. i, however, had an unpleasant experience with a female maitre d' who was flat out rude and nasty. Sometimes you get stuck with a kooky waitress that has no idea what she talking about, but you honestly can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Treat yourself to dessert :)

Food and coffee is delicious, but I will NEVER return. The service here is horrible.  This is beyond the typical aloof Williamsburg.  I ordered a cup of coffee to go and had the milk thrown at me, the sugar slammed down on the bar.  There are plenty of places to get good food in Williamsburg.  This is not worth the service.

I had been to 5 leaves one time prior to going the last time.  The place is tiny and can get really crowded.  The last time I went I was meeting a friend there and decided to go early to have a drink.  Well I walked in, found the last seat at the bar.  Mind you there are only about 6 -8 seats there.  And then waited and waited and waited...the bartender did not even know I existed.  So I left..I guess if you are not a regular or a hipster forget about getting served.  Oh well there are plenty of other places to go.
Tiny little place, one bathroom stall, but AMAZING food.  The brussel sprouts were the best Ive ever had.  My duck comfit risotto was divine, and great service to boot!

i moved to brooklyn from sydney, australia about 10 months ago and i can honestly say this place is my FAVOURITE cafe in new york... and i know good food, i have been to a TON  of cafes in manhattan and brooklyn and nothing really deserves a 5 star rating quite like 5 Leaves. I NEVER write reviews but i love this place so much, I had to write it a killer review.. i mean , the ricotta pancakes, truffle fries, moroccan scramble... EVERYTHING here RULES! bloody marys are great here and the staff are super nice and chilled... they are great at their job and add to the overall experience here for sure.. make sure you go here! you will probably have to wait a short while to be seated cause everyone is wanting a seat! but its WELL worth it! i promise you will be returning back like I have ever since i went for the first time, this place is super special for sure..

I recently moved to Brooklyn from LA and my friends insisted that I try this place for brunch. After a lengthy wait we were seated outside, after some wait we got our drinks and food. It was average for the price, I would say. The menu is actually pretty limited and I had to settle on the Moroccan Scramble which while adventurous, didn't actually come out well as a breakfast dish- I found it overwhelming. I had some of my friend's truffle fries which were tasty but certainly not the best I've had. All in all I'd say this place relies heavily on the Heath Ledger hype and didn't wow me in the slightest.

Have been here a few times for dinner and I have loved it every time! The food is delicious and the menu has a varied selection. The service is great as well. The only downside of this place is that it is pretty small so it can get a little crowded and loud...but this won't stop be from coming back! Love!

I want to give them a better review because the food is seriously so amazing, but I just don't like the clientele.  Am I a dick for saying that?  It's like the atmosphere that Louis C.K. describes when he talks about trendy coffee shops.  Unbelievable food though, seriously!

Kale salad - delicious.  Moroccan Scramble - delicious.  Pancakes - according to husband, delicious.  Granola - delicious.  Hamburger (regular, not the Five Leaves special one) - very good.  Some kind of trout for dinner -- good but not great. The wait for a table - starting to become a deterrent.  Tables - too close together and too small -something falls off our table almost every single time.  Ambiance -  not particularly relaxing - you need to be in the mood for a lot of togetherness.
I love this place. I crave the burger and seem to order it every time i come here, i cant help it its just so good! Also have amazing fries with truffle oil- yum!

food is realy tasty and worth 5 stars.  one of the best pancakes and tasty scrambled eggs. the only complain i have: the place  is very busy and hectic. it is not a place to relax over  a cup pf cafe and a sunday brunch. way to crowded. would be much more enjoyable if cut some 2-3 tables.

Shock health department CLOSE this restaurant by 42 points,live mice,smoking in the kitchen,shame a very well attended restaurant and can not afford a decent cleaning ???? disgusting eaten there many times but never more !!!! Check out ABC Eat !!!!!
The burger was amazing.  Everything is very healthy.  I hear it is great for brunch; the lunch menu is a little small but everything is good.  Can't wait to go back!

The food at Five Leaves is good, but my problem is with the service.  I have been twice and once the service was fine, but the second time I came for brunch and had the worst service I have had in years.  The wait staff neglected to get us menus and even when our waitress stopped by about drink orders she didn't glace down to notice we were menu-less.  Then they brought us the wrong drinks and later they brought us the wrong food.  It took forever to get anyone to get us the check.  And the icing on the cake (though not anyone on the staff's fault) is that the bench on the wall has heaters underneath it and the seats turn into a sauna.  Both times I was there I was sweating by the time I finished my meals.  I may return, but it won't be until the heat is turned off.

Can one review white hot Williamsburg hangout, Five Leaves without using the dreaded 'H' word?  We can if we dance around it, say to the sounds of the Dirty Projectors in our skinny jeans, beards and flannel shirts, with our fixed-gear bikes secured nearby.  Delicious diner/bistro food with gourmet flair, this is Nu-Brooklyn cuisine at its finest.  Serves cocktails so terrific they'll knock your Uggs off.

I was taking a trip to the McCarren Park for my soccer game with a couple of friends, when I saw this restaurant nearby- (between Lorimer St & Nassau Ave) called Five Leaves. When I walked by, a scent of ricotta pancakes was in the air, compiled with banana, and a pile of berries. It looks as good as it sounds. I would say the coffee part is a little overpriced but the breakfast is a must. So I decided to try these ricotta pancakes. They came with a mound of honeycomb butter, toppled with berries, and a whole banana. These amazing pancakes filled me up quickly, and the texture was fluffy and soft. I highly recommend this place, just come before noon and you won't have to wait like a half-an hour for a table. I would also have to say that the exterior view is amazing. Also if you get the chance, definitely try the truffle fries. They are crispy and brown on the outside with softness bundled on the inside. And they aren't even that greasy, like McDonald's or any other restaurants'.

amazing service and great food. I was told i had to get the five leaves burger and it was great-  even had a fried egg on top of it!! i'd never had anything like that before. A wonderful brooklyn spot to visit on my trip to nyc. I just wish it was easier to get a table:)

Sitting in the sunshine with a cup of lemon and ginger tea and a huge stack of beautiful pancakes in front of me laden with fruit and maple syrup is my idea of pure heaven, will come back here for sure!!
Yes, the place is a caricature of hipsterdom, but the coffee is excellent and the pancakes are rich, decadent and delicious.

Very beautiful place.  Nice for a beer or coffee.  I was very disappointed when I had dinner there though.  There were three of us and everyone's was really bad.  New York has become one of the hardest places in the world to find a bad meal, but low and behold, we found one here.  My chicken was awful, it tasted like Purdue, cooked in a public school cafeteria.  The risotto sucked, it was bland.  There was no love put into any of this cooking and the ingredients tasted like they were coming from Sysco's institutional division.  My girlfriend's trout was watery and tasteless.  It has that gross earthy taste that makes you know it is from a very industrial fish farm.  They even couldn't nail pub fair.  The shepards pie tasted like 5 day old lamb curry from an Indian Restaurant in Uraguay or something, with frozen mashed potatoes on top.  Such a shame as it looks very cool.  Also way over priced.  Unless they get there act together and start using god ingredients and get a chef who can cook, they are fucked.

the atmosphere is wonderful and has an industrial, yet comfortable feel to it, though it would be nice if it were a bit bigger, but hey, it's really cute. our waitress was really nice and extremely understanding. the lights were especially adorable and hip. but the food. i shared the home-made ricotta and the ricotta pancakes with my friend. the pancakes were really fluffy and good. it had an entire banana with blueberries and honey butter. the honey butter was SO good. but the ricotta! home made ricotta with honeycomb, sage, sea salt and figs came with delicious fruit bread was absolutely heavenly. the slightly creamy ricotta and savory sea salt combination with the aromatic scent of the sage. oh my yum. my other friends got the BLAT which was okay, though i only had a bite. i am definitely going again.
typical tiny, hipster hipster restaurant. the food is sooo tasty - haven't ever had brunch here, but would love to try! i bet it's super packed even then.

I am a huge fan of Five Leaves.  I'm sure people will think I am crazy, but I firmly believe that they have the best burger in NYC.  And I have had many, trust me. All their food is really, really good though.  Even when I don't order their burger--which is rare, but happens occasionally--I am not disappointed!  I have always had great, attentive, accommodating, fun service there.  Also, love love love their cocktails and wine list.  It's a perfect date place in that it has a sexy, romantic vibe that makes you want to sit, talk, have another cocktail, and soak up the low lighting, but it is also casual and completely unpretentious.  I like it for brunch but I LOVE it for dinner.  I would give it five stars except that, yes, the waits can be prohibitive and it is pretty pricy.  I have had a number of gasps at the bill at the end of my nights there, though part of it is always that I want to stay a little longer so I get another drink or some dessert to justify it!  I highly recommend.

when you've got a craving for truffle fries this place totally hits the spot. it is cozy but everyone is very nice and the food is kind of amazing. i ate there when it first opened and as mentioned it was hot to the point of distraction. now they have that under control and the experience is lovely. i'm particularly partial to their small plates. despite the tastiness, it feels slightly over-priced and i wish that they would add more cocktails to their drink menu.

We found Five Leaves whilst exploring Williamsburg.  Judging by the crowd spilling out onto the street and the look of the burgers and salads, we thought we'd hit on an absolute winner for food.  After  a 30 minute wait, we were finally seated.  I ordered the house made ricotta and His Lordship ordered the grilled swordfish on pumpernickel and a side of fries..  Big mistake!  We should have stayed with the burgers.  The house made ricotta comprised of a bowl of watery, salty ricotta, 3 bitter figs with the honeycomb, olive oil and thyme battling out for taste supremacy.  The grilled swordfish fared no better.  It was basically a cold  fish sandwich with beetroot dip. The fries never arrived.  We both managed to swallow a few spoonfuls and drown our sorrows in our drinks.  The waitress was astonished as to why we hadn't finished our meals. Not wanting to be obnoxious and cause a scene, I had hoped the look on my face relayed my disgust.  We didn't even bother with the missing fries. The waiting staff were hovering, waiting for us to vacate our table for the next guests, so we cut our losses and left.  I would rate that meal as the one of the worst I've had the misfortune of having.  Note to chef:  Drain the Ricotta! Taste your own food!

I've eaten here half a dozen times and can't deny that some of their dishes are quite tasty.  Unfortunately, if you also value service and fair pricing, look elsewhere.  The staff has been spoiled by the high demand (there is generally a long wait), and therefore you will find them impatient and unaccommodating.  We went there for brunch at 2:30pm, and were told there was a 1-hour wait.  We put our name in, followed by a 4-person party behind us.  After an hour, we were seated.  The 4-person party was already at the table next to us enjoying the famous pancakes and eggs we had eagerly awaited.  The waitress then handed us a lunch menu and informed us that we could no longer order brunch, which ended at 3:30 (it was 3:35).  We asked politely if they could just slip an order in as we'd waited an hour for brunch, but they tersely refused and recommended the restaurant across the street (where we ended up going and having a delicious, and more reasonably priced, meal).  If you like 6-oz cappuccinos that cost almost $4, and rude management, this is the place for you

As if this place is not busy as it is.  But, hey, they deserve the 5 stars.  I come here most often for brunch.  But have also come at other times of the day too.  The wait is very long on weekends from morning to afternoon with oodles of people spilling onto the nearby sidewalk.  The service is usually good.  The guy that keeps track of the table wait list is friendly and attentive.  Host, manager, part owner? Not sure who he is, but he has an amazing memory and always remembers you and your position in the line up to get a table.  The staff, for the most part, are upbeat, attentive and non pretentious.  The food is consistent and flavorful.  I like pretty much everything I have ordered here.  The only exceptions to that would be the ricotta appetizer, not bad but sort of bland.  Also the sage, egg breakfast sandwich was not remarkable.  The burger on the other hand is remarkable.  Delicious and I love it with the truffle fries.  Five Leave's truffle fries are like small slivers of greasy crack for me, and I almost didn't try them because I hate mushrooms!  I also really like the baked beans with eggs and toast a lot, but with that burger on the menu it makes it really hard for me to order anything else.  I always promise myself that next time I will try the pancakes because they look really good.  It's also nice to come here on cold winter nights to sit and drink wine with someone on the butt warming benches!

ABSOLUTELY PHENOMENAL!!! I got the special, which was a handmade pasta with greens, parmesan, and mushrooms. It was some of the best pasta I have ever had (even after getting back from a trip to Italy). My boyfriend got the Salmon entree and it was cooked well and was accompanied with a nice acidic tomato sauce. Salmon usually isn't something I would order, but I had some of his and it was delicious. For drinks, I got the sauvignon blanc that was actually an orange wine, which I had never had before. It was nice and dry with a bit of an acidic undertone. My boyfriend got an old fashioned and he enjoyed his as well! A great ambiance in the restaurant with dim lights and low music. Is a great date spot!

Jean-Georges' casual yet chic restaurant features amazing Mediterranean dishes, balanced cocktails, and impressive ambiance. The crab toast and brick oven pizza are amazing. And there is even a tree in the dining room for extra special flare!

Chic American restaurant with an all organic menu whose untraditional dishes work well together. Costs a pretty penny so would only go for a celebration or important date. $30 a dish. 4.25/5 stars as a dinner spot.

I went midday during the week (with a book, of course) specifically for the crab toast and a drink. The inside is very cute and the service is very pleasant. My drink was underwhelming and the crab toast was fine, but not so good that I need to come back. It's not big on flavor, so if you're into more of a refreshing lite bite, fine. I do love that it wasn't heavy, but it just didn't excite the taste buds as much as I'd hoped.

If it was possible to give six stars I would. This is a wonderful restaurant, offering both vegetarian & conventional dishes. The fried chicken was terrific as was the ravioli and pasta. Service was prompt and waitstaff was friendly & attentive. This now becomes a regular stop on our frequent trips to New York. Outstanding.

The ambience is great, I also love how all the abc restaurants are within one building but they all have different vibes and theme. Between my friend and I we shared the ravioli, broccolini and the basil, tomato pizza. 10/10 recommend. Also dessert is a must here.
Everything we ordered was really good. The mushrooms pizza and the duck main dish especially stood out.

Food, service and ambiance are all amazing at ABC. It is quite pricey, but the quality is worth it. I always have an excellent experience there. They have a varied menu with lots of vegetarian and vegan options. They also have a great wine selection!

My friend made a reservation for brunch this past Saturday and we were seated right away. I ordered the soft boiled eggs, which comes with a side of toasted sourdough bread and she ordered the carrot and avocado salad with a side of chicken. We shared the crispy potatoes with garlic aioli. I really liked my dish - it was very refreshing and reminded me of a fancy deconstructed egg salad. My friend really enjoyed her salad dish and although salads typically aren't too filling, this one was filling enough that she had leftovers. We both enjoyed the potatoes - they were super crispy and well seasoned and the garlic aioli paired perfectly. The restaurant is decorated very nicely and has a really nice atmosphere. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to others!
Food was delicious, everyone loved what they ordered and the space is beautiful - calm and intimate with a slight chic but not too minimalist interior.

The food and drinks here were great! I tried most of the appetizers, the black truffle pizza, the scallops, and the Sea Bass. Although each scoop I had was great, I was dying to reorder the Peekytoe Crab Toast and the Long Island Fluke Tartare. There was a sweetness to the crab toast that gave it sweet and savory taste and made me request another round for the table mid-way through the meal. The tartar was also delicious but instead of sweetness, the standout flavor in this dish some tangy citrus. For drinks, I mostly stayed with wine but I do recommend the ginger margarita. Overall, I would return here in a heartbeat and I hope the crab toast is still on the menu .

Phenomenal food! I would recommend the duck and crab toast. They also have a great variety of drinks, there is something for everyone. It has a beautiful atmosphere and would be great for any occasion. Can't wait to go back!

Two words - crab toast. This is simply one of the best dishes that I've ever had, and something that will keep me returning to ABC Kitchen for as long as they offer it. The rest of the menu is great too - it's seasonal and highlights the freshest of ingredients - same with their cocktail list which is always evolving (the vodka thyme lemonade is one of my all time favorites).  I typically make a reservation, but sometimes they can squeeze in walk ins. It's also conveniently located in ABC Home so you can shop while you wait!

My team hosted a small dinner here, and everything was perfect. The table setting, the servers, the attention to detail, and ofcourse food. We had a pre fixed sort of menu that included some amazing salads, chicken/fish for the main course, followed by a delicious dessert. We were sitting in a corner with very nice table setting and it wasnt too loud. Highly recommend for celebrations and group events.

The food here is phenomenal! I got the margherita pizza. Our party ordered duck , fried chicken, fries, and the brown butter cake.  Sooo good! The fries are to die for. The waiters and waitresses are nice and helpful. They took my coconut water when I had a sip left but was gone before i could say anything lol. My only suggestion would be to ask if they can take your food away first but it's ok, really great experience here!

Nice ambiance, tasty drinks, and great desserts! That green juice cocktail was amazing. Felt healthy! Haha. The desserts were great. Tasty, but not overly sweet. Just a right balance. Would come back again.

Wow ... good food .. however we just sat and waited 2 hours from the time of ordering and receiving our food ... at a time when the restaurant was not overcrowded .... there really was no reason for the painful delay nor should the customer have to figure out what was the cause of delay. The front line service people offered several apologies ... when it was time to pay and add the tip ..  and it really wasn't their fault .... but absolutely terrible service from a restaurant that charges premium prices and represents themselves as an upper tier restaurant. I felt like I was at Friendly's. A terrible experience that left all of us feeling ripped off.
A very nice and fancy restaurant with a great atmosphere. The aesthetic was perfect for a date.

Dropped by here for an after-date drink and sat at the bar. What intrigued me was the cool, yet welcoming vibe. I went at night so the lights were kinda dim  (kinda hard to read the menu).  The bartender was friendly and the dining room looked busy. Would come again to try the food. Bar seats were slightly uncomfortable, though.  The place seemed a little one-note in terms of clientele, mainly millennial and gen x folks.

Just stopped in for a late Sunday evening supper after cocktails nearby and ABC Kitchen did not disappoint. The crab toast was amazing as always. We also had some pizza, pasta and the ice cream sundae, it was all great.

The food is always good at ABC Kitchen. The atmosphere is just a little bit cold. Not in the temperature, but in the vibe. The Decour is very nice but it almost feels like an institution these days. It doesn't have a cozy feeling, which is harder to find these days in New York City restaurants. The servers are always professional and kind.
Good food and atmosphere. Great service and friendly. Accommodating. Very busy and noisy. But we could hear each other across the table. Not sure how that worked? I'd go back.

I came here for dinner with my cousins and had a lovely time. I think people come here for the ambience, dim lighting, string lights, floral arrangements, and long tables for larger parties. We ordered 2 pizzas (a spinach and goat cheese + a mushroom pizza), both which were pretty good. We also ordered ravioli, straciatella cheese which came with pita bread, and a kale salad. The portions are very small, so keep that in mind while ordering. We also ordered drinks which were quite tasty! While I won't say it was the best food I ever had, the experience was what made it a 4 star review in my mind. Staff was also very courteous!
Amazing vibes & food. We got the crab toast for an app & I got the sword fish for my meal. So yummy!

While I have eaten at ABC Kitchen many times, I had never been to brunch there until this last weekend. There were so many things I wanted to try and I changed my mind 100 times before deciding on the Dutch Baby and crispy bacon. The bacon came out very quickly, while understandably the Dutch Baby came out much later. It was delicious! The only problem with my meal is that it left me so full that I had no room left in my stomach and wasn't able to order my favorite sundae afterwards. Oh well...next time.

Service is great and the atmosphere is nice.  Everything about the food is really good EXCEPT the salt content.  Too much salt in almost everything!  Beautiful lobster roll with too much salt sprinkled on top.  Fries and chips with way too much salt. Pizza is too salty.  They should call this place ABC Salt.
The food was great - highly recommend the mushroom pizza. Very cool ambiance for an elegant yet casual dinner

I've been wanting to try this place out for a while, partially cause I saw a photo of its crab toast ahah! We came here one Friday night and got the crab toast, fries, and two pizzas (along with some beverages). I ordered the black truffle pizza and I think that was the highlight of the meal! The crust was thin and oozing with cheese and the egg! The only one thing was that I thought it was too oily for my liking but great flavor!

A for Ambiance and Service, but between the price point and the food not being extraordinary, that's why the rate. The food is good in a simple way, but it's nothing special. The salmon, for instance, that comes with "maitake mushrooms," in fact comes only with 3 and they're crispy. More than half the plate was empty, an odd appearance.

Good food plan to return. The fried chicken, pasta, and duck (though a small portion according to my dining friend) were all yummy. The apple Ala mode and chocolate cake were fab. My one critique was the supetbdim lighting really  made reading the menu and seeing the food hatd.

I've always loved abc kitchen...but the last few times I've been have been very disappointing. There is a salt monkey in the kitchen ruining the food. My duck was over seasoned. The mash was super salty. My duck was rubbery, no sear on skin at all. I had the rubber duck. So sad.
So so so good! I have a wonderful meal at ABC. I can still taste it. I highly recommend this NYC spot. I only wish I had come here sooner. Don't hesitate to go for brunch.

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ

column6: We had a group of about 10 people and honestly had some of the slowest service I have ever had in New York.  At this price point they need to be on it and not only did they take over 15 minutes to take our drink order, they also brought our first round of drinks after our mains arrived.... Food was ok but again I would say at this price point the service needs to greatly improve and I would expect a little more on the food quality as well.

The peeky toe crab & almost all of their desserts are phenomenal. However when I was there last month I ordered the duck breast & it came out extremely undercooked (almost raw). I didn't realize this in the low lighting, but shortly after taking the first bite I completely lost my appetite. They did afterwards bring me out a plate of the duck that was properly prepared but of course my whole family had already finished eating by the time this was done & after the feeling & taste of raw duck in my mouth I no longer was hungry.

Brunch was absolutely delish. It was really hard to choose between savory or sweet - there were three kinds of fresh-baked goodies and cardamon pancakes... and did I mention all the dessert, like the peach shortcake and milk chocolate layer cake? Coffee was weak but the crispy potatoes with aioli were addictive and I loved the egg sandwich with sumac hot sauce and fontina.

It took us a while to find the restaurant because of a tiny sign. The food here was mediocre but enjoyed the candlelight, pretty flowers atmosphere. We were told by our waiter that the restaurant does not offer complimentary birthday dessert. we would have to order desserts and he will put a birthday candle on top.

Such a great spot! I've been obsessed with ABC Cocina for years, and really enjoyed my past visits to ABCV. I'm happy to say ABC Kitchen more than lived up to my expectation. The ambiance is cool, the staff is friendly, and the food and drinks were awesome. I highly recommend the scallops and peekytoe crab toast. The Long Island fluke tartare was much smaller than expected- good, but not as satisfying as the other two. For drinks: although the citrus and sage was too sweet for me, the bell pepper martini was wonderful. My husband also liked the Manhattan. Finally, the much-hyped chocolate cake was a very good chocolate cake, but the apple tarte tatin was the table favorite. This is a great spot for a date night or girls night out. Very classy and hip at the same time.

We went as a group of 6 and tried over 10 dishes. 2/3rds of the dishes were so salty my throat felt parched. The prices are outrageous for the tiny amount of mediocre food you get. The only good thing was the decor and great service.  Honestly shocking how busy it was on a Tuesday night...

We decided to try this spot again after the debacle the first time and thought it was pretty good. The appetizers were amazing, we had the tar tar, calamari, and crab toast. I thought the crab toast and tar tar was best. For the entre, I had the sea bass which I thought was pretty good but not as good as the appetizers. Cocktails were interesting.

Atmosphere with a great staff/service and a meal I won't soon forget. The fried chicken was like no other... moist chicken with a crunchy fried batter that made me not care about calories. Even the desserts were super great. Make your next date night a great night.

The standard of the food has gone down over the years, and the style of the cooking is not so novel anymore. On our last visit the service was also slow / inattentive, which was disappointing. It's not bad per se but at this price point I think one can do better.

Came here with family and really enjoyed the experience.  The service was attentive, but not annoying about it while being really nice.  The cocktails were the highlight of the menu, but the food was also delicious.  I ordered the hamburger with jalapeños and fries, which was really good.  I would definitely suggest bringing friends for their cocktails and bar bites.
One of my favorite restaurants in NYC a must try beautiful establishment and food was a ten try the cornbread dessert

Having been a regular patron at this place, i used to have very high regards.  ABC used to have impeccable quality of food and service - a standard that I used tell other should match.  However, lately both the service and quality of food has gone down.  The veggie burger with pita bread today was very disappointing.  The pita bread seemed like it was grilled in a bed of oil.  I still have the oil after taste.  The service has also gone down.  We we're served the main course followed by starters followed by bread for the table.  Did not expect the service to go down with a change in managers.
Standard brunch fare. We had the burger and salad. Solid and tasted well. Interior was really nice and so was the service.
Always a classic go-to for a special occasion or date night! As you can see, seafood options are delicious.
Lovely place! The dessert peach shortcake was amazing, so was the sea bass and crudo! The roasted carrot salad was also very good! Lunch is not as busy, so I do recommend stopping by in the day ~

A classic New Yorker scene. Great food, healthy options, cocktails are divine, and ambience is always a high energy dining experience! Definitely recommend. Great for a corporate meal, date, or to take friends visiting from out of town. It's a very rustic farm to table vibe!

I'm glad indoor dining has resumed in NYC, and I can enjoy the dinner without suffering from the chilly winter. The entrance of the restaurant is very low-key and easy to miss at night. I like the decor and ambience in the main dining room. The food were tasty, and the service was great. I was so full after the dinner. The only downside was the time limit on dining due to limited capacity during the pandemic. Would love to come back again after the pandemic.
Great food, especially the crab toast. There was also a fish dish that came in some broth that was excellent but I don't remember the name. Can't wait to go again.
The food was absolutely delicious and the ambiance was warm and inviting. I highly recommend.

First visit to this long established place. It was good, if not a bit routine. Fried chicken was moist and large portioned and the side of mashed potatoes typically of comfort. Tuna ceviche appetizer was also good. A restaurant to return to for a satisfying meal but not one for an excellent meal of surprise and uplift.
Do, good food, limited menu. However, service is horrible. Don't come on a Cridsy. They are too busy snd don't really care for you or your business. They seem to have plenty.

This place was fantastic! I dined at ABC V with a few colleagues and we all enjoyed pretty much everything on the menu. I am not a vegan or vegetarian but I did leave full and wanting to incorporate these meals into my lifestyle
Such a great vibe and lovely food and cocktails. It was quite warm in the middle of summer, but we didn't mind.
Absolutely love this place from the ambiance, decor to service! If you are in New York, this is a must try place!

The ambiance was beautiful, lighting low but not impossible to see..very soft.  Food was delicious we shared the Peekytoe Crab appetizer, and the entrees were fried chicken, scallops and sea bass.  All perfect.  Service was wonderful. Will definitely return. My only complaint was I wanted more food  because it was so good.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY

column6: I love their crab toast and caramel popcorn Sundae is one of my favorite desserts ever. Very cute decor and pleasant ambiance. Perfect for dates and weekend brunches.

I came here for dinner recently and absolutely loved the place! The ambiance is incredible, the food was very good, and the service was the best part (shout out to our server Omar who was amazing - give that man a raise!) Highly recommend it.

Excellent server, food and drink  was grt, fun and  simple ambiance but need big improvement on desserts for real. Had chocolate cake ( which was so average, had better ones in cheaper price) and panna cotta was good but nothing special. Beside desserts everything else was excellent.

We were able to snag a last minute reservation for Sunday (2/20) brunch. The decor is stunning, the food is divine, and most importantly, our server Allie, was a delight - professional, courteous, and full of personality. One word of advice - save room for the apple cider donuts!
Bad service. Sat down for half an hour, no water or waiter to help us order anything. Tables came in later than us got faster service. Would recommend avoiding this place

Loved my experience for brunch at ABC Kitchen. The inside was very trendy and the decor was cute. I got the cardamom dutch baby pancakes which were delicious. Had a very unique taste but very hearty for a breakfast. We also got some potatoes and bacon for the table and the bacon was crispy and divine. Loved my strawberry champagne too.

First off, this place is lovely in terms of atmosphere and overall vibe. The bar area is a great place to have a cocktail or sample some appetizers. Went here one evening to meet up with former colleagues. It was early in the week -perhaps a Tuesday, and the place was packed. We were seated at a table and the room got darker fairly quickly. The crowd was great but it was difficult to talk due to the acoustics. Our drinks took forever to come -and no one really checked in on us while we waited. So, once the server came back we quickly put our order in since service was slow. Our appetizers also took forever, and were tasty but smallish portions. The rest of our food also took forever and a day-and were good but nothing fantastic. One of us in our party wanted to change out their cocktail because it was wrong , and we had to wait and wait again for someone to come by, we finally flagged someone ! Service here is sorely lacking and does not match the prices. If you want to venture in save yourself the wait and grab a drink at the bar and an appetizer. Not sure if this is Michelin star-if so, they(michelin star peeps)  need to revisit that status asap !  :)

Quality and service used to be unmatched here. Sitting at bar for brunch at this moment. Bar server obviously does not want to be here - no personality or energy or respect. Drink was good. Ordered eggs Benedict and asked the whites to not be runny or undercooked. Served edible but definitely whites were raw and undercooked. All food served on chipped plate. Disappointing.
The food and service is good. They have an extensive wine list which is great. I recommend the burgers or any pasta they have. Their fried chicken is also really good.

Really good food, really conveniently located just off of union square. I really liked the feel of this place as well as it is exquisitely decorated. Didn't have any specific dish that was so stellar to recommend, and it was on the pricier side, but if you are in the area this is a solid choice.

I gave it one star because there isn't another option! I went there on the 12th of December and got food poisoning from their raved burger. Four hours after eating, I was throwing up and stuck to the toilet for hours! After reaching out to them to let them know what happened, no one returned my call!! Horrible service! Stay clear of this place!

This is an incredible, elegant spot near union square. The chef puts his own twist on each dish and they are all incredible. Didn't feel like drinking so I ordered the Red Juice (strawberries, beets, honey) and it was amazing. Don't skip out on starter salads or dessert because they're just as good as the main course and everything is so fresh and healthy that you feel great and energized after. Can't wait to come back!

Good service and good food. Portions are small and prices are big, but it's New York and Jean Georges restaurant so it's to be expected. We only ordered two meals, strozzapreti with spicy bolognese and potato mushroom (and what I think may have. We beet) pizza. Both very delicious. We will be going back to try other items on the menu. Dining room is large and your are NOT sitting on top of other patrons which is a big plus.
Temperature screening when you enter. All servers masked and gloved. Social distance between dinners. The food as usual especially the Black Sea bass!

Sadly, ABC Kitchen after Covid has been such a disappointment. Turnover in staff has left the restaurant ill-equipped to manage high quality and knowledgeable waitstaff. When I dined there in August 2021, my appetizer  included seasonal melon which was rock hard and unripened. When I mentioned this to the waiter, he shrugged and did not know how to respond. Another waiter came by, and said that the melon was the best the chef had. I told the second waiter that the chef should not serve unripened melon, but I got just another shrug. It's sad when management doesn't care about providing the highest quality service of the highest quality food.
The indoor ambience of this place feels so fresh and pristine. Yummiest drinks ever. Really sweet employees. Cool find
ABC kitchen is one of my favorite dinner spots in town and continues to be! Their lobster is to die for.

10/10 no doubt. they combined all the restaurants due to covid so we tried one thing from each and just wow. I go to a lot of restaurants but there are so few i'd end up back at and this is one of them. top tier restaurant for sure.
Fresh ingredients with great combinations . Lovely organic setting with a discreet nod. Staff a little ridged for our liking but a must visit.

I feel bad posting this because I understand the strain covid has put on the dining industry - but I don't want others to come here and waste money.  Do NOT go here post/during COVID. We loved ABC prior to covid but is sadly not the same now. We received terrible service, the outdoor area was incredibly non pleasing and the food was just not good. The chips and salsa looked like we just bought it from Trader Joe's. Food was not fresh, pretty sure the corn was from a can. Extremely limited menu which is understandable during COVID but still things ran out. We were never offered drink refills and had empty water with no napkins or silverware  for 20+ minutes. Especially at the unreasonably high price point- total disappointment. Will not be returning probably ever

I've been coming here with my family for so many years now for birthday celebrations and other special occasions. Their food is incredible. It is expensive, but for a splurge every so often I couldn't recommend this place more. The service is wonderful, and you can tell there is a paced feel where you aren't rushed out. My good friend and I recently spent three hours there chatting and having dinner and they didn't bat an eye, which I really appreciate! Not sure why the average is only 4 stars, they deserve 5!
ABC Kitchen, you can do better with speaking to customers over the phone. Bad manner of talking, no professionalism, almost rude...

This is an awesome place to go with a group.  The service is so generous - they give you all the time you desire and come only when you need them.  I like that!  We were here for 3 hours on a Saturday (you must make a reservation or this is not an option), and tried many items "family style".  I LOVED the squash blossom pizza!  OMG I will come back just for that and NOT share it with anyone!  Burger was good, meat and cheese platter was also good.  What is GREAT are the drinks.  I have a feeling everything on the menu here is pretty amazing.  Also, the Union Square farmers market is right there, so its a nice way to spend a Saturday in the city.

The food and service was great! My truffle pizza with an egg was so good I got it twice. Not to mention their red bell pepper martini! So delicious. Didn't take a lot of pictures because we were hungry when we got there and forgot but we got the crab toast and my husband a pasta dish that was really good too. I can't wait to be back in NY and eat in this place again.

Amazing food, great ambiance, and helpful staff. The ricotta toast is one of my favorite dishes. There are three ABC restaurants, I'd recommend trying each one as they all have a different vibe and different menus, drinks, etc.
The ambiance was so nice and the food was just amazing. Our waiter was very kind and thoughtful. I highly recommend going here!

Went here for brunch with a friend while in New York and overall, it was a lovely experience! Upon walking in, the decor is captivating and welcoming. There are beautiful antique chandeliers and wall fixtures that give it a very artsy vibe. Our waiter was attentive, but not pushy. I ordered the goat cheese and spinach omelette and my friend got the shrimp salad. Our waiter also brought out a complimentary toast with crab on it, which was delicious. At the end of our meal, we asked the host to take photos of us with the decor and he was very obliging and sweet about it.

Jean George still got it!!! Service was great, atmosphere is beautiful and the food is still consistently amazing.  The truffle pizza, caramel popcorn sundae, and cavatelli with duck ragu were the standout's for me.

i came here for restaurant week and everything was amazing. each course was flavorful and of great quality, but this CAKE. i literally dream about this cake. the chocolate ganache paired with crunchy chocolate ball bits, and the marshmallow coating.... this is my dream cake and i let it live in my mind rent free.
I live between LA and NYC but this is still in my top 2 favorite restaurants! Get the beets with homemade yogurt as a starter...so fresh and delicious. Also, I never skip the caramel popcorn sundae!

We went to ABC kitchen for my boyfriend's birthday and had a reservation. The atmosphere and place was overall nice. However, the only downside was that our food took a long time and we noticed those around us that got seated later and ordered later, receive their entrees before us. It was overall crowded and busy, so I think the experience could have been better if the staff was more attentive and the food didn't take an hour to get to our table.

I came here for dinner by myself before a show and sat at the bar.  Food starts being served at 5:30 pm.  I really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.  The bar area is very pretty.  I had the ravioli and their service was quick.  They were very attentive to me and I enjoyed my dinner and reading during it.  It is not an inexpensive meal but I only had the one entree.  They also gave bread with olive oil.
Came back after being here years ago. It was a great atmosphere and meal. Service was as expected. They even sat us earlier than our reservation time...which helped us.

For the amount of hype this place gets, my expectations were not completely fulfilled. Atmosphere was great. Service was decent. Food wasn't particularly bad but didn't match the price point. Braised beef was my favorite dish; and it was served some root vegetables and a nice gravy. Salmon was decent, but not spectacular. Unsure if I would make a return back to this place.

Great service and delicious food! I always enjoy their food seasonally changed. Been here several times and all my experiences are fabulous. Beautiful restaurant with delicious food - the decor is really really beautiful and creative. I highly recommend this spot.

My group came to ABC kitchen last minute with no reservation (whoops) and they still found a way to get us a seat rather quickly. I'm glad they did because I loved every dish. The tuna sashimi was unexpected but amazing and flavorful. Same with the fluke, I can't decide which was better. The lobster dish did not disappoint, but was also relatively classic. Cookie plate was a fun ending, would recommend!

Absolutely amazing dining experience. The food was phenomenal and was presented so nicely. The environment was elegant yet not too fancy. We had multiple dishes and were very satisfied. Great place for birthdays, anniversaires, or special occasions.

I had high expectations coming here after an amazing meal at ABC Cocina, and it did not disappoint! The service was very friendly, but didn't really standout to me. Although inside the restaurant is was quite dark for my liking, the food made up for it! My sister ordered the lobster, and it was literally just lobster with nothing accompanying so she was still hungry and had some of my black truffle and fontina whole wheat pizza (which was so. good.), so if you get the lobster, I do recommend ordering a side/small app. The menu is fairly limited as well.

I like the happy vibe! Fresh flowers, Casual chic, beautiful people, very friendly barman and waitress. Crab toast was incredible. My husband loved the fried chicken and I had a beef loin which was perfect! They brought us a dessert for our anniversary which was very nice!

I've been coming to ABC for three years. I came last week for brunch and it took over 1.5 hours to receive Eggs Benedict. The waitress assured me several times it would be out any minute. I had to beckon her several times in intervals of 15 minutes to check on it.  She finally admitted there was a mix up in the kitchen. I was expecting to not pay for it, however the waitress did not refund us but instead brought us an ice cream sundae. I am dairy free. I won't be coming back.

Highly recommend! Came with a group and enjoyed excellent service and ambience. Very vegan friendly and accommodating. I couldn't believe the cauliflower soup was vegan-you must try it! They had a custom vegan main, which was mushrooms and potatoes in a delicious broth. Everyone enjoyed what they got, from fish to pasta. Do make a reservation in advance :)

This is a solid restaurant and worth going to, but for me, it was also somewhat disappointing. It's just that with so many restaurants of this caliber to compare it to, this restaurant didn't wow me. The food was good. Not great. I do have dietary restrictions so that could influence my perception of the place, but I've encountered enough talented chefs who don't let that impact flavor. So yes, definitely come here. You'll be impressed by the friendly service, the great decor and the fun beverages. And don't get me wrong! The food is good. But if you ask me to dinner this Friday... I won't be asking you to take me back here.

Lovely! We went for lunch during restaurant week. Bread is served with oil. The cauliflower soup was delicious. It had a little spice to it, but not too much. The salmon salad for lunch was also a treat. The notes of fennel we were a nice touch.

Mmmmm yum! Really enjoyed this place for lunch. Lots of options and we tried a free things. Coffee was good. The ravioli was amazing and so were the roasted carrots. I would highly recommend this place to someone visiting New York. The service was amazing. Food was fresh and everything went off without a hitch.

It's good but not excellent.the asparagus was 2 pieces around $20-it was tasty but not special. The arris con pollo was the best thing I ate and I've had much better elsewhere. Margs were good and strong

For a check that was over $300 for 2 people, I find it ridiculous that ABC Kitchen was out of bread for a 9:15 PM reservation and they packed my black sea bass dish with soup in a porous container that COMPLETELY leaked through the paper bag within the less than 10 minute ride home.

3.75 stars, rounded up. The ambience and staff at this restaurant are great. The menu seems unique. I was not wowed, and I generally am somehow with something at a restaurant of this caliber in NYC when I visit. The arugula salad was good. The crab toast was great. I ordered the tagliatelle with shaved black truffles and fresh mozzarella. I even asked our server what she thought and she said this was a favorite. I was really excited, as I generally am for delicious pasta. This dish was actually beyond boring. Which is hard to do with black truffles, right?  The flavor profile was bland. Nothing stood out, including the truffle taste. The sauce was just ok, nothing extra to add pizazz. Could maybe use some red chili flakes or something to kick it up. Sun dried tomatoes or spinach or mushrooms or SOMETHING. Anything for a $34 pasta that I would pass up for the mushroom ravioli at Olive Garden (yes I went there, to the Walmart of Italian restaurants). The sea bass was also just ok as was the ravioli (very plain dish). Not sure that I would return but the company was good and we had a good time.
Very fancy, white table cloth restaurant. There was construction going on when I visited so I walked past it a few times. The meals are very light and made w delicacy.

I had dinner yesterday at ABC Kitchen yesterday and it was a terrible experience.  The service my waitress Alex provided I found to be extremely rushed.  I've been here before and have had a great time so it much to my surprise.  I was on a date and merely trying to enjoy my company.  The service was obtrusive, rushed and ill timed.  I have worked in the industry so I understand points of service.  Alex was determined to put us on her timing which caused much friction and never took head to any clues or warning of such service.  She had other people interact with the table as a way of being determined to have her way of rushing service to turn the table.  I found this extremely off putting as others around me seem to be able to enjoy their company at a casual pace.  If I had known ABC Kitchen was a 'turn and burn' type restaurant I would chosen somewhere else.  The last time I was there Nathan gave me his card personally so this is why I thought ABC Kitchen was a good choice.  I think the ambiance is nice but wouldn't come back if management condones such behavior from waitstaff.  At no point did Alex take any hints to my dissatisfaction which was aweful.  My evening should have been about me enjoying my company instead of a privileged server feeling that she could do no wrong and then assigning other to approach the table to rush service.  Sincerely, Jason
Terrible service. Bland food. A very disappointing way to spend a few hundred dollars.

Tucked away and unassuming but very spacious and too quaint and cute for words. Came in for a group of six at lunchtime on Monday and they were super accommodating and friendly staff. We had the mushroom pizza which if you love mushrooms, this is a must have. Also had the calamari which was good but the sauce stole the show. Great for business lunch or would be sweet spot for brunch.
Loved this spot!  Came to meet a girlfriend for lunch and ordered the salad with grilled chicken.  It was special!  Service was great and so was the cappuccino!  Will definitely come back!
I ate inside when we were still able too but you can also sit outside. The crab toast is Devine as well as the sandwiches. Fries are fabulous. I got latte and mimosa

If I could give this place six stars, I would. The ambiance, the food, the service... everything was excellent. We got white truffle stracciatella which was on special. It melted in our mouths. Then we had tuna sashimi which was good and fettuccini with Brussel sprouts and pesto was so delicious as well. Overall, this place is amazing. Definitely coming back when I'm in NYC
Love the decor and service. Food was okay. Very little portion and on the pricey side. We ordered pizza and pasta. Pizza was a little too dry/overheated. Pasta were good.
Went for brunch, got the turkey and bacon. The sandwich was delicious. The bread and the herb mayo they used accentuated the already superb organic ingredients. I will definitely be back again.

Terrible service.  Waited for 10 min before we had ask them to serve us water.  Another 10 min before the waitress gave us the menu.  Half way through us placing an order she walks away and comes back after two minutes.  Food used to be fantastic, just about ok now.  This was one of our favorite restaurants and we chose it for a special occasion.  Never again!

I want to like this place but it's not letting me. I had a reservation for two, my friend arrived a few minutes early but was not allowed to be seated. Food was barely satisfactory, my salad appetizer was way over salted I didn't even finish, the main course salmon was slight better. The cake was very firm and too sweet. I left very hungry. Also I wasn't very fond of the decor here, a rusty pipe was right above my head, not sure if it was done on purpose or what. Overall I'm rather disappointed given this is one of Jean Georges' restaurants.
Luv the restaurant ambiance , service top-notch....food decent. Luv the mushroom pizza but pasta was ok.

Fun and great atmosphere. Loved decor and all that the restaurant stands for. The calamari was coated in pretzel crumbs which was very mild tasting but delicious. The crab toast was delicious and unique. Full of flavor and different that the norm of what you "normally" get on a menu, it was very light and flavorful. My pasta with bolognese was very good and spicy. So if you don't like spicy then stay clear. The porkchop on the menu was heavenly it was so juicy and tender and the apples added the perfect combo. It was spectacular. Got the shaved brussel spout slaw and it was bland, wouldn't get that again. Our server was super nice, but our service was slow at the same time. Needed to ask for a refill and to have my bread plate cleared after removing everything else. Overall, very minor and would definitely go back.

You'd think a restaurant that charges $34 (including tax and tip) for a cheeseburger would have the foresight to put slam-guards or a jointed-arm or felt-strips on the door to prevent it from smashing shut. Not even so much as weatherproofing or draft-stoppers so that the hostess wouldn't need to wear such a luxurious shawl for warmth! Meanwhile, I stood there--completely unacknowledged--waiting for a few minutes as the hostess continually chatted-up some lucky guy to whom she eventually gave a card before deigning to recognize that I existed... So much slamming! Slamming & slamming & slamming... But how could anyone possibly expect oversight from the administrators when the very next (jittery fidgety erratic sporadic) person I encountered couldn't even make eye contact or focus on any one thing for one single second... What an unbelievably uncomfortable experience... Ew...

Happiest place on earth. My heart sings with every traceable bite.  Their commitment to high quality local, organic, and sustainable food is really wonderful.  Consistently delicious since the day they opened. The crab toast is by far my favorite. Yogurt and beets are a must. Pizza with farm egg is wonderful, but so is the basic and perfect margarita pizza.  The chocolate chip cookie is like magic. And once upon a time, they had a smoothie bar in the back with mind blowing creations. I think I still have the menu.  I could go on and on. Clearly nothing but cheesy love for ABCkitchen. Thank you, JGV!

The ambiance of the restaurant was fabulous but only come if you've got money to spend because the waiters laughed when our group of mid 20s sat down and only ordered salads and one drink. They expect every table to be spending $500+ which quite frankly, I just can't afford. Sorry I didn't order the truffle pizza for $108...

A posh, country styled eatery that features organic dishes on a fun atmosphere.  Enjoy a mid day brunch with biscuits and jelly doughnuts.  The juices are succulent and if you can reserve the large wooden table, I highly recommend it.

Beautiful and spacious restaurant!  Really something when you walk in!  Drinks were good, appetizers were great.  Looooved the ricotta with strawberry preserves.  Had the cheeseburger and the sea bass.  Honestly...the sea bass (replaced with red snapper) wasn't great.  VERY bland and not at all impressed.  The cheese burger was really good....tons of flavor.  Although I wasn't thrilled with my entree, I would absolutely go back.  Everything else was awesome and the vibe of the restaurant was better than I expected!
The food is terrible now. The service is so slow and they aren't even nice. don't ever come. I'm trying to help you save money

Super disappointed in a Monday night dinner at a restaurant we used to love. Cocktails were great but the food was pretty bad. Almost everything we ordered was oversalted but otherwise tasteless.  Listless, greasy fried chicken and a pretty dull version of the restaurant's well-known carrot and avocado salad were two of the misfires. When we mentioned the cook's overly heavy hand with salt to our waitress she shared that we weren't the first that evening to report similar sentiment.

I ordered the crab toast. Pretty good, but felt that the bread was overtoasted and too hard. It was also too salty and had waaay too much mayonnaise and oil. There was a generous amount of crab, which was very fresh and tasty. For $16, the portion size is on the smaller side. It was cut into four pieces, so good for sharing as an appetizer, but not filling if eating as a main.

ABC Kitchen is an NYC classic. I remember not being able to secure a reservation here pre-covid. We ended up being able to make a reservation rather easily. The service was very slow, it took a while for us to get seated, and then a while for the food to be ordered. We got the mushroom pizza, burger & fish of the day. Food was great, I have no complaints about that whatsoever. Everything was cooked well and was delicious. If they can work on the service, that would be my only two cents.
Great service and amazing ambience. The food it's phenomenal, as I already anticipated.
Favorite chicken entree and atmosphere in Flatiron! Always a lovely menu, wine list and good crowd.

I was so excited to check this place out because of the reviews and general hype, but dad to say it was probably one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. We ordered the meat and cheese platter to start and the prosciutto smelled a bit weird and had excess fat on it. When I told one of the employees, they told me that's the way it comes. I come from a meat and cheese background and that's not how it's supposed to be. I asked for crackers but they said the best they had was toasted bread, but even that came out extremely burnt. Our drinks were watered way down. My friends ravioli had one peice of burned or over cooked ravioli. And the burger I ordered medium well was medium at best. Fries were coldish and droopy. Within 35 minutes we paid the check and left. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. It may have been great at one time, but can't say the same now.

Really beautiful restaurant with lots of space and a nice big bar. I was there with a group of four and we were able to get some appetizers to all share along with a few entrées that we all nibbled at. The fried chicken is absolutely delicious, and is single-handedly one of the reasons that I plan to return. The yummy cocktails are great as well. The restaurant wasn't too crazy at 5 PM on a weeknight, but you may look to book a reservation for more popular nights.

It was okay, but just okay. The decor is beautiful, service was great. The drinks were amazing. The food was just basic, nothing impressed me. We got pizza, fried chicken, burgers, tartare, calamari. It all just left a lot to be desired... it was basic.

Fun, modern and romantic atmosphere.  Crab toast is five stars - wonderful ratio of flavorful crab on perfectly toasted bread.  It is simple and refreshing.  Wasn't as big of a fan of the spinach ricotta pizza, although the texture of the crust was divine, in my opinion the flavor was a little too yeasty and the cheese was a little too strong.  Sea bass was delicious - outside had a nice crust on it and the lemon added a good twist.  The almond cake itself was five stars! However, I think that it would be better paired with a creamier ice cream/sorbet.  The almond and pear garnish enhanced, but the pear sorbet didn't really compliment the cake - it was a little too icy and overpowering.  Perhaps a lighter pear ice cream (or even vanilla or milk flavored) would bring the dish to five stars in my mind.  Will definitely be back to try other items on the menu.

I really enjoyed this spot! the servers were all very welcoming and sweet. The food made everything better. We had the roasted carrot and avocado salad, the crab toast, and mushroom pizza. I can't decide if i like the salad or the pizza more. The salad had a very authentic taste to it. It remainder me of a middle eastern dish. There was a great vibe in the place dimmed lights and nice decor.

Awesome, fresh food. The crab toast is incredible and has a little kick to it. The eggs benedict is perfectly cooked and sitting on a fresh and homemade English muffin. And not to mention the cocktails; the ginger margerita is fantastic, and the bartender was excellent and delightful. Highly reccomend.

We booked a large group dinner here for my birthday. Quick response, and very easy booking process. We chose from a list of items for each course and everything was amazing. For market table we got squash toast, crab toast, and roasted beets. My favorite were the two roasts but the beets were also great. For apps we got roasted carrot salad, kale salad, calamari, and ricotta. My favorite was the carrot salad. For entrees we got ravioli, salmon, fried chicken, and pork chop. The best was the fried chicken and salmon. For dessert, we finished off with chocolate cake, almond cake, and sundae. If you can, get all three! They were all so amazing and so different in their own way. Can't wait to come back!

Food is mediocre and overly priced. Servers are arrogant, rude, condescending, and maybe a touch racist?..just atrocious. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place, there are plenty of other great restaurants in NYC.

Love this place. ABC is also known for their furniture company which I love as well. Had their crab toast which was absolutely delicious and the bass as my entree-phenomenal. Service was a bit slow, but all-in-all, great experience as always. This is one of my favorite farm-to-table restaurants. Great for lunch and dinner. Try making reservations few days ahead as their availability runs out quickly if you try to make it on the same day you want to go. i'd say the dress code can be business casual, but no strict dress code.

The fiod quality is so good .. Crap toast ,chicken liver toast..( appetizers) are amazing , entrees are very good quality mushroom pizza and sausage pasta.. Just the service is Little slow .. atmosphere is great and elegant

Brunch: we had the crab toast (delicious), and the scrambled eggs & potatoes, and scrambled eggs & oysters. Portion sizes were a lil small (not enough to feed this hungry hoe.) And it was a bit expensive for a pretty average brunch. The service was GREAT though, Jocelyn was really nice & attentive. However, it took us a while to be seated and the hosts were abrupt. Also, Google Maps is wrong. You can find the restaurant below abc carpet & home.

It is an absolute delight to dine here every time! I came here to get a quick lunch with my husband. The place is rustic and inviting. I love how the food translates into the space. It is interconnected and makes sense. We had a reservation and were shown to our tables promptly. Our host was very polite and answered all the questions I had for him. We got started of with a basil lemon soda and a gin based cocktail. They were very good. We got the heirloom tomatoes and the cucumber coconut soup which was also very fresh and rustic. For the entrees we got the salmon and the veggie burger. The salmon however was a little overdone and the veggie burger was decent. We ended our meal with an almond panna cotta which was perfect. This is a place to come to get a meal which focuses on making the fresh market produce shine.

This used to be my favorite restaurant in NYC but I went here for Thanksgiving dinner and was very disappointed. The service was terrible, and the food was just decent. I had emailed them to ask if they had a specific Thanksgiving menu and never heard back, and didn't see a special Thanksgiving menu on their website or social media (or any mention of a holiday prix fixe), or anywhere on Resy where I made the reservation, so I assumed they were just offering their normal menu. I was shocked when we sat down and it was $168/person for a 3 course prix fixe menu that was items they normally offer for twice the price of what the same items normally cost. A table next to us told us not to order the Turkey as they were leaving because it wasn't good, and the two other tables next to us had to send their food back and also complained about the service. There are many other restaurants in NYC that I'd rather spend $400+ on dinner.
One of our favorite restaurants in NYC. Best suited for birthday/celebration/friends & family in town.

Heard many great things about ABC Kitchen, so I knew I had to try it out. When walking in at night you will find it to be a nice low-lit environment - perfect for a family dinner or date. II shared two entrees: the Asparagus Pizza and the Fried Chicken. Wow! The asparagus was tasty. Light on the stomach and has a unique flavor - definitely a good option if you want something healthier. The fried chicken was amazing as well. It was very crispy while still being nice and tender on the inside. The sauce that it came with was sweet and spicy; it went perfectly well. The service was great, the prices were fair, and overall I left highly satisfied.
Food is good, vibe is great! It's a little bit dark but it makes good and romantic mood. I love this place!

It took a while for me to snag a Saturday night dinner reservation, but it was well worth the wait! I had the fried chicken over greens with hot sauce butter. The serving size was very generous, chicken was tender and juicy covered in a panko-like coating, and the hot sauce butter perfectly balanced out the dish. The atmosphere was pretty and upscale without being pretentious. ABC Kitchen is a new favorite!

Grabbed a little bite to eat here for lunch. The ambiance really set the tone for what would be a great lunch. Ordered the Turkey Cuban which was nothing shy of spectacular. Always been a softy for crusty bread. Of course I had to pair that with a nice glass of white wine.
