My friend and I sat at the bar by the front door. I had the prix fixe lunch for $25, which is definitely worth it. The beet and yogurt salad is awesome; I didn't even know there were non-purple beets and I actually like them better! The hake was cooked very nicely and the mustard sauce was delicious, but my one complaint is that there was too much black pepper in the dish. My friend had the gazpacho, which was good and definitely tasted like strawberries, but not overwhelmingly so. We shared the strawberry dessert which was scrumptious! And lighter than others, I'm sure. I love the ambience, such wonderful decor. Great place!! I will definitely be going back again and again.

My dinner at ABC Kitchen on Thursday night was the best meal I can remember!! It was the perfect place for my family -- beautiful design, relaxed but elegant vibe, not too loud, and most importantly, AMAZING food!! Between the four of us, we got the crab toast, salmon tartare, and cauliflower dish to start. The crab toast was RIDICULOUS. I'm still thinking about it. A must-have for sure. Salmon tartare was also amazing. Perfectly grilled sourdough bread as the base for both the tartare and the crab toast. We ordered the cauliflower dish with the egg on the side because I don't eat eggs, even though the waitress cautioned us that it might be a little dry--It was THE MOST DELICIOUS CAULIFLOWER I've ever had in my life!! Even my dad who doesn't love vegetables like I do agreed. Then for our main dishes we had the house made spaghetti with chanterelles, the tomato basil pizza, the burger, and the sunchokes. The spaghetti is now one of my top five favorite pasta dishes (along Scarpetta's spaghetti, and Spago's sweet corn agnolotti), and the sunchokes were an amazing seasonal special. Definitely get them while you can! I did not try the burger but they loved it, and the pizza was solid. I've definitely had better as far as the dough but their tomato sauce is really delicious. The pinot noir and blood orange bellini were also excellent with the meal. And for dessert, I had heard so much about their salted caramel sundae that we had to try it and it definitely lived up to the hype!! We also got the doughnuts that were perfectly light and airy. All in all it was an unforgettable meal. ABC Kitchen is definitely my new favorite restaurant in NYC! SO GOOD!

We had such a great dinner here this past weekend. The actual restaurant decor is the perfect blend of contemporary but comfortable, rustic but elegant. Everything we had tasted great (ginger margaritas; roasted carrot and avocado salad; tuna sashimi with ginger and mint; fried chicken and collard greens; skate with kale; salted caramel sundae). My only complaint is that there were so many things that looked good, and we were only two people. I look forward to returning and exploring the menu again.

It took a month to get a reservation here, so we were very excited to try this place out. I'm a huge fan of Pipa (also attached to ABC Home) and sorry to say this place didn't live up to our expectations. In fairness, they were very high. The wines are very affordable and we enjoyed ours alot. The ambiance is very sexy with a dash of home comfort, but the food was just alright. It's an expensive meal and didn't live up to the hype. I'd come back if I was trying to impress an out of towner for drinks at the bar, but probably not come back on my own.

I attended a work dinner at ABC Kitchen. We ordered dish after dish, each of which were impeccably prepared, delicious and inventive. The cocktails were hit or miss, but that wasn't what we had come for anyway. The service is top notch and the atmosphere unparalleled in New York. Although it is expensive, the quality and experience are well worth the price. I would definitely return for a dinner out with family or celebratory dinner with friends. The setting lends itself to special group occasions.
Went for brunch and it was just okay. Didn't live up to the hype and overpriced. The environment is lively and trendy but wouldn't come back here.

there's always a long wait for brunch but i don't care, the food is so yummy. service can be a little slow, but the foods always solid. I love their handmade sodas (can drink a whole gallon). my favorite brunch item is the smoked salmon with potato cake, a little spicy and the salmon literally melts in your mouth. food is consistent every time i go.

This is my favorite restaurant in New York, hands down.  I've been here about a dozen times and love everything about it from the decor to the wait staff's uniform to the cocktails to of course, the menu which is full of organic and sustainable options.  I  only wish it was on the west coast so I could frequent it more often.
One of the best JG restaurant. Lunch is better value.
Excellent restaurant across the board- been back 4 times with friends, boyfriend, and family members and all enjoyed as much as I do!!

Dined with some friends of mine for brunch today, (Saturday 8/31).  THIS PLACE IS INCREDIBLE.  We enjoyed everything from apps to dessert. Drinks were amazing. Had to wait for a table, but didn't mind since cutest hostess at the front (long brown hair, blue eyes, perfect smile) Our server was great, attentive, and informative. There aren't enough words for the food. Perfect all around. Will be back very soon.

Walked in on a Monday evening around 7:30 without a reservation. Got a seat right away at the bar. The service at the bar was great and everything we had was delicious. I would recommend the Pretzel dusted calamari and the cheeseburger. The sea bass was good, but nothing special. I also had a ginger margarita which was awesome.

For lunch I had the lobster which was really nice but nothing amazing. However, my friends and I really did love the restaurant! My friends enjoyed their meals and despite my EXTREMELY slight negative comment on the lobster, I would recommend people on going and I would definitely go back. My rating is a lot higher than 3, though maybe not quite 4 just based on my personal opinion of the lobster.
The reviews are in line with the experience you'll get here: excellent! awesome place to go and enjoy a meal, you'll return if you go here I promise
Great New American food! I went here with a friend for her birthday, and we had an awesome time. The server was enthusiastic and helpful, and the food came out very fast!

Truly as good as it gets. My friend and I stopped to have a snack before a Saturday night show. OMG. We stumbled upon a gem. We sat at the rear bar, and were served immediately. We had the carrot and avocado salad. So simple, but the carrots were marinated before roasted. AMAZING. We also had the asparagus salad. Very unique. Loved the antique dishes and silverware we were served on. Very reasonable for local and organic food in NYC.

A zero for wait staff and management. Did not get a chance to dine although there were plenty of open tables when we arrived. Was told on the telephone that they take walk ins... Arrived at the restaurant and was told an hour and a half wait. Had a drink at the bar and after waiting for over 25 minutes... And still open tables...asked a manager (a clown) how long they hold tables and was told 20 minutes. I have been in the business for years and know what a real restaurant hour and half wait time is. Left and had a fabulous meal at Koi... Trump Soho... Without the BS.

Ate there last night for a girls dinner. We had to wait about half an hour for our 10pm table but it was worth it. The food was fresh and interesting. The toast appetiser was great. My halibut fish entree (main) was also great, as were the other fish dishes I tasted. Desserts were fun, esp the donuts (suprised!). Service was good, and the docor is beautiful. They were gracious even as we were the last table (we did get seated pretty late). Definitely worth a visit. I wish I could take the raw wood round table home....

Can't say enough about this place - my husband and I went for our anniversary and it was a peak experience.  Between the server's recommendations, the quality of the food and the decor, no detail has been overlooked.  After our dinner I promptly called on Monday to book a reservation for my mother's visit and expected that I would be disappointed the second time around but found the food, service etc to be as fabulous as the first time around.  Definitely try the peeky toe crab toast, chicken liver and the pizza with morels and farm egg.

Pass on the appetizer mozzarella and heirloom tomatoes  -- tastes like something you'd pick up at a grocery store, 4 totally bland balls of cheese, tomatoes in lots of vinegar.  Sugar snap pea salad also was not notable, mostly hunks of lettuce with the bitter ends.

Great food - best ordered family style and shared.  A lot of hype surrounding this place, it just manages to live up to it.  Excellent, friendly service and not a bad choice on the menu.  Pricey but a nice treat.  Happy to see more chic establishments popping up in the neighborhood!

Chic (in that pared down sort of way that's popular these days) ambiance. My jacket kept falling off the back of my non-angular chair-- annoying, but the wait staff was diligent about keeping an eye on it for me. The food was mediocre--a gimmicky menu that's mostly talk with little taste. The vegan at our table was impressed.

Can't believe anyone has given this anything but 5 stars.  I've eaten here only twice and my third coming up in 2 months (I live in SF), but everything I've ordered, or glommed off my dinner partner's plate has been close to perfect.  Not a stuffy place, servers adequate but not fabulous, but the food is over the top good.  Addition to review. Last visit we had reservation for three. Day before we ate, we tried to add a fourth guest and they said "no". On arrival they seated the three of us at a table for four.  It was embarrassing for us to convince our friend that they reAlly said no to her husband.
Hats down to the staff and chef's. So delicious everytime that I'm a repeat customer and would not hesitate to go back.

Went here for a work dinner - probably wouldn't come on my own due to the prices, but it was amazing! The fried squash appetizer and pig entree were my favorites :)  The sunday was also amazing, though I had little room left to enjoy it!
I want to eat everything on this menu.  I recommend making reservations as soon as you think you might need them.

Food is pretty good, but not great.  The place is too noisy, busy and is a scene and the food isn't good enough to make it worth tolerating.  However, if you like a trendy scene and don't mind okay food, high prices and mediocre service then this is your place.
Managed to get a table around 10 pm on a Tuesday without a reservation... very hip, and an amazing meal

One of the best meals I've ever had in my entire life.   The service was impeccable - the waitress answered all of our questions and gave amazing recommendations.  This was my first time at ABC Kitchen and I tried all of the recco's.  You have to get the egg pizza and of course caramel popcorn ice cream.  Those were my two faves of the night.  The only downfall is we had to make a reservation almost a month in advance for an 8 pm dinner on a Saturday.  But WORTH IT!!
Outstanding - from service to food to ambience.  An incredible experience in every way!
The food and service were excellent. A wonderful lunch in NYC. Mushroom pizza off the charts good.
Great food, great service.  I loved it here. It was a good experience and I love their avocado salads! I recommend trying this place if you are in the area!

AMAZING...we visited this last Thursday evening after my Mom had heard amazing things and it didn't disappoint. It was delicious! We did make a reservation which I highly recommend since this place is becoming the "it place". Great server, ask to be seated in the back if you want to be able to hear your conversation better. I had their version of the tomato/mozzarella salad and it was SO good, they add sliced peppers of some sort and it really gives it a great zing. Then for my main dish I had the halibut which is steamed in olive oil, I mean WOW. Everything was great. I would go back in a heartbeat.

this is one of those places where you almost wish you never went because it is good and you constantly crave it. went for sunday brunch and lots of things from liver toast, crab toast, mushroom egg pizza (my fav) and the cauliflower soup. AMAZING. cute decor and great service too. liked it much better than spice market

I  made a lunch reservation for ABC kitchen and arrived a few minutes early.  I have no problem waiting since I was the one who was early.  I checked in with 1 of 3 hostesses and was told it would be a few more minutes.I waited and waited..then almost 30 minutes later I noticed they were seating people who arrived later than me, before me!  I expressed my frustration to one of the hostesses and FINALLY after standing in front of her did me and my guest get seated.I wouldn't go back since service was terrible.  My food was OKAY and the dessert was fantastic- salted carmel sundae.  But, I wouldn't go back just for  dessert because the restaurant is very disorganized.  As I was leaving I noticed the same frustrated looks on other people waiting.

I think this restaurant is definitely worth a try. I love the peaceful decor, the service was so friendly from the hostess to the server, and the food concept of market to table, organic, locally grown is my favorite. However, a big warning, lots of the appetizer dishes are fried and the menu description doesn't mention it. Ask first "is this dish fried" for any dish you want.  I think from a health standpoint, it was not a good meal for me.  The flavors were good, but again, heavy oiled. I will go back and carefully ask about each dish.  The goat cheese pizza with spinach was very good and the wild striped bass was also good.  Wine selection is very good.  They offered a truffle pizza for 92 which is over the top in my opinion but I hope someone who tries it will write a review.

The restaurant is pretty and has a great feeling about it and the food is delicious.  We enjoyed the Cauliflower soup and the ravioli.  There was a great lunch Prix fixe... Appetizer, entree and dessert for $25.  The sundae with peanuts and popcorn.... Amazing!!!
Great food. Knowledgeable servers. Lovely to find restaurants that try to source their supplies locally. I will be back for more for sure.

We went here for dinner on a Saturday night.  People were already lined up out the door.  They fit us in informing us that we had to be out by 7:30 which gave us an hour and a half.  Plenty of time.  The service was decent.  The best part of the meal was the crab toast.  The soup was mediocre and the fried calamari was like fried calamari anywhere else.  My pasta entree was so under seasoned I feel like there was no salt at all.  A rare complaint because I'm pretty sensitive to salt.  The scallops were okay and dessert was mediocre.  C'mon JG is this what you have to offer? Even if it is casual we still got a hefty bill and left wondering what all the hype was about.  I'm tired of people wasting time listing what farms things are from rather than caring if the food is good.
The Crab toast is amazing, also love the chicken liver toast... Great for lunch. Very busy spot but don't be put off... worth the wait.

A-Mazing lunch. Four of us got a wide variety of cocktails and meals, including apps & dessert. Everything was delicious and memorable. Fantastic service, beautiful decor. Even on a busy Saturday, we were not hurried, the place felt calm and it was a wonderful experience.

Unreal meal and service at ABC kitchen last night.  We were seated exactly that the time of our reservation, our waiter was very nice and speedy and our table was lovely.  We started with the calamari and the crab toast.  I can not say enough good things about the crab toast!! It was unreal!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Make sure you squeeze the lemon on it because the flavors explode immediately.  It is one of the yummiest things I have ever eaten.  We then had the organic chicken and the black bass.  Both were unreal and had a really nice heat to them.  Perfectly seasoned and really enjoyable.  Finally for dessert we decided not to try the sundae and do something different...we went for the banana ice cream cake  and it too was unbelievable.  For $100 for the two of us the meal was a hit! Loved it and can't wait to return.

We got there around 8 pm on a Saturday night without a reservation. We were told that there was an hour and a half wait but it was also possible to get a table in 45 minutes. We decided not to sit at the bar but go elsewhere for a drink, came back in about 40 minutes and got seated almost right away. I ordered the Basil lime daiquiri and my friend got a glass of the Pinot Noir. The cocktail was good - pretty much what I expected it to taste like! For appetizers we ordered the Roast carrot and avocado salad, which was excellent and the sashimi marinated in ginger and mint which was nice but not amazing. We had read rave reviews about their mushroom, parmesan, oregano and farm egg pizza which sounded both interesting and weird. So of course we had to try it. I thought it was one of the best gourmet pizzas I've ever had. Dessert was the vanilla cream donuts with a bacon fudge sauce that our server recommended. Again a little weird with the bacon, but surprisingly good! The service was very friendly and the place is modern and warm. All in all an excellent dining experience.

I went in  there couple of months ago with my hubby, it must have been the first couple of weeks they opened. So there was no wait (luckily!). Try getting a reservation now, it is sometimes weeks away. We were wandering inside ABC (as I usually do when I pass by) and realized that there is a brand new restaurant downstairs. We decided to give it a shot since we have nothing planned that night. The decor and the ambience was chic but very comfortable. It felt like we went into someone's summer house almost. I ordered beets with yoghurt and the fried organic chicken and my hubby went for the halibut. I couldn't believe how a simple dish like beets and yoghurt could taste so sophisticated and my chicken was tender and delicious. Hubby definitely like the halibut. All we did was to talk about the place, utensils, plates and what an extraordinary job they did for the place. Another important point for was their ingredients were organic and local. It has been a real delight! I tried going back with my girlfriends but we could only get to sit at the bar. Hey, word spreads really fast in NYC. I think it is a great addition to a great store like ABC and I will definitely be back.
Had a great lunch here. The best mushroom pizza (hen of the woods + farm egg) I've ever had & won't be matched any time soon. Cool atmosphere & very friendly server.

ABC Kitchen is absolutely phenomenal but definitely requires advance planning because reservations go very quickly! After visiting on Sunday, ABC is definitely in my top 3 NYC restaurants.  The restaurant is beautiful inside, with great chandeliers and an almost country feel which fits with its organic/locavore menu. First off, our waiter was super enthusiastic. When we asked about the food, instead of just telling us his favorite, he launched into an entire speech about texture which was different but made sense in light of the food. We started off with crab toast with lemon aioli and the roast carrot and avocado salad with crunchy seeds, sour cream and citrus, two of their specialty appetizers. The two were quite different but both phenomenal. The crab toast had great but simple flavor and the carrot was well seasoned and the salad was an amazing meld of flavors. Instead of getting a drink at dinner, I tried their housemade ginger and lime soda. Even though I'm not much of a soda drinker, this was amazing. It wasn't overly sweet at all and the flavor was very distinct and a great complement to the meal. For our entrees, I got cornflake crusted skate with kale and sweet potatoes and my boyfriend got their fried chicken with collard greens and hot sauce butter. Both were fantastic. The skate had a great crunch from the cornflake and the plating with the sweet potato and kale was a great seasonal mix. The fried chicken is one of ABC's specialities and while I am definitely not a fried chicken girl, it was phenomenal. The inside was so juicy and flavorful and I was definitely happy to take a few bites as it was a massive piece. For desert, we went for the famous sundae with salted caramel ice cream, candied peanuts and popcorn and chocolate sauce which was to quote our waiter, "indulgent". It was definitely large and needs to be split but absolutely delicious. Clearly, I'm a huge ABC fan and can't wait for another trip back!

I am deeply saddened to say that I cannot give ABC Kitchen 5 stars.  Although all of the food was delicious, I believe that ABC Kitchen is passing off Chinese Truffles as French Truffles.  I ordered a pasta dish with a large helping of truffle on it (and paid significantly extra as well!), and when I tasted it...it had absolutely NO truffle taste. It was a bland, chalky taste.  A real shame.  I informed my server and she simply said that it was "too bad."  Caution yourself when you order anything here with truffle on it. I absolutely love truffle, and what I was served was not French or Italian truffle- it was flavorless. I am saddened that this happened to me at a Jean Georges restaurant.

Ambience amazingly shabby chic.  Sea carmel sundae - amazing.  "Best turkey sandwich you'll ever have" per the waitress - no by a long shot.  Dry and meh.  Be wary of your credit card charge - a friend and I show three charges totaling $200 for lunch and currently working with ABC to get it fixed.  All in all, a cozy restaurant but I wouldn't necessarily come here for the entrees.
truly super food and service last night. Been five times and this last time was the best. Constantly updated menu and truly delicious.

My friend and I went without reservations and they put us on the list but we scored seats at the bar, which turned out better, more room. The food was excellent. The Rhubarb homemade ricotta app was superb. They also had  my friend's favorite wine from Washington State. The service was good - attentive, not pushy.
Great food, service and ambiance--not easy to get a reservation but once you do it is totally worth it.  We enjoyed every moment and hope to return!

We went here for lunch on a Sunday on a whim, expecting not to get in without a reservation, but the hostess was very accommodating and sat us immediately. The food was fantastic---fresh, simple, and well-cooked. I had the spinach and goat cheese pizza and was pleasantly surprised with the amount of spinach (most places just sprinkle it on; here it was definitely a main ingredient, as it should be!). My friend got the eggs Benedict and said it was the best she'd had in years. We also got a sample of their desserts and loved them all. Their grape tart was interesting and tasty. I can't wait to go again!

Food is a stand out at ABC Kitchen, but the hostess Lily was affected beyond measure. We had an 8pm resevation, but when we called to inquire if we could come early, they said no problem.  I actually spoke to Randy in reservations who was so helpful and provided a high level of customer service.  When we arrived they made us wait over two hours.  When we were finally seated, the restaurant had several open tables.  Our guess was that we didn't qualify as beautiful people.  Laughs on the restaurant, my husband is CEO of a company, and speaking at a large conference here this week. One thing he will not be promoting, the seating team at ABC Kitchen.  They told us the manager would come over, but he or she was non existent.  Too many other amazing restaurants that treat customers with respect in the city.  ABC get over yourself!

I went to lunch here on Monday.  I arrived just a bit early and was seated right away.  I ordered the ricotta ravioli and was served quickly.  I liked the garnishes and asked my server what they were.  He didn't know, but he took the time to find out and inform me what hey were.  I was in and out in thirty minutes.  Both the service and food were good and I will eat here again and would recommend ABC Kitchen to others.
Amazing food: very tasty and original. I really loved it. A lot of creativity. It s difficult to find a table but definitely it s worth to book a month in advance.

I have to now say that ABC Kitchen completely redeemed itself and is now back on top as one of our favorite restaurants. Six of us returned for lunch and we all agreed that the food is some if the best in the city. We couldn't have been happier with our latest experience. Special thanks to Ryan for going out of his way to make sure we had the experience that ABC strives to make sure all guests have. And thanks to Nathan for being such a great waiter.  Nathan and the other waitstaff made sure that the service was as good as the food. We once again look forward to returning!

Nice food, nice atmosphere, not even super expensive, but in my opinion, an uneatable sausage, a cold pre-cut prosciutto and a home made  sparkling water that is not sparkling, is unacceptable for a place with that name and that chef.

I came here on two occasions, once for brunch and once for dinner, and had mixed experiences. Brunch was a bit disappointing as I was expecting a lot after hearing raving reviews from friends. We ordered salmon sashimi toast, which was refreshing and decent. I read good reviews on the mushrooms pizza, and was excited to try it. Unfortunately, the egg was too runny and the whole pizza was somewhat soggy. Cheeseburger was standard. Dinner was a set menu as we had a big group of people. We had so much food and most were delicious (heirloom tomato toast, spinach & goat cheese pizza, string beans with smoked bacon, fried calamari, roasted beets salad, tuna sashimi, heirloom tomato salad). I tried both the salmon and fried chicken and both were yummy but nothing spectacular. The bill came out pretty high, but I am still giving the place a solid four-star due to the beautiful decor and romantic ambiance. I have tasted better food, but if you could get a reservation at ABC Kitchen, I think you should still give it a try.
Amazing, amazing.  I went here when it first opened and have been a fan ever since.  Lots of great, tasty options.  Only problem is how popular it has gotten, which makes getting a table a nightmare!
salads and pizzas a must.  reasonable wine list.  try anything and dig the scene.
Decent overpriced food, if you've got lots of money you will love it

Absolutely love ABC!  Didn't have a rez and had to wait around 45 min which apparently here is not that bad.  The interior is visually appealing with nice chandeliers, white high top tables, and decadent wood.  Very difficult to make a decision on what to have as everything on this menu looks incredible and focuses on local, organic ingredients in all dishes.  The staff here is very attentive and describe each dish in it's entirety.  Started with the crab toast with lemon aioli which was great, heaping quantity of crab.  Next time want to try the chicken liver as Bill boasted it is better than Spotted Pig.  After hearing the specials, ordered the pan seared skate with kale and butternut squash puree and my gf got the wood oven roasted Maine lobster.  The skate was cooked perfectly and paired with the puree was absolutely delicious.  Had some of the lobster which came out cracked open and prepared nicely so you didn't have to put in work which was nice, the flavor was great.  Was going to wrap it up and get dessert elsewhere until the woman helping clean up asked us about it.  I remarked that we were good and going to another spot for that and she replied more or less that we had to stay here to try the salted caramel ice cream as NY Time Out rated it the best dessert.  So we of course stayed to complete the meal.  You can share this with two people as the serving is large.  I was surprised at first with the popcorn but the whole combination was amazing and this was literally one of the best desserts I've ever had!  So glad we stayed!  One of the best dining experiences all around, praise the mighty Jean-George!

High marks for decor, ambiance and innovative menu but the experience was disappointing at the onset, shortly after we sat down. My guest and I  were clearly catching up and didn't even have a chance to browse the menu. We were queried twice in very short order for our selections. By the third attempt (within 10 mins) we felt pressured to order. Ok, chalk it up to over zealous service.  Appetizers were tasty and well presented. But, before we could finish them, our entrees came. There was a hasty and awkward shuffle on the table as we tried to make room for the extra dishes. This was definitely the low point. It felt like amateur night. Apologies were made but the experience was already marred.  Amateurs or just trying to rush us? Making matters worse was the over cooked and over salted snapper. I really wanted to enjoy this evening. It was hard to get a reservation and that ABC came so highly recommended, I was especially disappointed.

Just now writing a review because I don't use this site too much as I'm very busy with work on a computer so the last thing I want to do when I get home is get back on one, but when I do log into yelp- I do several review from the past weeks as we eat out a lot. I was very disappointed with this place. My fiancé actually took me out for my birthday and we were there for over 3 half hours before we fished out meal due to the slow service and a server that lacked Enthuastic, energy and just seemed like she absolutely hated her job (not sure her name, but she was thin, blonde, shoulder length hair and in her 30's.) When we first arrived we were seated and finally had to flag someone down just to get a drink order in and a glass of water. Granted I know it was Father's Day but e waited over 30mins just to get a greeting, a drink etc. After that it was another hour before we received our appetizers and the entire night continuing like this. Every time we needed a drink or to place an order for another course we had to flag someone down. We never really seen our waitress more than one other time during the service (which was fine) cause she seemed very unpleasant and in a bad mood. I assumed they pull tips but I felt bad for the bread guy and the water boy doing all the work. Anyways after watching five tables around is come & go with full service I was staring to feel it was personal. Not a god feeling for your special birthday dinner. Anyways we complained to the manager and she comped our drinks. Not sure if that was enough since we paid over $200 for horrible service if lack if it and it took up my entire night. Which my fiancé had to work in the morning and we didn't leave until almost 1am. Don't think I'll be back. Bummed because this was a beautiful restaurant and the food was good.

I LOVE this place. I love it, I love it, I love it, I love it. After a friend recommended that we try a friday night dinner here, I was sold the instant I walked in. The decor was out of this world-gorgeous, delicate chandeliers, natural wood cut tables, ornate bread china, even the water drinking glasses were of spectacular design. The restaurant was perfectly lit with spectacular decor. I felt like I was inside a majestic jewelry box. Absolutely NO detail is overlooked. Now onto the food. Being a Jean Georges restaurant, you know that the standards are extremely high. The waiter recommended a deliciously light red wine  (the tempranillo). My friend and I shared the ricotta ravioli, the crispy organic chicken, and the chef gave us a free side of the corn--all absolutely delicious and gorgeously presented. For desert we had the salted caramel ice cream (with chocolate sauce and caramel popcorn), which was probably one of the most mouthwatering desserts I've had to enjoy in NYC thus far--the balance of the salt and sweetness was divine. The service was friendly and on point, and the experience overall was spectacular. Will definitely be going back here again.

nice  but not over the top ambiance. same with the service. the chicken liver toast and the chocolate bread pudding were the beginning, end and highlights of the meal. way too many toppings on a good burger which should be able to stand alone or with a tomato and onion slice( a la jimmy buffet. ) this burger was topped with shredded cheese, jalapenos, some sort of spinach dip, sort of the kitchen sink of burgers. sliced salmon with potatoes roesti just average and mushroom pizza , while tasty should not have been soggy for 18 bucks. roasted carrot and avacado salad was good but just that. i can't agree with all the other yelpers who are crying amazing because it is a jean- georges restaurant. if you're a cook , foodie or just live in new york , you should be a teeny bit more savvy...

This review is based entirely on service.  We took 8 people to dinner the other night and the place was packed as usual.  Our client got us the reservation as they have connections.  They had never been there and we had bragged about the place so she said fine let's go.  Our client needed ice for her drink, nobody came to our table.  I finally had to go ask our waitress who was at another table could we please have some ice for one of our guests.  It took another 5-10 minutes and we finally got some ice.  We never got any food for over an hour.  When food finally arrived nobody came to check if we needed anything.  We needed some lemon for the fish and chips but it came when we were ready to order dessert as I had to leave the table to find someone to get it for us.  I think the server may have been new but maybe the restaurant should have more servers so that people can have a little better service.  It was just very embarrassing in front of this client as it was our suggestion and she was highly disappointed.

interior is shabby chic just like abc.  staff was all really pleasant and our waiter was able to give very good comments/suggestions on a lot of the menu items. we had roasted carrot and avocado salad and clam pizza for app.  i got the carrot salad cuz i saw sour cream in the ingredients but i was really pleasantly surprised by the carrots. they were vinegared and sweet and went nicely with the avocado.  the bread for the pizza was good.  pizza good overall but i prefer the white clam pizza at pepe's.  clams slightly sandy but big meaty ones.  entrees got char and fat wheat spaghetti with pork ragu.  the char was great (as char always is) and was served over perfectly roasted regular and horny cauliflower. not a mindblowing entree but very solid.  i like the texture of wheat pasta tho it's not for everyone (not as gluten-y as regular pasta and has a bit of al dente texture) and the pork ragu was not heavy like i thot it'd be so it was an enjoyable dish.  dessert menu all looks delicious.  most everything has a slightly non-traditional ingredient twist to it.  we tried the salted peanut ice cream sundae with caramel popcorn. it was good for what it was but i think i actually wanted to eat cake with ice cream so it wasn't the right dessert for me that day.  they make their own sodas and i tried the tarragon root beer upon several staff recommendation. it's got the root beer flavor with a little more herb/licorice-y flavor.  it's good and not too sweet. nice casual, good meal.  i'd go here over maialino for similar vibe dining in same area.
casual but nice ambience.  execution of menu is only average, not at the excellent level that is to be expected of Jean Georges V.  thus it is overpriced.

i enjoyed the french toast, eggs benedict and sausage pizza which were all good, but what stood out the most were the crab toast & lemon aoli and roasted carrot & avocado salad! those are must eats here.

i went to abc kitchen after seeing a ton of friends checking in to it on facebook. i dragged my husband against his will and found ourselves making a reservation for brunch. we were the first of many to arrive and many tables were open despite the hype and unwillingness to allow us to change our reservation time. all that aside, the food was not worth it. plain and simple. i ordered a salad with poached chicken. i found the flavors were nice however, a problem is very apparent when the salad has SAND in it. my husband ordered a pizza with egg on it and found the entire thing to be very soggy and hard to eat. the service was ok at best and i will not find myself revisiting. a friend of mine told me about her plans to go to abc kitchen and i tried to advise her against it. she went anyways and was also disappointed. the best thing i can say about this place is that its very well hyped. that's it.

i was just telling somebody that every time i go here the food is always really, really good, as is the service, so i realized it was probably worth doing a yelp review too. the crispy shrimp salad is great. so it's the pretzel dusted calimari.
the ambiance is as beautiful as the food is delicious. great menu, warm efficient staff and you get to shop before and/or after. big thumbs up!

Some hits and some misses - the gumbo and rice with octopus were both pretty salty, and the yellowtail crudo could've used a little more seasoning on the fish itself instead of on top of it. The favorite of the night was the corn dumplings! Super interesting and different

Food was pretty good! Everything was unique and flavorful. The corn dumplings were delicious. Overall, everything was really good but it was super expensive for small portions. Would consider going back for a special occasion.

Mokyo - the sister restaurant to thursday kitchen - is phenomenal. The service was extremely friendly and attentive. We were seated right away for our reservation on a Saturday evening. There is a spacious room in the back of the restaurant with beautiful, rustic decor. Our waiter suggested ordering 2-3 plates per person - each plate was shared with the table. We had the corn dumplings, beef tartar, wagyu oxtail spring roll, scallop (served with a yummy creamy purée), gumbo, and noodle (best one) - and we loved every single dish. Each dish is small but the food was fresh, flavorful and beautifully plated. Overall, great service and food, will return!

Corn dumplings were actually super good! This might've been our favorite of the tapas. It was creamy and savory and the corn flavor was mild but complemented the truffle. Other favorites were the gumbo and the noodle. Drinks wise I really liked the lychee cocktail. They put the cocktails in bags that glowed which was a fun spin.

I LOVE Mokyo. Tho was my second trip there. All of the food is phenomenal. The corn dumplings are my favorite things on the menu. The noodles were delicious but a tad spicy for me (admittedly not a spice guy) but still delicious. Recommend you get 2-3 plates per person and share
LOVE this spot! Every dish is so delicious and unique. Especially love the oxtail spring rolls, lobster roll, and yellowtail crudo.
Go here and get at least 2 orders of the corn dumplings!!! We got complimentary sake when we sat, server gave great recs and place was lively and full but not too loud!
The cutest spot with each dish intricately prepared. Would definitely recommend the cauliflower and corn dumplings- my top 2 favorites of the night!
Delicious shareable plates - we liked everything we ordered - lobster roll, noodles, ribs, rice with octopus, desserts, etc. They also start you off with free sake and the cocktails were good too.

I came here on New Year's Eve and wow the service was phenomenal!  The food was delicious, our favorite was probably the mini lobster rolls.  The drinks were also very good.  Will recommend this place to friends and will try to come back soon!

Went to dinner there with my son based on a recommendation from someone on my flight to Manhattan. So glad I went there. We had the corn dumplings and 5 out of 5, beef tartare 4.5 out of 5, yellowtail crudo 4 out of 5, lobed roll 4.5 out of 5, gumbo 4.5 out of 5, rice with octopus 5 out of 5, and lastly injeolmi mousse 4.5 out of 5.  Top 5 best meals in the past year.

I love Korean food. This place had such amazing tapas styled plates that I was able to share with my friend. The drinks were AMAZING and came in cute little pouches. I love Korean food but I don't think that I would go there again, just because I don't really like fancy food as much. Which is what I felt from this place. I'm super happy I tried it and heard good stuff about the sister restaurant that I think I would try next!!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY

column6: Mokyo is the sister restaurant to Thursday Kitchen, but I definitely enjoyed Thursday Kitchen more.  The food here was delicious, but the portions are extremely small for the price.  I know they serve tapas, but I think I could have used a little more in each plate.  The best dish here was the Octopus with Rice.  That is definitely a must get, and the most worth it.  The ribs are also very good - fall off the bone, juicy, and flavorful.  The corn dumplings are sweet and creamy with a little citrusy kick to them - delicious!  Every dish is very creative and delicious.  I just wish the portions were a bit bigger.  Definitely come here if you want just a snack, not a meal.
Super similar to their sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen. A different menu offered with a slightly different spin on fusion. My favorites were the corn dumplings and wagyu

Really cute spot, come with friends and share a bunch of things, or a cute spot for a date night! They have cocktails in capri sun bags. The mango lychee was really good! Also they give welcome sake shots which is a nice touch. For food def do the oxtail spring rolls and cauliflower, both were amazing. Noddles are good, and we got the scallops which were also amazing! Would def come back to try more of the menu.

column3: Central City, Salt Lake City, UT

column6: Drinks, food, ambiance are similar to Thursday kitchen. Their apps such as ceviche and dumplings are prime!! The strawberry soju is a must! Enjoy your time here to relax. The staff is attentive and food phenomenal.
Everything was so inventive and delicious. The corn dumplings and jambalaya were incredible. Cocktails were delicious and great value too.

Came with a party of 5 and we decided to order everything on the menu. Our server started us off with a round of complimentary sake shots, and they were also gracious enough to accommodate an extra person (we had made the resy for 4). All the dishes were great, but some standouts were the Cauliflower, Corn Dumpling, Lobster Roll, Scallop, and Noodle!

There is no debate when it comes to Mokyo. Not only did i thoroughly enjoy my meal but i RETURNED BACK a week later because I could not stop thinking about the truffle corn dumplings and oxtail spring rolls. Those are by far the 2 best menu items. I also got the rice and octopus which was incredible. I typically don't enjoy octopus but I enjoyed this so much I got it again on my return. The plantains were just average but I am confident they were the only "average" thing about the menu. The steak was incredible as well: juicy and served medium rare. I can't wait to return back to Mokyo because the food is to die for and the ambiance just makes the experience that much better.

Mokyo is a gem! It is a sister restaurant from Thursday kitchen which is one of my favorite restaurants. They have some similar menu items and new ones as well. It would be a little bit better if it had more different items than Thursday but you can't go wrong with anything on the menu

Really cute and fun experience! The small plates were great and super tasty - loved the little lobster rolls and the corn dumplings. The cocktails were also so fun and cute. My only complaint is that the portions were so small - we unfortunately left a little hungry!

A bit disappointed in MOKYO. Their sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen, is better in my opinion. The dishes at MOKYO are overpriced for what they are worth. Their hints of Korean flavor are miniscule. Walk-ins have to sit at the bar even when tables are empty.

Nice service and decor. The food was a bit of a hit or miss. We ordered 8 dishes for the 3 of us. I enjoyed the corn dumplings, scallops and wagyu steak. The yellowtail, plantains, spring rolls and lobster rolls were ok. The steak was too chewy and we had to spit it out. Overall it was a nice experience but way overpriced for the quality and quantity. Not likely to return
Must try everything in the menu! The tastes, flavors and presentation makes you feel like you're at a Michelin restaurant! Also the service was wonderful! 10/10 will definitely come back soon!

Really excited to see so many modern Korean places pop up around the city, and Mokyo lived up to the hype! Out of what we ordered, the corn dumplings, oxtail spring roll, and cauliflower were the standouts. I was tempted to get another order of the corn dumplings - they weren't what I expected and unlike anything I've tried before, but the combination of the savory corn and parmigiano with the truffle salsa was a touch of genius. We also got the rice with octopus which I thought I'd love since I'm a huge congee/juk fan but found a bit bland. The injeolmi mousse was honestly one of the best restaurant desserts I've had -- definitely don't skip it, it was a perfect ending to the meal.
Sister restaurant of Thursday kitchen. Quaint eating environment with friendly staff and free sake. Food was great and came quick, was expecting a bit more for the price but would come back again

The entrance of the restaurant looks small but they actually have plenty of space in the back. We ordered the spring roll, octopus with rice, and corn dumpling and honestly it's enough for two people. The corn dumpling tastes similar to Thursday Kitchen's edamame dumplings but my favorite dish has to be the octopus with rice. It is flavorful and the rice is well prepared. 10/10 would come back to try the tartare and scallops

One of the best meals I've ever had. I would give recommendations for what to order but we honestly tried so much and it was all spectacular. I'll make this place a regular visit when I'm in New York. Try it asap
The food was fine but doesn't stand out. The inside dining was very noisy so it isn't a good spot if you're looking for a place to chat and catch up w friends.
Everything tasted so good. Vibes were great and staff was attentive. We got seated quickly. Make sure you make a reservation.
Best Korean food I've ever had. In a city with a ton of Korean options Mokyo stands out. Everything on the menu is good, the service is great, and the vibe hits the mark. Do not miss this.

Absolutely phenomenal!! It's been a long time since I've had a meal that was this exceptional. We ordered 5 different dishes and EVERY dish was amazing. Even Michelin star restaurants aren't able to manage that. Now, i have to try Thursday Kitchen.

Fantastic little place for tapas style Korean inspired dishes. Reservations are recommended. The kitchen turns out amazing dishes including the ribs, corn dumplings (2 orders please), hamachi, etc. the pop rocks mascarpone ice cream is super fun to eat as well.

They give you a complimentary shot of sake before you even order! We are two two tiny girls and we ordered 5 dishes and we were pretty stuffed. The order of tasty dishes was 1) octopus rice 2) scallops 3) ribs 4) gumbo 5) beef tartare. We also ordered the hazelnut mousse and it was amazing. Overall, the presentation and taste was on point. It was about $200 in total. Service was attentive and food came out fairly quickly. Would recommend and dine again!

Wow, this place was incredible! My husband and I are still in conversation days later about how fantastic the food was. From arrival, our expectations were far exceeded. Everyone working here was kind and the service was superb. We tried a bunch of different dishes from the menu and liked everything but one dish (the cauliflower was kind of basic). The server recommended 2-3 per person and he was definitely right. Each dish was a small tasting and had its own distinct flavor profile. The corn dumplings were complex and delicious. The texture was smooth and it just had such a wonderful umami taste. The beet tostada was also interesting and had so many different textures in each bite. The food on the menu seemed simple, but each bite was so much more complex than it appeared. I can't wait to return on my next visit to the East Village!

Quality, creative, and delicious Korean fusion dishes. We really enjoyed all the dishes we ordered including dessert. The octopus rice was especially wonderful with melt in your mouth octopus. Service was attentive.

An amazing Korean fusion small plate restaurant, Mokyo, the sister restaurant of Thursday Kitchen, presents an elevated experience of comfort Korean fusion. Everything on their menu was excellent, but standouts include the lobster roll, corn dumplings, and octopus rice. Would def nut again

Portion are small but it's essentially Thursday Kitchen 2.0. If you're familiar with their first restaurant then you'll enjoy Mokyo too. The food is good and the drinks are fun (if you get the adult capri-sun soju cocktails). Restaurant is small, not as dark as Thursday Kitchen and not as loud. Food is good but nothing was out of this world.

Thursday and Mokyo both have me at a chokehold. They're both so good and I always have trouble deciding which one to go to. If I can have a subscription to come once a month or two a month I definitely would. Corn and edamame dumplings by far my favorites. Only thing I would consider for space is expanding!

The food was very good. There are definitely a lot of unique flavors. The corn dumplings, The noodles and the cauliflower were my favorite. do not try their cocktails. They don't have a liquor license so many of the drinks are unusual. The vibe is good. The wait staff was nice but a little bit hard to understand. The water was refilled every few minutes. I do think it's a little too pricey for the portion size.
The food is to die for. I love this place and have been twice. Definitely make reservations cause they are fairly busy.

Cozy, clean find on St. Marks. Korean traditional flavors mixed with a modern spin and it works!! Each tapas/dish was carefully crafted and prepared. The food was excellent and surprisingly filling. We had three people and seven plates. Our favorites were: corn dumplings, octopus and rice, and sweet plantain katsu. Service and servers are so excellent!! Definitely recommend it!
this korean fusion restaurant is very delicious. each plate was very unique and full of flavor.

I finally got to try mokyo after wanting to go for so long. I am a huge fan of Thursday's kitchen so when mokyo opened up, I had no doubt that it would be amazing as well. The food was so delicious and everything that I expected. We had a total of 6 dishes between two of us( they are small tapa style dishes) and we finished every last bite. We left full and content. My favorite was definitely the pork jowl. It was super tender and had a buttery texture. The corn dumplings reminded me of Thursday's kitchens truffled Mac and cheese which is my favorite dish from Thursday's so that was amazing. The mini lobster rolls and the gumbo also did not disappoint. Other than the amazing food, our server Sophie was such a joy to be around and gave us the best experience. Bernard also took great care of us. I would definitely recommend and will be bringing all of my friend back!

Super fun spot with some amazingly creative and tasty dishes! The menu is all small plates, so it's a fun spot for a date and an even more fun spot to dine with a group. Then you get to try more! The restaurant is lively, making it a fun spot for a weekend night. Our waiter was incredibly kind, guiding us through the menu and checking in between dishes. The drinks were served in giant adult Capri sun pouches with a light on the bottom, which amused us to no end. On top of the silly but cute presentation, the drinks were great! I recommend the pure strawberry and the mojito. But the stars of the night were there dishes, specifically the cauliflower, oxtail spring roll, Berkshire rib, and noodle dishes. I would also recommend the sweet plantain and and crudo. The beet tostada was good, but I'd be fine skipping it, and the pink lady apple was the least favorite of the bunch. But overall, every member of our party had a different favorite dish- the mark of a great night enjoyed by all!

Got a couple of different tapas here and the lychee reach rich. I'm normally not a huge fan of cocktails but the lychee drink was really good and was served in a transparent pouch with a small light inside, which was fun. The tapas themselves were pretty overpriced in my opinion. The server said 2-3 tapas is reasonable per person but I was not really full after 3 and I have a smaller appetite than most people. The ambiance was also nothing to write home about in my opinion - I thought it was too loud to hear the people I was eating with. This would have been ok had the prices been a bit more reasonable.

This place is absolutely divine. I took a friend here for an early dinner and we left feeling full and happy. We were catching up after several months of distance and having a delightful meal to pair with our reunion was bliss. I cannot recommend the corn dumplings enough. I also think the noodle are not to be missed. My friend has an allergy to nuts so the waiter explained what dishes had nuts before we ordered. Unfortunately the noodles are made with a peanut sauce, so I got them all to myself. The service and the food were perfect. Phenomenal experience.

Mokyo is the sister restaurant of Thursday Kitchen. We came here on a Wednesday night and were able to be seated quickly. The menu is very similar to Thursday Kitchen as in it's all tapas but with very different flavors. The chef is the same in both locations and she's so talented. We ordered 6 dishes to share between two people and we were stuffed! Everything was delicious but I think the gumbo was my favorite. I loved the corn dumplings as well, its taste was nothing like I've ever had before but in a good way. Bernard took care of us that night and he is amazing! Such great customer service. He even gave us some sake tastings. Great food, great cocktails as always and great company. What more can I ask for? 100% recommend for a date night or even to catch up with some friends. They do have a larger table now that indoor dining is available.

Managed to get a walk in 2-ppl table on a Sat night - a bit lucky in fact as the place quickly get more crowded. Very unique Korean fusion food with wild ingredients that surprise your palate. Loved the pork jowl - the strong taste is balanced so well with the squash. The oxtail spring roll is an exciting creation of a modern comfort food. Would love to come again.

Get the corn dumplings with truffle salsa verde! That was the favorite dish of the evening among our group of 6 along with the oxtail spring rolls and noodles. Everything tasted great but those were our faves. Appreciated the creativity in the dishes and wonderful balance in flavors. Not only was the food delicious but the service was top notch by our server Sofia. Will definitely be returning and hoping they always have those corn dumplings on the menu!

Inventive and exciting small plates with diverse flavors. Everything I ordered was delicious especially the empanadas, but again, you can't go wrong. The consuls were also delicious especially their twist on a French 75.
Delicious small plates, but they are each pretty small so do expect to order about 3 plates per person at least, so it'll be a bit pricey. And expect a wait during the usual busy times.

The service was impeccable and the food was exquisite. I would definitely recommend getting the pork jowl, its a must have if youre in the area :) They take reservations through resy, theyre typically always booked so make sure to reserve ahead of time. Everyone at Mokyo was incredibly friendly and the entire restaurant was so clean. They give you a shot of sake as a palate stimulator and it made everything all the more tasty :)

Had an early dinner here yesterday. It's tapas style so my boyfriend and I ordered 6 plates to share. We got the yellowtail crudo, oxtail spring rolls, gumbo, lobster rolls, pork jowl, and the rice with octopus. Everything was delicious but my favorite was the rice with octopus, that is a must get. Our waiter was very kind and explained all the dishes as they came out. He also gave us complimentary sake shots, which was a nice touch. We also ordered the lychee mango and blah blah blue cocktails. The lychee mango is the most popular but I preferred the blah blah blue. Cant wait to come here again to try the other dishes and have the rice with octopus again!

Had a wonderful dinner here. The drinks are super fun and delicious - they come in pouches with light bulbs. The server recommended 2-3 dishes per person for sharing and two of us got 5. Every dish is outstanding. My favorites are the steak and grilled octopus on rice, both very well seasoned and cooked to perfection. The corn dumplings have a very interesting texture - the filling tastes like corn soup. The cauliflower is also good - sweet, sour, and sticky. The only thing to note is that for the price point, the portion size is small. If you come hungry or have a bigger appetite, you may need to order more.
The food was great. We tried the spring rolls, dumplings, and steak. The dumpling was the best one with amazing taste. Overall, a bit pricey though.

Cute little Korean tapas spot in the east village. Interesting menu with creative flavors! The corn dumplings were very savory, and you can definitely taste the truffle in the silky filling.  The oxtail spring roll was one of my favorite items and a must order! The steak was just okay, nothing really amazing to scream about. The yellowtail crudo had an interesting sauce that reminded me of the dipping sauce for viet summer rolls lol and the lobster rolls were really tiny (2 bites max) but good. My other favorite dish was the rice with octopus, really flavorful and the octopus was cooked perfectly and not chewy at all! Expect to order 2 to 3 plates per person, as the the portions aren't that big, as expected for tapas.  Definitely make reservations because it's pretty popular, and was poppin even on a snowey Friday night. One last comment, the tables are pretty closely situated together, so keep that in mind.

Amazing quality food. It's an Asian tapas place so expect small portions, can get pricey if you're eating to be satitated but quality really was top notch. The octopus was probably my favorite, but thought everything here was delicious. Highly recommended

I've always been the biggest fan of Thursday Kitchen so it's safe to say I was incredibly excited to try everything Mokyo had to offer. Dined on Friday and ordered the hits: corn dumplings, pork jowl, steak, rice and octopus, noodles, the lobster roll, and finished with the mousse for dessert. The clear stars for us were the corn dumplings and the pork jowl - perfection. You can't go wrong with this menu, go with friends so you can try it alllllll. Can't wait to run back. Also, shout out to the staff as the service was incredible. They stopped by to explain every dish and give us tips on how to best enjoy it and we really appreciated the level of detail and attentiveness.

Please go. Just don't even read this review or anyone else's review because everyone has different palates and taste preferences but literally. Just go. Check out Mokyo. From the food to service, everything was delightful and wonderful. I can't believe how delicious every dish was. Each dish came out at a great pace and the server explained every dish in detail. My friends and I shared the oxtail spring rolls, yellowtail crudo, scallops, CAULIFLOWER, corn dumplings, octopus and rice, and Berkshire ribs. Oh my. Each dish had such a complex flavor profile. The corn dumplings evolved in my mouth - at first I thought too creamy, but it became nutty, savory, sweet - all in one bite. The scallops were cooked PERFECTLY. I hate over-cooked scallops but these ones were amazing. The cauliflower was the star because the bite was crisp - both inside and outside. Every component on that dish served it's purpose and I couldn't get enough of it. My friend loved the octopus and rice - to the extent that she said she would ask for it as a last meal. Gosh, so proud of what chef Kay has achieved and the marriage between Korean and Spanish cuisine. Please go support.
One of the best places I've eaten since the pandemic. I found this place on TIK TOK!!!! We were the first guests there today sat outside. You must try everything LOL!

This place is one of my all-time favorites in the city! The aesthetic is simple, clean, but manages to be comfortable and chic. The service here is fabulous as well.  I really can't say enough good things.  I've had several things on the menu and standouts are the dumplings, crudo, and octopus rice dish.  The house sake is smooth and guests get a sample when they're seated.  A great touch!

Absolutely loved our meal! I wish we could have dumplings from the Mokyo Every  day  and I mean it. We actually ordered a second plate after tasting the first one. Loved the Noodle as well, it was spicy but just the right amount of spicy

Cute date spot with small plates and decent selection of drinks. I liked the spring rolls and the mousse. The cocktail drinks came in pouches which was interesting. It's also conveniently located near Saint Marks!

Such a fun restaurant to visit now that things are opening back up. Great for a casual friends hangout or even something more special. My group of 4 was able to order almost everything on the menu. Our favorites were the lobster roll, plantains and corn dumplings. But you really can't go wrong here. The service was also so patient and accommodating! Restaurants like MOKYO are what makes New York so wonderful.

Mokyo is an absolutely outstanding dining experience. We had 12 different tapas off the menu and every one of them was simply delicious. Incredibly creative tastes, beautifully plated. And the service was off-the-charts excellent (thank you, Daniel!!) To deliver such an end-to-end experience - so amazing at so many levels, such attention to detail, all while making it look effortless - is truly special. This place is a gem. I felt lucky to have found it and will most definitely be back.

Great food and great service. We originally had a rezzie for Thursday Kitchen but due to my lactose allergy we couldn't eat much of the food. When we came to MOKYO, the waiter walked us through every dish, telling us the ingredients and what substitutions we could make - which we could do for almost every dish. Despite coming with no reservation, which I would recommend, they were able to seat the two of us for 1.5 hours, which was enough time. Pork jowl was the star, with it being just as described by the waiter - crispy on the outside and soft and chewy (and very fatty) on the inside. Personally, a close second for me the was the gumbo - super flavorful, not really sure how to describe it though so you just have to believe me! Cauliflower kind of tasted just like marinated chicken wings, so would skip on ordering this. The rice was super soft, as was the octopus. You couldn't really taste that it was octopus but the dish was still worth getting. Spring rolls were crunchy with a great sauce on the side. Our meal came out to $80 for 2 people, so if you have a budget - be careful since it's easy to order a lot given they are tapas and everything is pretty good. Despite the price, I do think it's worth coming here, even if only once!

When I heard the news that Cuomo is shutting down indoor dining once again, I immediately booked a table at Mokyo. This place was on my "must-eat" list. And this is my first time dining here. I must say, if they served their dishes in oversized dishes and charge double the price, they can easily get a Michelin Star. Really Michelin-Star quality food at very fair price!

This place is awesome! Super cozy vibe, very LES style layout and decor. The cocktails come in cute bags with light up cubes and are delicious. The service is wonderful and the food is sooo tasty. We got the spring rolls ( so good), corn dumplings ( very rich and very good) the noodles and the ribs. All the food was so flavorful and our server took great care of us, we even got a little welcome shot! Highly recommend this place, make sure to book a reservation ahead of time!

one of the cutest restaurants i've been to in the city! fav dishes were the lobster time and oxtail spring rolls (not pcitured) drinks were really pretty and a little on the stronger side. even if you come with just two people, you can get ~5 dishes. i'd def come back to try their other items like the dumplings which look really good! best part was the amazing service-the waitress (or maybe she was the owner) was super genuine and was patient when she was explaining her recommendations.
Can get expensive if you are ordering to be full at the end of the meal. Recommend the corn dumplings and steak. Food was extremely good!

Great food and great service at the right price. I actually enjoy every dish on this menu and love the pace/flow here. Some favorites are the ribs, lobster rolls, oxtail and dumplings but as I said, you can't go wrong with anything.
UPDATE: went back to Mokyo for Valentine's Day.  Ordered the pork jowel - MUST have, the dish is divine

I think Mokyo might be my favorite Korean restaurant in all of NYC! We ordered 5 dishes and at the end were debating which one we liked the most (hint: they were all absolutely delicious but it was the corn dumplings for me). They do have a strict reservation policy, but the food just doesn't disappoint. Highly recommend this place to anyone who wants a punch of flavor with every bite!
Was able to taste multiple dishes, all very flavorful. Friendly staff, cozy vibe, great food & drinks.

Amazing food, cocktails and friendly staff! The corn dumplings are a must have! They burst open in your mouth, and the truffle accent flavors were divine. I also loved the plantains and yellow-tail sashimi. So delicious and excellent. If you like spicy things, get the cauliflower. It seriously tasted like spicy Buffalo crispy chicken. Perfect temperature and texture. The lychee-mango cocktail  brought back memories drinking Capri Sun, served glowing from inside oh and I forgot the shot of sake they brought to welcome me. So fun.

This is by far my favorite restaurant, the customer service and the food is absolutely amazing. Without a reservation they sat my friend and I down during a busy dinner time AND where able to give us a bigger table when our third friend arrived. They proceeded to give us complimentary sake shots and complimentary shots of their nicest vodka. The food here is something I have never tasted before, I literally cannot get enough. If I could give this place 11 stars I would.

Delicious food, refreshing drinks and amazing service make Mokyo worth a visit! We ended up coming here because the sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen, had a 2 hour walk-in waiting list. So glad we did! Ordered a grapefruit beer - fresh draft Sapporo mixed with grapefruit for only $6. We also ordered the corn dumplings, spicy noodles and octopus with rice, which was plenty for two people. The service was really polite and excellent too, and I appreciated that the servers explained each dish as they set it down. Happened to come here on the night of the flash storm, and they even quickly reconfigured the umbrellas to help us stay as dry as possible. I want to come back and try everything else on the menu!

I had a dream the other night about the corn dumplings here and honestly I don't even like dumplings in general that much. Or corn. Low key and intimate atmosphere added to the experience. Every item on the menu is  you cannot go wrong. Go with the server recommendations. Complimentary sip of sake at the beginning of the meal too, nice. Try Thursday kitchen too right around the block if you love this place!

This place was absolutely delicious!!! When we ordered we asked the waitress what the best dishes were and she suggested the lobster roll, corn dumplings, and pork jowl and they did not disappointed! Each of those dishes were so flavorful and tasty it was like an explosion of goodness in my mouth with each bite. The corn dumplings were incredibly unique in their flavor profile, it is hard to describe. The sauce was slightly sour and balanced well with the starchy flavor of the corn filling inside the dumpling. The pork jowl was so soft, it practically melted in your mouth, and was incredibly well seasoned. The lobster roll was my personal favorite as the bread was so soft and the lobster was perfectly cooked with a wonderful sauce to top it off. The other items we ordered were definitely not as good as the first three. The plantain katsu was boring compare to those other dishes and it just didn't have as much flavor. The pistachio sauce definitely helped with the flavor but overall it was not as good. The oxtail spring rolls were fairly average and the sauce didn't add much flavoring to it. The meat was very soft and cooked well but it lacked seasoning in my opinion. My least favorite item was the gumbo as I just didn't liked the seasoning and it tasted the most generic to me. I enjoyed the pop rocks dessert though as the ice cream wasn't too sweet but had a thick texture that paired well with the fun pop rocks. Overall, I would definitely order those first three dishes, maybe even a couple of each because they will impress.
This is one of my favorite places in NYC! The servings are small but every dish is so tasty. Highly recommend!
Pretty good food. Some dishes were overly salty. Service was a bit slow. Drinks were kind of gimmicky.

this place is great! great service and atmosphere too. personal favorites were the beef tartare, lobster roll, steak (not pictured), and yellowtail crudo. the mousse also tasted great -- was a bit hesitant to order it because i expected it to be too sweet for my taste, but i'm glad i tried it. we ordered 7 dishes for two, so the costs added up. however, all the dishes were well-presented and tasted great. we also ordered two drinks, and the little light-emitting device put in the drinks made taking pictures much more fun. would recommend this place!

The food here is delicious! I came one time when they first opened and the food has improved drastically since then. All the dishes we ordered were really good (oxtail spring rolls, fried cauliflower, steak, pork jowl) and all memorable on their own. I'll definitely be back!

This spot is great and offers decent food. The service is awesome the Korean host patiently introduced us the food. However, food portion is surprisingly small, smaller than all we thought. So you'd better have that in mind before you order. Overall, I really like the lobster roll it's stunningly amazing! Must order!  ($50-70 per person if you wanna leave with a full stomach)

Possibly my favorite restaurant in the entire city. It's even better than Thursday Kitchen which I thought would be unbeatable. The food is like no other you will ever eat anywhere else. Every single dish we had was phenomenal.

Lovely spot with attentive service. All the dishes we ordered were amazing, no complaints. My favorite would have to be the super tender and flavorful pork jowl. Every other dish was great too, butternut squash toast with the steak was really smooth and buttery, corn dumplings were creamy and delicious, lobster roll had amazing flavor, and the spring rolls were perfectly crispy. Dishes are small so I would recommend at least 5 dishes to share for two people.

Went for a post-date snack and drink, and I loved it. They have a large menu of sake and soju; we ordered a carafe of sake ($22). The small-plate style was super conducive to sharing food. We had these fusion dumplings ("corn dumplings" on menu) that seemingly combined Korean and Tuscan cuisine (the dumplings had truffles and parmesan cheese). I then went again for a proper dinner and it did not disappoint. We ordered 6 plates for 3 people, which was perfect portion-wise. Oxtail spring roll, lobster roll, gumbo, and pork jowl were divine and highly creative. Octopus and wagyu were okay and not super exciting.
Love this Korean tapas-style restaurant.  Amazing, flavorful, and creative creations!

Great food and great dinner date location. Tapas - small portions, told to order 2-3 per person. Small portions and it being slightly pricy matches the slightly upscale atmosphere. Corn dumplings: A+ creamy, milky, and complimented perfectly with truffle flavor. Would definitely order again. Pork Jowl and steak: both were cooked well with excellent flavor. Chicken: average, powerful sriracha flavor, worth skipping. Noodles: not chewy, flavor okay, do not recommend. Had fun cocktails, including a lychee drink and a mojito. On the sweeter side which I actually enjoyed.

Mediocre and a rip off. It's the kind of place where they serve 20 cents worth of plantain for $12. Literally 6 slices of plantain! I left hungry and got a second dinner in the east village after ordering everything on the menu with a party of 4.

Fantastic restaurant. I've previously been to Thursday Kitchen and was thrilled to be able to get a seat at Mokyo. I went with a party of four and it was an amazing time. Their plates are simply explosions of flavor and brilliantly created. The attention to detail and service is top-notch. Definitely gives off Michelin star-rated atmosphere. Hope they can keep up their consistency with the food and service being exceptional. Look at their menu before hand, order all the tapas, fun drinks and lastly, have a blast.
Love this place. Fantastic food. Fantastic service. This restaurant is now on my rotation of places that i will happily visit monthly.

Yooo! This place is SOOO dank, some of the best quality food I've had, such a fun atmosphere and such good service, Sophia was our server and she was amazing  like I'm not kidding I fully wanted her to stop working and just come eat dinner with us, such a eccentric person who seemed to be just so herself. she made dining here just that much better. Give that girl a raise

Came here for my friend's birthday and had a grand time. We all got soju shots on the house since we were returning customers. The service were on point and each dish was so interesting, but with familiar Asian flavors. You won't go wrong with anything, but the truffle dishes are especially great!

phenomenal food and service. in two weeks i've gone three times and find every opportunity to go again. the environment is boisterous yet intimate and the servers are so hospitable. i always have an amazing time. when you're eating, all you want to do is close your eyes and take it all in.
Straight up one of the best spots in all of NYC. The food is amazing and the wait staff is wonderful. Huge thank you to Bernard and David for making my dinners here amazing

Second time dining here and I can't wait to fo back! The corn dumplings are sooo good I could eat 3 bowls of just these - the combination of a creamy truffly dumpling in the cilantro sauce is outstanding. The Rice w/ Octopus and the Noodles w/ Brazilian nuts were delicious too.

The service was amazing, each dish was unique and delicious, and the outdoor seating was cozy and warm. Highlights were the oxtail spring rolls, the cauliflower, the corn dumplings, and the octopus. Hurry out to support this local business! We will be back!

This place is truly excellent! All of the dishes are innovative and delicious, the service is impeccable and considering how good the food is, the prices are reasonable. You must get the corn dumplings, yellowtail, pork jowls and pop rocks dessert (best dessert I've ever had at an Asian restaurant)! Oxtail spring rolls, steak and lobster rolls were also great. We can't wait to try the sister restaurant, Thursday Kitchen now.

Absolutely delicious. Ordered about half the menu and one dish was more impressive than the next. We especially loved the lobster rolls (incredibly flavorful) and the corn dumplings. Mushroom and cabbage was on point. Noodle dish was a party in our mouth.  Service was also friendly and super attentive. Don't miss out!

Got delivery, and the items were OK to our taste. Most of the dishes- Gumbo and octopus rice, were a bit too sweet for our taste. Would like the texture of octopus to be firmer. pork jowl was fatty, but that's probably what pork jowl usually is. Oxtail spring roll was heavy and salty. Dumplings were interesting but filling was mono textured. Maybe this kind of food can only really be truly enjoyed it in person at the restaurant.

If I had to choose between Thursday Kitchen or Mokyo, I would pick Mokyo everyday. The food here is carefully thought out and just hands down delicious. I was able to order everything on the menu, except for the persimmon and gumbo (they were out of the gumbo). I would highly recommend the noodles, corn dumplings, and korean steak. The mushrooms weren't my favorite, but still fairly decent.
Incredible food! Each dish is so unique. The dumplings and yellowtail were the best and must try!

Ordered the pork jowl, corn dumplings, gumbo, potato crisps and calamari. The pork jowl in particular was really good -- it literally melts in your mouth!! Would definitely get this if ordering here for the first time. The potato crisps were also a hit. Very attentive staff. Also I accidentally forgot my credit card on the table when I left, and a helpful staff ran after me for more than a block to return it. Was super grateful and wished I had thanked him more, but he ran back to the restaurant in a flash. Great place!

The food here was amazing! Came here on a Saturday night without reservations and we were seated inside. Our waiter, Bernard was friendly and helped us decide on how many dishes to order for my fiance and I since these plates were small. We got the Lychee Soda, Oxtail Spring Roll, Corn Dumplings, Rice with Octopus, Pork Jowl, Noodle and the Wagyu Steak. Of all the dishes we ordered, we both really liked the Corn Dumplings, Rice with Octopus and the Noodle. Will definitely come back!

Sort of disappointed :( My table ordered one of everything (except for the fish) and we only really enjoyed the pork jowl (absolutely delicious!). The other dishes were alright in our opinion. Cauliflower was drenched in the sauce (way too strong), steak had no sear, the rice with octopus was super salty and we couldn't finish it, etc. Portion sizes were really small for the price. Also I didn't like how there was such a long waiting period between getting served each dish - for a while we thought we were finished with our food since nothing came for ~15 mins but then 4 plates suddenly made their way through, so I wish they could've all been served at the same time/with not that long of a waiting period. The indoor seating area was also very hot and the water they served had no ice lol.
